SAFLLTynAHKgIXSdkAspDg.text: Its a nice place close to home.. quick service...the sushi was good..I had better but this was good

lwVDqfSdDABz2N_sE6avqg.text: Had the ecstasy roll and the baked 428 both so delicious! I like the fact that they offer half roles so you can get a variety of options.

cHOLBMx2QOVqY_w9J-YRxw.text: Recommended by Lisa C. and Jacob H. ... came here for lunch during my Yelp Spring Break weekend  and all i have to say is WOW, so good! Lunch price is $22, Dinner is $27.  AYCE nigiri, sushi rolls, appetizers, side dishes, and desserts! The fish was fresh and the service was pretty fast. The day we were there, they had salmon belly nigiri.. oh man, i don't know how many pieces I have ate.   onto the dessert, we had a choice of fried ice cream, black sesame mochi, lychee sorbet, and green tea ice cream. The lychee sorbet was so refreshing! the fragrance of the lychee was just unbelievably good! Each bite i took was so delicious, and it had lychee jelly in them too! I had two of this dessert .. i could have eaten extra scoops if i wanted to... but i stopped myself, cuz i shouldn't be greedy. Gotta let other customers have some! Man, thinking about it now is making me salivate. I want to go back!   If you come during dinner, they also have many more special side / appetizers dishes and sushi.  Also you'll get to order uni and sweet shrimp!   Although it is a little out of the way from the Las Vegas Strip, i wouldnt mind visiting Sushi Mon again. Maybe I'll come here on the way to vegas before i check in ... or on the way back home.  Nonetheless, Sushi Mon, YOU will see me again! Next time.. it'll be for dinner!

F1IRYwccKfzfWj11J_YdNg.text: Came here twice for lunch. The first time had the bento box with salmon and the 2nd time we sat at the bar but I ordered the veggie bowl. It was good, but not amazing. I have this dream of this amazing bento box but I dont think it exists. I love the idea of a bento box, but I havent found one that blows me away.  So, if you come here for the AYCE, I can't vouch for it. I generally dont do AYCE. I have a few pieces, and I'm set. Both times we were seated quickly and food was quick too.

LPUFkugkhsljyMJMVLPTwQ.text: I came to this location instead of Sahara because I figure the original is usually better than the other locations. This place left so much to be desired. I had high hopes from the the reviews but I can't. Be forewarned that I'm a visual person when it comes to food. The fish cuts were poor and the rolls broken and not well formed. I did not like the Futomaki but it's my fault for not reading it thoroughly. Unfortunately the rolls didn't live much to its hype either as they were all overpowered by one component or sauce. The only thing that really tasted good was the salmon belly(despite its poor presentation). But the super white tuna was great!! Other than this, the pricing was spot on for AYCE; $22 for lunch and $27 for dinner. Service and cleanliness are a thumbs up. But other than that, not enough for me to return. Sorry Sushi Mon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This among other orders of sushi is just looking dilapidated and sad..
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Um.. Quality control please?

dI1Pi_e_07igunGu5yXwpg.text: First time I came here the food was awesome, yesterday I went again and was very pleased!

CanfZvNGn6-H9f-iDXusPA.text: Nom nom nom. The best AYCE sushi place I have been to anywhere! (Now if only J-town has aYCE sushi) A bit of a drive from the Strip, but very very worth it.   Our seat at the bar placed us right in front of our sushi chef, who made our orders fresh right when we ordered it. All the nigiri we ordered tasted great -- especially the seared ahi tuna and the super white tuna. The cut rolls were delicious, especially for an AYCE place. We also tackled the Sushi Monster Roll -- a roll cut into 5 pieces, which is the size of your palm. It takes a while to make so order that first over the nigiri rolls and other rolls so that you aren't waiting a while for it. However, one thing we didn't realize was that everything under the 5-piece roll section are just as big as the Sushi Monster Roll. We ordered the spider roll and that was super huge too!   The AYCE menu also includes side orders, such as edamame and gyoza, as well as dessert. After all the sushi, I ended my meal with a bowl of creamy green tea ice cream (they also have tempura ice cream, but that would've been too much after all the food I ate). Great food, great price, great place! Sushi-mon is on my list of places to go every time I'm in Vegas.

XD_IFihjYjefIbsolHiChQ.text: Tried a few other AYCE places here in Las Vegas and this Sushi Mon is still the go to spot.  I've introduced many of my friends from So Cal and they always make a special trip out here when they are in town.  The fish is fresh and the cuts are amazing.  Very friendly service each time and they don't balk if you go over you 1 hour.  I highly recommend this place and I'm upgrading it to 5 stars because of the consistency of the staff, food and portions each time I come to Sushi Mon.  I has not changed in the 1 1/2 year that I've been coming.  Keep up the great work.  **Not to mention they have a frequent eater card, buy 10 get 1 free**

fWkFN-baC9dMqQgQSgRWng.text: I work at a sushi restaurant but I come here when I crave sushi :D  Service is great. Food is great. Unfortunately, unlike most places, they do not have soft shell crab for AYCE appetizers :(  I've been coming here for years. Still a royal customer!

5isK81-y62zwfL5jt-gojQ.text: The shrimp tempura almost didn't even have shrimp in it and it was extremely over cooked and greasy. The waiter was ignoring us and I had to call out for someone to come bring us the bill. The food was just okay, it just so happens to be near my house, however I don't think I will come back. It just wasn't anything special. The presentation was nice though, the rolls looked pretty.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiger roll, Mingus, and shrimp tempura

mej2__p6-F_RvEv_d_fCtA.text: I'm torn between giving this place 2 and 3 stars. Would say 2.5 if I could. Only the extra half because the first time I ate there, I got a very nice lunch special with a good variety and everything tasted fresh. But we went back for AYCE and it was pretty bad.   The sushi chef seemed new, the cuts to the nigiri were amateurish and he was veeeeery slow, despite having parts, like the California roll, the basis of most of their rolls, pre-made. Nothing tasted fresh and we actually sent a roll back because it tasted really fishy. That was spicy tuna.   If I ever go back, and it would be shocking if I did, I will stick with the lunch specials.

SMmj8PTz15cnkmEFTi31Ow.text: OMG, the worst! Fish is so stale, the sauce cannot cover it! I was so disappointed,  was told by everyone to try them.  My husband and I took relatives from out of town on a weekday  as it was so close to Anthem. Horrible experience.  Terribly embarrassed , please rethink this restaurant!

iFc206upTIKSbjQrT0YzGA.text: The best Sushi AYCE place ever ! Fresh food, awesome service, a must go place for me every time I come visit Vegas.

IFOQt_G-PdohOsa53pbvag.text: The all you can eat sushi is a great deal here. Excellent fresh sushi. I was trying to keep to my diet and I ordered the California Salad. Super tasty and amazingly filling. It was kind of weird to have crab meat without rice but the avocado was a perfect touch. I also ordered the dynamite appetizer. Food takes some time to come out but it's a great place to get good sushi. Just gotta be patience and learn not to fill up on the rice

99YC-_df-RjedUtVIj_Bow.text: Came here for sushi on a Saturday night. Busy, but not so busy we weren't able to be seated quickly. Reasonable prices for the quantity you receive; their AYCE deal is especially good! I ordered the nigiri, assuming there would be 4-6 pieces, as is standard, but there were only two. Bummer. No complaints on the hand roll and the rock 'n roll I ordered, but a note on the edamame: it was dried out and pruny, with way too much salt on top. It looked like they baked it instead of steaming or boiling it! Just a small annoyance, but it took down the overall experience, especially as I love my edamame.

0Wc4L1qUXCTZaGHQIOTNNA.text: I gave it couple tries and was never happy with this place.. The sushi is good but not great and I just didn't feel like I was eating something different with every roll they brought to us. Will not be going back.

h2rfQHzlDTNIfYd4g1Rnfw.text: We had a 15 min. wait on a Sunday so that was understandable. The food arrived quickly although it was extremely busy. I didn't feel rushed or ignored at all. I enjoyed their version of the philly roll. Would revisit.

SnHqfRoeTiwy8pM5AVvnig.text: Love this little all you can eat sushi! !! Best sushi in town, I think.. All the sushi is super fresh,  rolls are amazing. . Don't forget to try the yellow tail collar,  it's one of my favorites also the fried shrimp heads!

86PMIS_q9NIeoeYI-yDjGA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. We try to go once a week. Everything is fresh & the service is quick. Only con would be the dinner wait time. Have waited 45 min before, sucks but totally worth it! For all that we eat, the price is right!! Rainbow roll is a fav.

jsdJp4yrR7U879MgIy1pYQ.text: I've been to Sushi Mon many times before and I feel like each time I go I'm more disappointed. I used to love Sushi Mon and would tell everyone it was the best sushi  spot around. However, the past few times I've gone the quality has not been as great as it used to and the service isn't that wonderful either.   I went with a friend last night and we waited over 40 minutes to be sat. That isn't too unusual for Sushi Mon and before I never minded the wait. However, sushi mon has a website where you can check who is next on the wait list. When we were next to be sat, a party of four was sat down before us and then we were sat shortly after. Not a big deal, but a host should always follow the list. Especially when we had been waiting beyond our quoted time. The server, Claire, also took the order of the table next to us before taking ours. She waited approximately 10 minutes to come take our order and was extremely rude to us when she came to our table. In the middle of our order for AYCE she said "okay is that enough for first round?" Even though the table next to us had ordered far more she never asked them if they were done ordering. Once we ordered our food it took a very long time for it to come out even though the table next to ours who she clearly favored got their food shortly after placing their order.   The sushi was alright, definitely not as good as it used to be. I found the presentation of the sushi to be sloppy and inconsistent. So with the average sushi and poor service it's safe to say that after being a very loyal Sushi Mon customer I'm not sure if I'll be returning.

jzlXM73bFuyr4C0u28OIxw.text: Came here for the $10 AYCE sushi event for Sushimon's 10 year anniversary and it was awesome.  The fish was good and they were ultra-fast!  We ordered 4 orders of 6 types of nigiri and it was sitting on our table in 5 minutes tops.  I really enjoyed the garlic tuna nigiri and the cajun albacore nigiri and make it one of my frequent orders that day.  Didn't want to order any rolls because I was more focused on hitting up the nigiri and making sure to get my monthly nigiri fix.  My buddy ordered 5-6 orders of uni sushi (usually one order per person at other sushi spots) as well and got it just as fast as I did!  The food was pretty fresh and my group and I left super full from definitely stuffing ourselves with all the yummyness we could.  On a side note, we had to wait for 4 hours, but with the AYCE price this low and one hour of AYCE madness, I wasn't suprised or mad BECAUSE IT'S $10 DOLLARS!!  Just because some people don't have patience and/or didn't make an effort to come down earlier does NOT mean that Sushimon deserves a 1-star for not catering to you.  They took the price cut to give the public a nice treat and were simply overwhelmed with the response.  Yet, they turned up the production to 11 and kept the event going as best as they could.  No one was entitled to the $10 AYCE price and I definitely didn't feel like I was.  I came in as soon as possible, waited my turn, and got to enjoy the event as intended.  I give them 5 stars for dropping their price low, good foods, and giving us the best service they could while dealing with snooty ungrateful people.  Definitely stopping by again; Sushimon has made a customer out of me.

sdzIflHDeo-1dc5O82n7KQ.text: We had the absolutely worse experience here!!!! I can't even give them any stars. The hubby & I decided to go out for some sushi & live right up the street. We've been here a lot. This Thursday night it looked like they had large party so we stood at the door for about 5 minutes waiting patiently & no one acknowledged us. So after a while my hubby see see to open tables at the bar & so we decide to sit. They bring our drinks, we put in an order & after about 10 minutes one of the servers come over & asks us who sat us. My husband was like we did. Now at this point we've been seated for about 10 minutes & I need a refill on my water. The server tells us that we have to get up because there is a waiting list. While this is going on the people behind us were also arguing with a different server because they sat their party on a table that does not really fit his party. Anyway, my hubby is asking the guy if he's serious. The server looks at the owner and says yes but we can add you to the waiting list. My mouth completely dropped.  I could not believe as we are enjoying our dinner they want us to stop & step out but still want us to come back. We will never come back. Never did they say sorry. We are so unbelievably shocked at their service & attitude we will never go back!!!!! My husband has just about told the story to everyone he knows!! He's in sales & it's now a part of every conversation he has. It's too bad. I use to like it there. And the only reason I'm giving one star is because I USE TO like it there!!! Shame on them

4rMq0h-1YoGlu0clzUntqw.text: I have been eating here for over ten years.  It is by far the best sushi bar I have ever been to. Not only in Vegas,  but better than anywhere I have eaten in Cali too! Everything is superb from the minute you walk in the door until you leave,  full and satisfied. Amazing side dishes and creative delicious rolls make for a super combo your taste buds will thank you for! My favorite is called "crispy rice". I will always be a fan.  Thank you sushi mon

eaaGbaPe7ZF22ZEL1snisw.text: All you can eat and a great buzz from sake. That's what sushi night is all about. I love that this place is open late. After I get off of work, most places are closing. People have to wait for a seat sometimes, but that just means this place is that good. Great people work there.

tjA-9_c9uxW4U2AZQPLz4Q.text: There are so many AYCE sushi places in Vegas and quite a few of them are VERY good.  Sushi Mon might not be as pretty, spacious, or friendly as some of the other spots around town but they definitely come through on the food.  Especially the specials.  The other night they had an amazing sashimi salad on the AYCE specials board.  The Striped Jack was so tasty and definitely not something you find at most of the AYCE places around town.  They had salmon belly and yellowtail belly on the specials board too.  AYCE Salmon Belly?  So yummy!!!  The nigiri was all fresh and flavorful.  I really like that they don't go heavy on the sauces that mask the fish flavors.   Another favorite is their Salmon Collar.  A lot of places around town over cook their collar.  Sushi Mon's is always moist, lightly charred, and absolutely delicious!  They don't have a lot of dessert options but then I never have any space left.  And depending on what time you go, there may be a long wait.  We got there at 6pm on Friday and had a half hour wait, people who came just after us were told the wait was going on an hour.  Still, I give them 5 stars, and we drive past three other really good AYCE options on the way here.

UwliyE3eQJMEFsDDeb38jA.text: So yummy and great service.  Staff is always friendly and the sushi bar gents are great.  For the all you can eat dinner they have a fantastic dessert selection including green tea creme brule and fresh made chocolate mousse!!! Icing on the cake to all their amazing fresh sushi,  I even just gave them a list of stuff I liked and asked for a sushi roll that incorporated that and they did without flinching. I took off a star for the wait time... word has gotten out how good it is.

HryWHCd_6uVeb3LgI7_KWw.text: Yay for $13 pitchers of Sapporo!   The place was mobbed when we arrived and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The fish we had was fresh, though the cuts weren't as nice as what we get at Bluefin.    I also liked that they had various daily specials, so that you could get a small sampling of other higher-ticket  items. We were lucky and the specials were for super white tuna, fresh scallops and white clam.   We tried the tuna and scallops and they were both tasty. I loved the scallops, they were big fresh pieces and very supple.   The amaebi was a bigger portion and pretty nice. Sweet, juicy with that distinct raw-shrimp mouth-feel. Yum!    The home smoked salmon was interesting! It had bits of dill flecked on it and was smooth, subtly cooked and with a mild creamy flavor. Not as strong a flavor as in commercial smoked salmon, which could be a positive or negative depending on your preference. I liked it but wouldn't buy a large package of it.   I had masago with quail egg. The masago was was briny and sweet with nice pop and a generous portion. The egg seemed a little less fresh. The overall effect was still pleasant.    The uni was NOT as fresh as what I've had at other restaurants. There were odd discoloration marks on it, which I haven't seen anywhere else.  We got a half order of the volcano roll on a friend's recommendation and neither of us liked it. It had a lot of krab in it, which is a turn off.  An order of gyoza meant 2 little bitty pieces. The boy had those and found them unremarkable. He also had the yakitori, which came in a super heavy sauce. Not something he'd go out of his way to have again, and though the portion was small he tried to enlist my assistance in demolishing it.    I also had the miso soup with fried amaebi heads. The batter got soggy because the heads were totally submerged in the scalding-hot broth, which was disappointing. Also, the fact that the broth was a few degrees shy of boiling- miso is NOT meant to be boiled because it ruins the integrity and health benefits of the miso. The soup utilized white miso and was still flavorful once it cooled down enough to be edible without the risk of 3rd degree burns.   The ahi poke salad was very mild in flavor impact. I liked the combination of seaweeds/seaplants in it but otherwise it was forgettable.   The lychee sorbet was a refreshing option. I liked the little bits of what seemed like candied/dry lychee that I'd occasionally discover.  Overall, it was fun and we enjoyed our beer but we won't venture out of our way when we've had better luck with sushi spots closer to home.

6ElV7XAcmDDu013RdUMw7w.text: Heard great things about this place and driving by it weekly on the way to my brother's house...   Came here for the Lunch AYCE option, it wasn't that busy when we came around 12PM, got seated for 6 and had our drink order taken right away.   The sushi menu and quality was exceptional. I think I fell in love with their Unagi and Cajun Tuna? .. or maybe it was salmon. *shrug*  I even got a stamp card since I'm the local and managed to get 6 stamps per my out-of-town friends :D

M4vA9b1Yjzb_LHMYlwr7mA.text: Don't go here. They don't care about customer service. Food is not fresh, chewy seaweed. The wait is NOT worth it. Just horrible. I'm disgusted.

nfguCiUJdIZ7pl50uYCAbg.text: Good is delicious but on the days my family & I decide to go it's super packed but the just means the food is worth the wait!!!

9sdfVIloKjAGs8qkwbZgmg.text: When I read about their $10 all-you-can-eat promo a few weeks ago, I made plans to attend with a big group of friends. Sushi Mon isn't our favorite place and we figured the wait would be pretty long, but since they clearly advertised a no reservations policy we figured it would be worth it to go and wait; We were severely wrong.   When we arrived there were a few people gathered outside and the restaurant was full, but it wasn't too bad. When I went to the hostess to put our name on the list, we were informed they were booked solid until the end of their event and we couldn't be served even though our whole party was present. So much for the "no reservations" policy.   Save yourself the trouble, there's all-you-can-eat sushi places nearby with better flavor and similar prices--we won't be returning.

1zN-XMSFtHMKRRUzx0aBPw.text: This place is typical. Nothing really too good. It's realistically good enough for the amount you are paying. The waitress though made a comment when we ordered a lot from the "all you can eat" menu.  One other note -- not very clean!!

GT1qIEVW82kl7ZGAWP67mA.text: This place never disappoints :) always looking forward to this place when we fly in from Hawaii, and it's the guaranteed spot to go to on our list :) and the people remember us :)  Every time we went there we had great service :) this last time we went was the first time they got out orders wrong lol, we ordered Hamachi nigiri, but instead the lady brought us Hamachi collar x) wasn't a bad thing, cause we decided to just eat it, and now we have another favorite on the menu to order haha :D  Everyone should come here atleast once :) and you'll be coming back again and again for more ^_^  Thanks again Sushi Mon!!! See you guys again next year! :)

YvaPg6JvHSUFAYeuE5uBaA.text: The best sushi i ever tasted!!! i go almost once a week. Great quality great environment. the mochi is fantastic as well as everything on their menu....

XUcQkA1Wm0kvbEC4yxDe1A.text: I  love this place!!! have not been able to try a  lot of sushi, you go, you order you get big rolls you eat it then too full to try something else. My daughter eats here a lot and talked me into going omitting the part that there will be a wait, I do not wait  well. But this place is well worth the wait (which by the way was only 20 min on a Friday at 630) At Sushi-Mon all you can eat, you can order two or 4 or 8 of anything and everything.  I tried things I have never tried before, you see it and if it looks good to you  try it, if you like it you order more what a great concept.  Not to mention everything is delicious!!! Right down to the desserts, again order them all if you want.  The staff is very  friendly and helpful, it is a dinning EXPERIENC I cannot wait to go back again!

cv3HnQTyGwsSaFs8Ydgprg.text: The Sashimi Lunch is one of my favorite meals in Henderson. The Sushi is always fresh and they slice it thin for me. The Miso Soup and Salad come with it. A healthy and affordable Lunch!

b9R3kyZEycJ1L2kwwzacpg.text: We went on a Tues night, no reservation, no problem. We were seated promptly. The AYCE sushi dinner is a bargain. The sushi came out quick as they had quite a few sushi chefs working that night. A few of us ordered the salmon, tempura, cali roll combo. The food was delicious & the servings were huge! There were 2 pieces of salmon, combo shrimp/vegi tempura & 6 pieces of cali roll. I would return when I'm in Vegas again. The food was good, service was quick & they are definitely affordable!

cAFn1Z42ARZtPC39BGsAsg.text: I enjoy their sushi a lot! Whenever I go with my family, we always do all you can eat sushi. You get your money's worth! Whenever we're really hungry and craving sushi, we come here! During the day, it isn't that busy but when you come during the night, it's quite the wait and a lot of people.

I8FGXsAanlHp42_pv8jgrQ.text: Nothing spectacular and feels obviously like a chain. It's a decent option but I'd rather drive a little further for something better. Did have a very negative experience once with one of the chefs while sitting at the bar.  Took forever for any of them to take notice that we needed to put in an order. When we asked for another volcano... He shot us this look and said again??  Obviously this was an inconvenience to make.  Seemed like he tried to be a little more friendly toward the end because he realized his own reaction but it was too late and really spoiled the experience.  Haven't been back since.

0YVpju28I2YPBG_4ovEiXg.text: So, we live on the complete opposite side of town from this fine Sushi place, however recently our favorite Sushi Chef made a change and now does his thing here!    Aside from it being a bit of a drive, we've now got our new favorite Sushi restaurant!  They have great portions and the fish is incredibly fresh..which is what you want when you sit down at the Sushi bar.  Could not be happier!  Mike, Haru and the rest of the Sushi masters were fantastic and we left stuffed not wanting to eat for days!  We'll be back, just perhaps not as often as we normally would.

FESYrhY_t7tJFtX-dO_Uiw.text: Food is delicious, you won't be disappointed there. The service is not particularly good. Our server's name was Angie and if you leave one piece of food on your plate she'll charge you extra for not finishing. This was my favorite go to spot but not anymore. An extra $8 charged to my bill cost a lifetime of return business. ACYE means ALL YOU CAN EAT. That means whatever you order is YOUR FOOD. Please change this policy.

rT61KFWZBqxeUTEissJHfg.text: Consistently great! Tried the Dynamite appetizer for the first time-scallops and crab meat mixed with mayo and yum yum sauce baked all together-very good. AYCE option is the best. Sashimi and seaweed salad, baked green mussels, super white tuna, Golden Knight roll, and Pastel roll are favorites.

5ny1yOUEtuLh-7juUa4h8Q.text: Fantastic service and the fish is fresh: I especially enjoyed the fresh salmon belly, the fresh scallops, and the uni. The miso soup was also good, since I enjoyed the hot broth and the tofu and seafood in the soup was delicious.

XEVZTDAHmOABQx3ReBge3w.text: Sushi Mon is the closest AYCE sushi place by me, so I decided to give it a go.   The food is pretty good in terms of AYCE sushi quality. The interior is small, and the service was quick with the water refills. I'll probably try this place again if I am ever craving sushi!

F4O4sTm9HBbN8c6laGZEfw.text: We 've been to this place many times and it used to be our 1st sushi recommended restaurent in Las Vegas. It's been about 4 months since last time that we's dissapointed with the fish. We decieded to come back to try again and hope that it'll be good like it used to be. But we's dissapoint again. Hard Soft Shall Crab, sushi rice was not stick together, rice over fish above sushi rice, salty salad dressing.

hqxJQ6nXOBlc0Zzih5Atfg.text: Bad Customer service.  2 Open tables, made me wait because I am party of 1. Offered sushi bar, but my legs hurt hanging from there. I think its rude !!!

4uCY63ygfH5UoqX2JfnY6g.text: Came here for AYCE sushi before heading back to Los Angeles and it was soooo good! This place is unlike other AYCE sushi joints where there is a set price for the weekend the entire day. There is still a lunch and dinner pricing. I don't remember what the dinner price was but for lunch on Sunday it was $22. They also don't give you a paper to write down your order, there's a server that comes to take your order.   There is a lot of things to choose from in their menu. My group got a few rolls and then mainly stuck to nigiri the rest of the time. Don't forget to look at the daily special menu because that is included as well!   The sushi that definitely stuck out to me and was soooooo good were the fresh scallops, negi toro and the blue fin toro. I have no idea what was on the fresh scallops but it was my favorite! I could've kept eating that for the entire time! For their special rolls the ecstasy roll was BOMB. Def recommend trying those 4.  They also have really good desserts! A variety of different flavors for their mochi ice cream and the lychee sorbet was AMAZING!  Service wasn't bad. Well at the beginning service was great but towards the end of our meal it kind of got pretty slow but we didn't mind it.   I will definitely be back here on my next visit to Vegas!

sQ-LlgjnbJtLSYwboXL3Ww.text: This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas. Yes that is a bold statement but the prices are great the food is amazing and the location is also convenient. This will always be my first choice for sushi when I have one

zTunAa03HAIlZxNRT2zKmQ.text: I wasn't a big sushi eater..Sushi Mon has changed my mind..love this place, be back real soon.:)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great meal &amp; Co..

h7uyDt-aLLDaG6V02dO4ww.text: Met my bro in law and his roommate for some sushi. I have been here once before but it was a while ago. I am still dreaming over the food we had. The flavors, the presentations, the atmosphere were all amazing! I will be bringing many more people here.

0umGj-290NzmcbKvaAAjeA.text: Our standard for weeknight take-out sushi. This place is always slammed. Service is great, take out portions are great. Would be 5 stars if I didn't have to check my order before I leave every time...  Try it for take out its just as good as the AYCE.

hiC6ipxzrMjZkRhizzlNuw.text: So I don't really understand why so many people like this place. The food is honesty not very good (ex. Chicken was burnt/tasted bitter, sushi had uneven amounts of rice and was falling apart, salad was pretty salty), but there's not really an issue service wise. In fact, the service was pretty good, as the food came really fast. I wouldn't really recommend this place aside from the fact that the combos are a little cheaper compared to other places, but it also doesn't taste as good. If you are looking for good combo/bento boxes I would definitely recommend "The Midori Japanese Fushion Sushi" instead.

bnc8IIVZUQQ6GWbmDr032A.text: Always hits the spot! Very affordable for AYCE Sushi especially for lunch! Staff always have a smile on their face and very friendly. Sushi Chef's at the Sushi Bar are also very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Roll
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Max
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No Name Roll

Wbo1cdSocDaD7Jsn4oJNgQ.text: This place was recommended by an employee from the M casino due to its popularity and proximity to the hotel. It is located in a Plaza with ample parking.  We went here for lunch and the place was not busy. We were seated right away and our server got our order. My friend got the deluxe combination which wad a few pieces of sashimi, 4 piece California rolls, tempura, rice, salad and miso soup. I got the combination of chicken katsu with rice, miso soup, 4 piece California rolls and salad. We also ordered fried oysters and baked mussels on the side. The service was good. They had a lot of staff there that kept checking on you. The food was good for me. But he didn't like it that much. Their sushi was not that good. Maybe we should have tried one of their special sushis. The price was reasonable. Just not sure if it's something that we will go back for.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu combo
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried oysters
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deluxe combo

IM_zaqazz_ndWzx3Yyo5rw.text: Great choices and great price for AYCE sushi! For my toddler they added a 3$ charge but we didn't mind. She had a good amount of sushi. I love how they have a roll with just rice and spam cause my daughter loved it. The service is great and fast. Sushi is fresh.great appetizer choices as well. Can't wait to go again.

sSk-sV1eW4yJu0OVz_yglQ.text: Super disappointed in the service and treatment from Sushi Mon. I've been going to Sushi Mon for over 10 years. My family as well for many years. We came in, a party of 6 as we had family in town from Japan that specifically asked to eat at Sushi Mon after hearing about it from a friend in Japan. George told us they couldn't seat 6 comfortably and would have to wait 30/45 even though we were okay with squeezing in. He continued to tell us this was not possible. We then settled with a to go order my mom placed in which she tried to pay and George then walked away to tend to other customers. Then a young lady came and made 6 seats happen at the table we were originally to be seated at and we were confused since George told us he couldn't accommodate us which is why we settled for ordering take out. They left us waiting.. and waiting.. My mom asked to pay for the take out again, in which George then told us take out would take a 30 minute wait. We ordered the take out 15 minutes prior, confused we asked him if he even placed the order which he replied no. We asked why he didn't place the order and he said he thought we were "figuring out what to do" which is confusing since we ordered 3 Sushi deluxe to go because it was clear we were not going to be accommodated. So frustrated as that would make 45/50 ish minutes of standing around in this place when if George had took the order it would've been ready in 15 more minutes. It felt deliberate and like he wanted to confuse our party who then went outside in the cold looking for another place to eat. I spoke to the manager that didn't care to make this better, letting me know George has been working at sushi mon for 13 years. For what reason I don't know or care, it is irrelevant to his service and actually sad if he has been working at this establishment for so long leaving us all in disarray. She offered us a few deserts, lame offer being honest. We left, disappointed and quite frankly not sure if we will come back here as the quality and service isn't the same. This is something you don't want Japanese people to say about a sushi restaurant.

dqAkiM1DdUacpDd_YDA8Jg.text: Our Favorite Sushi Restaurants in Town! Always Great service and Wonderful Fresh Sushi.  Large selection and they let me customize anything! You can't go wrong from appetizers, specials, Roll, sashimi, nigiri and desserts you're going to leave FULL

KIH7WEKRzv7g1nrENwm3AQ.text: My love... my favorite sushi place in the world.  My family and I visit Las Vegas almost every winter and we come here and eat all-you-can-eat lunch/dinner whenever we come.  All servers are super nice all the time and make you feel comfortable.  I feel like there sushi quality improves every year, as well as the customer service.  I look forward going there again next winter!

kR6lsZRGZezhmlPbVoI7kw.text: Employees are so nice & friendly! I went with a friend & we greatly enjoyed our time there. The best part, of course, was the sushi. Very yummy

QPydYBX_fV67FjEztjZNSg.text: Love this place. Relaxing, friendly service and the food is delish! After visiting the first time about 2 months ago, we go every Friday now and pick up an order. The prices are just right!  Love it!!

TYRnZxhq5myv5NUbn8AA0A.text: Awesome. Great people and great food. So I walked in here not really expecting to much but wow...this please was great and they have an all you can eat sushi which included everything on the menu and dessert items too. Needless to say I may have ate too much but it was well worth it.   I will be come back next time I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry and vanilla mochi.

JQtWGolzLaabxIKCnWPAWA.text: This is my first review on yelp and I assure you that this place deserve the 5 stars ! I tried the Pixie roll and loved it !

VPiN-yLyTOz5oyk-bNQlvw.text: Let me tell you, this is THE spot for "All You Can Eat" sushi. The service is amazing and so fast!! Manuel aka Manny, Sal & Mauri were a complete treat and so much fun!! I definitely found my new go-to sushi stop. Thank you, guys!!!

rc5JEQo8MwD5qiqJ_mpOFw.text: This is the usual go to spot in Vegas for AYCE imo.   $26 for dinner & $21 for lunch. Quality is good with a lot of appetizers, desserts, nigiri, and so on to choose from. Not to mention all their special rolls as well for the AYCE menu. If you can eat a lot of sushi like I can, you can easily get your money's worth!  Location: Corner of a shopping complex with a lot of parking. Place is kinda small, but if you don't go during peak, you'll be fine. They have bar seating as well. Best part, they're open LATE! Vegas standards, 1AM isn't late, but for sushi/restaurant standards, it meets it amazingly.  Service: No issues with service. They were attentive, kind, and very quick to refill water and clean the table off.  This most recent trip, I just wasn't hungry enough to get my money's worth and ordered the S.S. combo. First time actually that I dined here without ordering the AYCE! Combo came with their salad, soup, and the main dish which included spicy tuna roll, 3 piece nigiri, and 7 piece sashimi for $16!  Overall: I'd say this is a great sushi spot outside of LA, where I live. For some reason, I always come to Vegas and crave sushi. If you're wanting AYCE, I would suggest this spot for sure. Def bang for your buck without the loss of quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S.S. combo

mJq5bialJ3lxDymq9btxpQ.text: Been trying a lot of different AYCE sushi joints after I moved and so far I've been unimpressed with the quality and selection of their rolls. Sushi Mon has both great value and product, the salmon and tuna tasted very fresh and the servers were quick and attentive. We sat at the bar and were attended to within the first minute (despite being mostly full) and were eating 5 minutes in. Normally I have to wait 30 minutes for a table, then another 10 minutes for an appetizer.  The selection of rolls and appetizers were varied enough, not the most eclectic I've seen but we loved almost everything we ordered, especially the Cynthia roll. Their baked mussels were pretty good as well. Didn't try the nigiri or sashimi so I can't review them but I will definitely be coming back for more.

dvECnswHGvPdpcFmBXZC3g.text: We shouldnt come back here  Service is still poor. It took 15 minutes just to get our drink. Server is not paying attention to its customers, takes 30 minutes to get our orders.  We will never come back here ever

zB8sgotWA9wyo8crZwWyvg.text: I used to be a regular at Sushi Mon.  It was always one of our favorite all you can eat spots in town.  For some reason we hadn't been in 3 years and decided to dine there tonight.  I went with a friend and my 3 year old son.  My son does not like anything that is typically offered on a sushi menu so I packed a juice box and a plastic bag with something he would eat.  Our server mentioned that it was their policy not to allow outside food and told us that if my son were to eat or drink what I brought we would be asked to leave.  I tried to order a drink for my son (juice or milk) and was told they only carried soft drinks or lemonade.  I didn't want to cause a scene so between sushi rolls I took my 3 year old outside to eat his meal.  It was tough to explain to my son why he had to eat outside in the 105 degree heat.  The most frustrating part of this evening is when we explained to another employee why we were feeding him outside she said that she had never heard of such a policy.    I was also disappointed in the service we received.  We tried to flag the waiter down for drink refills multiple times with no luck.  Luckily the hostess had a pitcher of water and could at least keep our waters topped off.  There appeared to be plenty of servers and ours did not look overworked but we were not given much attention  The sushi wasn't bad but not like I remember it.  I know this review won't apply to people without kids but Sushi Mon made it very clear that they have enough of a customer base to be family friendly.

KqFGOR73osjo_cqBHWwARQ.text: This place has been consistently awesome since I was in college.  I feel that it is a Hawaii go to spot, and the food and service is always on point.  The all you can eat lunch special is a great deal, I just wish they had Hamachi Kama.

zkl8GzWHRt9a6tBUicZdIA.text: We have 3 all you can eat. The selected nigiri we had were all awesome! We had super white tuna, yellowtail, salmon (the best), albacore, Cajun albacore, halibut, red snapper, mackerel, yum yum scallop, salmon roe, and smelt egg. Plus, everything on the board of daily special fish, spider roll, half hurricane, and green tea ice scream and lychee sorbet. One the other friend is a vegetarian. She had everything that has no meat and she loved it!!!

eGEUI62CoVZ6t74ok3AK7w.text: Alright,uhh this was a small but clean Japanese restaurant which located at Silverado ranch. I ordered "all u can eat", that was an impressed experience at that place. Each piece of sushi had a just good size for me to eat, not very big then hard to bite. N tuna was gorgeous because of it tasted fresh. In a word, I will come back without any hesitation.

23gOtcsHi1xaaZ9nHg2Zsg.text: Great AYCE sushi. Try the Albacore Nigiri, Baked Grren Muscles, Sexy Girl Roll, Ecstasy Roll, and Mochi ice cream to finish it off. Very friendly and fast sushi chefs.   Tip: come for a late lunch (before 4pm) and enjoy AYCE sushi and food for only $21.95.   Warning: stay away from the 9-1-1 roll unless you can handle extreme amounts of jalapeno heat. This roll may put a speed bump on your sushi experience.

4xSvwo0AIDqyWL2ch_WSzA.text: This place is one of the better ayce in Vegas. It's always SUPER busy, especially at night, so make a reservation.  The service is always pretty solid. I can't really think of any complaints there.  The apps are super good. Seaweed salad, poke, gyoza, everything super fresh and tasty. Miso soup is pretty solid. The mussels are amazing. Not too much globby cheese and sauce. The poke is also very fresh and not overloaded with onions like some other places do. The Cajun albacore here is still my favorite. The perfect amount of spice. Nigiri cuts are always pretty thick. The ecstacy roll and the lemon roll are my favorites. They do half rolls here, too. Which is awesome.   I love that you can also get more than one mango mochi for the all you can eat. A lot of places don't do that and I'm obsessed with mango mochi.

cL1AUlRORfwaep5NxneOVw.text: This used to be my favorite sushi place, due to the variety and desserts. (Tempura ice cream yuuuum) but their service became slow and it was always too busy . The sushi is not really wow to me , it's just yummy

2lqOjJy5aiBaVryg7_8r8g.text: walked in and the place was about 1/3 full. not one person greeted us. the sign says "wait to be seated". 2 employees looked at us and didn't say anything still. after a few awkward minutes I asked... should we seat ourselves? one of the employees looked surprised that I asked. another employee seated us. the menu had several options and we opted for all you can eat. our waiter took our order and someone else brought it to our table. our waiter was busy watching a game on TV. the food was delicious... I've been here before and the service was good..  I'll give them the benefit of doubt... it was after 9pm. maybe they were tired. a simple smile and welcome would have make this a better experience.

p60r275sAcm6cqCmfTAyRw.text: Good food, good service. We had the AYCE and got our money's worth. Great selection of rolls. Only dislike is the seating. Not good for groups and you sit VERY close to other tables.

2SgvU-QHibsyzF5Ow7jL-g.text: Always great and fresh! Last visit was super busy and it didn't help that their computer system crashed but you'd never know the difference really...service was great as usual.

IevN0StkMxb9u2w4L_nAqw.text: Can not beat the quality of this place for the price highly recommend this to everyone! Oh and they're open super late.

XzcwoL0VWCqHFhIHzLEgoQ.text: This place is amazing!!! Got to do the all you can eat. The quality is way above any other all u can eat sushi or even non. The staff is super nice too.

WD7t2x9GybwF7HuaallFBg.text: Best neighborhood sushi! Love all the sushi i order and we've pretty much tried everything.  Nothing ever new on their menu.  Its all good though.  They also have the best baked mussels in town.  My niece loves their yellow tail...says its the freshest in town.   Another draw back is the wait time.  You will always wait a minimum 35 minutes...every time.

Zh-RpLh6Lp7h79L1UPP-IQ.text: Use to come here all the time when I was in town and loved it. Came here the other day and was very disappointed, either they changed owners or switched there food quality. The fish was not good quality and very dry. The menu prices are not what you see on your bill. Check your bill cuz the add a bunch of add ons not stayed on the menu or the waiter. For the bill I had to pay, I could have had great quality sushi for that price at a luxury hotel on the strip. Save your time and stay on the strip for good sushi.

DlBQpvDXxlKEBgh0PUfUgQ.text: Great AYCE sushi. Tasty, large selection of nigiri and rolls, and friendly staff. This store's sister is Sushi Goyemon up in Spring Valley. Goyemon is also one of the highest rated sushi spots in town, and there is no percievable difference in the food, as they have the same menu and prices. Of course the actual chef could be having an off night or something that would make the quality suffer, but I've eaten at both locations multiple times and have never had that issue!  Some of my favorites are the super white tuna (seriously, I could just eat 10 servings of this and call it a day), the sexy girl roll, and of course the $6 giant Sapporo beers.  Inside is actually very small. I'd say something around 20 seats at the bar and about 10 tables. However, the longest I've had to wait is about 30 minutes and they will give you a call when a table or bar is ready.  If you live nearby, get the AYCE club card or whatever they call it. Takes 10 meals to get a free one, but after going a few times with my girl we are almost already there as they count all diners as individual meals, not 1 for the group which is nice!

CA4TrX4cBHv8gMJxBz4wjg.text: By far one of the best Sushi restaurants in Las Vegas area, fish is always good, and fresh. Garlic edamame is the best, deserts are delicious. Hot Saki is super yummy...

Zw2wxEmisGjQulWOWg29sQ.text: For the price best all "you can eat" Ive had in vegas. All the nagiri sushi was very fresh with large slabs of fish, rather than just a big clump of rice to get you full. The only down fall was that the cucumber salad was a little off and there was a bit of a wait. But definitely worth it!

8nfu9CzhmKxWcXcFW8jJ_A.text: This place is da bombz.. Recommend by my friends.. The fish is very very fresh.. You can't go wrong with AYCE.  Well worth the price for a buffet.  The service is excellent and the chefs are nice to you.  I lost count on my dishes but I was stuffed.  Once your done, order a plum ice cream.. OH yum!!!   If your in Vegas.. this is the place to go.    Awesome!!

pO-Ifew57Ch0OoTbgMwRNA.text: I primarily like it here because it's less than a mile away from my house, and it's fairly consistent. Nothing to really blow you away, but nothing too disappointing either. The tempura vanilla ice cream is soooo good... I remember falling in love the first time I tasted it.   Kind of small interior, so I'd avoid during peak times or prepare for a wait. I'd recommend sitting at the bar for quicker service.

1-R_YEsevfcCyvDnQtYMGw.text: Well I have no idea why this business has a good rating, the sushi was some of the worst I had in vegas.... The rice was falling apart in the soy sauce that I was dipping it into like i've never seen before.  My girlfriend got a tamago sashimi and she said it wasn't that good at all.  The sushi was prepared pretty quickly and the waiters were alright, although He forgot to refill my drink the whole time and we had to wait for the check for awhile... it wasn't even that busy also.   All these 5 stars are baffling to me, this place isn't even close to that.    OH and also I got an appetizer and I didn't get it into I was done with 2 rolls of sushi.... so I wont be going here again, i'll stick to my regular places.

xu_Vo1bizQocEza4pekeLw.text: The fish was fresh, however wait staff were the worst .  I had to ask for water to three different people and two of then twice.   I had all you can eat, I ordered the Tempura Shrimp and waited for twenty minutes I asked the wait staff four times, they said they would check they were not slammed with business.  After 27 minutes  I never got the shrimp I paid my bill and left.     Owen/boss didn't seemed to care!   I will not go back.  To many other sushi places to try.   They  failed me!

t6uB-TfQQlj4S3rM-hgPpw.text: WAY better than the Sushi Mon on Sahara. The restaurant is clean and the sushi is good. The servers weren't too friendly (one even walked around with a grumpy face); however, the service was decent. If you want something, you have to flag them down. At first we made the mistake of waiting to order when they came to clear our plates, but it took a huge pile and quite a wait before someone came by. They are quick to get you what you want after you order it though.

YDCqiNvfDta8KcgO1t7paA.text: By far my most favorite sushi place. I always get the Ah Chi Chi roll and the Cajun Albacore. The staff has always been extremely friendly to us, and the all you can eat is a good price. The fish is always great quality every time we go in and if you haven't tried the Green Tea Creme Brulee, I highly reccomend it.

7_rI-clbiKRnKwGNR-wF2A.text: Don't know how the food is because I didn't get to eat. I meet a couple of friends there and they had already been seated at the bar. The bar was full except for 3 seats. I asked if we could move to those and the said the were reserved, so I asked how long the wait was for a table and they said around 45 mins so I asked about the bar and they didn't know. Then I asked if we could sit outside because they have a patio with tables and I got told that the only way to sit outside was to order togo... Why have a patio and not use it for service. I normally go to sushi for the all you can eat so ordering togo makes no sense to me. So I decided to leave and I won't be coming back. If you are always busy and you have more tables , why not take advantage of them.

JGgZ_dzlqY7V7QdB6H_ORA.text: After reading all the reviews I had to try this place for myself. After arriving and seeing a nearly full restaurant, I was surprise to see how quickly they sat us at the bar. Service was consistent and faster than I would expect from a restaurant that busy. Quality of the sushi was on par for the price. Atmosphere was lively and my favorite part of the evening. We soon found ourselves amongst friends as people chimed in either suggesting something for us to try or inquiring about certain rolls we had ordered.   Wonderful food, great atmosphere, decent price. Will be back.

K9qlgfaOCpvNk5I5nWuX7A.text: Normally its always worth the wait but this time it was uncalled for "Ridiculous"!! We frequently dine here almost weekly and have always experienced great service until lastnight. We had a party of 7 (not Asian size if you know what I mean.) We were given a wait time of 25 min. But Waited over 1 hour before two 4 seater tables opened up at the same time. Starving and relieved that finally we're going in, two people drove right up, no  waitimg list needed for them and this hostess (short girl with blond dyed, black roots) automatically offers them one of those tables and tries to squeeze us in the other?? That's where I lost my mind!  Especially because there was a 2 seater opened for them and we needed both tables. This hostess refused to put both tables together for us and rudely told us we'd have to wait 15 minutes longer till more tables open up (4 separate parties had to leave first =8 seats still. ) WTH? When we were done, one of those two tables were still unused. So Dumb! If it wasn't for your waitress' making a way for us, you would've lost our Tip let alone our business lastnight!  Good job Sushimon you hired an idiot for your welcoming party, who pissed off your frequent flyer- Don't think we'll be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a 4 seater for God&#39;s sake!! Not a 6 or 7 (with a chair at the end) unless it&#39;s zoned for little or small people only.

BrGmDkBlOebBzdUAPHJJ-A.text: 3 stars for an average sushi experience:   Wait time was 30 minutes, which isn't terrible considering some places have an hour wait for a Friday night. The service was okay, nothing to rave about, but they weren't terrible. Not very personable or helpful. The food was meh, it's not the best, but there's definitely worse out there. I think I'll stick to Yama sushi

cYqlad7xJxvPPkMFadYw_A.text: When we drive to Vegas, this is always the first stop before we hit the strip. Sometimes we even make Vegas trips just for Sushi Mon. Great quality cuts for the sushi, which is pretty much the only thing I order here. The service is exceptional too.  Never got the rolls so I can't review them, but going back to the sushi. The salmon cuts are very nice! They usually have 3-4 featured sushi, but it costs a little more, just charges you dinner prices which is about 3 bucks more. If it's available, it's kind of a no brainer for me.   Love this place, highly recommend it, which I do to all my friends. There's dessert too, but it's up to you. I usually just eat more sushi instead, but the ice cream is great.

RGRrCppYZJa8qHLPKHNhFA.text: I don't come here often as it is usually not in the normal price range but for random occasions and meeting up with friends it's great!  Every single time I have come here I have ordered AYCE -- my fiance has too -- and we both feel like we always get our money's worth without eating ourselves sick (hah!).  He is not nearly as in love with sushi as I am but he can eat yakitori, tempura shrimp, edamame, and green tea ice cream like nobody's business.  He is also willing to try what the table orders sometimes, so it works out.  Service here is above average and I have always had a decent experience.  Everyone is friendly.  Be forewarned:  This places is POPULAR and SMALL so it can get crowded and service can get bogged down during busy times.  I really like how AYCE allows you to order half-rolls.  I know several places do that but this was my first experience with one...hee.  What to order: Dragon Roll (I'm biased), Aloha Roll, Moon Roll, umm... just look at the menu and dive in.  And dessert is good, too!  I am IN LOVE with tempura fried ice cream, and this does not disappoint.  Next time I am gonna see if I can get green tea ice cream up in that tempura shell... mmm.

UyLbbf9frNQcF7D2jaNDqA.text: Average AYCE sushi, just as another reviewer said. sushi is AYCE quality. not better, not worse than any other place. probably not returning again...  but just so you know what i mean by average AYCE: -shrimp tempura made with anemic shrimp, not in panko but regular batter -it's a plus they have uni but minus that it's not good quality -plus that they have the raw shrimp. also plus that they deep fry the head, but minus that the deep fried head is very oily and a bit soggy. perhaps oil not hot enough? -there's a 1hr limit -white tuna and hamachi is decent quality  i've definitely had worse but i've also had better. meh.

K6x0PdomynlvOrTRlfpsSw.text: I love sushi and I love trying new places so when I was trying to figure out where to meet a friend for lunch, I went right to Yelp to find a new place that would be in a good location for both of us. Between the 4 out of 5 star rating, and remembering that I had heard good th8ings about Sushi Mon, we decided to meet there for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon.   Most of the tables were full when we arrived so we decided to sit at the bar. After a quick glance at the menu it was clear that AYCE would be the best way for us to go so we started out with some edamame, miso soup for my friend and drinks while we decided on a few rolls.   I love that they offer 1/2 rolls, it allows me to try things that look yummy but I am not sure about. I also love that ACYE included nigiri sushi, and the fish was nice and thick and tasted very fresh. We started with an order of tuna, salmon and yellowtail to start and ended up having seconds and then thirds of the tuna as it was just delicious.   As for rolls, we started with 1/2 orders of Caterpillar and Philadelphia rolls. These are my basics that I almost always order, and Sushi Mon did them well. We also had the Frying Jason roll which was a baked  roll that had scallops and yum yum sauce. A little heavy on the sauce but I would certainly order it again. We finished off with a Spider Roll because my friend wanted somethign with soft shell crab. This was made with soy paper and was large so I had a hard time eating it. This was my least favorite of the rolls we had...  The only problem I had was having to ask for water refill. Otherwise it was an extremely tasty lunch. They charge a little more for AYCE then some places but the quality of fish makes it worth it in my book... Sushi Mon is definitely on my go back ASAP list.

puC3tMKSbMVGccMm0A7R8A.text: Been eating here for years. I would definitely consider this my local sushi spot! If your in definitely try the Yellowtail jalapeno, California salad, and the Lasagna roll -just a few of my fav.'s. The wait can be tricky at times but I just call ahead and make a reso..  ***Please do NOT confuse this restaurant with Sushi Mon in LA..... That restaurant is HORRIBLE and they are not the same company.***

d_xiQn2-MqzanWv0l61FqQ.text: Food is ok, not friendly if you are solo. I guess they can get more money place two people at a table instead of one. Both times I went there the bar was full, they had tables open and they wanted me to wait for a bar seat to open. The first time I left, the second time I made the seat me at a table.

CsGLhyZbaOGDLfiEs6SXNA.text: I think my honey and & I finally found our favorite lil hole in the all place to eat, lol. From the exterior Sushi Mon looks fairly decent until you step in and the interior gives off that hole in the place feel mind you it's that feeling that makes it diamond in the rough. All I have to say is the super white tuna is superb it taste's like melted butter in your mouth. The service was great and quick and who's ever heard of tempura ice cream? Of all the joint's we've ate at we've obviously never heard of it and I must say it was pretty good.

LXuJ9a4kqt9_w1Z_whU7Vw.text: This place once was one our favorites, but yesterday we had the most awful experience ever and I will never go back. The food quality was extremely horrible.  When the cashier called the restaurant manager to explain our concerns, she replied that she doesn't have control over the quality of the fish and food....WHAT?  That was by far the stupidest thing I ever heard.  The service sucked, all but one person was nice...the rest could care less about their job.  Maybe this was just a one off, but I'd rather spend my money on other All You Can Eat Sushi places around Vegas.

R-ccD6MoAl8DGwoyKWW4kQ.text: We were craving sushi & what better idea than to go to an ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT place. We had a party of 9 and they seated us right away. everyone on the table must order the all you can eat. Our server was nice for the most part and came around to check on us often. We kept ordering back to back and the chefs kept up to the point we ordered more than what we could handle (always happens! LOL).. It is all you can eat sushi n they have dessert too. Everything tasted fresh and the portion of rice tk the fish was PERFECT! It was enough where you could taste the fish, not spam musubi style where 90% is rice. They do give a stamp card so if youre. regular, dont forget to ask!

JxuEg7q78tcaTJLgfTpNGA.text: 40 minutes waiting for food! I left! Customer service is horrible. I asked the waiter for waters for my kids and he never brought them.

OwfpVYCLSsriUrbSA_YbFw.text: If I could give them a zero I would. We got kicked out tonight because our 4 year olds had left over chicken nuggets they were finishing up. Mind you it is in the 60s tonight. Melisa the server came up to our table after we had ordered drinks and she said the kids could either sit outside and finish their food or we can leave. Definitely never coming back. They preferred for 4 adults to walk out then let 2 kids finish their chicken nuggets.

tcD3gqbW9zgQFfwiKk-4MA.text: Ive been here twice, once for dine in, once for takeout. both times it was amazing. the service for dine in was friendly, not the quickest, but pretty good. for the atmosphere, its comfortable. the sushi itself is delicious, and the seaweed salad is great. takeout was simple and quick. great place overall.

4PxUKNtxw6djK0M1YBNyiw.text: Came back yesterday to celebrate boyfriend's birthday. We have always gotten the AYCE. Yesterday we did too, but I was noticing that this place would be very affordable if you wanted to get something other than AYCE. Most of their regular sushi things (think california roll) are only about $6 for a full order, and soft drinks are only $1.50- which I have never seen at a restaurant before. Anyway, the AYCE was great yet again. We always leave full and happy. Our orders came quickly and the waiters and bussers are quick to clean off any empty plates. We really enjoyed our early dinner here. Took 1 star off simply because it was REALLY HOT in there yesterday. Not sure if there was no AC, maybe the AC was out. It was just really hot which was not great for an AYCE setting. I highly recommend the Moon, Frying Jason, Pastel, and Golden Knights!

0AHWp8IGcEtFY3BKlt9BpQ.text: It never occurs to me to review places I go to all the time.     My family and I are basically regulars at Sushi Mon.  I'm not going to say it's the best sushi I've ever had but I will say that it's the best ayce sushi in Vegas.     I've been to quite a few other places and none other than goyemon (which is a sister restaurant of sushi mon) can compare.   While sometimes you get a miss and the service is bad or the sushi isn't that great but most of the time you'll get A service and good quality sushi.   Especially if you're like me and don't want it drowning in some sweet disgusting sauce.    Definitely give this place at least 3 tries and judge for yourself!

wSq64GRzz7xajYh68jBuRw.text: Great food ....HORRIBLE SERVICE!! I started a birthday tradition that only lasted 2 years after last night ....and keep In mind I never said it was my birthday because I wasn't expecting any special treatment .  Stay away from the short Hispanic girl with long black hair ( in a ponytail ) she is so rude !   I first called to ask if I can make a reservation..... her response was " we don't do reservations over the phone " so i asked how I can make a reservation, her response was " come In and if there is a wait then out your name down and we can call you " THAT IS NOT A RESERVATION ...facepalm ......  Then we get there and it was not busy at all , there was a total of 4 of us , but only myself and my partner had arrived . Naturally we ask to be seated because i was super hungry , the same girl who answered the phone told us she couldn't seat us until the entire party was there ...... I can understand if there was people waiting to sit down and they were slammed .....they had at lease 4 open tables ! We had to sit in the hot parking lot waiting for the rest of our party .  Our server was decent , but left halfway through our dinner and didn't even tell us . No one checked on us the entire dinner . Our bus boy basically became our server .....  Before getting the check my friend had a free meal to redeem and they wouldn't honor it because it was expired last month ....any small business should honor a free meal especially when it goes to show that someone has been there at least 10 times.... but did they no !   Lastly ....we asked the so pleasant girl/ host from earlier if we could get our check ......and that it would need to be split by couples ( and we did hand motions to show how to split the check ) well we get the check and she just split it down the middle ! This was a problem because my other half only had one roll and we had some drinks ....so it wasn't a even split .......I kindly ( even though I was completely over this place at this point) brought it to the host attention ......she replied with " well you said to split it " ...THAT IS NOT WHAT WE SAID  and not only that don't argue with your customers! It then took about 20 minutes to sort out the check fiasco .....I will find a new all you can eat sushi place from now on

mpu-4C-gLnSz4VUB5LVv4A.text: What a great price for all you can eat sushi at lunch! Our server was knowledgeable and encouraged us to try some different things on the menu and if we didn't care for them to let him know. That was really nice considering there's a sign that you can't waste anything, even the rice. But anyways, the only reason why I'm giving a 4 instead of a 5 was that service was a bit slow. We ordered a few plates and it didn't come till after our desserts were delivered even when we ordered those particular plates a few orders prior to dessert but other than that, the fish was fresh and everything was very tasty. I went overboard with the specialty rolls but being too full and skipping dinner that night was worth it.  I'd definitely be back again!

fk2C4zs7NxAfNO5l_iOqJg.text: If I could give zero stars I would. Went to this restaurant to meet a friend and witnessed the staff over serving a table to the point they were cursing and belligerent. Then they allowed the patrons to continue in that manor even and also call my African American friend a ni**er. Any management that over serves and allows this isn't getting my business anymore.

YZf3Edxfq-Y9CCgLvFufMg.text: This place can get pretty crazy crowded in here.  I was definitely a skeptic, but thought it was more than decent after our AYCE meal.    The fish to rice ratio for the nigiri were perfect, especially for all you can eat.  Small cut of fish and the proper amount of rice to make this one-bite, as it was meant for, that much more satisfying.  That is my one pet peeve about AYCEs, is they make massive portions and 2 rolls max, you'll be stuffed with just on rice.  Not here...  The fact that they offer salmon belly was a big score for my guests this evening.  $26.95 for dinner, just ordering a few uni nigiri and salmon belly already paid for itself.  We all opted for AYCE, so sharing was really convenient and allowed us to try more things on the menu.  highlights for me-   tako poke- though a little chewy with light flavoring, more of a ponzu taste was a refreshing change. salmon belly- marbled like crazy throughout, but that made it that much more buttery hamachi kama- fully cooked yellowtail collar bone with a side of ponzu and chopped scallion.  I always find this dish so satisfying to pick at. uni- nice delicate pieces gently laid over a bite size amount of rice. The seaweed wrapped the whole rice with the leftover stuck left out to the shape of number '6'.  Rich and buttery, YUM! red bean ice cream and green tea ice cream- scoops of heaven, hints of matcha and hints of red beans.  Not the best quality, but definitely not too shabby.   The albacore, sashimi salad, red snapper were all good too.  The extensive menu included specials for the night, lots of side dishes and the nigiri was the most impressive for me.    We ordered but one roll to share amongst the four of us and the sexy girl is a no go.  Stuffed with the California roll as the base, a little piece of the tempura shrimp and bits of scallops on top over too much whatever sauce and whole load of tempura sprinkles.    My one other complaint was the temperature was set way too high for the amount of people in the restaurant. We were situated in a corner with the larger table, under the vent and the heat was so uncomfortable, that the blast of cold air from the ocassional opened door was more than welcomed.    Towards the end of our meal, the service got super slow and ordering became more of a waiting game, so we settled for our dessert a little sooner.    Sushi snob, I am not, but this was a decent sushi joint.  I haven't enjoyed much sushi out here, for the fact of being disappointed in comparison to Hawaii and Cali sushi.    I'm super excited that we have this place in Henderson.

24wdRnoWhtvFBsm49vABZQ.text: Our go to spot for AYCE sushi but they have so much more. Salad, tempura, udon and so much different appetizers. Dessert is also included and you image AYCE Mochi ice cream. This place is totally worth it.   Lots of parking. Only reason why they got 4 stars was that the service was a little slower than usual. Short staffed but still great place to eat.

HXKi7r0Mx92nyV1dCiwsQA.text: I can never get enough of this place. If I could come here every week, I would do it.  This is by far the best All-You-can-Eat Japanese restaurant ever.  Not only it's fresh but it is also full of Japanese servers and sushi chefs.    I have tried many different AYCE Japanese places and none compare to Sushi Mon.   Who knew Las Vegas would serve such freshness and tasty authentic Japanese food.    The menu has tons to choose from. Also be sure to check out their black chalkboard on the side.  It has tons of specials so check them out.  If you are at Vegas and you are looking for some fresh sashimi, then this is the place to come.    You won't regret it. !!!!! Yummy

Bg_4nztkpWpKqbR3OAf4Hw.text: I ventured here to this sushi place because my usual and favorite sushi joint didn't open til 4pm.  First off nice ambiance.  It was almost packed but due to the 45 minute time limit of AYCE, people were just in and out.    We were super hungry, all our food came out within 10 minutes of ordering.  Service was helpful and friendly.  The menu was easy to read and came with pictures which was a plus.    I still prefer my usual sushi spot but SushiMon had the Ecstasy Roll which was so good that I will come back just for that.    The 45 minute ayce time limit made me feel rushed but I get it, it's a business.  At first I was going to give this place 4 stars but not all places give you AYCE dessert.  So they deserve the 5!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ecstacy is delishhhh! Pic menu is how you do it!

f2qZO6rmu_UC93VFgXOeTg.text: I gotta admit i love this place only if I don't get seated at the bar.  I think service is way better not sitting at the bar.  Sitting at the bar is hectic cuz the sushi chefs are really busy.   It's my go to place for sushi fix and it's only 5 minutes away from my house.  Wait could be like 30 minutes to an hour but they have an app that will text you when it's almost your time.   So I go there and put my name down... go home and wait for the text.  Lol.  I love the menu selections and the specials.   My son always gets the bento box.

KMug8IP41VoqMzZBk7zBHQ.text: Not many sushi places to choose from after 10pm in Henderson, and Sushi Mon has been a reliable place for me to satisfy my late night craving. The AYCE has plenty of options on the menu and also include daily specials. I find the nigiri sushi mediocre but the side dishes are excellent. The candy crush sashimi is not bad either, while the mini udon is actually rather large.

VGVN7M96R7FGUml78xuvlw.text: My husband has been coming here for years on his yearly visit to SEMA. I'm glad I finally got to try it. I was amazed at the service and quality of the food. If you are a sushi lover All you can eat sushi is the way to go . Although I would have preferred sashimi I settled for nigiri . I definitely over stuffed myself but it was so worth it.

nWnx62mufHscU-q95XJ0XA.text: Not the best ayce sushi I've tried, not sure what it was exactly it just wasn't the best but they're tempura ice cream is so good

eJFRLhJ5F3AqBw-Gatl0yw.text: CONS: Busy, busy, busy, and you'll always be seated crammed up against other people.  PROS: It's busy because it's delicious, the fish is fresh, and while the wait staff is busy, they've always been really cool. The AYCE is fantastic, and they have great combos that are yummy as they are affordable. I judge a sushi place on their nigiri, and this place has yet to let me down.

ZNDPInYEXDx3zPa9YSSkBA.text: This is one of the few sushi joints that I love and trust. ACE for 2 was $54. We also had 2 Sodas & a bottle Sake making our total $75 and some change.   Great selection of sake. Servers are very nice to look at! :-)  They were also  knowledgable of the sushi and sake menu. Our waiter made a suggestion on a sweet sake and on The Chubby roll. Both great suggestions.   I love Sushi Mon because of the fresh taste that their fish has. I eat everything from eel to octopus to tuna to just their appetizers. Everything is so delicious and fresh that it will leave you wanting more. Get ACE if you want to try everything. It's all yummy.  Next time I'll do a play by play on my meal here because I love it so much.

T97inSlpSybS8Pd_IVB7_w.text: F*** this place! The sushi here is ok! Don't get me wrong, that's the only reason I gave it a single star... but the manager "Archer" is a this is a piece of shit. The customer is always right! Specially when it come to being comfortable in a restaurant. Me and my friend sat at the bar but then  5min later other people came in and where way too close to us where we could hardly move, at all! My elbows were literally hitting the person next to me! We politely asked the manager "Archer" if we could be seated else where because we felt too uncomfortable sitting by the bar. "Archer"  with a stupid look on his face and fucked up attitude said no because we had already sat down... when there was so many empty tables free... this made my eating experience at SUSHI-MON a headache and felt disrespected in public... I will never go eat at that place ever again!

Mal-gK6s_ksr9KHEYdDzZA.text: First of all, I love sushi.  Feeding my bottomless pit a huge amount of sushi is beyond love.  After work, I'd work out at the gym across the street from here so I can feel not-so-guilty for over-eating.    Though it's a small place, this is better than the one on Sahara.  They have fresher fish and better cuts.  Super white tuna!!!  Word of caution: eat super white tuna in moderation as they have a laxative effect.  If you're a lightweight or if you're not a huge sushi fan, they have a good regular menu.  By the way, Sushi Mon is on the 50 Must Eats in Las Vegas list.
