ucXcbCHQogF4v-s-nL1Dug.text: I'm a little disappointed with Sushi Mon tonight. My boyfriend and I ordered takeout again and we got our usual but this time I also got the chicken teriyaki. I couldn't wait to get it home since I was starving.  We ate the sushi first and that was good like always. Next came the chicken teriyaki... everything was fine until I got to the last piece of chicken. It had a bone in it and I bit down hard on it and I felt the pain in my tooth. I immediately spit it out and ran to the bathroom mirror. I didn't see any damage but I can still feel a slight pain.   I just hope they are more careful in the future. I will continue to get take out from there but I think I'll just stick with the sushi rolls.  I would have given them four stars but I deducted one star for the chicken bone.

xUymG2S73yEHdM8mn9m08w.text: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE... No one to seat us when we walked in (just a table for 2) and there were several tables open so we figured we would seat ourselves, so we sat at the sushi bar for a good 5 minutes before the hostess came over to us and rudely asked us if we were on the waiting list. I replied that no we sat ourselves because there was no one at the front. She then rudely replied "Nope you guys need to get up there is a waiting list" even though there were several tables open that when I pointed this out to her she said it's because she gives people on the waiting list 10 Minutes to come back for their seating. She didn't even offer to put us on a waiting list and didn't seem to care we were going to take our business elsewhere. Her attitude alone was enough to give this restaurant a 1 star, Because I believe customer service is the most important asset to a business it. There are a million of sushi bars in Vegas not hard to take your money elsewhere.

-bU7tmYFDJQKleMDiy5Low.text: For ayce sushi, this was a very excellent experience.  I tried to order a lot of different nigiri and determined my favorites were negi toro, barracuda, and ikura.  All the others were good but the negi toro really stood out.

tfs7fZo_3zmwcDF8Q-1xrg.text: Ok , so my Sushi spot has always been Yamasushi. Because they had set the standard high from the very first time. Today I decided to try this place out because it was closer to where I live, and let me tell you , This place is AMAZING!!! I think I might have found a new spot. The only n hat I've thing about this place is that they don't have the "no name roll" that Yamasushi has. That's why they got a 4 Star from me. Lol other than that this place is well worth it!! Specially their AYCE!!!!!!! Winning!!!!

mqGPYObK3BGq75EoWG9C7w.text: Who goes to Vegas without stopping by a few AYCE?  Sushi Mon is a great little joint with some decent eats!  Sushi Mon is a small and lightly decorated place with some good eats to offer.  The fish is fresh and the portion sizes are decent.  On a shady note, they do seem to pack a whole lot of rice in every bite.  Tactic to fill you up on rice faster?  Probably.  You can pack away a variety of items before having to loosen the belt.  They have daily/nightly specials written out so make sure you take a peek at the board before you order.  As far as AYCE goes, they're not bad.  I do think there are better sushi places you could go to but if you want speedy seating and no-fuss service, come here!  You get what you pay for without the unnecessary frills.    Whenever my friends and I come here, we try to score a seat at the sushi bar.  It's always fun watching the sushi chefs prepare stuff and if it's slow, they make random handrolls and other items for you to try.  The chefs are sweeties but the waitresses tend to steer clear when you're sitting at the bar.  Can a girl get more tea please?

MAg4V1J29b6gSokhBtU16g.text: Friend and I are visiting Vegas for the first time. When we arrived, we both knew that buffet style was in our minds. He said "you like sushi?" 'My response was "only if it's AYCE or cheap." Sushi Mon meets both of these criteria. But, the best part, is that it's fresh and delicious! Some buffet style sushi can taste cheap but not Sushi Mon. We had a magical experience and left hoot with our bill. Pro-Tip #1: Don't drink carbonated beverages. Straight water will get you the bang for your buck.  Pro-Tip #2: Order the Chubby and Volcano rolls. Amazing.

P_7Uyu2OwXQkyl1F9tA6Mg.text: We had never been to this Sushi-Mon location, but it's our friends favorite and right down the street from their home, so we said 'why not?'   We sat at the large table just inside the door, it seats six, and that was the size of our party. We spent almost an hour in the restaurant, all ordering AYCE, and were only able to order twice. Once upon arrival, and once for dessert. What a sham. We kept trying to flag down the waiter (this place is tiny, so there shouldn't have been an issue) and he was just too busy for us, apparently. We requested a hot tea refill 3 separate times to no avail. The nigiri that I was able to get to the table was great, fresh scallop had a pine flavor to it - strange. Our friends had many rolls - they ordered everything they wanted in the first order, and asked later on why we ordered so little. We explained that with AYCE, you're supposed to order little by little so you don't over-order. They have clearly eaten here so often that they knew you only really had one solid chance of getting your order in. Sad.   We won't be back to this locaton. We'll stick with the other Sushi-Mon and Goye-mon along with other faves in the valley.

D1GMGq4phweuhSR6aKXcPw.text: If I could give zero stars I would, I came here years ago and it used to be my favorite sushi place. I moved and haven't came back since, BUT was in the area and came to try it again yesterday with a girlfriend and I have to say it was the worst experience and sushi I've ever eaten... it took us 15 minutes between each roll to actually receive our sushi rolls! The sushi was DISGUSTING , full of fat and every roll tasted the same, Like they covered it with salt, they were all extremely salty. It was busy and everyone was getting there food on time but my table, only got to eat two rolls each because we were almost at our time limit ! Slowest sushi makers and service ever . Thank god I never came back when I moved until yesterday... get your restaurant together !

oEGo2jdyXgRtJEO_t-UpDg.text: Sushi here is good - not as extensive as some other places in town I've seen, but enough to provide plenty of variety to all but the most extreme of sushi snobs (of which I am not).   I tried the seaweed salad, several different nigiris, and a few rolls during my AYCE experience. All was very good, and came out quick too. Bonus for AYCE is you can do half rolls... Allows for more variety so why not?  The service was pretty quick and the sushi chefs were super friendly. I can't say that it's the best sushi I've had in town - but it seems pretty darn good for a strip mall in Henderson. I'd definitely be up for sushi mon again, not sure I can fill up their buy 10 get one free AYCE card though, that just seems a little implausible to me... But hey, you give it a try.

t60iLkTx0-nQJoZiawaK6g.text: One of the best sushi places I have even been to. We got beef, cucumber salad, California rolls and noodle soup. The meal was huge and quite inexpensive. We always have a good time here. Drinks are very affordable. Wine only 4.50 which is very unsual for Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v1TYjdBM8qKbAfKNm447rg.text: New management in this location. No Uni and no substitute! No fried shrimp head in my miso soup! WTF! From the waiter, the new management limit the food to save costs! Sorry to see one of the best sushi places go down like this. We come here for over 15 years and always order fried shrimp head in miso soup. Now they stop doing that to save food cost, why don't they close the business to save the rent!! Time for searching a new sushi place, IMO

rLUWlyqaJ9uEyVBmVtR02w.text: Sushimon has always been the go-to spot for sushi. The sushi rolls are always good but what I really love about this place is that their Nigiris are amazing for AYCE. I have been to many sushi restaurants, and most of the time the nigiris are gross, but Sushimon gets them right! They make their rice really small and the piece of fish large, so you're not overwhelmed with the sushi rice. The service isn't always the greatest and they do have ups and downs when it comes to the fish or sushi chef, but sushimon for me is the best place to come for AYCE.

CPC2Qa9kkmDRBjHkiRCKaw.text: Have eaten here consistently for years and if it's anything, my experience is always consistently good for AYCE. Generally speaking, quality offerings including some fresh catch on special, which, without question is the way to go and fill up on if doing AYCE. Tip: they'll sub out the fish on special for standard roll inclusions if you ask and you're doing AYCE (for example yellowtail belly vs. yellow tail). I'd like to see larger cuts served generally, especially on Nigiri, as well as more wild caught offerings rather than the mostly farm-raised variety (salmon belly) but I'm nitpicking.

G8dhgW0NgZ_Bcic80L6wqw.text: All You Can Eat (LUNCH) - $21.95 All You Can Eat (Dinner) - $26.95  We went to the Sushi Mon for all you can eat lunch. I didn't realize that something I love is only served during dinner hours. It is a little pity. The quality of the fishes can be better. People are always talking about the buffets of Las Vegas. This one is just OK to me.

Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi poki.

FDxyjMYPLK6RYuncpoTslQ.text: If only I can give 0 star I would. This 1 star is for the service. Specifically a server. His name is JEFFREY. Ate here last night with a group of 10. The host sat us quickly and tried to merge 2 tables together but to try to make it easier for them we said they can leave it separated. We sat down and they came back and said the server wants the table together which was fine we didn't really care. They only gave us 3 menus (mind you there were 6 adults and 4 kids. So we asked for more menus no big deal but come on. I mentioned to the server JEFFREY that we plan to split our bill and he said ok but you can tell he was irritated. JEFFREY took 1 person order on one side of the table cause we weren't ready so the other side of the table decided to order. When he was done taking their order I asked if we can order so he wouldn't have to go back and forth and when walking back to the other side of the table he rolls his eyes and mouths "oh my fucking God".  And that's where I lost it. I'm pretty sure it's your job JEFFREY to take our order so why give us attitude for something that's your job!!! I hope the manager sees this post  because it's UNACCEPTABLE!!! Please talk to your employee to ensure this does not happen again.  And JEFFREY learn proper customer service especially if you plan to stay in the food industry.

2z2kFornK8gh55WHEvj_lQ.text: My husband and I usually love going here to eat and enjoying their all-you-can-eat options. Last night both of us went there to eat. He had the all-you-can-eat which I believe included in a sexy lady and a Dragon Roll, I ate a half roll of Athena and sunrise or Sunset I can't remember which one it was one of those names though. And after we got home from eating, about 4 hours later, my husband got extremely sick he threw up everywhere. I then followed suit. :( it's still really early in the morning so I'm sick this morning but first thing I'm going to do is call the restaurant.

LzJoiSmyO4j4ipvHWuYaoQ.text: Finally I made it here again. It's been almost 2 yrs. Super white tuna damn I had probably like 5 orders alone. You can get half orders on some rolls. Fish is very fresh especially the sake(salmon). No toro though. Limit 2 orders on sweet ebi my fav and uni was ok. It's about 20 min trip off the strip. But well worth the trip. $26.95 pp for dinner. Great place def recommend.  Bring your appettite.

LpDOeEy6PhkrHl1Cb6deOA.text: Say yes to:  Yellowtail Amber jack Baked mussels  Yakitori  Vegetarian: Tamago sushi Seaweed salad  Dessert: Lychee sherbet Green tea ice cream  Service was really quick and efficient. The wait was not too long on a Sunday night. AYCE dinner is $26.95 for an hour of eating.  The lychee sherbet and green tea ice cream were equally delish. The lychee had real lychee pieces and was really refreshing. The green tea ice cream was more like matcha green tea, very great. The mochi ice cream and tempura ice cream were not worth it. Food wise, the fish was pretty decent and fresh, the portions are small so you can try it all. Overall a really great deal!

CTy4ZQcnI8kq8CBnqzYjlg.text: Been eating hear since '04 .. Used to get mad at the all-u-can eat and they'd get mad if your baby ate and tell u no... Well the kids 8 now and we usually get take out anyway.. Only had a problem once and they fixed it .. Now big deal.. Nice staff good prices and good sushi. Spouse is Japanese and sushi mon gets the approval for good sushi!  Oh and they have a sushi bar and usually a game on especially Monday night football.

T5ZEj7y4A439VgxeLg6Qhw.text: First thing first. Same owner as goyemon which explains why the menu is the same, but it's less crowded. I thought the food was delicious and the service was spectacular. I called several times for a table for 10 and they stuck to their policy and wouldn't put our name on the list. It worked out fine and we only had to wait 20 minutes. They are strict to their no sharing policy but are fine with letting some people order a la carte and others ordering all you can eat. It works out perfect if you have light or finicky eaters. I would definitely come back here! Delicious for sure!!!

WQrLlnPirtTpTnHUB74YbQ.text: Been coming here for years and every time the service gets a bit worse. They have a waiting list, they take your phone number and leave empty tables open till everybody shows up. We've been looking for a whole row open for half hour while people waiting outside. Food is getting worse, chefs are getting more rude

vOJ49kBOzqUFlBbPKTqm8w.text: Came here for a quick late night sushi date with my good friend , right off the bat our server was rude , didn't sense good vibes from him at all , he literally took 20 mins to take our order wasn't busy at all .. He was standing there talking to his friend. Finally when he saw us " giving him the eye " is when he came .. The food was okay not to expensive ... Could have been better , literally had to keep flagging him down .. The services overall sucked

h2fIf9F2ygtPGiTSU2r_2w.text: Quality of sushi is really good. There are plenty of other options included with the AYCE sushi plus dessert!! I wish they carried asahi black though.

wqBa-90p0_zp2UVUYO-Uzw.text: My experence was ok ... it wasnt the best to die for sushi but the reson why i gave it 3 stars is the service...

U0mCmf2iEwaFcRF0_uou5g.text: Over all we liked this place. AYCE but still quality is good (some are not excellent but still good). I want to come back again.

Y0gZrsbKnS01DMYbpoXDig.text: If you ever get sick of the buffet breakfast/lunch/dinners and don't want to spend the big dollars on the fancy restaurants then you gotta come out here.   If you ever go to Vegas and crave sushi, this is the place you need to be. You can't imagine how fresh the sushi is in the desert. Referred by my friend Kenny C, he was right on about this place. Sushi Mon is what it's hyped up to be.   The 27 dollar all you can eat sushi simply put..............is phenomenal. There are some rules and limitations on your sushi intake. You have to eat all of the rice, there is a time limit of 45 minutes, and you will get penalize if you waste food. Fair enough!!!   Each person is allowed to order one order of uni(comes in a pair nigiri style), one order of amaebi(comes in a pair, nigiri, and one order of the hamachi kama(half a cheek). These 3 orders by itself is well worth the 27 dollars. All three orders were excellent. You figure it would be lower quality uni, shrimp, and filled with a big glob of rice right??? No, it wasn't. There was very little rice and the uni and shrimp were extremely fresh. The hamachi kama was cooked perfectly, had that nice char from the grill that gives it that smoky flavor and it was seasoned well.   The rest of the sushi were good as well. The halibut, tuna, salmon.........were all fantastic. I tried to get away with some of the rolls because I didn't want to get filled up from the rice. Believe it or not, they were also fantastic. I have absolutely no complaints about this place and will be sure to come back the next time I am in Vegas.   Bookmark this place!!! This is definitely a must try.

nwLU--vbxGGjV4qUhUxH-A.text: Absolutely love this place, the all you can eat sushi is the bomb! The Hurricane was sooo good

Ci_qgB-Fa4n_E4FTrbcV3A.text: Love this place!!! They have decent price for all-you-can-eat sushi. I normally don't like going to all you can eat sushi places because I feel like most are trying to cheat you by giving you rolls or sashimi packed with rice or a lot of sweet eel sauce or all the rolls are made of california rolls with different toppings. However, this place is not like that. Their rolls size are perfect, and they have variety of different rolls and sashimi and not all california rolls based. You can also order half orders so you can save your stomach for more tastings. The sushi chefs are japanese so it is def authentic. Make sure you ask for the stamp card where you can get your 11th meal free

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
