R9eNQ9s4jlYwnJOPqSPfKQ.text: This is not the best sushi I've ever had.  However, it is the best AYCE sushi I've ever had.  And it's considerably better than some regular sit down sushi places I have been as well.  The fish is pretty fresh, they don't overdo it on the rice when you order nigiri sushi, the rolls are creative and very tasty and the coup de grace: they have natto!!!  I had four natto hand rolls on top of everything else I ordered when I ate there.  Just a very well done AYCE sushi experience.  Kudos Sushi Mon!  Cheers!

CVmp0CxYX6RWDyyky7l82w.text: I don't think I'll be going back here again. The food was SO bad. I was practically forcing myself to eat. I ordered 2 dishes and couldn't take anymore. My friend, who I apologized to multiple times afterwards for agreeing to eat here with me, kept getting evil stares from the waiters and chefs. I could tell they didn't like him because they would ignore him or never give him respectful eye contact when talking, but would turn around and smile brightly at me and give me almost flirtatious looks. Creeped me out!

bAE3cNJnempMe-ChltteaQ.text: Came here again this past weekend at around 9PM. We had two groups of 6 people. Wait was about 40 minutes long -__-  Service wasn't great but the sushi is amazing! Dinner all you can eat is about $25.  They have so many things to choose from. I wanted to order the chief's special I heard so much about, but the server said they ran out =(  All the sushi is fresh and delicious! They have so many rolls to choose from and they were all so yummy. But I liked my salmon, albacore, and scallop the most! So yummy =)   And lychee sorbet is the best!! I love this place! My boyfriend has been to sage sushi and a few other AYCE sushi places and he really liked Sushi Mon =)

Bcmyfymg1N4OgctDgYdYEA.text: This is the BEST SUSHI restaurant in Las Vegas.  And it's very afforadable, sushi buffet for $27.  It offers all the traditional nigiri and sashimis, but it also offer a variety of rolls.  As part of the buffet, you can also order hot dishes and desserts.  Everytime I am in Vegas, I will at least visit twice, and I am usually there only for 2-3 days.  It's a must visit like the Bellagio fountain.

aGYGgPP_YcEyjPGw9YekDA.text: Great to find a sushi place as good as this in Henderson! We love going to Goyemon on Decatur but wanted to find a place closer, and Sushi Mon is owned by the same company. OUTSTANDING Sushi and sashimi! Also great little side salad and miso soup!   My only complaint was the orange chicken wasn't real crispy and was smothered in sauce, so I wasn't able to eat it all. However, stick to the fish and you're golden! We got the sashimi dinner, andy roll, and the taylor and they were all fantastic!  We were also happy with the servers and the sushi chef behind the counter (we sat at the bar) so no complaints on the service side either!  If you're nearby, you MUST check this place out! So good!

7l0H9g6uFQ-ReZjQbCu_6g.text: This place always has great quality sushi and they are quick! The only thing I noticed recently was that the last couple times we placed orders for appetizers in all u can eat and nobody brought them to us. We even ordered twice just to be sure but nothing but normally the service is good and if it wasn't for that happening on occasion I'd give it 5 stars

AFkkzWlya-Tsj0URNhg3-g.text: ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT-SUSHI (incl misc apps) all MADE TO ORDER.  Noice!  Since I'm new to town, I've been meeting a whole mess of locals, and they all converge here on Tuesdays, LATE night...like MIDNIGHT late.   (..and here i thought i relocated from the city that never sleeps [aka NYC] but apparently VEGAS seriously..no SERIOUSLY..never E.V.E.R. sleeps..)    ...and evidently, neither does SUSHI MON! This joint closes at 2am! SuhWEEEET!  It's all you can eat GRANTED you finish YO food.  So far, my fave is the Moon Roll - albacore, yellowtail, avocado, eel sauce and tempura flakes...I think...  And it's YUMMMM..   They also serve flavored Hana Sake, which is a plus for yours truly.   I'll definitely be back because, as 4 stars says it: YAY. I AM A FAN :)

UWjxxUjX1eNKODWEZCWtFQ.text: I do love sushi and this place is great. It's smaller so if you plan on eating sushi for dinner, I would recommend getting here earlier or you will end up waiting. This time we came for lunch so there wasn't a wait to be seated. They have all you can eat for lunch and dinner ($21.95 for lunch / $26.95 for dinner) and there is a time limit. While I did not partake in the AYCE this time, I was pretty excited to get the sashimi lunch. Mmmmm!!

VFarQczAhV45LYfCAfxNfg.text: For an all-you-can eat sushi bar, this place is really good. But otherwise it's just eh. Not the place to go if you are looking for a high-end sushi restaurant.  They do have a very interesting selection of rolls they have created, so if you like an all-you-can-eat place with a lot of unusual options for rolls then this is a decent choice.  Very casual, no reservations and a long wait to be seated during busy hours.

LnqMDBDKOEcFjQfwQlFEdQ.text: I like the all you can eat. So much more authentic and tastier than todai. The sushi is okay.  Can't say I had better "all you can eat" sushi but I had better sushi.

yTDG3yPCxAkCqwjx8j6nbg.text: You can have all of the sushi you want ... for about an hour.   I tried this place with a group of my friends while we were staying at Vegas. They have a good variety to choose from and it's all made to order. The quality of the fish was decent but pales in comparison to a regular pay-as-you-go sushi bar. Some of the pieces had warm rice! There's also an assortment of rolls to choose from such as the spider roll and salmon skin roll. Beware... the rolls are huge!   Some of the items are one-order-per such as the Sweet Shrimp and the Sea Urchin. But they also have a bunch of other none sushi stuff that's all you can eat such as the miso soup, green tea ice cream and shu mai.   The place is small but can still accommodate a couple of large groups. A real cozy feel with waiters watching you to make sure you don't waste food.   They were quick to respond and take additional orders.  Overall you get what you paid for and for $27.00 (dinner) I can see myself coming back for more.  Just don't expect the best quality.

KRo7hF9ogZU7kWpHRM0QpA.text: This is probably the best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas.  The rolls are made fresh to order, the menu has a great selection, and the service is fast.  The best things on the menu besides the rolls are the baked mussels and Ahi Poki.  Just those two I could eat forever.  I would have given this place 5 stars if I didn't have to wait so long for dinner.  But it was well worth the wait.  Sushi Mon needs to expand so they have more tables.

xf0BwEk06CDFg85YlAHCrQ.text: my boyfriend's sister, who's a sin city local raves about this place! so on our last visit we made this our final stop just before heading to the airport. i have to admit we were a bit skeptical at first. we're pretty hardcore sushi eaters and this place just seemed way too good to be True!  the four of us came for the sushi buffet at about $25 per person. we seriously tried just about every roll on the menu and were stuffed but still made room for dessert! who could turn down endless green tea ice cream scoops right? the fish was fresh and the rolls each had it's own sushi mon little twist to it. i forget the names, but i enjoyed their variation of the usual spider roll and garlic tuna.   this place is a super steal at price, quantity and quality! generally a couple rolls sets the check at about $30 at typical sushi bars. needless to say we boarded our returning flight satisfied and full. sushi mon will definitely be one of our number one hit up spots when visiting vegas from now on.

G6Ky81GDCFVhagkpyRdnXw.text: This is the best all-you-can-eat sushi buffet I had ever been to!  Sashimi is fresh and quality is very good for what you pay for.   The best items to order are fresh scallop and tuna belly sushi.  It sure beat the regular sushi restaurant in terms of food qaulity.  Price wise - only $27.99 for dinner, that's a very reasonable price for a buffet in Vegas.  I will definitely come back!

N4WCelz4UpJ1eii0I2dzxQ.text: Oh, dearest me, Sushi mon, Sushi mon, sigh, why oh why do you charge so much for all you can eat sushi? Is the fish quality better than any other AYCE sushi restaurants? Absolutely not. Are their rolls superior to other AYCE sushi restaurants? Nope!  This wildly popular sushi joint is gleaming with southern Las Vegas patrons. They are swarmed with clients day in and day out and late night. I walked in at 11pm on a Friday and there was a large crowd of people waiting to either get into the restaurant or just hanging out in front of Sushi Mon. I guess that is the new thing these days. "Hey, we are going to hang out at Sushi Mon and pretend we are cool." Nevertheless, the wait was short as I was dining alone and the bar was sufficient for myself.   I started to look at their laminated menu and took a look around the restaurant itself. The restaurant itself is bland, Someone had the bright idea of putting tile, in a diagonal pattern, on the wall. Are you kidding me? EPIC FAIL. The seating is quite spread out and the restaurant itself is quite small. The sushi chefs are abundant, however, and that is usually a great sign for a busy restaurant. The patrons seemed happy indulging in their gluttony of raw fish, rice, mayo and cream cheese creations. I for one, always order the sushi first before I order any specialty rolls.   The salmon sushi was just meh to my standards. Their salmon was a bit  warm and the texture seemed off. The tuna was good and their yellowtail was surprising very good. I do have to say their rolls are quite interesting. I can't really remember what I ordered, but what I did order tasted a-ok to me. I remember asking my sushi chef to make me their best roll they had. It was some shrimp tempura roll concoction wrapped in soy paper. Can't remember the name but I remember liking it very much.   As for the positive sides of the restaurant, I can see why people like this place. The warm welcoming staff, the sushi chefs, and the massive amount of people waiting to attack their sushi rolls with their salivating palates.   A word for the owners. You are doing a great job. I hope you continue to succeed. For Christ's sake, please take that stupid tile down from the wall and put up some authentic artwork or something! Augh, it really makes me not want to dine there because of the crappy decor. Stop charging so much for standard sushi quality! Then again, if people are paying it why stop right? I understand.    Yes I would return to the restaurant, but, I probably wouldn't go by myself again. If my friends are willing to go I may just join them.

BMz11ymNQL7zglA0SCsnbA.text: We went here with the expectation of being slightly hustled. Was I ever wrong. The service is very friendly and efficient. The sushi chef, Jilson, was very helpful with our ordering. Half rolls are the way to go. The fish is fresh and tasty. The place is spotless. Restrooms are very clean. New favorite sushi place. Highly recommended. Go and eat here.

2P7R3P22vvdmergEPM_huQ.text: was good. and there was a very beautiful Japanese waitress.  and at that time not too many people so, we did not wait to sit.  sushi is ok. I will go again.

4d_nrul7co6n5uFCrrm-fA.text: We had high hopes for this place but that was not the case . Our server was hard to understand. The appetizers were over cooked & shrimp tempura was not crunchy it was soggy . The chicken teriyaki was to dry . The 2 pcs of fish wit salmon had too much rice & salmon was not fresh it was chewy . There tuna was ok & yellow tail was ok. The scallops were hard to chew. The server said that our 1 hour ion all you can eat is about to be over & if we want desert , I feel like we were rushed to eat go very uncomfortable. The desert was ok I fished . My sister & I won't be back.

I1rUVDIuFpGgMkqmH94ZfQ.text: Wow. This is one of my favorite restaurants. I live in Southern California but this is one of our must-eat places when we come to visit family in the Henderson/ Las Vegas area.  The best thing about this place is the choice of sushi/rolls you get.  You have a huge menu to choose from (desserts are included on the menu).  A very nice selection and high-quality.  Also, the staff is totally cool and are always ready to take additional orders.  Outstanding.

oWljlqwCCj66zEIhs1Dsvg.text: Having been jaded by "All You Can Eat Sushi" before my husband and I were hesitant to meet our local family members at a strip mall for sushi.  We had even made alternate dinner plans with our friends on the Strip, just in case.  It was a week night and pretty early 5:30 pm so there was a lot of room for our party of 5.  The waitstaff seemed a little standoffish at first, but after we ordered they were very quick to refill our hot tea and check on us.  3 of our family members ordered entrees.  The portions were huge and looked tasty.  My husband and I ordered the AYCE and were very surprised to see that there were so many choices for both rolls and negri.  We ordered several rolls both standard (spider, spicy tuna, yellow tail) and specialty (Vegas a go go)  We were delighted to taste fresh fish.  We ordered till our mercury levels were off the charts and then the sea called and asked us to pace ourselves for fear they could not generate enough fish for the rest of the world.  We left satisfied and happy.  I do appreciate their 20% charge if you do not finish the sushi you order.  I also appreciate the 1 hour limit on AYCE except if I was going to be held by it...I am not sure if its really busy that AYCE is worth it if you only have an hour.

jR9U89D5X1C8rTqjYgJ60A.text: I always come here when I go to Vegas. AMAZING sushi for a decent price. I highly suggest doing the all you can eat option since it's such a great deal. The only downside is that the wait for a table is loooong especially during dinner time. I've waited nearly an hour on a couple of occasions. Other than that, everything is great.

XsTAPxo9RfNh6SqnGUKbWQ.text: I love this tiny place! Far away from the strip, but located in a strip mall, this is a veritable treasure in the city of sin.   Any time of day, for $25.95 per person, you can eat all you want - anything you want - on the menu.  Though there is a sixty minute time limit, I have never been kicked out after an hour.  However, after eating sushi for an hour you are done! Especially after eating their deep fried or monster rolls, you won't have much room left. I advise sitting at the sushi bar.  You can tell the sushi chef directly what you want, you can have half orders of almost all the rolls, so you can sample a wide variety. Here is a sample of what I ordered on my recent visit, just to give you an idea: Dynamite (scallops baked with mushrooms and onion, a creamy mayo sauce, into a scallop shell) 5.25 Baked Green Mussels 5.95 Cajun Albacore Sushi (this is my favorite) 4.00 Salmon Sushi 3.50 Seared Tuna 4.00 Salmon Roe 3.75 1/2 order of Mingus Roll (deep fried spicy tuna, cream cheese, and avocado) 4.25 Pixie Roll (deep fried sot shell crab, spicy yum-yum shrimp and cucumber, avocade, wrapped with soybean paper and topped with smelt eggs) 10.75 J.J. Roll (crab stick tempura, cream cheese, avocado, asparagus, topped with eel sauce)  Of course I sampled my friend's dishes as well, and they were all delicious.  Though only the sushi is all you can eat, there is still an extensive Japanase cuisine menu, from which to sample. Drinks are not included in the all you can eat, but the desert is also included. I love the green tea ice cream and the plum sorbet. Curious about the 50 rolls they have? Go to the website for their complete menu and photos and descriptions of all the rolls.

8yrkltt2BGRlZ2DRXPoUVQ.text: okay. im a sushi whore. and i know it.  and there's no where better to whore it up, than at Sushimon's All You Can Eat sushi. basically, one flat fee to keep eating sushi nigiri, rolls, and food from the kitchen for an hour.   sushi - is good. really can't F'up the nigiri - its fish on rice. nothing fancy - rule is tho you must eat the rice. the rolls are the stars, as they are usually custom and made to order - i love the jaelin roll, tiger roll and super caterpiller roll. its good stuff - and whats cool is they'll let you order half rolls to really change it up.  hot food - is good too. mostly side dishes and apps - but i like the curry rice, yellowtail collar, fried gyoza and miso soup.  dessert - fried ice cream or mochi - the ultimate is the super sweet and exotic lychee sherbert - yum.  ALWAYS a stop when im back in vegas, i suggest the same for you.

qbQ6INYapVvAZjeA8SLxuQ.text: i wouldn't think that an all-you-can-eat sushi joint would be any good, but this place surpassed my expectations. can't say it was the best sushi i've had, but they were good, and had other dishes as well.  the fried oyster, baked mussels, and sake shots were terrific.  nigiri & rolls we devoured.  i agree that the price could be a bit less.    they do charge for unfinished food.

UO6R1MqTVoVR_Pf0S-Z5pQ.text: Always awesome. Love all the special rolls. My favorite Sushi spot at home. Great service and excellent Sushi - the rice is a little soggy at times. I haven't done "All You Can Eat" in a while, but the value is great. Get there early or very late. There is always a wait at the peak hours.

rZRvwWaB4tInTFwxh71zXQ.text: Until last night, this was #2 in my top 3 Sushi. I did discover an amazing place so Sushi Mon drops  into #3. However, they do have an outstanding assortment of special rolls and a very friendly staff. The prices are pretty darn good for a sushi place and you don't really have major quality issues because of it. I would highly suggest this place to friends and family over and over again. It is nicely located and easy to access.

maePtG-Uuz8SIZXS5SXDBg.text: another place i've been to twice...  that being said.. it must be good.  the first time we went though, there was a confrontation with a customer about sharing.. being that it is all you can eat, you pay a flat rate of about 25 bucks and technically can only share with those who also have the "all you can eat" menu.    anyway, there was a big ass scene.. i don't know what exactly happened, but we were sitting right next to the table and it seemed like the dude was trippin' over the mother sharing something with her toddler son..  idk if i liked that too much..  but, all in all.. it's a good place with good sushi..  being that their seems to be a lot of people that go to this place, a reservation would probably be best if your in a large party... or even if there's only 2 ppl in your party.  it's not a very big place and doesn't seat to many people at once.    since it is all you can eat,  we tried to order all our sushi at once.. and sometimes they forgot to bring something out... but do manage to bring enough out for you to kinda forget... i stress kind of...  anyway, good place... and they're open late!

v07UE0r5ZG9wcMaNN3I6Bg.text: First time at this restaurant, and loved it! Under $30 for all you can eat sushi, appetizers and dessert. I was a big fan of the half orders so I wouldn't waste any of the food. Although I loved a majority of what I ordered I wouldn't get the spicy tuna.

LUJSPBIk2sUAhvpE7W2cNQ.text: Ok..so if u want me to get straight to the point. I have been to this locatiom 3x. It NEVER dissapoints. I am talking about the best sushi in TOWN!!!! Moon roll, miles roll, JJ Roll the list goes on..chefs are great, food is exceptional, wait staff is friendly. The price moderate, for AYCE, but its worth every penny. This location is better than the one on W. Sahara, since they have more to offer. If someone talks about Sushi-Mon go to THIS LOCATION!!. The sushi chefs are much better, and the food is better and they have more to offer on the menu. Everything comes out fresh, and have not once have had a complaint. Don't forget the strawberrry mochi, and ice cream tempura, baked mussels and ahi poke are great too. This is the real deal, for sushi in vegas, forget the strip, with the over priced rolls. This is the best deal in town, and the best sushi in TOWN!!! If anyone out of town, asks me about sushi, i tell bring them here!

zeTJQ9DamihP4NyKrhRFdA.text: Very good sushi and quite a variety to choose from. I usually order nigiri, including ikura (salmon roe) and if ikura isn't fresh, it's disgusting. Theirs has always been fresh, as is the fish. They've never made a mistake with my carryout orders and the place is always hopping in the evenings so it's too crowded inside to wait for your order or a table.  People wait at the tables and chairs outside the building.  If you're from Vegas the heat doesn't feel so bad, but tourists will probably think it's too hot to wait outside.

uWE-_-4wSR-wJQpG6LdxLg.text: Sushi Mon is my all time favorite sushi restaurant!!!  Despite there's always a wait around dinner time, the sushi is fresh and they have the best tempura ice cream.  I'd recommend to get the all-you-can-eat to take advantage of all of the appetizers, sushi and dessert.  Trust me, you have a lot to choose from!

vCJvt_qyba4g1h2FXYH3zw.text: While visiting Las Vegas I just happen to select that place to eat at and wow was it amazing. The sushi was made fresh when we order it and the rolls were delicious. There was a wild selection of available rolls and nigiri and the lycee and tempura ice cream was amazing. The service was fast and very friendly. Definitely coming back here again.

vED2-odt4vN9Exn5NkBy5Q.text: This is my sushi place.  If I'm not scoping out a new place, this is my old-reliable sushi place.  Sushi Mon is a small privately owned sushi restaurant in a rather nondescript shopping center on the corner of Maryland and Silverado.  It's also very popular, so be prepared to wait for up to half an hour or even 45 minutes on busy nights.  That being said, it's totally worth even an hour wait to get in.  The sushi chefs are fun and talkative, and really help you out, and will make you custom rolls if you ask for it.  The fish is always fresh and flavorful, and they have a lot of specialty rolls, and are always adding more.  In addition, they have a large selection of nigiri, and will always have a special of the day posted on the wall.  The wait stuff is quick and efficient, though they don't have as much personality as the chefs.  And the manager is the best guy ever.    Personal favorites are the jala-jala roll, the sushi-bon, Pete's roll, and the must-have Dynamite.    The all-you-can-eat is $26.95, which is a little daunting for newbies, but it's the only choice for a Sushi Mon-ster like me.  Keep in mind, too, that you can get half-rolls as well, so you're not stuck eating a huge roll that you wanted to try but didn't like.  This is a social experience, so don't go alone, it's just not fun, is it?    Also, they have an all-you-can-eat punch card.  Eat 10 times, and you get your 11th one free.  I've made use of this 3 times in the last year.  Here's a secret:  Take friends from out of town!  You can have their stamps and add to your card! :D    Finally, this place is just plain consistent.  I've been to other sushi places where they were good one day, and not good the next.  The service would be worse, or the fish would be less fresh, or some thing.  Sushi Mon has always been good and delicious and has never let me down yet, and I've been here more often than those other places combined.    Don't look for fine dining, just fun, over-stuffed sushi dining!

v2bNGvVAp8_f0nspXwVThQ.text: I can not explain why one of my favorite Sushi place is so far from the water...Esp when I live on the water. But Sushi Mon is the Man! --OK that was lame but really this place has the best value, it is so cheap and the sushi/ sashimi portions are LARGE. Wine by the glass is $3 (prob not a recognizable vintage but who cares? -its 3bucks!) The sushi chefs are entertaining and its open until 3AM. I've been coming here for years --every visit to Vegas means a visit to Sushi Mon, I've been looking for something comparable in my hometowns. Still looking....

y-FVlYs31aQu0uBI_ABtMg.text: At first, you would think this was another wanna be sushi joint. Shockingly, this place is very good. I always go for the all you can eat. Go figure, I am a glutton. Try to come here with a large group so you can try all the rolls. If not stick to the small sushi or else you will get full with two orders of sushi rolls. There is always a wait every time I come here, so try to get here as soon as they open. I know that quality has gone down but that is every sushi joint in town. Some worse than others. Yes, I am a fan of this place.

0oiQY6o2xI5Pqx7NH_LW-A.text: If you're a sushi lover do the buffet amazing price and for delicious sushi! Everything was great quality and the selection was very extensive from side dishes, to specialty rolls and even desserts. The Tiger roll was great along with the fresh nigri rolls and the sake shooters were YUMMy too. All in all this was a great find and I would go back many a times if I had the opportunity. Forget eating on the over priced strip, this is where its at.

fAwbMY0vA9rJkqxIxpH7IA.text: I'll definitely come here next time I'm in town. Great food, friendly people.

oHXzMyAYXpaO2Z8bsFyrPw.text: If there is anything less than 1 star I would have click it.  My first time entering a review as this place has the WORST (when I say worst I CAP on it) management ever.  The manager at the front desk has the worst service as it was a cold night out we had kids with us and he rejected us a seat stating we could go somewhere else if we cant wait.  It took us 60 dollars in taxi fee to get there to try it out and he told us we could go somewhere else if we dont want to wait for him to feel the mood to let us in.  The night was busy but he was letting in 2 to 3 people but not reserving table for us.  STAY AWAY!

nqEHrzEV7K860lGhWDmoWg.text: Definitely one of the best all you can eat sushi bars i've been to.  The selection cannot be beat, where else can you get sea urchin or buttery raw shrimp included? Only gripe, Mochi ice cream was a lil frozen when we got it.  Delicious and a great value at 22 for lunch (i think).

MhBW8CCJ2UjIGk3zIW8fxQ.text: I love sushi mon!! We go there at least 3 times a month, food is good, service is good. My favorite roll there is the miles roll!!!! Mmmmmmmmm

lR1mUSKBe7GgdP9yoa84tw.text: Been going to this place for years.  There is usually a wait after 6:00pm.  Sushi is fresh and the Uni is yummy compared to other places.  Decent service and worth the money if you have a big appetite.

dhynwIazIH_HFj6BSZMk3g.text: This is my husbands and I's  favorite place to eat sushi. Great fresh fish, and speedy service! I only wish that they expanded the property. It gets a bit stuffy and its usually busy. So for the most part you will be waiting at least 30 mins if you go in the evening. Thank goodness they opended up a sister property Goyemon which gives you the same great taste with great ambience plus its on our side of town. Cant go wrong there! either way its worth checking out :)

d1XtuuWFA3LHAa-IQlQ2kw.text: Went to this place coz I could not get a table at my fav sushi place on a Fri night. I love sushi and having had sushi all around vegas, I consider this to be the worst in vegas.  I firmly believe, I eat with my eyes first. So, if it looks appetizing, It makes me feel good.  - For starters, it was stuffed with rice. - Size of few rolls were too big. It kept bouncing off of my mouth. - Very unprofessional staff. Smile dammit!!! when food is ordered. Staff should be friendly even when they don't want to. U are a running a restaurant. So hire such people and make the guest feel invited. - It gets worse now, I was sitting at the bar and some dude kept washing/cleaning the floor every 3 mins. I felt sick seeing a guy mop the floor while I was having food. This went on for the entire duration I was there. -  Very disorganized. No system to track who ordered what. I was sitting at the bar, the chef could not remember my order multiple times. I was given 3-4 rolls that wasn't mine. - Got a chance to peek at the back. The floor was covered with some white power that looked like flour.(Flour in a Sushi Bar?????) May be they think about cleaning the kitchen floor once in a while rather than cleaning the bar every 3 mins. - Slightly overpriced, but I don't mind shelling out few extra bucks since I love sushi so much. But this place just Blows!!!  Bottom Line: I'll be back to this place only in their dreams and in my nightmares. I would rate it 0/5 but yelp wudnt let me :(  My recommendation:  Yama Sushi(Maryland Pkwy & Flamingo). This place is the best in Vegas. 100 bucks, you will keep coming back to this place for more. If you digg sashimi, definitely try "Seafood Salad". Its out of this world. Yummy :)))

qbB4KA3V2DIP1AjEuyRLTQ.text: We ate at sushi mon every time we visit Vegas. And we love the place. But this time, they changed the all u can eat menu. No sweet shrimp, no uni, no yellow tail collar. Salmon collar is out, shrimp head miso soup out. Don't know how to order now.

oBz8lqLSBTOj7voC5sw3Dg.text: How lucky am I that this place gave me my first sushi experience ever!!! We come here once a week, and yes, almost everytime around dinner time there is a wait. BUT IT IS SO WORTH IT. Plus they are really good with their to-go orders. Not the greatest place for large parties who want to sit and socialize alot, but perfect for a quick, healthy bite. Try the tiger roll, it is by far the best.

Iml4yZtjRCZu_Ne7GeRL6w.text: I love the variety of this place.  The all you can eat option allows you to eat tons of different kinds of sushi and side dishes.  The quality of the fish was okay, but I wasn't expecting much from an all you can eat sushi place.  I recommend getting half orders so you can try more options.  The service was very fast and friendly and I would defeinitely come back again.

qTXnUUY6o6oiq8xJqG_gIw.text: i like this place and love the taste of the sushi. great quality for being no where near the ocean.  only sucky part is being the person who has to eat the leftovers because some girls have hungry eyes...

TA5DKS8slBc3qcGpHkKamQ.text: I was told there's an amazing sushi all-you-can-eat restaurant off the strip in Las Vegas and I did my first visit in Feb 2009. That was such an awesome experience. Came in around 12pm and ordered lots of half-order baked rolls and fancy sushi. The raw fish, esp. the yellowtail, was very fresh. The strawberry mochi was also very impressive as a dessert.  Based on my previous experience, I gave it a second try last week during lunch time. However I found that there must be something different... I can tell the sushi was made differently, although all the chefs were the same. When I pick up the sushi, the rice fell apart easily. I was not sure if it's because the chef did not make the roll correctly, or the rice was not made for sushi at all. But with the price they charge, it is not supposed to happen (especially it's made by Japanese chefs!). The chef lapsed our order several times even when we were sitting at the sushi bar. Even if the raw fish was still fresh, I was feeling so different that I have to gave it only 3-start this time.  C'mon sushi mon, you fish deserves 5-star, what happened to your sushi rice??

bsWGgWjcNlidiZ-CL7i31w.text: I've gone here several times before and I remember years ago it was pretty decent, but the last few times I leave there being completely dissatisfied.  My parents enjoy it since it's close to them.  The rolls are loaded with rice and tasteless chewy fish.  I should have ordered cooked food.  And the service.... I literally had to flag 3 servers down and it wasn't even that busy.  Definitely will not be returning.

o4WItFdn6K-HAyv2CC9DlQ.text: Based on the rave reviews, I decided to stop by for the "all-you-can-eat" dinner during this trip.  The quality of the fish is mediocre and nowhere near fresh. Yes, I know it's in the middle of a desert, but I expect some freshness when I'm eating raw. The yellow tail roll looked like clumps of fish paste. the sweet shrimp tasted like it had been sitting out on the docks for days before transport to Vegas. It was a hard dinner to digest. As far as the "all-you-can-eat" deal, I asked for 3 orders of sweet shrimp but was limited to only 2.  I consider this a False advertisement as it's not  "all-you-can-eat", but rather "what we are willing to serve you".  I used to live here and there are other far better local  joints that serve decent fresh fish. Anyone who rated this place more than 1 star must be on crack or smokin' something  really good. Either way, I'd rather be doing that than gambling on my food.

jrEmpV3DLJ5y3bm14TFIPA.text: Great place for all you can eat sushi, ingredients are fresh and tasty. My family loves this place, service is friendly and fast. Many creative sushi rolls as well as your basic rolls, good made to order food, fresh seafood and good desserts. Cant get any better than that.

LPKoF9ghNmuafH6ftZGcpA.text: AYCE sushi is like playing roulette. This one seems to be a winner.   You can usually tell a bad sushi place when the list of rolls is 8 pages and comes in book form.. sushi (to me) is not crazy rolls with names like "Oriential Delight". Whenever you mix too many ingredients and then drown it in sauces you can't taste if the fish or rice is good or bad.  Maybe I am a purist but sushi should be good rice and good fish. this place has a full list of nigiri-zushi and sashimi and it is all really good.

pMacOCXDgEwhhCAohCcOxA.text: We travel 4 hours to Vegas and we always have to stop by Sushi Mon. This time we tried the Maryland location. We arrived at 10:30pm and there was 20 minute wait. Most of people come here for AYCE sushi. It never disappoints us. I especially like their great service. That's why I gave 5 stars.

kthkni9ygFbQta_L0gHl2Q.text: There is a Vietnamese boy at this sushi joint! At first I had the suspicious that he's Vietnamese but kept on thinking he might be Korean or Japanese. He looks kinda like Kim Hyun Joong but Kim Hyun Joong has plastic surgeon and 99-100% of Korean actors have plastic surgeon. He doesn't have plastic surgeon so I kept on thinking he must be Vietnamese. I finally asked if he is and he said yes but he doesn't know how to speak Vietnamese. Mystery solved. He doesn't seem as difficult or strict as the Korean and Japanese. Might be easy going to ask him then the others. Usually I don't dare to ask to much except to eat my food and pay. He's young so will have less experience but I'm Vietnamese I can handle inexperience than strict personality. He looks like he's from Da Lat region. Em trai nhin thay yeu uoi, nen uong sua pha voi  bot calcium cho to con len!   As for the food, I live a block away so I have to come here for sushi. Everything is either prudent or bland here. Salad has a prudent ginger soy sauce with sesame oil. Sushi hand cut and all sushi roll have bland taste. Fish taste ok, but from time to time the tuna is brown. I stay away from it multiple times. Dipping sauce is only soy sauce + wasabi and no other sauce available. High fresh quality might be given to Kabotu. I have the suspicious that SushiMon is part of Kabotu, Goyemon, and Monta Ramen. Monta Ramen is the noodle house and Goyemon is the sister sushi house that will capture those that doesn't like or know SushiMon. SushiMon on the westside is for those that are in the west but are a fan of SushiMon. Kabotu is for those that willing to pay for the higher quality fish reserve for its priority. Goyemon might be the sister but both SushiMon locations will always have a better quality of fish. Goyemon might is the 3rd standard, so 1st Kabotu, 2nd SushiMon, and 3rd Goyemon.   Best dishes for the buck are the Salmon Dinner Special and Sashimi Lunch Special (include rice + miso soup + salad). 3 hand cuts or 2 hand rolls lunch special (include miso soup + salad) for $9 is not bad. Good price. Sushi at Wasabi on Eastern might be a little better but SushiMon's price is the best in this area. Nake Sushi in Summerlin on Rampart x Lake Mead has a similar deal, but it's in the west side. Here in the southeast, SushiMon is the place.  This is an AYCE, so be smart when you order or else wait. Order 4-6 at first then go down. DO NOT order 2 at a time, because that's a long wait. Those that complained about the wait, is because they do not go to AYCE often or have lack of experience with AYCE. It's like the Rio buffet, when it's self serve it's fast that's because you serve yourself, but once you order something special like a sauce the waiter seems to disappear for a very long time.

9ZpHJeHtUHMJRLnn1Cgtzw.text: I've been going to this place since it opened! They have so much sushi rolls it's ridiculous!   If you are going to come here make sure you get the all you can eat! I guarantee you want to try everything on their menu!   The fish is super fresh! It taste as if they had the ocean in their back yard.  So awesome!   The hamachi kama is my favorite and the baked mussels is a must! If you are hungry this is the sushi place to visit!   It can get extremely busy at times and their can be a wait as longs as 45 mins- 1 hr.  If you have the patience your wait will be worth your while!

qHGQyqNf4V00qshfr3irEg.text: I usually don't go to sushi places, but I did not decide tonight.  My friend craved for sushi.    I was uneasy since there was a wait and was told at first that it would be 30+mins..  We waited and was seated in less than 20.  We got a nice seating in the bar area.  After being seated, I was ready to eat.  I was amused by the ayce rules.  60 mins. I was curious what would happen if I went over by 5 mins?  I absolutely loved how great the ayce menu was.  Side dishes and dessert?? dang!  I am sold.  Nice because I felt like i had my own sushi chef.  We told him different items to prepare for us.  Very nicely presented and the fish felt fresh.  I like that because I have had poor experience at other places.  For an ayce, I see why there's a line outside.  I enjoyed the 624, baked sushi which I haven't had before.  Very unique and hot!  The snow crab was a little dry.  I didn't like it.  Friend was craving for salmon and we over ordered.  Regardless, it was very delightful.  I usually have a hard time with rare fish, but it wasn't an issue tonight.  House was very efficient  on getting our side dishes.  We had very awkward request.  We had ice cream in the middle of our meal.  Sushi chef thought we were done.  I tried some lychee sorbet, very tasty but not for me.  I did enjoy the special mochi mango ice cream.  Friend was full, but I told her it was amazing.  She managed to intake half of it.    Service was nice, Sushi Chef was friendly and chatty.  Overrall, a great atmosphere.  Not made for large groups.

MjagLw3lczuwTEi4Zxv9cg.text: I absolutely love this place! It would be my first go-to choice for sushi. They have a fairly big menu and the prices are pretty decent. I love variety so I always choose to have ALL YOU CAN EAT sushi.  You have to finish your order before you order the next roll.  That makes sense because it'd be such a waste of food, and of course no sharing.  Don't be cheap and ghetto and try to dish it off to your friends.  The prices are already fair as is.  Service is fast and friendly.  I love their 911 roll! I have a pretty high tolerance for spices and this roll is so painfully delicious.  When it comes to a spicy tuna roll, I prefer the tuna well diced and mixed with chili sauce which is how Sushi Mon makes theirs.  I don't like the low end sushi style of a tuna roll with just a blob of spicy mayo on top.  Their LASAGNA ROLL is also a favorite.  Try it out.  The last time I was there, I had apple/pear sake.  It was so good.  That says a lot from someone who rarely likes sake because of it's strong taste and burning sensation.  You definitely should give it a shot.  Off topic - it's a small restaurant. You get the mom and pop shop vibe (which I love and appreciate) Seating is pretty limited.  They're usually busy so they don't take reservations. That's the only "bad" thing I'll say about the place. Just make sure you plan to wait a little bit if you decide to dine their during the naturally busy hours.  Overall, I miss and love this place!

WL5UqB8G5qK9hWVsvj27hA.text: It took me 2 years to come here and MAN it was worth the wait!   The nigri is sooooo good and fresh!  Yellow tail Collarbone (Hamachi kama): THE BEST THAT I'VE EVER HAD.  The rolls are pretty big as well.  Dessert wise - Tempura Ice Cream: I believe it vanilla ice cream in side (YUMM) - Lychee Sorbet is really good too  This place is a little pricey $26 for dinner and a few dollars less for lunch but SOOOOOOOO WORTH IT! I will come here every time I go to Vegas!

pi_uJmyAzGjyWFe-z5YxTw.text: really don't know how they could ever get this high rate and please don't make too much hope on here and the all you can list eat always ran out of the expensive price sushi ( like uni and sweet shrimp)

w1o_uelwT_mGdvipdUvhcg.text: This is my #1 sushi place. The fish is always fresh, and the staff remember me every time.   Reading some of the negative reviews on this place, I just have to comment.Too much rice and rolls are too big? Come on people! Its sushi, not sashimi. In Japan, the piece of fish you get is HALF the size they serve us in America. So of course your going to rice with your fish. If you dont like rice order the more expensive plate of sashimi instead.   With that said, they have an extensive amount of rolls to choose from. The price might be a little high ($27 for dinner) but they also have stamp cards for All You Can Eat. Buy 10 and get the 11th free!   So with good quality sushi comes price, but its well worth it. They are always busy so that has to mean something.

mKYnOOnLOiQ4MFVzhZWabg.text: Best all you can eat sushi in vegas hands down! My husband and I frequent sushi mon at least once a month. Service is always good. The ecstasy roll is AMAZING! gotta try it. We have never been dispointed! Get AYCE you really get your moneys worth. Tempura icecream is awesome too!

lkaA27JlcRYIu4PJmPFapg.text: The BEST place to go for sushi in the city. No other place compares to Sushi Mon. The fish is ALWAYS fresh, the service is ALWAYS excellent and I will ALWAYS pick sushi mon over any other sushi bar.   Give the cajun albacore tuna a try. It's to die for!

IOTjOeS1K_PJEnIM-H3dww.text: This was one of the worst sushi buffets I've had by any standard. We went on a late Friday night, and here are the problems:  - already slightly pricey, and all the limited quantity items (uni, clams, etc.) were out - can't get the orders right and kept bringing us random stuff - that seafood salad thing is huge - looks impressive, taste is okay, but it's just a bunch of leftover fish chopped and drenched in soy sauce...not too impressed. - bad/not very nice service but speed was okay - can't really taste the fish...which makes eating sushi pointless. - nigiri had tons of rice  Okay, there are a few good things: - the special rolls on the menu are pretty nice, definitely try the wet dream and what some of the other yelpers have mentioned - plus points for some of the good looking waitresses  All in all, I won't be heading back to this place anytime soon. There's gotta be better sushi buffet in Vegas than this one.

BvHX3QN3oJ9Xx6PW1TrxDQ.text: My first day in vegas I ate here and was blown away. I know live a few blocks away and 5 years later I still dine there. Staff is amazing and the food is great.

AKylvhR973llvrsxoArhrw.text: Snobbish host, generally don't care about your business.  Went in with tables open, however, was told all reserved and customers waiting, but there was no one there.  Requested why the was of 30mins when there's no one in line, waiter simply told us it's just how it is.  This place was my favorite for the longest time, with excellent service.  Throughout the years the service level has drastically deteriorated, seems like to happen when their business gets really good.  I hope their management do something about it coz I genuinely like their atmosphere and the great food they provide.

XmQWK8Dlpw-EaLN3bcB6hg.text: I'm usually very skeptical of AYCE sushi... but this place was surprisingly good.   Decent sushi (quality and prep), great selection of the basics and the rolls. They don't have any fancy fish selections but they have the basic and they are done well. The fish was fresh, the service quick. The fish to rice ratio of the nigiri was good. The rice was done well, not too tangy, not mushy, doesn't fall apart. Loved the yellowtail, red snapper, and albacore that day. I'd say pass on the fried oysters and the green mussels. Rolls are ok.   All in all, definitely worth the $30 and the ~25mins drive off the strip (as a vegas visitor).

jh21U1o4_2CvBLtfdK2dHA.text: Good service and good sushi.  I've been here twice, the 1st time just sitting on the table ordering from the menu. And the second time me and a few friends did the whole buffet thing which was only like 30 bucks for all you can eat! This was the best deal since I love uni, hamachi and just sushi in general! The workers where always on it, with getting things you needed (lemons) and filling you're water.   The reason for the 4-star was because the wait is incredibly long! and I got yelled at for hiding and not eating all my rice....apparently they don't like to waste! =/

4OJVvfWt3I5SW6ncBVOEdQ.text: Miso soup is a bit too watery... Do not have much flavor... All you can eat Sushi works for growing men...  A lot of rolls... Definitely not traditional or authentic Japanese food, but... Overall is GOOD

-SkTb_oyaCCDRsEFfekYuw.text: Once again Sushi Mon has exceeded my expectations.  This is now our second time here and had the best service from the staff and our Sushi chef Tomo.   If you come to the location on Maryland be sure and ask for Tomo you will not be disappointed.

uuzb5k9M4ma4WjK-OK50zw.text: Unfortunately not as great as the last time we went but still good. Still love the appetizers and that you can get more than one desert :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken on top; good but kinda heavy
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sa6OiZ7Uf7chr0lEOZAdlg.text: Best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas never have any issues when I come in and everything is fairly priced they also give you a stamp card so every time you get all you can eat sushi you get a stamp and after your 10th you get a free one!

KY3tV66tMCyBIlJDeR0dvg.text: Wow this place is excellent best AYCE sushi I've had in the year I've been in Vegas. Sat at the sushi bar and let the chef choose. All was phenomenal will definitely be back.

ngT21GkwQGteE98bn-fE_g.text: I am usually weary of the quality of AYCE sushi, not wanting to get sick from bad fish. Sushi Mon blew any preconceived thoughts of disgusting buffets out of the water!  A double-sided menu of food that is made-to-order greets you, yay! My exact order (almost) every time is as follows: edamame, seaweed salad, cajun albacore, pastel roll, sexy girl roll, yellowtail collar and strawberry mochi. If I'm feeling a little frisky, I'll order the mussels as well. Did I mention I get all of this for $26.95?! Amazing, I know.   Due to their amazing menu size, they do ask that you not waste any food and eat all you order (cue the forklift to get me home). When you order a roll, you have the option of ordering a half roll so that you can order more of a variety.   The only reason Sushi Mon lost a star is for the size. The tables are sooo close together and I wouldn't dream of going here with a large group in fear of having to wait 45+ minutes for a table.   Side note for parents: Your little ones can share the AYCE with you if they are young enough to sit in a high chair, which is a nice touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy Girl Roll..My FAVORITE! A unique twist on a shrimp tempura roll

-udskl32eVJqforz8qJpEQ.text: ktnv.com/news/dirty-dini... *Look up Sushi Mon dirty dining! Not only is the quality of sushi not fresh its sub par. The people making it weren't even Asian, I thought they were gonna bring me out an enchilada roll and horchata. What the hell????? I left feeling robbed of my $33.70 I spent on dinner AYCE. Came home to tell my mother the horror story of poor quality sushi only to be informed further more that sushi mon was on dirty dining. I'll go throw up now... I WILL NEVER BE RETURNING EVER AGAIN IN LIFE!!!

A4jsATVBUQcQgPJFtb_JzQ.text: I'm not a Vegas local, A friend and I are here on vacation from Reno, so I'm used to different sushi joints. When we got there we were seated at the bar and ordered our rolls. We tried ordering appetizers but he said he's doesn't do that. We had to wait for the waitress to come by and ask for drinks. The roll pieces were really big and thick, so that being said I was filled up fast and didn't eat half of the roll. When she came by she asked why I didn't eat it, which was weird. But I told her.  Another thing is I didn't get my edamame until a little before the check. Overall it was an okay experience.... I don't think I'd eat here though.

P6ujElZ0eS_b0_57SPEnUA.text: This is our favorite sushi place in town. Most sushi places have decently-priced AYCE. Most have a huge selection of specialty rolls. This one has all that plus a cadre of fine, friendly chefs and wait staff that know us and have my wife's entire order memorized from appetizers to dessert. (But that also might speak to how memorable my wife is.)  We love it. If you're looking for a new sushi place, try it. If you already have your own local place that knows your name, then it's really just a lateral move.

hy7-HhFKN6nj5tvS44joFg.text: Staff was great. The all you can eat is the way to go! You must try the hamachi collar and savor the moment because you are only allowed one.

2-UOHfelZgQsYUtkRR4h1Q.text: SUUPER UBER BUSY AT NIGHT TIME  but needles to say the food never disappoints! I recommend sitting at the bar area so you can see the magic happen. Been here more than a handful of times and the service differ from time to time, but overall still good.

ef2MuXNlSGcz0IrAC1OGdg.text: Came here for dinner on a Thursday night in a party of 7. Their $26 AYCE sushi was great value considering the quality of the fish we were served. Their specials included multiple nigiris that I haven't had before at AYCE spots including mackerel. They were very timely with service, providing water whenever we were low and coming around to clean up finished dishes very quickly. Of course the total bill was enormous with the beer and sake we ordered in conjunction, but with the fun atmosphere (we caught the end of a Packers-Bears game on the TV at the bar) that allowed us to sake bomb at the table, I will definitely return and recommend to friends and family.

4q2PRjIDDn6jcLWHb4CYLg.text: This restaurant has been a staple for sushi lovers, including myself, for a long time. I've been coming here for AYCE only so I can't speak much for the regular menu. But I can say their AYCE has always been solid and consistent which is why it seems to be always busy and which is why your service may take a hit. Be prepared to wait to be seated in the small restaurant during peak hours and to occasionally wait for your server or sushi chef during your meal because they are tied up.  They have extended hours for the late night cravings. For the novice sushi eaters, there are plenty of pictures on the menu to aid you. If you're sitting at the bar, the chefs are more than willing to answer any questions or fill any requests. Keep your eye on the chalkboard for any specials also.  This last visit I sat at the sushi bar just after opening on a Saturday and had a solid meal of appetizers and nigiri. The chef was busy but made sure my meal was flowing smoothly. I didn't get any rolls as all of the 30 pieces of nigiri were delicious and enough to satisfy me. They had two clam specials: Asari rayu and orange clam (I took pictures of both but they were pretty crappy so I didn't post them) which both had oil and sauce respectively that elevated the clam which is something I normally don't order.  Sushi Mon is not head and shoulders above the rest and they're location is not convenient for me. I am still a fan though and will continue to frequent there but it will most likely be only late night, or if I happen to be driving in the area and the wait looks reasonable.

Nfoiz18eDRix328BgSzcRg.text: It's been 2-3yrs since I've been to Sushi Mon, and uh wtf happened?? Sushi Mon used to be my go to ayce sushi spot since it was awesome and I lived about a mile away. I stopped going because I moved to a different city, then to a different area of LV and it's sad how bad this place is now.   Positive change - they've finally added more seating for people waiting outside. Negative changes - more things missing from the menu, slow service (waiters and sushi chefs), crappier quality sushi.   My very fav smoked salmon nigiri has been off the menu for a while, but now they also got rid of the fried oysters, couple rolls I liked and the curry bowl too. Despite sitting at the sushi bar on a night that wasn't full, it took forever to get sushi (they had 5 chefs working). The dishes piled up since the waiters never stopped, and I had to literally grab them to put in orders as they ran by since waving did nothing.     Dry hamachi and salmon kama, sloppy looking rolls and nigiri, smaller pieces of fish and they don't seem to put wasabi in the nigiri anymore. Spicy scallop hand roll that literally had 2 pieces of bay scallop mixed in with a lot of imitation crab, and also wasn't spicy at all. Even my lychee ice cream was all crystallized and icy.   The quality had been going down for a while, but I'm officially done with Sushi Mon now - there are too many other ayce options to waste money here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worst &#34;spicy scallop&#34; roll ever - literally 2 tiny scallops in the entire thing. Also not spicy

RAkNSlucR0ZjApIXI6SxRw.text: How I rate is would I come back. Would I? Yes. 1 because of the options. 2. The nice workers and Yoshi, definitely coming back for him. 3. Quick to serving and attending me. 4. Sushi was good! 5. They have Lychee Sorbet. Uhmmm, YESSS!!!  I want to tell you about my sushi chef though. I'm not too sure his name but on his apron it says Yoshi. He is the reason why I'm giving the extra star on my review. Super nice, always trying to convince you what's the days special and new items. Convinced me so well I got a new item from his suggestions. Very smiley and I love it. Tries to keep a conversation with you.   Currently eating their AYCE. I've been to multiple multiple AYCE. I usually vary by options and prices. Option wise they have a handful, not as much as the ones I usually go to near UNLV but this their options are decent. Prices are the same as any other one. By the way, I am eating for 1, so sitting at the bar was my best choice. Thursday night at 10 pm, not so crowded. Music playing, not too loud not too low. Servers, I'm at the bar so they don't really serve me but are attendant. Better than others in my opinion.   The reason why I wanted to give 4 stars in the first place was the small size of nigiri that they serve. A lot smaller than anywhere I've been. Even in San Francisco. And because, I'm guessing a new chef that he was mentoring behind him, kept staring making me feel uncomfortable. Not going to name names and leave it at that. But Yoshi was so polite and courteous to me, I had to give the extra star.

uu808MqEgOmzbjfRKPsUVg.text: My husband and I had only seen an udon noodle bowl of soup this amazing looking on the travel channel. Definitely our favorite spot from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ui8vOBd32O353_WUzA1iWw.text: I used to love sushimon, but after the incident that happened the other night, I will never ever go back. My husband and I decided we wanted to have some sushi at around 930 on a Friday night. We go in and the hostess tells us there's a 45 min wait although there is one large table that's open (with a reservation). So we decide, alright, let's just take it to go. We order a few sashimi, a screaming orgasm, and 4 rolls, which came out to 80 bucks! I seriously contemplate just waiting the 45 min and having all you can eat for about $50 plus tip for the two of us.   15-20 min later, they pack up our stuff and we drive home. We get home and they give us one roll that's the wrong order and then they're missing 2. So we give them a call, they say they have the food at the counter...we don't live a minute down the street so my husband asks the manager if he can just refund us what the two rolls cost. They offer to give him a 26 dollar credit the next time we go, + another $13 and not a refund. My husband insisted that we wanted the refund and they made him drive back instead of just putting it back on his card. So he goes there and gets the refund...and, I would think for the trouble, they would just give us the two rolls we originally ordered but forgot. Nope. What horrible customer service. Even though the sushi was fine and it's the closest sushi restaurant to our place, I won't ever go back. Ugh!

yi8xEcKHIO9gcp4hO_fG6g.text: Can't beat the quality and price.  If eating AYCE sushi is your passion, then this is a must try.  When friends are in town, they always ask to revisit.  Glad it's only down the street.

LefRWffdPthzQ2TPb4uMog.text: Has something changed? I was a huge fan of Sushi Mon when I lived a mile away...going at least once a week for their superb sushi.   When I recently flew in to town from my new home in Salt Lake City, I called in from the airport for a large take-out order due to my craving for some great sushi. I didn't recognize the food anymore.  The fish was different...muted colors, strange unrecognizable cuts in my sashimi, much thiner portions too. Not sure if I will try it again...I was quite disappointed that an old favorite let me down.

5--JvmB9iwWy9L4GmgGmiA.text: This is my second time coming here before leaving Vegas. The sushi here is good but for some reason the scallops had too much citrus sauce this time that it tasted bitter. Come here if you're looking to for some good AYCE sushi around Vegas. The only thing I don't like about this place is that they don't have a sheet for you to fill out for AYCE. The waiter/waitress has to handwrite your order. So m, if you have a large party, try and order as much as possible the first round because it takes a while to get the food and write down your order on a phone or paper so that they can just read your order.

pFmTe56gyEfz_OOp1AZn7w.text: Hi, what's going on over there? So many new servers, so much turnover. If we have one hour for AYCE, the servers need to come refill our water and drinks without being asked each time. I ate half my meal recently sitting next to dirty dishes left in an empty spot. I noticed the special Creme Brulee is no longer served, just Mochi Ice Cream and Ice Cream. Still nice, but did you lose a vendor or are you cutting corners. No more Blue Fin, so sad. We used to eat there every Sunday. When there is high staff turnover and a need for training can you leave a manager or someone who can run the crew and maintain consistency? It's like a free for all over there now. Hope someone replies to this review just to explain. We were very loyal customers and really recommended SushiMon highly. Right now it seems most front end hosts and servers are very very disorganized or left untrained. I would appreciate a reply here. Too bad Arpi doesn't work on Sundays or another manager. Things are definitely slipping and we come for Tomo but could eat at Osaka or Hiro Sushi instead

C_EdspVvtxero5ZPUxGENQ.text: When there weren't so many excellent sushi restaurants in the valley, we used to go to Sushi Mon frequently.  I hadn't been there for quite a while so I decided to go last night. It was disappointing. I ordered the Sushi Sashimi Combination.  The tuna sashimi tased "fishy" so I guess was not fresh. The eel and salmon was of poor texture and did not taste very good.  Even the miso soup wasn't particularly good.  The servers are very nice and the place is pleasant, but with restaurants like Hiroba and Yuzu nearby,   I don't think I'll be back to Sushi Mon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2Sso8EY-Y-a9qDNBHUvcgA.text: I've lived around the Silverado area for a long time and just finally tried this place for the for the first time yesterday, and I can honestly say that I will not be coming back here again. Out of all the AYCE sushi places I've frequented, this one gave me the worst first impression.   The service wasn't the best as I felt like my friends and I were rushed to ordering right away after not even being seated for more than a couple of minutes. It was irritating to say the least; the server never bothered to ask us if it was our first time, nor did he do any sort of recommendations for rolls to try.  Everywhere I go, I always get salmon nigiri to see if the place is worth coming back to, and this establishment had the worst one I've ever tried. The salmon was seriously so hard I felt like I was chewing on some cold steak. The rice was too cold as well. I also tried their takoyaki and a little advice, don't even bother with it. Their lasagna roll also fell apart way too easily unlike some other places I've tried. It's also a bummer that their agedashi tofu is not part of AYCE menu. I do however like their steamed gyoza, it was really delicious, soft and fresh.   I cannot with clear conscience recommend this place to any of my friends, and I definitely would rather drive a little out of my way to get better quality sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WnfOZ89x7PfY-QUPV0jQZQ.text: Been coming here for years prior to my yelp career.  Time to pay respects to Sushi Mon...man!  Service: You're greeted immediately upon walking in, and the sushi chefs at the bar have always been friendly. Wait staff keeps the drinks fresh every time I've sat for AYCE. The sushi chefs keep things moving and I've never had a problem with the wait.  They're moving quickly to get you full af asap so they can clear more covers with their limited seating.       Food: The Nigiri has always been fresh and on point with a great rice ratio.  Check the specials board because it's never failed me.  Great place to find something new to try. My particular favorites have always been the salmon belly and the fresh af Uni.  Everything is good quality and a good time.  Value: $26.95 for dinner ayce sushi.  Pretty good value for getting you a lot of good quality sushi in a short amount of time.  We rock the miso soup and dessert (Ice cream, mochi, and deep fried ice cream) that comes with the ayce option.  Ambiance:  Casual decor for your typical sushi place in a strip mall area.  Not a first date sushi place but a casual date sushi place.  There's flat screens strategically placed for diners and is brightly lit.  The tables are placed rather close to each other which I don't mind but may be an issue for others.  There's limited seating and it's a hot spot.  I'd never consider going here on a friday or saturday because I'd there's going to be a wait.  It's been my sun-thur late night ayce sushi craving go to the past 7+ years.  They close at 2 am and my visits have been usually around 10 PM on a sun-thur.  Sometimes even then it's been a 15 minute wait.  The wait is worth it, and Sushi Mon is one of those great restaurants that makes it hard to move from Vegas.  I know that at 12 AM on a wednesday night, high quality sushi is only a 15 minute drive away. Thanks for providing me a solid late night weekday sushi option Sushi Mon!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagana...my favorite roll...such a fatty I am..=)
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half caterpillar..
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half hurricane...

Kt48cdbFIhE8CkSR6NtsGw.text: Definitely one of my favorite sushi places in town. AYCE is worth the price. I love how they don't limit you when it comes to sashimi. And NO TIME LIMIT as well. I just can't help but keep coming back here at least once a month. YUMMMMMM!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V8H6QmkWnFBoCelapbed-A.text: The sushi and food is ALWAYS fresh and delicious here. Both stars go to that alone. Good fish to rice ratio on nigiris and cut rolls. Appetizers are always fresh and are consistent with good taste.    Timing on the food can be a hit or miss. All our food can be out within ten minutes of ordering on one visit, but takes 30-40 minutes on another visit. No explanation or apologies given whatsoever.   The issue we have with this sushi mon location is always poor customer service. I would say 9 of 10 visits, we would have poor customer service. The issues range from nobody serving us or taking our orders for anywhere between 10-20 minutes of seating us (not even drink orders), to unfriendly and at times rude service (for example, not being helpful at all when we asked about the status of our orders we placed 40 minutes ago).  We had continued to give them our business because of the food quality. But that only stretches our patience so far. We are sad to make the decision that we will not be returning to this restaurant.

6wiFt_JgLaeCwhaD3dKB0A.text: Came here today for all you can eat sushi! Was $21 for lunch and was the full menu! It was delicious. Our rolls were made so fresh and tasted spectacular. We tried the the little Tokyo, the tiger roll, the sexy roll. The service was also really good our server was very nice and attentive (:

9n2ZcqPPmKpdCUfWoWoSKQ.text: The ayce here is pretty decent. We came on a busy Saturday night and we were sat at the sushi bar.   I don't usually sit at the bar bc there are pros and cons. The chef is busy most of the time so it's kind of hard to ask him to make something for you when he's working on other people's orders. Seems like our server only took kitchen orders, so felt bad asking the chef to make things all the time.  The calamari here was one of my favorites. Other then awkwardly asking our chef to make something every 5 mins everything was pretty good. Sushi and rice proportion was pretty good. Smaller pieces, but at least not stuffed with rice.   Will come back if in the area. Not bad but not the best:-) recommend this place as one of the better ones.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 orders each: L-R : scallop, ika, and uni

r1bfP8Gr00g1n14Xkmn4hQ.text: Once upon a time like 10 years ago this used to be the spot to go,  especially late at night for all you can eat sushi.   As I've gotten older all you can eat sushi has lost its appeal, but late night sushi is still a very real need.   The last two times I have given in to the craving  and not wanted to drive more than a few minutes from the comfort of my home, I had come here and been severely disappointed.     Don't get me wrong I have lowered my expectations for a place who does all you can eat,  which I personally don't do.  I just get a roll or two, and had remembered they had some rolls I really liked.  However it was just just barely passable the first of the two times I went back,  and the last time I went hoping it was a fluke it was basically inedible.   This past time just walking in to get my order the place had an old fishy smell hidden under the scent of the oil from the fryer. I got the hurricane roll.  The rice was dry like it had been sitting for a while,  the fish inside it might as well have been cat food,  the salmon tempura was almost like dehydrated salmon that had been coated in a tempura batter that had no crunch at all.  It had just soaked up all the oil and become soft and spoungy. To make matters worse it was like 13 dollars for this sadness in a styrofoam container.   They also put the sauces meant to be on the roll all in different places.  One was on top,  another in the container on the side,  and the other I realized after forcing it down my throat (I felt bad my boyfriend got it for me, and didn't want to waist it) ,had been stuck in the bag itself away from the roll completely.   Honestly right across the street is Albertsons. They are open late too,  the rolls are cheaper, and even though they aren't the most amazing in the world, are still 10 times better than what I  consumed last night.  Supermarket sushi at a non Asian market should not be better than a sushi house with chefs making things to order.  This is basically a travesty, and the nostalgia I had for this place is not enough to get me to come back ever.

LFzYYLLT0VRSLmzTNuf5cw.text: Great sushi made to order for buffet price.  Excellent appetizers cheese mussels and salad.  Super white tuna was the best.

vwt2s2Ya_CuPumBRT6aUJQ.text: For our last few trips to Vegas, we've included a trip to Sushi Mon.  Located off-strip and in a strip mall, don't let the location fool you.  This hidden gem is open til 2am and when we arrived at 9pm, the place was packed to the gills!  A good vibe of hungry and happy customers enjoying their meal.    For $26.95 (dinner price), you can get AYCE sushi!  Order anything you want off the menu which includes selections of ice cream for dessert.  Not conveyor belt style like most AYCE sushi places.......everything is made to order!   If you're sitting at the counter, the sushi chefs take your order and get right to work.   If you're seated at a table, all of the waiters are very attentive - they make sure you've got something on your plate at all times!   Good customer service makes the experience complete.    They have every kind of sushi you can imagine, and then some they've created on their own.  My particular favorite is the Volcano Roll.   Baked California roll with yum yum sauce and scallops.  Delicious!    Sushi Mon is our favorite sushi place in Vegas.  If you're willing to go off-strip, Sushi Mon is a great choice to indulge your sushi craving.

PuuSDuuR5MLFAmtEMYtWbg.text: Ehhhh. The sushi are too fishy smelling. We did all you can eat. But we got charged for an extra roll because we didnt finish some rolls. Never going back

53aMiXo26yv8BkGb01qing.text: I've been here plenty of times to get a sushi fix cause it's close to home. Also, I'm familiar with some of the workers which makes it more personable. Shoutout to George and Fran!!! Those two have been there for a while and they're always so nice.   I order salmon and garlic tuna nigiri no matter where I go and it's always satisfactory here. Today I tried out the yum yum scallop and it was SO GOOD! I've ordered scallop at some other places before and a lot of times I've been disappointed by the texture or taste, but they were perfect here and the flavor was on pointI also had a mini udon and it's pretty good for a sushi spot lol. Lastly, instead of mochi ice cream.. I did the lychee sorbet. Ummm.. 100% recommend! It was sooo good!!! And there are little lychee jelly chunks in it    The food is great, but the service is slow at times.

ehIEGLB7lBLA146KKddh6g.text: What's for lunch? So on the day I visited Sushi Mon, I wasn't sure what to have for lunch, so I mindlessly drove to the plaza where Sushi Mon resides. As I pulled in, I remembered, I've never been here. So I gladly pulled up and parked in front of Sushi Mon. Came in and it was nice to see that even though the restaurant had just opened up a few minutes ago, people were already inside with their orders coming out.  Good sign so far.  Since I was there by myself and only two open tables, I thought it would be okay to sit at the bar. Got the menu and I was glad to see they had a bentos on their lunch menu. Btw, lunch menu is reasonably priced. I chose the simple chicken katsu and CA roll meal that was nicely priced at $7.50. Yay, that means lunch is going to be under $10, including tip.  Everything on my plate was tasty from the salad with ginger sesame salad dressing, my all-time favorite japanese potato salad and CA roll.  Because it is a lot of rice, I wasn't able to finish up the CA rolls which is fine because that meant I could have it later for dinner.  Good customer service, clean restaurant, nice atmosphere and just as important, great price! 5-stars for this lunch experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu lunch combo @ $7.50.
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reasonably priced lunch menu

xgDhJusbMXVwPvZVxx6q2Q.text: Been here twice and do not plan to come back again. First time I came here w coworkers for an outing. Service was great but food was not all great. I went back again but this time brought my bf to get his opinion.   The cons: Tako and tuna poke is very bland. Miso soup barely has any tofu and the seaweed is paper thin. The takoyaki is frozen as it's quite mushy when bitten into. Had quite a lot of hand rolls and it was quite bland so I decided maybe it needs to be rolls instead but it was still bland. I noticed for basic rolls, they add a bunch of other ingredients in which, imo, ruins the taste of it. For instance, Phillip roll should only have avocado, cream cheese and salmon but they add eggs and cucumber.   The pros: Nigiri sushi are yummy. They actually put less rice just like at Sushi Neko. They actually have salmon and yellowtail belly which is good. Tako wasabi was pretty good too! Green mussels was flavorful. They can pretty much make all rolls into handrolls.  So all in all, both experiences weren't that great.  IF I wanted only Nigiri, then maybe I might go there.

5tz4BEXzjjJAhtdE6SVXeA.text: Love this sushi place! Their lunch specials are super affordable and filling! The rice to fish ratio is perfect. I've also had the all you can eat dinner and everything I got was amazing! This is a small place but it never disappoints!

N52oeDCFpoiQ_qV7_SnLkA.text: For the price, I was surprised by the great variety that Sushi Mon offered! Unlike other AYCE sushi restaurants, Sushi Mon had great quality rolls, each with a unique quality! You can opt to not do AYCE, but I think it's a great value, esp for the lunch pricez  They have a lot of different sushi that you can get too, and the fish to rice ratio isnt bad at all. The sushi tasted pretty fresh, and I had no complaints of any of the fish. All the rolls there were pretty great too. Cant remember the names of the rolls... But I really enjoyed them all! (Check out my photos!)  The service was quite fast, which I appreciated. Sushi Mon is located in a huge plaza, and parking is no problem.   They also have dessert as part of AYCE so leave some room! Will probably be back when Im in the area again!

CaKJQuU7W39FCvtpk8tV3A.text: This is my favorite sushi place. I am OBSESSED with their cucumber avocado roll!!! It's a great place and the service is pretty fast

jN8kQuqMx0RF4vLuX6VJPQ.text: I thought the sushi tasted pretty good.  The service however was less than expected.  I waited at the bar for almost 30 minutes and asked too separate servers for a check before I eventually just went to the front and asked the lady at the register.

V5q99c8laBaF9ouvEIok3A.text: We came in late night after the GK Game. And was looking forward in having sushi !  My server was great ! Excellent service!!  However my sushi guy wasn't very inviting or nice. He just left the finished sushi roll & items on the bar wout letting us know.  If I wanted buffet style attitude I would of gone somewhere else.  Usually you hand the finished sushi roll to the person. I felt it was rude and I understand u may have to turn your back to us but the entire time.  We sit at the bar for conversation & banter. Not always do we always chat but maybe someone needs a personality. Just felt he was very cold to us and needs an adjustment. I would of given a 4-5 star rating if it wasn't for the sushi chef. I give our server a 5 Star! Great Personality & always making sure our beverages were topped off. I appreciate u knowing the menu since I haven't eaten at Sushi Mon in years!

alTCbHN2907crmm3ttJU1w.text: owner lady was extremely rude!!!..., my kid was finishing up his egg roll we bought from a restuarant next to Sushimon, because he was hungry. When we sit down at our table and asked her if it is okay for him to finish up because he was almost done. But she would not budge and told us to eat outside. While we respect their policy, but the way her nasty rude attitude really throw us off and we dont wanna come back. We live near by and come there for last 6 years... but this time she really ruined it...!!! way to go ...

AjxPKdv9zo5iYnG8Cgqjzg.text: the best sushi buffet i've ever had... and it's so cheap!   the quality of all the fishes is real fresh.. even though they limit some of the popular/more expensive ones to just one order, like uni & toro, the chef sometimes would pretend that he 'forgot' and gives you more than two orders!  they used to have yellow tail collar included in all-you-can-eat menu though, but not anymore.... still worth it! for either lunch or dinner, gotta try it!  it's a must stop for me whenever i go to Vegas :)  go there early though.. otherwise there's a LONG wait...
