0a7JKoFew3_1pa7t1rZFsg.text: AYCE sushi here is amazing! My number 1 spot when I'm craving sushi. Good service and worth the wait.

An4ju5IoP4d7KOOSy8FmAQ.text: I love AYCE and this place does it perfect.  The food typically will come out quick, the fish tastes fresh even on weekdays.  Lunch at $21.95 is the perfect price and I'm sure I usually will eat WELL above that amount.  I want to give a long drawn out review of here but truly it doesn't need it.  I'm not a huge "roll" person but their Lemon Roll almost tastes like desert to me, the citrus kick you get at the end of it, just is a nice refreshing flavor to finish off a meal of WAY too much food.

ENjXuuXU0qdu9YRx-lO2lg.text: I cannot get myself to eat sushi elsewhere! I have been loyal to this place for as long as I can remember. I live on the northwest part of town and willingly travel out here whenever I want some good sushi. The bf invited me for dinner here last night and said "hell yaa!" without hesitation. We got the all you can eat for 26 bucks a head. Here's a list of things we ordered: seared tuna and salmon Ahi poki 'fresh' scallop Yellowtail collar Shrimp shumai Tarro(fish of the day) Super white  Eel Spicy shrimp yum yum rolls Gyoza(his order) Tempura ice cream  Our orders consisted  mostly of nigiris except the shrimp yum yum rolls because we don't like other things on the fish (like cream cheese..eck!) but anyway everything was,as usual, deliciously fresh. Well, except the scallops, it tasted a wee funny. It didn't taste as fresh as they claimed it to be. But the BEST PART was that TARRO !! I can eat three orders if it wasn't limited to one order per person! And the super white is to die for! A must frikken try! They used to limit the order for this before the tarro fish came out and now order as much as you can! Yay! We finished off with the tempura ice cream and satisfaction finally kicked in.   Overall, great food, the staff(servers) actually improved as far as the service, and definitely worth the money.

RIUMOLiUfyngjaAEzGorBg.text: Fish is fresh and has great color,  The service is good the restaurant is always packed.  Everytime we have gone we have to wait 20-30 mins till we get a table.    All you can eat with a stamp card.  10 visits and the nexty time is on them.  I am down.  Every time i have sushi i start out with 10 orders of Super White and 5 garlic tuna then i tell the sushi master to keep it coming and let him choose.  Always a good time with a shot!!!  Kanpai!!

sTpKaYfueimoUUXsuQuoPQ.text: First time at this location, I've been to the one on Sahara and I can say it was really good but I went to this one on Maryland and I hated it , the fish was horrible nothing was fresh the chef kept talking in their language never asked if we wanted something else when we would ask for something it took them forever to make I couldn't believe it I heard so many good reviews of this place I went I guess I just had a terrible experience I recommend Sakana sushi on Maryland and flamigo

vOx0PiyrjPLVqo2k57hgSg.text: The only sushi I go to here in vegas, yes I'm sure there are plenty of other good spots, but my girlfriend and I just have such a hard time finding good restaurants here that we don't even want to risk going somewhere else, this place is just fine. Price is average for any ayce sushi. And get a stamp card, every ten stamps you get 1 ayce!

aaLLvg5Vaz-pcQqpF-502A.text: Fish was fresh and cut in decently thick (read: not paper thin) slices.  We had salmon belly, tuna, seared tuna, super white tuna, scallop, snow crab meat, unagi, amaebi, uni, and more that I don't remember (3 guys ate about 45+ orders) and there were basically no complaints.  Service was pretty fast, despite a mostly packed house.  Orgasm sauce was unique and tasty, but it kills the purity of the nigiri.    Best AYCE sushi I've had and good enough quality for non-AYCE.

7iaTUPizVHPAlvc6soEO3Q.text: Great All You Can Eat Sushi Joint in Vegas.  Located in a shopping plaza.  Easy to park.    The restaurant is not too big but staffs are very efficient with orders.  During non-busy hours, you can actually eat longer than the regulated 60 mins but usually people are full before they hit an hour landmark.    Fishes were fresh.  Make sure to check their daily specials!  I like their fresh scallop (its previously frozen, however) but still pretty good for AYCE standard.  Uni melts in your mouth as well.  Sweet shrimp is better than typical AYCE place too.  I also liked their salmon, yellowtail, amber jack, albacore sushi.  Their tempura shrimp and seaweed salad is good too.  One of the best I have had in the AYCE restaurant.  Thumbs up.   They also make pretty good rolls, including 1/2 order rolls so for those who can't consume the whole spider roll, this is the place to go.  My only gripe for this place is that their sushi rice is bit on the firm side.  It wasn't  very "sticky" when I was there.  Maybe just one of the bad nights?  Their Ikura (Salmon Eggs) weren't that salty too so if you don't like fishy stuff, try to avoid that.  Other than that, its definitely worth to make a trip here if you are very hungry and loves sushi!

EEK0YfU46nde1O58LU-fgg.text: Best sushi in the valley!  Not only is this in my neighborhood; which makes it great, they have some of the best sushi around. Never too long of a wait and always quality service. Competitive pricing and large selection of rolls. Its nice to go back and get the same sushi chef each time.

v52WcR4lQwwxOgtT89nawQ.text: Best all you can eat sushi restaurant I've been to out of 5 different ones. Sushi mon's sushi on MARYLAND has the freshest sushi and great service for the 3 times I've been here. ***please note: the one on sahara is not owned by the same owner and that one was terrible when I went.

tQHAkNcsKIuAfkFLH5OkTg.text: A "must try" place. The sushi is ALWAYS fresh, the service is ALWAYS fast, the chefs are ALWAYS nice and ready to recommend something.It is a little pricey comparing to other places, but definitely worth your $. However..this place is SO tiny..and if you got on a Saturday or Friday night..you would have to wait 30minutes at least to get in..but we ALWAYS wait 'cuz we'r good sushi loverz :D

YIsWm5gTwXKw10GiKasMJA.text: I had really high expectations for this place because it was recommended by a friend and also because of the 4 star yelp rating. I was a bit disappointed.   Overall Rating: 3.5 Stars   $26.95 for AYCE at dinner (60 minutes to eat) is not bad considering the tremendous selection they had available. They have the good stuff like toro, uni, amaebi, ikura (limit of 1 per person for the toro, uni and amaebi). There was an extensive list of nigiri, hand rolls and cut rolls and the list of cooked stuff was not too shabby at all. They even have dessert on the menu! The best part of my meal was the 2 natto hand rolls. I love natto and they rarely have natto anything at restaurants. A major plus is that they do not overload your items with rice. I know a lot of AYCE places stuff you with rice and then make you wait forever for your next item, but not this place.   The downside? The good stuff wasn't actually that good! It was just average and not very consistent. My sister told me that her first order of salmon nigiri was good and the second order was dry. Huh? My uni was not fresh, the ikura was flavorless, the amaebi was a bit slimy and the toro was not bad but it wasn't exactly melt in your mouth. Also, other random pieces of nigiri that I had were just average. I am so torn! I really wanted to like this place but it's only just ok. Even though my natto hand rolls were da bomb, I know it comes out of a box so how hard is it to screw that up?   I wouldn't mind coming here again because I love the selection. I just hope that I came on an off day and that the next time I come, I will be luckier.

iLw2YX0r3KSyUvEugEtoBQ.text: Always great sushi no matter if you are doing AYCE or individual orders. Always a wait for this place.

FdsH2c4T1VWAJYp7A7ePoQ.text: I don't know why there's pressure to say up front that I'm no sushi expert (no one seems to say they are not Chinese or Italian food experts when reviewing pizza or dim sum joints, right?), but it seems like with sushi, you have to establish your cred (or not) right away. So I'm an amateur!  But I do like me some Sushi Mon.   The AYCE deal is available both for lunch ($22) and dinner ($27) and if you are planning on trying more than three rolls, this is your best bet since the prices otherwise take you over $25 real quickly. Unlike some other places, the AYCE sushi does not include miso soup, seaweed salad or a drink, just so you know.   Let's say you love sushi but your friends don't- bring them here anyway, since there are plenty of other Asian-themed dishes they can try while you grab the fish n' rice. There is a $10 "dinner special" with a green salad, soup, vegetable tempura, chicken teriyaki, potato salad and yes, a California roll, but your non-sushi friends can give that to you. Also, there are breaded and fried pork options, other teriyaki plates, etc.   But back to the sushi, which to me has to mean AYCE. Prepared mostly by Japanese (not always so at other places) and served very quickly once made, it has always been fresh and exactly as described on the menu, which is a big help since I'm not an expert, of course. Something new to me were the fried rolls (volcano sushi, flying Jason roll, etc.) and I could have done without them because they added lots of ballast, but it shows the creativity of the sushi masters at work. You can ask for half-rolls of most offerings, which allows you to try more types and not feel completely stuffed as you leave.  Now the place is indeed small and very popular, so you should definitely expect to spend up to 30-40 minutes waiting for a table if there are more than 2 in your party and if it's after 5 PM most days, but it is worth it. And beware- the wait staff is definitely militant about not sharing AYCE with those who order entrees and are also always on rice-wastin' patrol. Don't be the one to be called out- I've seen this happen once and it's not even funny.  What's interesting is that reviews of other sushi restaurants in the area (or even across town) often compare whatever place is being reviewed to Sushi Mon, which means it must have a standard-setting reputation among those who really know their sushi. As I said, I'm an amateur, but even so- Sushi Mon is a great place for all levels of sushi-knowledge, it seems.

4CkwtQ-_qtWkOvn7-by9CA.text: Service and food were good. They have all you can eat,  but not a big fan of the 1 hour rule. Not sure if they enforce it. Last night,  the complementary salad was overly salty. Overall, the sushi and tempura were good.

fWO8A0GUQAYqMVCUvcPpTw.text: Love this place! The Ayce is kinda pricey so I rarely get it & I also only eat one or two orders of rolls, but I love how I can order half orders to go. I usually do 2 full roll orders but 4 different kinds. It's the perfect deal. They are great. The pastel roll is fantastic along with the tiger. All their fish is fresh.

bEwL8geQnHlaoDAIGsQDJg.text: Love this place!!  AYCE fresh sushi & rolls.  The great thing about it is that you can order half rolls (4 pieces), that way, you can order more types of rolls.  Always get the special.  The last time I was here, they had one with mango on top!  YUMS!  The plum ice cream is sooo good, included in the AYCE too!!

k8w0lfLGkNugQIT4tqvK_Q.text: I guess when you give away the same Ferrari for $10 people will still complain. "Hey why is that guy's Ferrari looks shinier than mine?" or "Why do I have to get mine Ferrari after the guy who got here before me and is in front of me in line?"  Same quality of food and service for 1/3 of the usual price is a 5 star performance in my book. Kudos for Sushi Mon for having the balls to throw an event like this for their fans.

EoXoMuH25e5-tfKLP18JJw.text: I'm very torn about this place. The sushi is great in my opinion. I'm not sushi connoisseur but I like what I like and they do a pretty good job. It's clean and their late hours are very convenient. The service is average, nothing special but the GM is THE WORST. He is rude, impatient, and will ignore you for several minutes. Yes this place can get very busy and yes sometimes the wait is 20-30 mins. but he will quote you an hour long wait just in the hopes that you will leave! He is never pleasant when he answers the phone and lacks good customer service. I continue to frequent this place because I love the Pastel roll and I love the late night hours (he's not usually there too late) but if I have another poor experience with the GM I will have to reconsider how much time and money I choose to spend there.

TtjaSzw8NdoKCG71-Iq34w.text: This place got me so mad.  They tell u 15m for a take out order & iv been here over a hour.  & they have mess up my food ones already.   The food is ok but the staff has no idea what there doing.

Tqcgk4nUYLy3NNWHP1MvGQ.text: I visit about 2-3 times a month. Great rolls, awesome service, seated immediately each time, & I love how fresh everything I order is!

pPpodBOrdTTYVdM4oxWurg.text: I only ever come here for the AYCE and it's pretty great. The food taste great and although the restaurant always seems busy the staff do their best to check in and get any more orders in. However sometimes you might have to get the staff's attention because there is so much going on in a small space

xWCD9f9rsWTBxAzsR0QmgA.text: Lets just say this place is probably the best and freshest ayce sushi I've ever had in my life and trust me I've tried pretty  much tried most of the ayce sushi in LA/OC area.  The decor in this place was pretty fancy going for the modern look esp at the sushi bar .. this wavy texture on the wall lol like ocean wavy! pretty cool! WgoFBUieeVifrtIxJg4mBg.text: The sushi is good here, but I hate the wait. It's a small place so there will always be a wait...even during off peak hours. The ambiance here is very plain and nothing fancy.  The size of their sushi is small here. But I liked this b/c then you can order more variety.  The rice was nicely done as well. The rice/fish ratio is perfect. AYCE price is the same as all others around Vegas.  My whole family loved the seaweed salad to start. All the sushi is good, I especially liked the halibut. And I loved their red bean ice cream.  The cupcake place next door is amazing as well.

aJdMhZ-PJpXSZo7V0_eSBA.text: Wow! Sushi Mon just topped our list for sushi in Vegas. Nigiri was some of the best we've ever tasted. Rolls were fantastic. Sushi chefs were top notch. Definitely coming back!

7EfK3PU5YzVuA86H4MSYUg.text: First time we wanted to dine here, there was a 30 minute wait. We were too hungry so we left but anticipated our return since there were so many good reviews on here.  I hate to say our experience did not live up to expectations..  We sat at the bar for all you can eat. The sushi chefs didn't talk much at all, and the waiter was pretty slow in refilling drinks. Mine was empty for 5 minutes before they came to refill it.  I was enjoying my calamari and my Volcano Roll. I then ordered a deep-fried roll which I had never tried before, and stopped when I pulled a long hair out of a piece of my sushi. I completely lost my appetite and won't be returning. zG9HFfEX8MFK4uCAPEOVZA.text: I've been coming here for over 10 years and it's been consistently great for all 10 years.  I've eaten here probably over 50 times and it's always good. I've tried other AYCE places and they never compare to Sushi Mon. Great selection of fish and the absolute best part is they will make any roll they offer into a hand roll and they'll customize it for you.  I've been to other restaurants that look at you like you're crazy for even asking.  They never pressure you about the 1 hour time limit,  and the service is very good considering how busy they are.  My suggestion is don't bring small children that don't enjoy any form of Japanese food, the place is super busy to have to manage a baby and frustrating for fellow diners. (rant over) can't recommend this place enough and can't wait to go back.

3WXVV8JT-zf-xQ6CaSCcsw.text: Been to both Sushimon locations and they've left me with memories of sushi bliss. It'll cost about $20-ish and you have two hours to gorge. I've been here a few times with friends and we stuffed our faces like fat fucking Americans should. The amount of variety is off the chart and the quality of sushi is much MUCH better than your average buffet. TBH it's not even fair to compare the two.   But you have to get the All You Can Eat. BEST DEAL HERE.

cXPqL0EK6tjPgDmqh1MU4A.text: Okay so it's been a while now since I ate here at Sushi Mon AYCE. Now I remember why I stopped coming here! Majority of my friends have boycotted this establishment all together! Customer service here is just bad! Came here at about 10ish at night on a Thursday to meet up with my brothers. As soon as I walked through the door and was about to sit down, my brother said that the male servers already had given them a hard time. It was originally just my brothers that were  gonna have sushi and they invited me to join them. They told the guy server that they were adding one more person and the server said "why didn't you tell me earlier that you were adding on more person?!" My brothers then replied telling him that "I just literally got off the phone and it wasn't even planned!" So the server moved my brothers to a bigger table. (Strike one!)   So they ordered 5mins prior to my arrival. And the server took my order as well. The first two orders came on and the other male server just dropped it down on our table like he was sorta throwing it towards us and told us what it was. He also had an order for the table next to us and he placed their order nicely on their table and explaining nicely to them what their order was. (Strike two!!)  The rest of food came and ate, ordered more trying to pace ourselves. The thing that bothered us also was that it took awhile for the server(s) to come take our orders and clean the plates off and refill our water. And it wasn't even that busy. (Strike three!)  All in all our experience there was terrible. Don't get me wrong but the food was good and the service sucked! The only one we thought was decent was the one female server. I think it's time for me to boycott this place too! I don't think I'll ever return!

N8bBrnQ0g1gRXpxTXDT02A.text: I am new to Vegas but I was really craving sushi. My friend took me here since it is her favorite. I did not disappoint! We came during lunch and ordered the AYCE, bonus there was no wait! The fish was so fresh it had a sweet flavor. With other AYCE places the rolls are small/skinny, but that's not the case here. This is my new sushi spot even though it is far from where I live. It's worth the drive!

_7Xyhd1HcT_nU8g2dKwiVA.text: First time ordering from here. The prices seemed great from veiwing online. Very helpful service over the phone very busy when I picked  my order up! Basic spicy tuna roll I did order seaweed salad awesome price for a large amount but the poke was nasty no flavor no juice just chunks of fish on some rice noodles. This disappointed me as I was craving poke and got my hopes up lol. Will order rolls from them again but no poke from this place!

qkHbUEnRZGk5MbwWWg0jxA.text: Sad to leave a review like this but the manager Arpi Oganesyan at night is very rude and turned down business.  I could do with the refusal but the rudeness and snarky smile after was uncalled for and her complete lack of welcoming attitude. It was 125am and she said they don't seat people after 1 am and told me it's written on their website (which says 130am last call). I checked the website and nowhere does it state "last seating at 1am" she still told me I was wrong and said have a good night practically pushing me out the door.  Not once did she say sorry or offer any type of manners towards me and my party.  I messaged management and they apologized for her but sadly after years of attending this establishment, her snarky attitude and complete disrespect to myself and my wife has lost them business.  Also noted by others that attended that establishment who I'm told will be writing reviews about her as well.  Simple adjustments can get this restaurant its stars back.

DuVEZlJcwoLpT1K4WV3zhw.text: We came for the all you can eat and we won't leave until we've eaten it all.    We were a party of 4 at dinner time on a Saturday night.  This is a small space so there's usually a line outside for tables.   Luckily there was 1 table available and we snagged it. 2 of us ordered a la carte and 2 of us had all you can eat.   The AYCE menu was quite expansive, and somewhat overwhelming. We ordered mainly nigiri for the AYCE for more bang for our buck.  The nigiris were on the mini side, but good proportion of fish to rice. Depending on how you order, rolls can come as half rolls or whole rolls.  This I appreciate because you can try a large variety of rolls. They also have a specials menu that included blue fin, bonito, and other Japanese named fish I can't remember.  The AYCE also included a dessert menu with ice cream, mochi, and deep fried ice cream.   For a la carte, I ordered a niku udon because I'm allergic to seafood.  It came with a salad and CA roll. The udon broth was quite salty and I suspect made from some kind of concentrate. There was quite a large portion of beef, which was pleasantly surprising.  But it was A LOT of beef. I wish there was some kind of greenery, like spring onion, to cut through.   The service was great. The wait staff were quite attentive to us and there wasn't a moment where the table was empty.  We never really waited too long to refill AYCE. and the orders came out promptly.

5PWdXR1OX1Y1zsFftcJi6g.text: I come here all the time and it's always so great. From walking into the door the service is amazing, they welcome and seat you. There are some options of either doing all you can eat sushi or individually ordering sushi. I personally love the lemon and dragon roll as well as the super white tuna nigiri roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xo864AfTcw4KeHUpNtkCJQ.text: tldr  Some people swear that this place has some of the best sushi but I came in for the lunch specials. There's an entire section of lunch priced foods that are under $10 and comes with salad and miso soup. And they serve you orange cubes post meal. Tough not to go with the AYCE option but this actually filled me up.  Get: - beef lunch special (teriyaki beef, 4 pieces California roll, miso soup, house salad, scoop of rice)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef lunch special

cSEy-93kTEf6e27i3YapNw.text: I come here often with my mom to do the AYCE special. The employees are all very friendly, from the servers to the chefs. We like to sit at the sushi bar, and I always suggest doing so to get the best service.  There are so many options on what you can order. There are rolls, nigiri, side dishes, and salads. Don't forget you can order the special items on the board too! I did not know that my first time.  I don't think the quality of fish really stands out. I've had a lot of sushi and this would probably fall under average. However, it is one of the best I've had for AYCE outside of Japan. I generally prefer to have a small, high quality meal when eating sushi, but when I am really hungry and rather go for quantity, I'd come here.

KjaJC7L0CCglcrsnAkBHuA.text: This place is awesome! Great food, amazing and fast service. I love sushi salmon. And I mean, loooove. Salmon nigiris have always been just alright for me, since most sushi places I go to put 3-4x more rice to fish and I could barely taste the salmon. This place, however, gave me an amazing ratio of salmon to rice. More salmon than rice! Twice we've been here and they had ayce* salmon belly nigiri as their special. What a deal! Another salmon dish I like is their supreme salmon roll, where it is salmon in a sushi roll with salmon on top. The rolls have a nice portion of rice as well, so no way do you eat more rice than fish. It had been a while since I had great food and service, and it was truly appreciated. The servers were very attentive. There were at least 3 who attended to our table alone. Amazing how it's not just one server per area, but they all worked together to attend to every table when needed. Now that's teamwork! Not just that, but they don't ignore you after a while, like some places, just so time passes by and you feel the fullness to the point you stop ordering. Also, their dessert is unlimited! Very nice to know that that is an option for their customers.  Only con I found was once you step in the place, it smells slightly of sewage water, probably a restroom problem, but your sense of smell adapts to it after a while. Other than that, great place to eat ayce. Highly recommend!

MlduAl7AkLeZLas1KDAK_g.text: We ordered takeout and really had high hopes for the food here because of the reviews!  We ordered two 2 roll specials (which include miso soup and a salad), three specialty rolls and a side order of gyoza.  When we received our order, we discovered the combo rolls were packed incorrectly which was inconvenient since each order belonged to someone different.  The special sauce for one of my husbands rolls was packed in the gyoza box which gave me a surprisingly extra spicy surprise when I tried dipping my food in it.  The rolls were dry and did not taste fresh at all.  My friend said that the breadcrumbs on top of her roll tasted really stale and my husband at all of 3 pieces total because he said the taste was not good at all.  The miso soup was quite tasty and the gyoza was up to par.  I don't think I will return though as I have experienced much better tasting sushi around town.

b9S8yUN5WlYip8bGPJ0G3A.text: AYCE sushi is the best bang for your buck when you're able to consume more food than a starving college student. Now that i've been finished with school my ability to consume half the oceans supply of fish has greatly diminished but nonetheless I still can hammer time quite a fair amount of sushi.  Atmosphere/service: Fairly busy with an attentive sushi bar but as for the male wait staff it could be much better.  The decor resembles that of an older sushi restaurant that's been in business and Sushi mon has definitely been one of the lasting pioneers for sushi.  Food: I only eat nigiri and will share a roll with a friend. That being said, the quality of the fish is more important and essentially thats what sushi is, is the nigiri. I'm a yellowtail fiend and typically the first 2 orders are incredibly fresh with a beautiful dark pink to clear color. The chefs here are Japanese trained and cut the nigiri with just the right amount of thickness and low rice to fish ratio. They have implemented a new white chef who (no offense) cuts the nigiri poorly.  Overall: Quiet nights when I just want to enjoy sushi alone, this is the place I choose. Fresh nigiri, professional sushi chefs, and proximity to my home makes this a winner

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi and tuna nigiri great cuts

PZcEGka3Cn3Zt6BkTBSHgA.text: After trying so many Sushi places in town and having a hankering for really good Sushi, I decided to bring the family to Sushimon as it is one of the best places according to so many people.  I wanted to try some excellent sushi.  Here at Sushimon, note:  1. The wait - You are gonna wait for a table.  We came at 1:45 and got to sit down at 2:35.  A bit of a wait, however, they use a really good waitlist system online to notify you when your table is ready.  Although we waited a bit over 45 minutes, it is what we were quoted and we were able to hang out at the Starbucks for a while, so that made the wait worth it.  2.  The food - Besides, the normal speciality rolls, I ordered the Black Tobiko, The Salmon Belly, and the Sanma (Pike Makerel) from their special of the day menu.  I decided that I wanted Amai-ebi, Uni and also hamachi kama so they told me I had to pay the dinner menu price which is 26.95.  I was good with that.  3. Very good food, no problems as it is fresh and tasty.  4. The service - This was a huge issue for sure.  I went with the dinner menu at lunch to have the Amai-Ebi, Uni and Hamachi-Kama.  I did not get the shrimp fried heads from the Amai-Ebi and I never got the Hamachi-Kama.  Since I did get part of the shrimpt and the Uni, they advised me that they would charge me the dinner price.  I get that, and no problem at all. i was full, they would have made the items for me had I demanded, however waiting 40 minutes for these items I got full and decided to pass.  I thought it was decent for them to offer to cook it even though we were there past the 45 minute limit for all you can eat. I did not care for the fact that they said that if I wanted the heads with the Amai-Ebi it is a separate order. I was kind of shocked at that as I don't believe that is normal. However, that is my mistake. If you want the heads, be sure to order it.  5.  The service again - What is not the greatest at this place is the pace of their service.  Wavering between 100% full and 75% full, the service is extremely slow.  The waiters you have to flag down, they don't check in with you often.  The serving of rice is quite a bit on the nigiri sushi and I think the only way you can get your money's worth is to order enough the first time.  If you want an accurate order, you will need to have them repeat it back and then confirm all the bits and pieces that you want to make sure that this is what you are expecting.  Good food, fresh food, mediocre to good service and oddities in their menu and what they include is what this place is all about. Overall, I probably will try out some other places or go back to my regular places. I was not as impressed as I thought for a quality place with a waiting list to get it.  I will for sure adjust my ordering the next time I go there and be very diligent to make sure I get what I ordered and paid for.  Good place to go, just be careful.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Ice Cream and Mochi Ice Cream.
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moon Rill with Tempura Crumbs. And Dragon Roll.
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ecstasy Roll, Hurricane Roll, Sanma (Pike Mackerel)  Uni and Black Tobiko!

XHX5K7V7MVGoKz3ZcpHeoA.text: I imagine in the desert it is difficult to get fresh, good quality sushi.. we decided to try this because our 8 year old really wanted a california roll and it was close to where we were staying.. but the second we sat down my husband saw the all you can eat option, not generally a good sign.. but we were exhausted. So my son got the all you can eat because he wanted gyoza, shrimp tempura and a California roll. Ordering those individually would cost more. He got his food right away, roll looked good, gyoza looked ok and shrimp were skinny and sad looking. He ate all the roll and all but one of the gyoza and left a few shrimp. My husband had a sashimi plate, a seaweed salad, the salad was fine but sashimi huge pieces cut halfway through, no flavor .. he left half of each uneaten. I tried the sashimi salad, upon arrival I knew it wasn't going to be great. Big cuts of sashimi in general means low quality fish, this fish had no taste and was dry, and much of the salad was wilted and no longer edible.  I am sure it is the best they can get to turn around and sell it at a reasonable price in the desert. Our fault really and for those who don't have access to fresh or higher quality the size and price may be enough.. for us it just wasn't good.

ZbUXw0tfHkl9_Pt9mnR6aQ.text: My wife and I recently found ourselves in Las Vegas late one night and we were hungry. I asked our Valet for a good sushi place close to our hotel that was also all you can eat, and after some thought they called for a stout guy also working the valet who is supposedly their go to guy for sushi joints. Once I started talking to this guy i knew we were cut from the same cloth, so we looked up Sushi Mon and headed out. We found Sushi Mon quickly, it was only a few miles south east of the strip in a nice sized mini-mall. The wait was about 30 minutes for dinnertime on a Friday night, and it wasn't long before we got our seat at the bar. We immediately ordered and soon after the sushi rolls started (pardon the pun) rolling in. O.K I am not gonna describe each and every roll, since we ended up having a lot but here are my highlights. The menu and specials boards had quite a lot of choices, I went for the slightly different examples for myself while my wife started with sashimi. Most my rolls were good, especially the ones with the orgasm sauce on it. It was so good we ended up getting a couple sides of the sauce which seemed like mayo and ponzu with a couple secret ingredients to boot. The sashimi was a whole different story, the tuna and tuna belly both had a very nasty metallic taste that worried us so much we refused to eat it the rest of the night. We also ordered a couple real crab rolls that came to us 90% frozen (crabsicle) I also ordered the takoyaki which was o.k and the udon soup which also was just o.k. I guess it is hard to keep everything at a high level when doing such a high volume at an all you can eat place, so next time we are just sticking to the rolls. Service was pretty good on a busy night, prices were fair and food was o.k as long as we stuck with rolls and appetizers, Aloha

5GS7LBtWzHrlRV_vF6vD_w.text: All you can eat sushi for a reasonable price. We got there when the restaurant opened for the day so we were served with great service and food quality. All sushi freshly made and you can watch the chefs preparing it if seated at the bar. And they also don't limit you on desserts. Which was nice cause they have a lot of good options for it.

EuRGpzmW3BuemY52or9jFw.text: Loved this place !! Very good for All You Can Eat and at a great price !! The service was very good and they were packed !!   Very large selection of AYCE and fast with getting it out to you ! They are open from noon till 2am and we ate at the bar ! We will definitely go back ! The place is very clean and expect a little bit of a wait !!

XufieQf4J8xVS_9naCcHaw.text: Be careful of the 911 roll. I recently got it and it was so HOT that I had to order a scoop of green tea ice cream to help cool down my mouth. I've had it before and it was good (much milder). This most recent trip our table ordered a 911 roll (8 pcs) as we like spicy. But this was insanely HOT!!!!  I bit my piece in 1/2. That was it....it almost ruined the rest of my meal. It was so INSANELY HOT, I joked it should now come with a warning label. The next table ordered it as well. Our table heard that and thought...Oh! You have no idea what you're getting yourself into. That poor mans face looked like he was in so much pain after eating a piece. He turned bright red and was grabbing for his water (which doesn't help, it seemed to just increase the intensity when I did the same thing) Anyways you have been warned. LoL!!

2Sl-qWvzLxUNECtVf0-GGw.text: This is hands down my favorite sushi joint in Vegas. I've been coming here for the last 8 years whenever I'm in town and have a chance.  The main menu is pretty basic -- you can get almost any kind of sushi, rolls, and side dishes you can imagine. But the best part? Their special blackboard menu for the day, where you can order (sometimes limited) uni, sweet shrimp, toro, snapper, pork belly, salmon belly, and more! And as a bonus, ayce dessert including ICE CREAM!!! For the price, it's extremely great value.  Service is always superb and efficient.  Honestly, I wish they would open one in LA; I would go almost everyday.

_1Cp-cuOdQsm41o3LGFHCw.text: The sushi is not that fresh but the service is good especially for an all you can eat sushi.  But if you are doing the all you can eat sushi, you can only do it with upto 60 minutes.  Its a bit limited especially when you are with friend trying to hang out and enjoy dinner.

gJn0mp6EcdHCb9w4UlSYcQ.text: Every time we come to Las Vegas we gotta stop by here and get our sushi fix!!! Love that u can customize your order and they accommodate you no extra charge !! Always eat the all u can eat ! Only $26.95 plus tax . Awesome deal and during dinner you can get amaebi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amaebi,White tuna &amp; fresh scallops!!! YUMMM

0_2F3Hndnd3RB1q7TKkRnQ.text: Can't beat these place with AYCE Sushi.  I've probably been here for 6-7 years now.  Yes portion has decreased somewhat, but it is still good..  It's almost like a mom and pop shop.  They always have some sorts of fish belly.

EOgRi0BcvYHgHRS64GdFzw.text: So far Reno has the best sushi I've ever had! So my sushi standards Are high. I haven't found a good sushi spot yet & I thought this would be a good place but it was super packed! We had to wait for 20 mins standing while they had two tables open. Horrible customer service! The tables are to close together so you can hear everyones conversation. The food is alright but I don't think I would go again.

eIRElYA_FORWvRZhLtuaLw.text: One of the best sushi places in town. Never disappointment when I take my family here.

fBSPaFB_Kd1HxXNKkxaDZQ.text: I have such a hard time talking about this place. It's not my favorite place to go to but then it again it has some items that I absolutely love there. So let's talk about what I normally order and we'll go from there.  Salmon collar: Yepp, you read it right, salmon collar. This is the only place in Vegas that I know of that has this dish and when it's done correctly, it's so fabulous. Salmon collar is the cheek of the salmon. So you get this salmon flavor fatty part that is just so tender and literally melts in your mouth. It's done with a miso glaze here and again, when it's right (not too salty, which is usually most of the time) is just delicious. I swear  by this dish with a side of white rice, very asian of me. I will admit that I will come here just for this dish.  Green salad: Oh yah. I don't know what is in the dressing but it's one of my favorite dressing. I usually order a side of it to take home because I'll dress all my salads with this dressing if I could. So bright and refreshing.  Shrimp head miso: It's not on the menu so you gotta tell them shrimp head miso. It just adds just the right about of brine and salt to the miso. You don't have to eat the shrimp head but it's worth the try. You're in Vegas, right?  Nebakyaki udon: Served in a clayish pot and pretty darn good. I love udon but there's something different about it that makes me crave it. And when I crave udon, this is the udon that will cure my cravings. The only thing that I still find soooooooooooo odd and needs to be changed is, you CANNOT have this to go. I guess it's that hard for the owners to order big to go cups. I hope changes soon because I would have this soup more often if I could take it home.  All baked rolls: Okay, I going to let you all in on a small secret, I don't eat anything raw. I know, I know, don't judge me. But the good news is I can tell you that about the cooked stuff. No? Still not a good excuse? Well, deal with it. But, again, all the baked sushi is good there. Sometimes you just want to be unhealthy and break the cycle and have some cream cheese on my sushi. Speaking of, try the Frying Jason roll, one of my favorites here.  Now, the not so fun part, SERVICE. Where is the customer service? This place is the worst when it comes to service, minus the sushi chefs. ALL the servers there are so incompetent. They never seem to know whose section is whose. We get asked for water at least twice, I guess it's better than nothing, no one comes to check on you and you HAVE TO FIND anyone if you want to order more food, especially when you have the all you can eat. I wish they were just hire people that knew how to be servers. You're job is to be helpful, bring food to the table and check up on your guest, is it that hard for you to do? You're not in a fine dining restaurant, can you at least manage to be helpful?  If this place didn't have the few items that I can't seem to find at any other sushi place, I wouldn't come here. But, if you're lucky and come when there's no lunch or dinner rush, you'll find this place to be just that, okay.  Ciao and until next time, happy eating everyone :)

EFKyVPtXs386j9ID-RcnfQ.text: The sushi is good, except that they include imitation crab in almost everything. Service is very slow :( my boyfriend and I had to wait so long to get another order during an all-you-can-eat session!

D-60QoQaspsC23oN2iN2Zw.text: Sushi Monday is around the corner from me, and it's a solid choice for tasty Japanese food, especially late night. I'm not a sushi aficionado by any means, so this review will just cover the standard fare. The tempura is fresh and piping hot, therefor yummy. The age gyoza is great. Beef bowl is a delish winner, and the teriyaki bowls also have sliced asparagus, a perfect addition. The big complaint I have is how busy and popular they are! They take reservations, and it's a must have on weekends, unless you enjoy waiting for an empty table. They also do a great to-go business, so if you are like me, you call and order, then pick it up, and avoid how busy they can be.

A-gum73AdAVY_pjpPVn-ZA.text: Been here so many times, but on this occasion...  -The cuts of nigiri were horribly done.  My salmon had skin on it. -Our waiter said, "The ono needs to be unfrozen."  Ugh... frozen?  Did not live up to past dining experiences here.  And while I am a loyalist... Strike one Sushi Mon.

fJImROw3NtZwCa6tcedYqw.text: They have a great menu. Small dining area, practically sitting on each other.  I only went once and when I have bad service I won't go back. The rudest waitress. I only ordered 3 times due to her ignoring me but each time she asked me if I planned to eat it. Then it took 15 mins. The ladies next to me were served 7 times and I was there 20 mins before them. Island Sushi is my place of choice. Amazing service and sushi.

fQy9Fvkxa4EJDpahgiugoA.text: Great service, great food, great place.   Love this place. I have been going here since they opened. Consistent yumminess. My only complaint is that it is slammed on the weekends.

D7t-Rz4h0AdaVPsdIEbgcw.text: This place is NOT kid friendly, they state clearly at the table that you can't share food with your child and I'm sorry but my 3 year old is not going to eat enough that they should be worried. Additionally they charged is 3$ for our infant whom we know is really going to just slobber on some rice.

0q-T-AwWCY5lVJrPW7Qmng.text: the foods are great but the service... well it is ok.  The servers are little bit slow and take so long to just get my order. I understand they are busy but some times it irritates me.

60WeS7aiiqqDotiPYUC6IQ.text: The sushi was okay, not much in selection. Don't come here unless you LOVE cucumber in your rolls as well, seeing as they are in almost every single roll

MYZWurGC2iqwTZpzOh19Ww.text: Great AYCE sushi place. I went for lunch. A smaller establishment than other AYCE sushi places in vegas but still solid fish.   They have a 45 minute time limit, but they didn't seem to enforce it since it took them about 20 minutes to get the first set of rolls out.   The salmon belly was amazing. The sushi rice was a bit  blah and I got tired of it really fast.   The yellowtail was also very fresh as well.   In addition, great rolls and very different from the standard fare.

OF5_-PGbOQZoPMrHyJei-Q.text: The best sushi place in the sw area! All the staff are friendly and tentative, the chefs are always humorous to talk with while waiting and eating. This place is always packed but for a good reason! I recommend it to everyone!

IDRZm15X94pz017TGBg5Ug.text: One of my friends took me here for lunch when I was visiting Las Vegas last month.  Great sushi restaurant for lunch.  Its a bit small but, they still got quite busy.  They have a grea all you can eat sushi special for lunch.  Check them out...

A0zM50CBOoiI6CChRZPNlA.text: See my review of Goyemon just remove all mentions of pork belly. Great quality sushi + tempura ice cream = Perfect place for AYCE sushi.

hUCrB7-M5tai2L6zowg-XQ.text: It's just A-Right, over-priced for what you get. I'd still rather go to Yama Sushi down the road. yelp.com/biz/yama-sushi-... Cheaper and better quality! The names on the menu is not as cool! You know that's really important, Being cool! especially in vegas! The rice on the sushi was cold and hard, not sure what that's all about. The fish was ok, nothing spetacular. The best one on the menu was the Salmon Sushi, you have to get that! $22.95 for lunch is a bit steep for what I got...

OhPtX-SuiKTZsHxm0sHgPA.text: The basics: -All you can eat of the full menu -45 minute time period to order your unlimited sushi and appetizers (I don't think they really keep track of this) -the unlimited sushi includes the special rolls on the back page -there's a charge if you have any leftover food -The tempura ice cream was really soggy. The lychee sorbet was much better.

7UsT7_QDmEk7gMIAwUi2Cg.text: Every single time I'm in Vegas this is the place to get sushi! I love their specials menu and it's great that they're the only place that has yellow tail collar! Yum! Sushi is always fresh and I love ordering their Uni. Service is great as well, although they do get busy around dinner time so make sure you go at the right time! :)

DoXe9tta2m0FUXaFZopcsg.text: This place is a must stop now everything time we're in Vegas.  A good friend of mine introduced it to me and my boyfriend back in Oct and we've loved it ever since. There AYCE is a great deal. It gets pretty busy so the service can be much better but as long as you know what you from the form it worked out okay. If you wanted something that you didn't write on the form...good luck trying to flag a waiter down right away.   Overall fresh sushi, wide variety and for an AYCE place they don't pile on the rice!!  I hate going to places that piles on the rice and sauces. I can't wait to go back when I'm in the city again.

nLwbehDCatm85dhUbIoSgw.text: It's 10:30pm on a Tuesday night, and it hits me that I'm hungry... Really hungry!  I remembered driving by this place, and it looking fairly crowded before.  I yelped it, and it looked try worthy.  This place is not bad at all.  You can't beat the price for all you can eat sushi in Vegas.  I was seated at the bar and was given a brief explanation of how the all you can eat works.  The waitress suggested that I order small because whatever I don't eat, I will have to pay for in addition to the all you can eat price.  Also, you have to eat the rice and the fish (sounds obvious, but I do know of people who would hide the rice and just eat the fish).  Also, you can order half rolls (4 pieces instead of 8), so you can eat more of a variety.  There is also a 1 hour time limit... so no pulling Man v. Food all day here.    I ordered and ordered because I was determined to get my money's worth.  I had the sweet shrimp (only 1 order per person), snow crab hand rolls, crab sticks, garlic tuna (my least favorite), halibut, some kind of variation on the a shrimp roll with avocado, more snow crab, the hottest 911 roll I have ever had (I couldn't feel my tongue-- it was awesome), and more halibut.  I was stuffed, but determined to finish my last hand roll when I was asked by Jun (one of the sushi chefs) if I wanted anything else.  I told him I was tapping out.  I had fought the good fight... then he offers dessert.  I'm not one to turn down sugar, but I don't think I could have looked at more food much less ate it.    My bill was about $30 with my plum wine.  The only reason I couldn't give this place 5 starts is because I've had fresher fish elsewhere at an all you can eat.  Of course, this was in Cali.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic tuna

QS0_CZJmwWVEJXqzJuKOCA.text: Very good sushi,  not too much rice at all.  Great selection of all types of nigiri sushi,  we didn't bother with the rolls or appetizers.  Sit at the bar, you'll probably get better,  quicker service but you better know what to order.  Save room for dessert,  the green tea and red bean ice cream is da bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uDhwI72mmNFktwxuqURfQg.text: For all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas you can't beat Sushi Mon. The restaurant is not too big so sometimes there is a long wait, but if you don't mind eating at the sushi bar you are good to go. I recommend the Pastel and Spider for cut rolls. Cajun albacore is a delight as well. If you don't do the all you can eat the pricing is very reasonable. If you do the all you can eat do not leave without ordering the Yellow Tail Collar. It is a delicacy and I highly recommend it. The dinner all you can eat is only $26.95 and it comes with sides a plenty. Will come back here over and over again.

W2p2MsemL9CeuU6zi89cvw.text: I can't believe I have never written a review for Sushimon!  This was my go to place for AYCE sushi...when I lived on this side of town, I would come all the time, and even after I moved, I would make the 45min drive for excellent and fresh sushi.  I have ran into a new favorite though, which is still a sister company of sushimon, and a little more centrally located.  So what makes sushimon one of the best in town?  Fresh fish, fast service, and most importantly, YELLOWTAIL COLLARS!  Yellowtail collars are easily one of the best fish pieces I have ever consumed.  In the AYCE setup, you are limited to one, but it is what makes me drive all the way out here...it is seriously that good.  You HAVE to order it, especially if you go with the AYCE menu.  One of the most tender parts of the fish and packed with flavor.  I am a nigiri kind of guy, although we do order rolls every once in a while, but everything I have came into contact with is super tastey and fresh.  They have plenty of sides to order as well, such as tempura options and baked mussels.  They also have good deals on pitchers of Sapporo which is a nice touch.  Give it a go!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail collars are some of the best eats ever
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8gnw2QjINP4tY1dc4dnXvQ.text: Excellent well-crafted sushi, me and my girlfriend ordered all you can eat and had our fill of an amazing variety of delicious choices, customer service was fantastic and will define you be back

_Yuue5Fg9Jj-nEV5vq9Nxw.text: I had AYCE sushi a few nights ago and sat at the bar with a friend. When we sat we were greeted by one of the chefs who was extremely friendly. We ordered one of every roll and the two that stood out the most were the hurricane and ecstasy, both were excellent with flavors that complimented each other perfectly. Other than food the inside was clean and the staff was friendly. The only reason I'm rating 4 stars instead of 5 is the menu is a bit small compared to other AYCE sushi places in the valley.

QIJOqJ6kK32zyqgLNDn_ow.text: One word! Dynamite!! Get it, you'll thank me! AYCE here is worth the drive/wait. Try spider roll. Baked 428 is really good. And try something I call Hawaiian thunder! You'll need to order a Mahalo roll, a dynamite and 4 orders of unagi(fresh water eel 2 pieces an order). On a piece of the Mahalo roll, you put a spoon full of dynamite on it. Then grab an eel piece from the unagi and place it on top of the dynamite. And enjoy your Hawaiian thunder!

WxSq7aTe_R0f6QphHkaS_Q.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE but the only thing that knocks off a star is that the wait for this place can be ridiculous and they don't take reservations. I've waited and been happy with it, but it still sucks to wait over an hour for your delicious sushi.   On the plus side, this place has so many rolls and they do a great job mixing and matching the different fish options and the sauces. They also do specials that have proven to be pretty incredible (check out the posted specials on signs throughout the restaurant). It's pretty tiny in there and it does get a little cramped at your table with your 10,000 lbs of AYCE deliciousness.   As a HUGE bonus (wish I could give extra half stars!), dessert and appetizers are also AYCE so you can have as many mochi as your little heart desires. I once had a friend who came in and ordered ONLY mochi (no fish!) for the whole meal. No a lot of places can get away with that :) Also, they're open pretty late, so when the hunger strikes, you can get your sushi on.   Favorite rolls include: Super white tuna (BEST EVER), Lasagna Roll, Crispy Rice Roll, J.J. Roll, Pastel, Rock n Roll, and the Moment Roll.

rojebRexgSAGsYJKVORGzg.text: A few years ago Sushi Mon was one of our more highly regarded joints for AYCE. As we have since expanded our search to other local spots around town, it's taken a serious hit on the sushi meter as it just cannot compare anymore.  While their nigiri remains high in quality and freshness (albeit the portions have gotten noticeably smaller), their rolls are not particularly interesting. A great deal of the rolls contain crab stick which irks me. A lot of "crab," a lot of cucumber, a lot of tuna. Nothing different or special. They are also very dry. This negatively impacts the experience if you're not feasting on AYCE nigiri alone, as I've sometimes been tempted to do.   Our chef didn't seem too enthusiastic either. I hate sitting at the sushi bar feeling like I'm bothering he chef. I'm aware the chef-customer dynamic is different in AYCE than in traditional and authentic sushi settings, but maybe a smile when we order? Perhaps asking once or twice if we'd like anything else?   It's nice having a choice for all those late-night sushi cravings, but Sakana still wins in my book for best AYCE in Las Vegas.

sL5vCKSoPPGsbGcerqtGlA.text: Very good sushi, I will always come here when I come to Las Vegas Nevada or Henderson

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With the quill egg
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb

MBs_-NdT7dwsCr2uoWq7OA.text: A big group of us (16) made a trip out to Utah to do some hiking and on the way back to LA some people suggested we make pitstop at Sushi Mon for lunch. As an LA native, I tend to stear clear of any AYCE unless it's Korean BBQ because it's always sub-par in regards to quality and service, but Sushi Mon proved to be the contrary.  Some of my favorite items: scallop sushi | salmon belly | yellowtail belly | salmon | white tuna | salmon roe with quail egg | albacore | seaweed salad | cucumber salad | custom handroll (spicy tuna with avocado and quali egg)   Not only was the fish quality better that I expected, but the service was absolutely top notch. I was worried a party of 16 was going to be overwhelming, but our server (I forget her name) never flinched and got our ever expanding orders perfectly and it didn't take forever either.  I will definitely make a point to visit Sushi Mon the next time I'm in or passing through Vegas and you should too!

vT7WoiZsBEGHIEa-Uh9Teg.text: This is places all you can eat is out of this world! great service and open late. Quality food as well!!!

LDJiJ3ldOIvyTZ4JyqOVoQ.text: Sushi: prepare to not be seated edition. You will be bumped and told to wait well over an hour if a bigger group wants to be seated. The signs about not being seated if you don't have your complete party? Those count for you, not for them.

PJOHJYN-Nrk1YMIjkg1DyA.text: I think 3 stars is a good average rating for the average sushi and mediocre service they gave me. I think other sushi places are better but they do have good portion sizes. Their salmon is good but I didn't really enjoy the albacore and the halibut. I did the all you can eat. The lychee ice cream was amazing and the portion was even better. Our server came to us once for our drink order and our first order and was no where to be found. Later I found out that he'd left without a word and there was no other server that helped us as a replacement for him. It was busy but there was no wait, if I would've been at least able to put in another order I would've been happy.

p026iDuZ_tQlIqeFyOI1Ow.text: Yum, I love Sushi Mon!!  Sushi Mon is definitely the best 'all you can eat' sushi restaurant!  I came here for dinner with a group of friends, and we all decided to enjoy the sushi buffet for $26.95/person.   We ordered some rolls as soon as we sat down.  The rolls came out within 5 minutes, which is really fast.  Everything tasted fresh and really delicious.  I love how there isn't a lot of rice on the sushi, too.  Its great that we can order half rolls, so we got to try more items.  My favorites were the following: 1. Grilled Yellowtail Collar - the fish was cooked to perfection.  The fish fell off the bone and it was juicy.  I really liked the dipping sauce which gave it more flavor.  2. Seaweed salad - tasty  3. Lychee Sherbet - I've never had this before, but it was really good.  The sherbet tasted like lychee, and it wasn't too sweet.  4. Spider roll - The roll was pretty big, and the soft shell crab was good.  Overall, service was great.  Even though it may be a bit pricey, its definitely worth it!  I can't wait to come back when I'm in Vegas again.
