0a_Bb05B0XxaiMSybfVd4w.text: I visited twice.  Dine in and take out.  This restaurant is convenient because of walking distance from my house.  I moved from CA last year and Sushi "neta" (fish) is better than restaurants in San Jose, but they must improve the way to prepare their rice.  Shari was very dry.  Particularly, Maki sushi I took out collapsed its shape when I picked up by chopsticks.  Also, I felt their rice is missing "Umami".

dLDwyDPhBRc1hS3LGWMZ_Q.text: First time visit, not impressed. The sushi rice was dry, no flavor and it fell apart as soon as you picked it up. The tempura was soggy and not hot so I'm lead to believe it's pre-cooked and not fresh.  On a good side the chicken teriyaki was good and the service staff is friendly and attentive.

n9L7FehQHRy5Q9z1t7K3pw.text: We were at sushi mon on December 24th. It was a little bit of wait for 3 of us to get seated. This is our 4th time and we figured things out. We ordered specials on the chalk board first, because they are always fresh and good. The yellowtail collar appetizer was great. I felt like I was back in japan in a small izakaya.   We only order nigiri sushi because we love fish. Seared tuna, seared salmon and fresh scallop were our favorites of the day. Their fish is always very fresh and as good as being in japan. They sometimes get rice either not cooked right or the chef did not roll it tight enough, and rice can fall apart. However , we hit the good night and all nigiri made were near perfect.  We tried other AYCE sushi places, but this place is the best among them!

D1h_nI0MaHMQWtr460BgiQ.text: This used to b my all time favorite sushi spot don't get me wrong everything they have to offer is great from the food to service ... But I'm disappointed only to fine this place on dirty dinning with a c grade after what I saw on the show dirty dinning I don't think I'll b eating here anymore even if they got there A grade back ....

IrEi3wrQkX1L13avFdoPKA.text: This place is my favorite, my brother and I have filled our AYCE cards a couple of times. (Eat ten times get one free!) I love the lemon roll, Sexy girl, ecstasy, and hurricane rolls. The dragon roll is also good, and the super white tuna is to die for, buttery and smooth.

8D-E8JPuCm0olbVayqLQ4g.text: We were party of 4 and waiting for the last one to show up. They had free tables and we asked them if we can be seated. Host was very rude with us and without explaining anything, she said no we cannot be seated. We asked for a manager and he showed up couple mins later telling us that we cannot be seated because, if the last guy is late, we will keep eating more! What a cheap way of thinking!! They would rather keep us by the door, they do not have any seats for people waiting, than calculating that we would eat more...Sushi was okay, can eat anywhere else but the service was unacceptable.

BdiTcDB93JJfSfJf-o3L4w.text: We've been regular customers since it opened, today's food was terrible.  Sweet shrimp was bad, uni was brown, scallops was sour to the point of burning my tongue, and rice was big.  Very very disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most disgusting Uni I&#39;ve ever had.  Had to send it back, brown in color instead of orange or yellow.  It used be good here.

ZLYsWcn0sO-lJ-JiZ_d0Tg.text: I've been going to Sushi Mon ever since they opened and honestly it is my favorite sushi place! I never want to go anywhere else if my friends say lets get sushi I always tell them I won't go unless it is Sushi Mon!

4_xGHK4ruPR2UsybPU_w9Q.text: Sushi mon, is definitely the "MON".   My boyfriend and I woke up around 2. We were starving and heard this place was the place to go when your hungry.   Okay. 21.95 for all you can eat amazing ass sushi? That is freaking cheap! I swear, we ate 200 dollars worth of food here. I could not get enough of their salmon. We had like 10 freaking orders.   Are you kidding me! This is so cheap and they do half rolls here!! So you can try everything here without breaking your bank and stomach.   You MUST try their pastel roll and volcano roll.   Honestly, I've tried a lot of sushi places. The best I've had was in Hawaii and this is pretty close to it.

vQBSMQpURiNkYfOFj37Swg.text: 1 star because you can't put less but I will say service is pretty good.. Halibut and Snapper had texture of octopus.. Albacore sushi had texture of shredded tuna tasted like fish bait nearly rotten had to slam some sake down to get it down. Should have left then but I got one more roll with yellowfin tuna (maguro) because my first roll with spicy tuna wasn't terrible this also had. Terrible muscle texture obviously they don't know how to cut fish.. all the fish was served on warm-hot temp. Rice - terrible! Your fish is being cooked by the rice it was hot enough..  By far worst sushi in vegas I've had yet other than grocery store sushi.. go to blue fin or Osaka or really anywhere else..  My favorite thing about sushi Mon is that it is PACKED!!! Such a shame we live amongst so many Mammalukes..

2y3BL3g5sUdOmR1RoK_Arg.text: I would consider myself a regular. Love this place, the service at this location is awesome.

alMZsgCEtEX7smFwd3OYWw.text: Best sushi buffet i've ever eaten.  the buffet menu had amost everything i like and the price was very reasonable.    def going back next time im in vegas

Ghd3pJ1QL6FrMWF2itdTwQ.text: how could i NOT have written a review for this place? I used to go here at least twice a month!  sit at the bar - ask to sit in Fredo's section.  especially if you from Hawaii - he'll hook you up!  i love the baked mussels. but Fredo just keeps stuff comin - we don't even need to order!  Pricey: a little. But for the food and quantity - worth it.   GO!

Sk58ZX2-EpXN2afLXr8BqA.text: Excellent Sashimi!! I always get takeout because it's so busy!! Their all you can eat is awesome as well! Friendly staff!

kLQvPKESyNNz7qHwK13GBA.text: I've been coming here for years. And the sushi is amazing. But I'm giving this 3 stars only because of the new tables they've put in recently. They are now wider and I believe they've even added a table. At least if you sit at the bar you can lean to you friend to talk to them.So now basically you're sitting right next to strangers and I feel I can't talk with letting the adjacent guests know my business.

ULpRZgaAB0CjeLWOPq88Yw.text: Great AYCE, good prices. The wait is worth it!

BGla05_jmBmUDuRBXEPqVQ.text: Definitely come to see Alfredo! He comes up with creative and mind blowing sushi items not even featured on the menu! He is very friendly and definitely makes the experience. I love that this place is open until 2am.

V-1fdE2PryqksYpXw8lcSg.text: Well I wouldn't know how it would taste because of how long we waited.  The man at the front told us it was going to be a 40 minute wait, and we were definitely willing to wait, but once the clock went an hour and 15 minutes into our waiting time we decided it was ridiculous and left. Many workers came up to the front and didn't even acknowledge us. We thought from all the good reviews they would've offered us a glass of water or at least a "sorry for the wait." It's a shame the people were so rude, I'm sure the food would've been great but unfortunately we won't be coming back due to the long wait time and rude people.

FKOMtuJmNmwdF23LeE0Osw.text: Well..I'm bummed, I've been one time prior and remember it being supa-doopa!!  The sushi chefs would hoot and holler, play with you and have fun..and the food was great!  It was always packed and it was a pain in the arse to get a table.  We went last night and the customer service twas LAAAAME, they were burdened by us asking questions & attempting to get their attention.... And the food was ok-ok, total let down.  Japanese Lasagna is one of my secret favorite indulgences and their "version" is a mayonnaise vomit overload!!  YUUUUCK!  I couldn't finish it.  I will say however, that the miso soup is a delight, but everything else I had, MEH, I'll pass.  Not sure what happened Sushi Mon, you were the sh*t, but now there are much much better places around.   Eh. :(

-KjlJDilvOU1vIdxVohMHw.text: I think this place stinks because of the absolutely horrible service.  Let me explain:  Went there Dec 26th at 7:30PM.  I expected there to be a wait which is no big deal.  However, after standing around for 15 minutes at the counter and having some rude people cut in line to get a table, I went to the front to ask the host where I can write down my name.  He just answered that the wait was 40 minutes to an hour.  He was quite rude and didn't even make eye contact with me.  When I asked how the person that just came got a table, he just repeated that he was very busy.    The sushi bar had 5 chairs available so I asked if I could sit there.  He then looked at me and said that there are tons of people waiting.  I look around and there are 3 others.  Oh yeah, there were three others that were waiting before me and when they saw the line cutters get their seats, they left immediately without saying a word.  I on the other hand left using some expletives.   The fish might be good but I don't need to be mistreated and will take my business somewhere else.

bnFSl0yPAZO_q6YSe0JP1A.text: Recently moved to the area and browsing to find my new go to sushi spot with my fiance. We came in a week ago and were seated right away. Its a small location but it works. Unfortunately i wont be returning there was only one roll that actually stood out with amazing flavor, everything else had mild to zero flavor. Granted its sushi but some places tend to bring the flavor. There fried rolls weren't to our liking at all, the color seemed as if the oil may have been old and being we both felt very sick at the end of our evening and into the following days im for certain it was. Service is okay, and clean location. On to the next sushi place.

_Wdge8Jz7CSbWjihxAsxFA.text: A long long time ago, in a land far away, there was an innocent small town cowgirl who had never had sushi...that girl was me.  Luckily, someone close to me was a bit more worldly in that department and so one fine day after smoking a lot of "tobacco" a hunger came over me like none I had ever experienced, so I agreed to try sushi.  That first experience was at Sushi Mon and my life has never been the same.  I think it's rather cute/funny/entertaining that they make you read the "rules" of all-you-can-eat before hand.  Some of the rules include "your hour begins when you get your first dish," "if you leave rice on your plate you will be charged the individual amount of that particular item on top of the AYCE charge" etc., etc...  I see many people complaining about wait times here.  I have experienced that as well and yes, that is a pain but, that is also a good sign for any restaurant, in my opinion.  Now that I'm a bit more experienced in the sushi department, I can honestly say that I have yet to see a sushi roll selection that rivals that of Sushi Mon.  Who knew that such a great sushi establishment could exist in the middle of the desert!  Thank you, Sushi Mon, for making my first sushi eating experience a good one!!

LH5yRg7rfrJ7tO9hYikWwA.text: One hour for all-you-can-eat sushi? Game on.  There's always a wait here, and for good reason. At less than $30 for all the sushi you can possibly want, it's certainly a fantastic deal, as long as you order right. We went for literally all nigiris. The uni and amaebi is one order per person max, but everything else you can place multiple orders of. My favorites were the yellowtail belly, the mackerel, and the super white tuna. There are also lots of appetizers (seaweed salad, miso soup, etc.), and desserts as well (mochi ice cream anyone?).  This place is a must-visit for me whenever I'm in town, if only for the sheer knowledge that I am having awesome sushi in the middle of a desert. Oh Vegas.

Fu-9VWbMrlLganr4osQB0g.text: Sushi Mon has a special place in my heart. When I came to Vegas in 2005 I had never had sushi before and thus is the place I went to try it. Funny enough, it is also the first place my wife ate sushi, and back then, we didn't even know each other. Anyway, to me, this is one of my favorite places. I always get along with the chefs, they are very fast, the rolls are good, and the fish is fresh. What more could I ask? The price is pretty standard for an AYCE. You really can't go wrong here.

36LRjPqfA9WvXEFvIsHlhA.text: Every time anyone asks about sushi or wants to know where to get good sushi, I always refer them to Sushimon.   Now, don't get me wrong, this place is not perfect. However having tried more than a few spots in town, and seen the many gimmicks put up by other places, Sushimon remains my favorite sushi spot.   All the negatives that people mention about this place are technically  True  - This place is not close to the strip. - The wait time can be long(sometimes topping out at 1 hour + - The restaurant is smallish.  However, if you're visiting Vegas, and really want good sushi, is it  that horrible to drive an extra 10 minutes to not have to deal with casino parking, not have to walk a mile and a half to get to the place, and not deal with the absurd prices you often find at restaurants on the strip?  I've often found, that any restaurant, be it big or small that can produce a full house and wait, is doing something right.  Sushimon doesn't offer you fine dining service. It's not going to blow you away with it's superior service.  I don't know about you guys, but I really don't think that matters.  If you're getting AYCE Sushi, you already have an idea of what kind of sushi you want, and what your preference is.  All the server's I've seen at Sushimon are good at getting the food out, and keeping the drinks full.  You could go to some dirty place in the middle of a bad neighborhood and get Sushi for $4-5 cheaper, sure.  But Sushimon offers almost their entire menu on their AYCE and All-you-can-eat Dessert as well.   I know a lot of places mark off menu items and only offer you one dessert.  Things I LOVE from Sushimon  Nigiri: - Hamachi (Yellowtail) - Salmon - Super White Tuna - Unagi  Other offerings: - Hamachi Collar(most places don't offer this, and they sometimes run out, but if they have, order it!) - Salmon Collar -All the rolls(and 1/2 rolls for almost all of them if you want to try the roll without getting too full, again something most places don't offer) -Uni(Sea Urchin) (one per person) -Ama Ebi(sweet Shrimp) (also one per person)  Dessert(AYCE) -Mochi Ice Cream (Strawberry/Vanilla) -Green Tea, Red Bean, and Lychee Ice Cream - Tempura Ice cream  Sure you could in theory find a cheaper place than this, in a more "glamorous" location, but if I'm gonna shell out $20+ for a meal, I don't mind paying a little bit more knowing that my meal is going to be good. Sushimon offers you a large menu to choose from, speedy service, and most importantly, consistency. I've been here at least a dozen times, and haven't once had a bad experience.   In case anyone is wondering, they DON'T do call ahead seating, so you have to arrive in person to get your party on the list.

HTG0oNpRYqezKvZ8orTmqA.text: I'm not a fan of sushi (too filling) but I love sashimi.  With sushi, restaurants can get away with less-than-fresh fish by adding sweet things to it like gravy, etc. (I don't think the authentic Japanese restaurants never do this so if you find sweet gravy or sauce on your sushi, that's probably not authentic Japanese or the fish tastes stale on its own).  With sashimi, there's no getting away with stale fish.  I loved my Sushi Mon experience today because the Sashimi Dinner was reasonably priced (about $13) for the ample serving they provide, the service was great, and the fish was delectably fresh.  Additional notes:  It's hard to get a table at Sushimon -  and I live about 10 minutes away, so lately I've found it practical to order takeout by phone. The food is just as good.

zP9NzoJi7dLPDcVopI702Q.text: Lots of positives. They're open late, you can order half rolls to get more variety, service is pretty quick. There's plenty of cooked stuff for those adverse to raw fish.  We arrived at around 9:30 on a weekday and the restaurant was still at least half full. We were seated quickly, and we noticed a sign saying we only had 1 hour, so we ordered hot tea and a few rolls literally right as we sat down. Our waitress put our order in, and we got some more time to take a closer look at the menu.   Round 1 comes, and we order our round 2 right away. Then round 3 and 4 fairly soon after that. By round 4, our waitress said to us "you guys know the rules, right? no leftover rice?" Us: uhh... I think so? Waitress: you guys still have a monster roll coming Us: yea, we know  Hahahaha, she wasn't rude about it, but more shocked at how much we were ordering. We read over the rules, just in case, and asked her about the 1 hr rule. She said we were okay, they just don't allow customers to sit for 30 mins before ordering again. We continued for several more rounds, and then even ordered 2 rounds of dessert. I loved the green tea ice cream, but the lychee sherbet was a close second.  The fish was pretty decent. Ami ebi was awesome, and so was the yellowtail collar (warning, you can only have 1 order per person of these). Plenty of variety, and definitely worth the $27.

7q9AftApxNSg9S-_PtfX9Q.text: Sushimon is my usual go to place for AYCE, but the food tonight was terrible. Everything I ate was so MUSHY. The rice and fish were both too soft. I couldn't even taste anything. The terrible texture pretty much killed my appetite. Also, there was a hair in the dipping sauce that came with my shrimp tempura. I noticed that a majority of the sushi chefs were Hispanic rather than Japanese? Uhhh don't know if that affected anything, but I'm hoping it was just an off night for them.

KrbhCBBnb8YGfHTJr6BoJA.text: 12-25-2018  /  5:30pm  /  4 adults + 2 kids We had dinner at Sushi Mon. (AYCE Sushi) Table Number: T02  At 9:30 pm   3 adults had the same symptoms until next day early morning.  Adult_A: 5 times vomiting / 9 times diarrhea / Headache / Chills Adult_B: 3 times vomiting / 4 times diarrhea / Headache / Chills Adult_C: 4 times vomiting / 4 times diarrhea / Headache / Chills  We went to the restaurant the next day. I explained everything to the manager. She said "We can not do anything, Sorry"  If you want to get the same experience, please visit there and  try their ROTTEN food.  Good Luck^^

FKmCEL9B6AeHWsj2q64o8A.text: I'm a big fan of sushi. This place has the best nigiri for their AYCE selection . Their salmon belly is a must try !!!  They also have a stamp card for eating here that if you eat 10 times , your 11th is free. ( Downside is you got to fill the stamp card within one year or it's not valid)

tqJNO79AO4cPBObdYLK4Bw.text: Great food great prices. AYCE for around $20 For lunch and $30 for dinner. Incredibly low priced lunch specials as well. My favorite is the vegetable teriyaki bowl for $4.50. It comes with the soup salad and rice. Bargain of the century for those on a low budget. They also give you hot or cold green tea at no extra charge. You can't beat this place value and excellent quality. They open late until 1 AM I believe is the last call. They also include ayce desserts!

rAnsP3gJW0OqlwkSCh9S0A.text: I wish I would have taken more pictures of our food!!!  That is my one regret about this place!!!  I LOVE this place and I mean I LOVE it!!! My Husband and I went here twice in three days!!!  Over $100 in all you can eat sushi over two days and it was soooo worth it!!!  Mind you, we went twice with big groups so we got to try a TON of stuff so the list of stuff we have tried verses haven't is pretty significant!!!  Lol!!!  I didn't try one thing that I didn't like and/or love except for one thing!!!  I had the Green Salad and the Dressing was awesome and fresh so yummy!!!  The Baked Green Mussels I could have eaten about two or three trays of them!!! They were cheesey, sweet, and tasted like the sea!!!  Loved them!!! Never knew I liked Mussels as much as I did until today!!!  We had the Fried Shumai and that was interesting.  It tasted nice with the crunchy outside and the shrimp inside that was soft.  We had the Calamari and it was soft and not tough and very flavorful!!!  Another huge stand out was the Cajun Albacore Nigiri!!! Those I ate so much of!!! They are one of the best things on the menu!!!  So different in taste and so good!!!  We also had the Albacore, Yellowtail Belly, Yellowtail, Shrimp, Salmon, Red Snapper, Tuna, Yum Yum Scallop, and Surf Clam in Nigiri.  Loved it all!!!  So fresh and it was good with the Spicy Mayo or just plain Soy Sauce!!!  The Dynamite I was so scared to try and it was another thing I could have had serving after serving of!!!  Tons of Seafood in it and just so yummy!!! Literally the name speaks for itself!!!  Also, had the Vegetable Tempura and it was ok not the best just ok.  It would have been nice to have a good sauce like the traditional Ponzu with Daikon Radish.  We had the Garlic Edamame and those are the best seasoned ones I have ever had!!!  We tried the Strawberry Mochi, Lychee Ice Cream, and the Fried Tempura Ice Cream for dessert.  The Strawberry Mochi was great and the Fried Tempura Ice Cream was to die for!!!  So simple and good and just blow you out of the water delicious!!! The Lychee Ice Cream was the one thing I was not liking very much.  However, that honestly was just a preference thing not that it was bad just that I personally don't like it.  Finally, If they had one of these in Utah I would easily be there once every two weeks or more EASY!!! The sushi scene in Utah is so lame compared to this place!!! If they had one in Utah they would be booked all day everyday no joke!!! Please move one out here I am BEGGING you!!!  I can't afford to travel five hours every time I need sushi!!! Jk!!!  Basically, my new favorite place of all time and they need to have like a 10 out of 5 stars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, Salmon, and Cajun Nigiri!!!
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stacks of Menus!!!
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I believe this was Yellowtail or Albacore???  Not sure, but there was Calamari as well!!!

zBodvDoQXIcxxqNYM_dxUQ.text: Came here with my family for a Christmas dinner and it was amazing! It was my first time having made to order all you can eat sushi. A few people in our party had been to this spot before and it exceeded my expectations. We arrived about an hour and a half before we were hungry to put our name in. I was surprised the wait was so long but after going I could see why and plan to bring friends to try this place out the next time we are in Vegas :]  The service was great (I compared it to busy KBBQ spots) and the sushi was so fresh. We ordered a lot of the sashimi but surprisingly the sweet shrimp and ecstasy rolls were really good.   The prices were also great. The bento box we ordered for the youngest person at our table was $9.95 and included miso soup, salad, tempura, white rice, California rolls and teriyaki chicken.   The all you can eat the rest of us had was $27/ person.

wTV6o3xApYphZPOCouxiQA.text: I do not recommend you come to eat to this place at all. I had a lot of trouble ordering just some basic beef terreyaki because they were forcing me to order of the all you can eat menu. So I was okay with ordering all you can eat and I had my little 10 year old daughter with me which doesn't eat sushi at all. I told the lady I was just going to order some garlic ademame for my daughter she said okay. When the garlic ademame got here she basically made my daughter not eat it thinking it was part of the all you can eat. I told her multiple times that I would pay separate for her garlic ademame but my daughter felt bad and lost her abetite and so did I. I will never come eat at this place again terrible service and the food presentation was bad as well the rice would fall of as soon as you would pick it up with the roll.

plURFoKrp6OnUxhCA5r62Q.text: The best sushi buffet I ever been to. The food was made to order, fresh and filled with quality meat. You could order 5 rolls at a time if you wanted to. The chubby and one of the fried roll I forget the name but it was all meat no rice were the best but all the rolls were good. Service was great as well

FTB8-vnXoZuUM78ihootkA.text: This is the best AYCE sushi place I've been to. All of their fish is fresh and ready to eat. Sadly, when I came on a Friday night, they ran out of toro. But all of the other fish made up for it. We ordered scallop, tuna, white tuna, salmon, uni, masago with quail eggs, and more. They all tasted really good and flavorful.   The wait took about 1 hr but they will text you when your table is ready so you can go do other stuff and come back. Service was amazing and fast. Price is reasonable for their top quality of fish. We paid about $129 for 4 ppl. Overall, I would definitely  recommend coming here for AYCE.

JgyPp1sKqzQ9Ytsd8acSCg.text: We came here with the entire family and called ahead to make sure it was handicap friendly for my disabled mother and indeed it was.  She's also not a sushi fan but she ordered a beautiful salad that had shrimp that were cooked perfectly.  The staff was attentive and kept the rolls coming for the sushi fans.  My only complaint was the 911 roll.  The menu does say be careful but we love spicy sushi.  This roll  had no flavor it was just toxically hot.  Don't do it OR do it last because you won't taste anything for the next 10 minutes.  That having been said it was a good meal and we had fun!  Will return for sure!

MVgF5YDjyjojhJJX3jmhGA.text: The sushi was good, four stars there. The service was terrible. The servers were friendly but incompetent. Food took forever to come and at one point our food was served to the wrong table, it sat there for several minutes, the wrong table told the server and she picked it up and gave it to us. Food that was given to somebody else and in their possession for several minutes...just gave it to us like that's normal. I couldn't believe it, even McDonald's would redo the order.

v0Kaz54EibAsdX3c31n0NQ.text: Love that this place is so close to home. Great Sushi. Delicious AYCE. I come here often and sit at the bar. The cooks are so nice.

kV3yqw71kGdnc0kZZvZOjA.text: I was looking for an AYCE sushi spot near my house and I found this place! We came around dinner time so it was pretty busy. The restaurant is kind of small and we were seated at the bar so we had to squeeze in next to other people.   Our sushi chef who took care of us was really nice and the service was quick. I really enjoyed their tuna & garlic tuna nigiri! Can't complain about the fish to rice ratio.   Dinner price is about $26.95. They also give you a stamp card! Pretty cool since I've never been to a sushi restaurant that offers that.   The only thing that bothered me was the person sitting next to us at the bar. He was rushing the sushi chef because he "had somewhere to be." If you're in a rush don't eat at a restaurant? Try a drive thru instead.

IIvKFEMnz41Z4ER-MQIpow.text: What a horrible experience. 6 of us come to eat AYCE Sushi and the food was great. When our order was correct. However our waitress Anna messed up our order a few times. She then leaves to break without telling us that she is leaving. We didn't know who was supposed to serve us now. After receiving some food which we didn't order we asked where our server was and was told by Zach that she went on break. Nice to know. Thanks. I'm them informed that only a la carte restaurants let there customers know when they are going on break. Wow! Zach then continues to just make excuses why Anna didn't say anything before leaving. Cool whatever. I ask for a manager and Jennie the host says that there isn't a manager on duty that they are the only ones there to help also we had a guest that can read lips and sees Jennie say"these fuking people" to one of the other servers. Unbelievable! Unmanaged servers who like to argue with customers. Never coming here again that's for sure! Food was good service sucks!

ZTcsA9cq7tjN0SCAM7sgXg.text: I was looking for an AYCE place close to my house, and decided to give Sushi Mon a try. The interior is small but nicely decorated, and service was prompt. I had no wait when I went for dinner, but I also went after 9PM.  The food itself was tasty and consisted of standard AYCE fare. I don't remember anything particularly standing out, but it was all decent quality. Prices were comparable to other AYCE sushi places in town.

usVfatJAHVuGgNXWwitzrQ.text: I've ignored this place in favor of sister restaurant Sushi House Goyemon for too long. It may be an equal or superior experience.  Sushi Mon on Maryland is one of my favorites from back when I did AYCE (all you can eat) sushi multiple times a month if not a week. In case you're not familiar with Las Vegas, the AYCE sushi scene is huge and prepared to order, not buffet style. Goyemon and this older restaurant have identical menus (including AYCE dessert - that 1 per person limit at many restaurants is a pet peeve), but I always recalled Goyemon having a larger offering of special nigiri and appetizers.  Sushi Mon has almost caught up in specials variety since my last visit a few years back. I don't have a photo, but the nigiri included a hefty array of nigiri, including yuzu tobiko, seared bonito, and other ignored options. I tried and loved the blue fin tuna, salmon belly, yellowtail belly, and masaba (a variety mackerel that's far less salty). A full meal of those would've been more than satisfying.  From the aforementioned specials menu, I also enjoyed these nigiri: Japanese mackerel, toro (1 per person), young yellowtail, red grouper, and asari rayu, asari being Japanese littleneck clams and rayu being chili-infused sesame oil. The Japanese mackerel was rather salty like regular saba, the toro wasn't substantially better than the blue fin, the young yellowtail and red grouper were similar to regular yellow tail and red snapper, respectively, and the asari rayu was a bit more spicy than I would've tolerated if I'd eaten a full piece (but it does taste pretty good).  I don't recall Goyemon favorites such as spicy tuna rice cracker, sashimi salad, grilled pork belly, and fresh "wasabi" (I'm told it's not actual wasabi, but it's similar) being available at Sushi Mon before, but they were available and at least as good if not better. The pork belly at Goyemon has actually been significantly overcooked almost every time over the past year, but the pork belly in this meal was fatty, juicy, and only slightly overcooked on edges. Some grilled items which I missed from Goyemon are cajun salmon, miso salmon, yellowtail, and super white tuna, but I was more than willing to overlook those after having the best yellowtail collar from either 'Mon. (Salmon collar was also available, and both were 1 per person.)  The standard menu appetizers were also as enjoyable as usual. Dynamite (bay scallop, "crab" filling, onions, cream sauce) and atypically large mussels were great. As for standard nigiri, I enjoyed the super white tuna, hotate (sea scallop), and amaebi as much as I have at Goyemon or other AYCE establishments in town. Uni was slightly subpar, but I've had far more unpalatable experiences at similar spots.  As far as dessert, standard menu green tea was as awesome as usual, although some unusual ice was present around, but not inside. This stuff actually has matcha, unlike some competitors. I also had pineapple sorbet, which is as delicious as you'd expect, and a cream puff, which was enjoyable and packed full of vanilla cream. That's the first time that I've seen those desserts available at a 'Mon.  Wait was about half an hour for Friday night peak dinner. Dress accordingly for the weather if you're not able to come here during off-peak times. Cost for AYCE meals is $19.95 for lunch, $26.95 for dinner. Time limits are written as 45 and 60 minutes respectively, but still aren't really enforced except for special occasions. Most rolls are available in half orders, although I completely ignored rolls this time as I often do.  Sushi Mon remains in my top tier of Las Vegas's AYCE sushi (along with Goyemon and Sushi Koma), but I may be naming it as my new favorite soon enough if I experience enough delicious meals. I do hope to visit more often because it's more convenient for me than Goyemon is (although the latter is still 4.5* at least, so make no mistake about my opinion).

_DXkVIy5ji9iqqK4XkgrAA.text: I enjoy this place. It's small and it's always busy but the food and service is excellent. My favorite is the spicy tuna rolls and the Beef Bowl.

k565swyDM1eBk-tYEeESlA.text: I have been coming here since moving to Vegas.  It's out thanksgiving tradition for the past ten years. They are always busy and always on point.   Some of my favorite things are  The bake 428 Baked green mussels Orion and yeubiu  Alaskan  Fried gyzoa  JJ roll  Fried ice cream and strawberry mochis!!

n38B2gsx-lCTgrKrpjbLRQ.text: I was very pleased with this restaurant.  The food was delicious and the atmosphere was good for conversation.  Servers were attentive and food was a good value.  I'll be back.

byGV_HoYL9YG-mzWgJ3IhA.text: The restaurant is soooo much better now.  Their fishes for nigirI are always fresh and service are impeccable.   Love their specials. Especially when all the specials are included in AYCE.   Their mentaiko, super white tuna seared, and masago with quail eggs are my favorites

hbecf17LD6fC3PgwBkeuTg.text: Favorite sushi place close to home. All you can eat sushi was bomb. Even my take out orders are good.

SUE3crU4dCsYarmnvnZ7QA.text: Came here for their AYCE lunch and had a great time. This was one of the better AYCE sushi joints around henderson. With their reasonable menu prices at 21.95 per person for lunch and 26.95 at dinner time, you can't really go wrong. This place gets really busy so be ready for a wait.  Their sushi was well made with great fish to rice ratios. The food was so good I couldn't really get a good picture we were eating it too fast!  We left here stuffed and got here early enough we beat the crowds. Our waitress was very kind and kept our cups full and orders rolling. I would recommend coming here if you don't mind waiting to eat.

nzCAfxrpfKs9cF1EZ0JWuw.text: This is a great sushi place. Here is my opinion on the rolls I had.  Sushi monster-a tourist roll, bland, don't bother Baked 428- chicken?? Well it's amazing!! Pete's- ok Sunrise- the spicy Cajun albacore makes it very good Andy-bland Calico- wow, really good, the Cajun albacore on top makes it so good No name- above avg Jala jala- bland even with the jalapeno Ecstasy- very good...not orgasmic but very.  The best part of this place is how small & therefore, fast they are, with a great quality food.

QI1XTcxvO9rPlc22UK8EDg.text: Low quality food and service. Not worth the high price tag of all you can eat. I've been to places cheaper than this with top notch customer service and food quality.  We were never introduced to our waiter, had to order from the lady that seated us, after getting our first order and when we were ready to order another round we ended up waiting 30 minutes and the lady we initially ordered from informed us that she is not our waiter.  Soda was watered down, tuna had a odd consistency, and it took forever to order.  Will not be coming here again. There are many other sushi restaurants, I recommend going anywhere else.

84lXfvTPAFn7wjClfZmyfQ.text: back for more food, so happy they went up to an A rating. My confidence is back, so is my business, highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh food, great prices, excellent service, and their rating went from a D to an A, Yahhhh for that!

ARHHBTgJqkeLvmwVMYXhhg.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. I don't know where some of these 'amazing' reviews are coming from. I ordered AYCE and they offer a wide range of selection. The food is good, everything is seasoned well and it tastes great. But the reason why I will not be returning is because there is JUST WAY TOO MUCH RICE and the fish is too thin. When i put the sushi in my mouth, 1/3 of the time I can taste the rice and fish evenly. But for the remaining 2/3 all I am chewing on is rice. It felt like I was downing a bowl of rice with fish flavoring. At my go-to AYCE sushi back home (sake2me-tustin), the size of the fish is 2x the size and rice is 1/2 that of Sushi Mon. I didn't expect it to be at that standard, because that's just how you do ayce sushi business (so the customers don't eat alot), but I thought the amount of rice:fish was ridiculous. I think I ate 1/2 of what I normally eat at an AYCE sushi because I was so full on rice. I glanced over at the next table and saw the rolls. I was glad I didn't order one.. lol I saw the great reviews on here and was excited for it, but I will not be returning... The waitress was really helpful and nice though.

wIfReWg8idg8SWgi6zoV1A.text: Oh my gosh! By far the best Sushi I have had in town! I am not a frequent flier when it comes to Sushi restaurants because I'm not the biggest fan of fish, however, when I went to Sushi Mon I could not get enough of the dishes! How can someone who isn't a fan of fish leave a Sushi restaurant completely stuffed? I tried the menu and simply amazing. Great customer service, amazing food, a must go to if you are looking for Sushi in town

Qva1UjTZ9NU0zsL8Afe4nQ.text: I am embarrassed to say that this is the 2nd time I came and ate here and am just writing a review...I left yet again with a very full and happy belly.  The sushi is always fresh, my favorites are the Andy, the tuna is so fresh and it is a light creamy roll, loving the tuna poke and  the moment and then I order the dynamite for dessert as it is sweet and creamy.  Usually there is await so I suggest take whatever is available, bar or table...and don't be afraid to ask any of the staff for help because they seem to work as a team and that way you aren't ever waiting long for anything.

rBdefGIYN2B4sxQpFfEW_w.text: I used to satisfy my Niku Udon cravings at Shuseki but yesterday being desperate for food, I decided to give Sushi-Mon another try after my last encounter (did AYCE and found a hair in my food lol)   I know last time, the curry dish wasn't too large of a portion and Bun got a tummy ache from the dinner specials we've stayed away for some time but yesterday it being 1am, we wanted actual food.  The Niku Udon sufficed what I was hoping for it to be, the portion was just alright. The broth wasn't bad but over time can leave a funny after taste. $9.95 was my meal before tax and tip.  I'll keep this place in mind when I need food and wouldn't like to drive so far it out - it is less than 5 minute drive from where I live... which means I can definitely walk there lol

OpPArmj2Oe-8U_qZC6CDFQ.text: I never had bad service from here and sadly i did last night. Never once a 5 stars from me dropped to a 1 star. I work in the food industry also so i know how it works. The only way to keep customer coming back is having good food quality and providing excellent experiences for them. We waited almost 10 mins to have anyone to noticed us and sit us.  Only time the server check on us is when he asked for our drinks. Asked for one iced tea and 1 water with lemons came out 2 water with lemons. Hey thats ok. People make mistake.  What upsets me the most is that if we seated at the bar, the reason to sit there is to be served directly from the chef.  We sat there exactly for 10 mins. And no one even acknowledge if us were there. NO HI NO HELLO NO WELCOME but a glare from a mexican chef with his unhappy face. We get it youre busy. But it takes 30 secs to remind customers that you know they are there, and will be right there to help. I wouldnt mind waiting so much.  I wanted to walk out so bad but the bf told me not to since we ordered side dishes already. 10 mins passed, still no help so i had to get the server attention if we could order and he took our orders.  Was going to do all you can eat but we felt so uncomfortable with the place were being so loud, no one seems to want to come check on us or even help us. Also the mexican guy kept glaring and rolling his eyes at us. So we switched it to ala carte and hurried to leave. The Experience werent great at all.

Q0OtDhtQxPTsoXJ58FBaTQ.text: Ok.. this place is OK.. the fish is good and the options of rolls is good but after about 10 visits I have to say the service is consistently hit and miss and just like most other local AYCE spots the rice is overwhelming in the portions. Not bad all around though

F-UuyGDvkJPCkbwRQkw2xQ.text: This has to be one of my worst meals particularly in a Japanese restaurant.  The food was extremely average, but the service was exceedingly poor.  Granted wwalked in at 12 midnight but they are open till 2am.  But throughout our stay there were about 6 employees who were more interested in chatting with each other loudly in Spanish and ignoring us and our needs even when I had to ask for things.  I will not be back obviously given the large number of much better restaurants in Vegas.  Good luck!  The quality of the sushi was mixed.  Some not so good.  Hopefully they will improve.  I think a thorough replacement of the staff is necessary to turn this one around though.

ERq94AWJd6ibTptTRF-xZQ.text: I gave this place a second chance and instantly regretted it. Walked in and waited five minutes to be sat at the sushi bar. There were only four other people in the restaurant!  I felt rushed the entire time. I got there at 12:45 and didn't get any sushi until 1:05. Then they told me last call was at 1:30.  The sushi chef was really rude. He held up his finger like I was an inconvenience when I asked for extra sauce. The sushi tasted ok but it was room temperature and almost warm. The best part of my meal was the fried stuff because I was able to eat it without feeling like I might get sick. I probably won't ever go back and the only reason they got two stars was because the servers were friendly and kept checking on me.

W-VsCTEjB-1keKE6zimASA.text: We were very excited to try Sushi Mon for the first time, many of my co-workers raved about it.  My husband and I decided to give it a try last night. Our server's name was George and from the beginning he seem to have a bit of an attitude he took our order and when he came to give us our plates he sort of tossed them to us, very unprofessional in my opinion we sat there eating for about 45 minutes before he refilled my husband's drink. We were very polite to him figured he was probably having a bad day the other server kept asking if we were ok and if we needed anything, unfortunately we didn't catch his name but left him a nice tip! R2Z6NBtiFqOPnGott0eFwg.text: Best place to come in Vegas for all you can eat!! I love coming here , and the staff is amazing !

v-QiyXM2CyAt6AKSA1BpKQ.text: Would of given 0 stars but Yelp will not let you.  Got sick every time I ate here and I wondered why. Goggle "Dirty Dining  Sushi mon" and you'll know why.

YQDVP1RBm3c-RTK9sT3pOA.text: This is one of two of my go to sushi spots for AYCE with the other being Island Sushi.  This place is great despite the wait that usually accompanies coming here.  The restaurant is very bright due to all of the windows which is really nice and the staff are always happy and attentive.  The food is great and always comes pretty quickly!  I usually come here about once a month with my friends going about twice a month lol.

ieolj7QIS238Z555LWnPCA.text: Fresh food and great service. I love love love this place!  I have never had a bad experience at this Sushi Mon. The staff is kind and welcoming.  The menu is off the chain! Even if you don't like sushi, you can enjoy the hell out of this place. Even the all-you-can-eat menu is worth it for non-sushi eaters!! Price is just above an average going-out meal (based on what you buy) but it is all completely worth it! My favorite roll is the lemon roll & I always "splurge" for some green tea icecream at the end of my meal (seriously, it's like $2).  I'll always enjoy lunch or dinner here with any picky or non picky eater!

JIHgEu3P7Qn34mLAZM63UQ.text: Been a great place!   Never gotten sick and they're open till 2am.   Best advice put in a huge order or you could Wait a while to get things made up.    Good job after many visits sushi mon folk

3-MkfxF5FA17WdcF8hV3mQ.text: Last week I ate here with four friends on friday. Their customer service was great, rolls we ordered came out quick, and they were not bothered by how loud we were.

AXzNWjZP_koiLObL7ogeIQ.text: 2 thumbs up for this place!!!!!!!!!!!!  I saw my fd's pic when she went to vegas and i was told the sushi is GOOD (she's not a sushi lover). So I went there to try in my vegas trip (you know how hard you have to squeeze a quota out from the vegas buffets when you only stay there a few days) Then, I came out with a fat belly with high satisifation =)  1st, their price is reasonable!! only $27 for all-you-can eat with all FRESH sushi!!! You can really tell the freshness of sashimi WORTH every penny you pay!! Unlike other sushi buffet, they give you cheaper fish to maintain their cost, sushi mon has really good sushi (or even better than some Jap rest)!!! The sauce with some sashimi give you a better taste or refreshment! I love their citrus sauce!!!!  2nd, like all buffet, they'll remind you dun waste the food so you have to finish the rice. However, unlike other sushi buffet, their sushi rice is abit smaller than usual so that will give you more room to try other food.   3rd, even though they limit your dining time to 45mins (dinner hours), but that's enough!! Because the chefs made it quick and won't waste your time!!!   4th, all other hot dishes and appetizers are also delicious =)  So combine all these reasons, I went there twice on my 3days vegas trip. I'll definitely go there again when i go vegas =)

Lv6gD8xhtqq5FGIfNbjFPg.text: Love this place! must have the all you can eat for 28$ it's time limited though you have 1 hour but that's enough time. Their rolls are good and love the shumai and the shrimp tempura. The only crappy thing about this place is waiting during busy hours its busy to where you would wait 30-1 hour well worth it though pretty cheap and its all you can eat sushi.

W2MWdi4jjkM4jkyCESudxA.text: The hostess greeted me and I immediately thought his place was gonna have great service. My friend and I were sat very quickly at the sushi bar where we were greeted by our sushi chef who's name I don't remember, but he had these light green eyes you can't miss. He was awesome. The real trouble began after he informed us he was going on break and had a different guy take over. My friend asks for another roll, as the chef begins to make this, the server drops off our checks, right in the middle of our meal. Now I wouldn't be so irritated by that if we were almost finished, but it felt as if we were being rushed to finish. Also my friend was supposed to pay for this meal, somehow they gave us each separate checks, one AYCE and one ale cart. We told them we were BOTH doing AYCE and that it would be ONE check. I was a little annoyed but figured hey must've forgotten or something might have happened, so I brushed it off. The final straw however, was when the checks were dropped off the chef stopped making our rolls and looked at the bills. He then asked us why the checks had been dropped off, and if we were done. When we told him we weren't finished eating and to continue making the roll, he still continued to question us as to if we were finished, asking if we were gonna pay for the rolls he was making, saying "I don't know what's going on." Only after we flagged down a server to change both bills to AYCE, did he continue to make our rolls. The first sushi chef we had was amazing, I'm really sad he had to go on break before we finished our meal. I'm sure this review would've been much better if the second chef hadn't been so rude. I won't be back, but for everyone else who goes and sits at the sushi bar, look for the Hispanic man with the green eyes, like I said he's AWESOME.

OqVw_WhWwOYfj-BeL3zY8w.text: You can't beat Sushi Mons' AYCE selections. Very fresh sushi and great bang for the buck. One of those "melt in your mouth" type of deal. AYCE is $25/ per person.   Be prepared to wait approx 40 minutes to be seated on Friday and Saturday nights though. Even the sushi bar can get really crowded..

akLf_MOK41mSlnhf7dWB5A.text: The sushi quality is really good! Depending on when you go it can be a bit busy but they are normally very quick with getting you in. The service is good and quick and I would recommend it for anyone looking for a good sushi place!

dztPNtyZ4oKERhLtpl8v6w.text: Place is our favorite....the fish is great and the people are cool. Place gets packed in the evenings which is always a good sign.  We have been going weekly for several years and can't say anything bad.   Hiro and Eddie are the best!!!!

lK9sp5_l0AxVE9-WjCU-ag.text: Great place...great service & very close to my home.  The wait was not bad for a Friday night. This is now my new favorite sushi place.

ajSERPfMf9xAf0kWmOeSpg.text: Used to come here EVERY TIME we went to vegas but it's come down a little in my opinion over the years as more people have found about it and frequent this place..  and since they don't take reservations the wait can be long, but usually worth it.   Its all you can eat for around $30, and that includes almost the whole menu.. appetizers, nigiri, rolls, dessert... thats what makes it so great its not just the sushi..   The kicker here is you get 1 order each of Uni, Toro and Ama Ebi, (provided they have it) i always give away my Uni and ama ebi to whoever im with.. not my thing..   there are 2 schools of sushi, THE NEW: rolls with fancy names and this inside and that on top; and THE OLDl: traditional nigiri, rice with fish on top.    if you like rolls this is definitely the place for you, many different types of rolls and you can ask for this, instead of that on top, they don't mind. (just leave a little more tip would ya?)    But if you are a nigiri person, heres the scoop.. Seems like you are only allowed so many servings of the good stuff per person (maybe 3 or 4) then you get the second rate stuff.. heres what i mean.. say you have 2 people.. you order 6 orders of  hamachi.. they come out nice, fresh, white belly part.. yum so good.. you want more?.." 6 more please,," what you will get will not be even close to what you got the first time!  you might get the redder part of the fish or older and kinda dried out.  nothing like the first batch..  So heres what you gotta do.. order 8 or 10 orders the first time.. then move on to the next fish and never return to one that you've already ordered.. the best thing is to take people who order rolls, that way you get to have their portion of the "fresh stuff" while they dine on the rolls!!  bonus!!  (this rule dosent apply to rolls only nigiri, the rolls are always consistent i think)  There are specials too, they are unlimited (not part of the holy trinity of "1 each", uni, toro and ama ebi) there is also a supposed 1 hour time limit but its not strictly enforced (i just leave a bigger tip when i stay longer)  The next question, how does it stack up to Hikari?  The fresh stuff is much better than Hikari, the 2nd round stuff is not.  You can't order just sashimi (no rice) here only nigiri.  Pros: Freshest AYCE made to order sushi "first round only"  Cons: Uni, Ama ebi, and toro, 1 order only, 2nd round of nigiri is lacking (but understandable why they have to do it to get rid of product and not be cleaned out)   The fine print: you have to eat every thing that you order, or you have to pay for what you don't eat on top of your AYCE price..   Tips: Get there before opening to avoid long wait times.  check specials board on the back wall.. if they have Moi (pacific thread fin) get it!!  that is the bomb!!  if you order Ama Ebi, ask them to fry the heads for you.. its like eating a potato chip but shrimp flavored.. to get the most for you money.. avoid fillers and fried stuff in the beginning they fill you up faster save them for the final rounds.  avoid the tako poke, its not sliced tako its idakko (whole small tako), more rubbery and chewy, nothing like Hawaiian style tako poke.   Verdict: it teeters at 3 1/2 stars but if you follow the 10 step nigiri program i've laid out it could be a 4 star deal.

ejpKONlqjVZvHPXq9oQ2tA.text: Waited for about an hour because we had a large party, but the food (all-you-can-eat) came out really fast.  There was a lot to choose from on the menu and their desserts (especially the strawberry mochi) was so good. The downside really was just the wait and their suggestions of the new sushi rolls which did not taste good.

n2fCBH4UwThRLLA3RqxEhQ.text: The service was excellent, despite the fact that they were packed on a Tuesday night.  We sat at the sushi bar... where the sushi chef's were extremely nice, as well as entertaining. We got the all-you-can-eat for $27.  The sushi rolls were creative, amazing, and all of the ingredients were as fresh as they come. The strawberry mocchi is a delicious way to top of an excellent meal.

maAU1hc7NxAkLQslX6EpAg.text: One of my favorites of my AYCE Asian Vegas tour.  The staff was friendly, the sushi chef was nice, and the place was very clean and packed with people for a weekday.  They have a wide selection of rolls, but I mainly stick with sushi so I can not comment on them.  The day I was there they had salmon belly, oh my!! There is also a selection of kitchen items that can be ordered from the waitress.   If you go, save room for the tempura ice cream, it comes with the AYCE and is my favorite of the desserts from my trip.

nwc_yZHrtFn4s5mya2GycA.text: This place seems to be super packed all the time- which means the service is rushed with everyone snappy and out of breath. Sushi is good. Once, there was a hair in one roll and after informing our waitress, she apologized and brought back a bowl of tempura ice cream after the bill...which was cool. Because it's super packed, you are jam packed with other people like a can of sardines so it tends to get noisy.

hb0TLoyAqalpyRcUSsp60Q.text: What's that? All you can eat sushi? SIGN ME UP. Coming from Rhode Island, then living in San Diego for years, of course I was hesitant about sushi in a desert. WRONG. It was absolutely AMAZING. Being the little adventurer I am, I of course ordered the usual favorites, but then started venturing off and trying things I wouldn't have tried in a million years. Was not disappointed by a single. one. absolutely stellar food.

2F9wZo489tailIKyEv5Nbg.text: OMG, all you can eat sushi for $28!! And I'm not talking about the nasty Todai or buffet style stuff! This place has a full menu of sushi, sashimi, rolls, appetizers, and desserts that you can order endless amounts of if you choose to do their all you can eat option. Otherwise, the rolls will cost you $4 to $9 each. You can also do half orders of each roll so that you get more variety! Of course, you need to finish everything or be charged for the price of that plate. Not like anyone would waste good sushi, right?! I've never been so full in my life!   My favorite roll here was the deep fried philadelphia roll...mmm. I think I ate 3 full orders of various deep fried rolls that night! Another thing to try here is the fried shrimp heads! I didn't think I would like them, but they are delicious! Crispy and flavorful :) The desserts here are good too...I had the strawberry mochi and lychee sorbet.  Word of advice...it's probably not a good idea to do an all-you-can-eat dinner less than a few hours before you go out clubbing and binge drinking. I'll be coming here for lunch next time!

8WSsijHDgiksfhdBALgetw.text: Uni was great  Sweet shrimp was impressive  Pixie roll - the soft shelf crab ROCKED  Poke was good  Collar was very smooth in texture and yum   Don't really remember what else I ordered but they were pretty good in general.... The only downside was the food came kind of slow because it was pretty busy that day even when we were dinning at 3pm.

O3JEr0T3QZ96DQw5qn5gYQ.text: First off, it's hard to compare this place with other sushi joints local to Las Vegas because I am technically a Southern Cali girl. But Overall, I did have a good experience at this place.   Some friends and I were running some last minute errands in Las Vegas and we were way off the strip to take care of them. We were also quite hungry and just looking for some decent food we saw along the way. It was either Sushi or Greek. Everyone felt like Sushi so as soon as I saw a decent Sushi place, I said "let's go to THAT one!".   So we parked and headed inside. This place is TINY as heck. We luckily got seated fast but then a line started to form immediately after us. We definitely lucked out! I can only imagine how long you must have to wait to be seated when there are so few seats in this joint.  The service was not bad. But they did forget TWO of our orders. But the sushi was very good. We didn't opt for the All You Can Eat because there's no way I could eat $27 worth of sushi all by myself. I wasn't THAT hungry. I instead just ordered 2 rolls which came out to less than $15 total and I was a happy camper. The rolls were delicious and satisfying.   This place is busy and seems very popular among all. It must be a rare good sushi place in Vegas and so that's why everyone comes here. In my personal opinion, it's very hard to find good Asian food in Vegas. I have not been very impressed but this place is the first to semi impress me. I would actually come back again if I felt like driving off the strip for some sushi.

KP3xamCC0n_5ApOV_mtEiw.text: Off the strip, but worth the drive.  Went for lunch and ordered the AYCE sushi.  Everything on the sushi menu was AYCE including appetizers and desserts.  Service was also top notch!

K0LLaHoHKsHiHd2FGkhyYA.text: Excellent, high quality, fresh sushi. Good variety of sushi choices. Very friendly staff.

_X6i_2W8ftWHrz9ixp5GGg.text: My favorite Sushi restaurant in Vegas so far.  They have an ALCE option which is usually the best way to go.  **if you order a la carte and  decide to spend more than the $28 AYCE price, they will let you just pay that flat fee and go to town!!! sunrise roll and seared tuna nagiri are my faves!

h9-rJ_RmbHE72ZHxrJB-TQ.text: One of the few sushi restaurants worth a short wait. The food is always fabulous and the service is attentive.

2O_nSJeQlT6n_4TG5urN_A.text: Always have a good meal here at Sushi-Mon.  They have a good price for their All You Can Eat deals and also have a frequent eaters card for a free all you can eat after so many visits.  Sushi has a great taste to it and they have a good variety.  Service is always good when I go in and the sushi chefs always recognize me and my girlfiend when we go in.

OK-cK_GRlT5I-kJGHaZL9Q.text: This place is going down, food still good but service is horrible. They say they close at 2:00 am, I got there yesterday at 1:01 and they didn't let me do the all you can eat, and the guy at the door told me an my friend, either Allan carte or leave. We couldn't believe it. Awesome costumer service. We will never come back.

Oh9Y5lO5kvEj-kK_4-gH2g.text: Such good food! And really good service! The all you can eat is probably one of the tops in town! The service is really good and their desserts are bomb. It's a pretty long wait for a table on the weekends around "the dinner rush" though, so just call ahead in case. I could LIVE on their baked mussels.

9YrP4oPSXB0mLhdMwwFpjA.text: I love Sushi Mon!! I go there every time I want all you can eat sushi.  This place is always busy!! But of course I never mind the wait, its well worth it! They have very fresh sushi and a huge selection to choose from! I love sitting at the Sushi Bar and interacting with their Sushi Chefs.  The best part is, when you get all you can eat, there is a huge menu of not only sushi but other dishes you can have along with desert.  I love the mochi balls.   My fav is the strawberry.  For $25 a person, you can't go wrong! Sake Bombs!! Sake Bombs!!  :)  If you don't feel like all you can eat, they do have a very reasonably priced sushi menu!! YUMMMMY!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wzueHsgstDNwwSERQJKnMA.text: I LOVED this place. I would rate it 4.5! We had a party of 11, so the wait was long (approx an hr!) and the place is small. The sushi tasted fresh, just the way I like it! Some of the rolls I didn't really like, but some were delicious! Great service as well! For an AYCE sushi place, I'm impressed!

Nv5jxY8M0C7lJZ8C4ozobA.text: sushi mon you are consistently delicious! always busy but regaurdless always great service and food. My only complaint is that SOME sushi chefs go heavy on the rice. Other than that everything is great, i love how its open late so i can enjoy after a night of drinking. Price is very reasonable!!!

IhF2QBOT9WQrH-ZBwGJ-eg.text: All you can eat sushi, but the catch is that you can only order three dishes (per person) at a time, and finish before you are able to order another round.

x4ZtGuQciqpyuWHND2I-ZA.text: The price has stayed the same, but the nigiri has way too much rice compared to before and the slices of sashimi is a bit smaller.  This is why I am dropping a star on the rating.  Other places like Yama and Oyshi has a better sashimi to rice ratio if you ask me.  They seem to not carry Toro anymore and I have not had the super white tuna there in awhile now.  They are definitely cutting back on the special sashimi with the down economy.

yRU-DC8eZYjzbfzFGcVybA.text: What can i say... Other than.. Be prepared to leave in a self inflicted Sushi and wasabi Coma... $28 for the all you can eat buffet, Made as you order, this is not the pre made sushi sitting on a tray on a bed of ice. THis is legit, you order they roll and you eat. You can also order sides like teriyaki chicken and the other normal items. I am a sushi lover so i say bring it on.. You roll it, ill eat it.... The word Roll seems to be coming up alot in this review, maybe because when your done eating this is exaclty what you will be doing......Rolling out the door. Thumbs up to Shushi mon. Be prepared for a wait, the building holds about 60 people or so and it fills up nightly.

EV-quBPXVu71kCVBWZCZjQ.text: The sushi quality is fantastic--I can't believe that it's AYCE. And you can get one order of uni, sweet sushi, and some of the other pricey sushi that they have on special. Frequently, you can't see the rice at all underneath the nigiri because the large planks of fish cover the rice entirely. Definitely worth driving away from the strip for.

cU4OY46Pzy6VGzwluqA5uA.text: One of my first all you can eat sushi joint I use to go to all the time. Now and days I go to other places. Wondering if their still good?

Z2hcItGDw2SSt_3nYj3_Sg.text: The prospect of indulging in all-you-can-eat sushi is similar to weighing having sex with a person who's obviously taking it around to everyone like it was a church donation jar: you're probably going to enjoy yourself, but it's surely not going to be the best experience of its kind, you're not going to feel good about yourself afterwards, and you may hours later fear you've contracted something awful. In this context, Mon Sushi is still a whore, but one with a killer body, great technique and a vigilant prophylactic policy. I have no regrets besides the two pounds of rice-filler weight gain - score one for the whores?

QWjmFK_159b0YjvRfB96vw.text: This is my FAVorite sushi place in town..I've been to like 8 other places.. Get the Durango roll and share my experience please.. the sushi chefs are friendly and funny when you sit at the bar.. idk who's buying that all-you-can-eat though :/ please go here, these guys make great sushi and deserve your $$$

o4f9_VUsHTIGSj0fBWdfHA.text: My wife and I love sushi.  We have been to several Sushi restaurants and sushi buffets in Las Vegas and Henderson.  Personally, I think Sushi Mon is the best - however, it is one of the most expensive.  The only knock on them is: a.  $27 price tag per head - ouch -- pretty pricey.  Most sushi buffets run around 20-24 bucks.  If you look around, you can get some under 20 too...  If they lower their weekly prices, they probably get more customers.  b.  1 hour time limit on dinner -- early in the meal, rather than enjoying the meal, I found myself "clock" watching.  But, actually, this was not bad, after 45 minutes, I was ready to be rolled out in a wheel barrow.  I was stuffed and felt like I was going to give birth. Being a guy, this probably would be my 15 minutes of fame on CNN. c.  You may have to wait 20-40 minutes.  By the way, problem with waiting is that there is NO waiting area.  The street is it.    We have been here 3 times already.  Unfortunately, they do not take reservations.. Be ready to wait in line.  The first time we were here, we had to wait 45 minutes (ended up shopping at Smith's grocery store to past the time).  Secondly, I would recommend asking to be seated at the BAR.  When they seat you at the table, they give you this menu and you have to hail down a waiter.  I rather sit at the bar and watched the "sushi guys" make the sushi.  Also, you get quicker service instead of waving down a waiter.  You can ask the sushi guy directly to make you the roll.  As for the sushi, it was fresh!  We love the cooked eel, salmon, and yellowtail.  yum... definitely, we will be back!

JsAx5gC5bliEwBCeU3B43g.text: I am a long time Sushi Mon patron and I am pissed! Sushi Mon used to be high quality sushi at an all u can eat price. Now it is LOW quality sushi at a very high all u can eat price. I moved from Vegas a few years ago but come back to eat every time I am in town until now. The year 2010 I ate at Sushi Mon on four different occasions and the quality was worse every time. It seemed to be even worse during lunch time. Do your-self and your waistline as well a favor and go sit down in a relaxing environment elsewhere and get some great fish.

VJWsh9FOyh00Ss1nY2U0mw.text: Great price, and great service! Sometimes at AYCE places, the waiters have attitudes because of the large orders, but here, it seems they really want you to eat all you can, if you are not being wasteful. They are happy to have you try everything on the menu, and recommend half orders so you can fit everything in. They even have some "good stuff" that are not on the menu of AYCE places, like toro.

aQmY86irUhvl7PjqrrlNAw.text: Ive had Sushimon 2 times now and both times have been very good. They have an all you can eat dinner there that is VERY much worth the quality of sushi that you get. in addition the atmosphere is pretty light and fun and there is the cutest older woman who works there who provides excellent service. it's pretty damn yummy. I'm a fan :).

e2qHmXajg74K4ZsHAGYA4w.text: If you like sushi rolls you will love Sushi Mon. This place has a huge selection of rolls that leave you spoiled for choice (make sure to choose at least one that has "yum-yum" sauce). The mochi ice cream is great too.

7mRmI6x9teb82jyCvaRS_A.text: I really don't get why people like this place so much. i go all the time because it's near my house but there are like 5 others in a 2 mile radius that serves all you can eat and is way better.  For awhile I thought the staff was kind of rude. I don't need them looking over my shoulder to see if my half bite of my friend's sushi roll is breaking their "no sharing" rule. Dang, I just want to try so I know whether or not to order. I recommend I love Sushi or Kaizen Sushi (more expensive though). They're close and off Eastern.

00BRmJA5US7skAaRCmitkg.text: They have stupid rules about combining tables, instead they let us wait and let everyone who came after us sit!

RPm0bLn1mQoNhvYDUsgmVw.text: On a Saturday night this place was packed and busy but the service was prompt. We sat at the bar and the orders we made arrived in a reasonable amount of time. Was a shift change but both of the chefs were friendly and made some good suggestions. Overall an excellent dinner. The baked green mussels are to die for.

zeo8IkyzrC4qx4SKf5L_qA.text: This place is amazing. Usually has great staff and sweet service for when I am there.  I've become friends with the waiters because I am a regular here. The place closes at 2am and will accept late munchers until 1am, which for me, is such a great thing!   The food is great in my opinion. I often order nigiris (salmon belly, yellowtail belly, etc) and boy, they are just so buttery and creamy in my tummy! They are often given to you as fast as they can because this place can get quite busy.  Food taste: 4 of 5 Ambiance: 4 of 5 Staff Attitude: 4.5 of 5  The only thing I really hate about Sushi Mon is that it is so cramped, which means longer wait for you and your party of however many to get seated. Often, party of 2 gets seated quite fast, but anything over 4 just gets ridiculous from waiting 40 mins to 1 hour. So, be prepared to wait and mingle around Smith's, Dollar Tree, or Toyko Discount before you get seated.

IHcHQKuTA-AdFyfESJlHmg.text: As a regular (ate here well over 20 times) I would say this place is a hit or miss. On a busy night i would skip this place altogether.  While the raw scallops the best I have had for an all you can eat place the service is just horrible. On their slower nights the service is wonderful and the food is equally great. I dislike how rude the host/cashier person can be. I get it 'you have a high volume of people in that small restaurant' BUT that does not justify treating your paying guests like a burden. I will say the food is pretty tasty and for what you pay it's worth it. Service needs improvement regardless. Go check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

XEI3OOpKE-cZsYmTBn-ePw.text: 1 year ago I was really craving sushi and my personal trainer recommended this place. I'm serious when I say that you can't go wrong with this place, especially with the "all you can eat" deal. Almost every weekend I have to eat sushi and this is the best in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heaven!!

Ah7HYaaLfR8BnadwQsE9KA.text: I would call myself a regular here, not just because it's in my area but because I know what to expect every time. The fish quality is always up to par. The service is pretty good, depending on how busy it is. The wait could get long when sitting at a table, so I would recommend sitting at the sushi bar for quicker service. The price for AYCE (all you can eat) sushi is reasonable, as long as I get my mochi dessert at the end I'm a happy camper. Definitely a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2XynzxGIStpEGaPEl3kG4g.text: terrible customer service!!! ever!!! They do not care about your business at all, because they are very busy. Even the owner is rude, how can the waiter can be take care the customer.  the food was great, how ever, It does not worth it to make make upset after a meal!!! never come back again. So bad lost a favor sushi place.

c4XMmaxfne27V5OsDKDTQg.text: I love coming here.  I enjoy the options and that I can try whatever I want for the one flat price.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Achichi Roll- Hot like most people have never had. ..wow!

8vRuk2zaQKnhSms6kwiLsQ.text: Not that good at all. All the rolls tasted the Same and nothing out of the norm. Quality of fish is not that fresh.Service is okay.

3LbTSOIlVLBFk6NKw79sjg.text: There are so many places to choose an all you can eat sushi restaurant in Las Vegas/Henderson...the best I have tried so far has been Sushi-Mon!    Every time my family members visit Vegas, that have to get a fix of Sushi Mon.    Why is it that they crave this particular restaurant?    *their awesome and fresh quality? *their quick service and friendly staff?  *their myriad selection of delicious sushi combination and original master pieces?  *great price? *not only do you get to choose from a extended selection of delicious sushi, you also have the option of ordering appetizers including gyoza, seasame chicken, miso soup, shrimp and vegetable tempura, hamachi kama...do I need to say more?    What I love about this place also is that the sushi to rice ratio is just right!  (meaning they are not cheap and do not overload their sushi rolls with rice) haha.    One of my pet-peeves regarding sushi is the rice quality and boy does Sushi Mon meet my standards.    My opinion, check this place out!    Don't forget to save room for dessert! =)

DH-wAPndcDCPIsZd-NA-kA.text: Great place! Nice staffs! Love the screaming orgasm so much! As it was recommended by the chef when i explained what i was craving for.

QAlGArRVCXHLPpyDhZR9kw.text: this place used to be the bomb, great service great food, and a ridiculously long wait during peak hours. I really liked the waiting system where they text you and let you know how long your wait is and when your table is ready that way you can go hang out at starbucks nextdoor or run some errands. The last time I was there with the husband, there was no more waitlist texting system and we waited 3 hours for a party of 2 when the hostess originally said only 45 minutes and they would call us when our table was ready. Came back after 2 hours as we waited in the car because it was so cold and windy outside and the outdoor heaters were broken or turned off. I thought they had the wrong number to contact me, but nope. I told the hostess that they weren't on, she just said, "oh, ok." anyways, after a 2 hr wait in the car in the cold, the hostess told us it would be only another 45 minutes. Waited another hour and finally left and went to Sushi Koma. It has been 3 weeks and I am still waiting for a phone call to tell us our table is ready at Sushi Mon.   I had also gone to Goyemon (a sushi mon related joint) about a week ago and they still had the texting waitlist system which worked perfectly. Not sure what is happening at sushi mon on maryland.

pS-bIcEaDnv5K-2yF8myqA.text: Mediocre sushi. House salad is extremely salty, teriyaki chicken is dry, and the sushi doesn't "WOW" me. A plus side is that their lunch specials are great sized portions for not so great sized prices, but you compromise with the quality. Sashimi doesn't appear to be fresh. Potato salad tastes like nothing... is it supposed to be a palate cleanser? Tempura tastes fine, but the onion is impossible to eat and the sauce is extremely salty, overpowering the tempura. Staff is nice, we got free oranges. yay.

4xUTYoKyrpirQa3qW02bFw.text: Hrm... Have to update my review as I'm not sure how I feel about this place anymore...   Between  November 2015 and now (January 2016) my boyfriend and I have gotten AYCE here about 5 times. Our last two times were not as great as the first three, so we will probably be finding a new sushi place ):   Our first bad experience - We came with our friends in the middle of the day and sat at a table instead of the sushi bar like we usually do. The service was slower, some of the rolls tasted a little different than usual, however, overall, still a good experience! Until they brought the check out before they even brought out our friends ice creams. We reminded them that we only received half of the desserts we ordered, so they cashed us out and then brought the ice cream. OK, no harm, no foul. My boyfriend and I had finished our ice cream and our friends were still finishing theirs and drinking their hot green tea. However, since we had payed at this point, they asked us to leave so they could "get the table ready for the next guest" (!!) I was a little disappointed by this as we already felt rushed when they brought the check out before the dessert. Not to mention there was not a long wait at this point (only one family who had just walked in, and clearly we were about to be finished and leave, just finishing up drinks), and we would have gladly moved to the bar while our friends finished their teas and then left. The whole situation just felt rude and I was disappointed that we had raved about this place to our friends, asked them to come here with us, only for us to get kicked out at the end of our meal! It was pretty rude and we wouldn't have tipped so well if we knew they were going to treat us like that...  While that left a pretty bad taste in my mouth, we decided it was probably just a fluke on the hosts part and wanted to give this place another try, especially since we have never had bad service before! So we came around noon and went to the bar like usual, the place was already pretty full this time, even though they just opened. The usual sushi chef we have (I forget his name, but he is hispanic, very friendly man and super good at his job!) was not here this day. The chef we got was super slow and the rolls didn't taste the same as usual (fish wasn't as fresh maybe? or chef used different ingredients? I'm not sure). He also wasn't very personable, whereas the other chef was always saying hello, asking how you liked the roll, and cracking jokes! It wasn't all on the sushi chef, though, because our edamame came out from the kitchen burnt! The server, nonetheless, plopped it down in front of us. Even the nigiri tasted different, and sub-par, which is usually so fresh and my favorite thing here!  I will probably give this place one last try, however I don't have high hopes after my last two experiences here. Looks like we will just have to find a new sushi spot. /:  TL;DR - Used to love this place, last two experiences have not been as great. Check came before dessert so we were rushed through it, then asked to leave to 'clear the table for the next guest' even though our friends were still finishing up. Gave it one more shot and sushi wasn't fresh, edamame came out burnt, and food was just all-around sub-par.

sx4UDUB4cd_ppgtDFJOonQ.text: Although famed for their AYCE sushi specials of which I did not partake, Sushi Mon has solidly well valued, if not great, Japanese food.  This corner shop is more on the "suburban" outskirts of Las Vegas and is in a shopping plaza.  In short, I got a teriyaki lunch special for 6 bucks and it was quite filling with its large bento box full of servings of chicken, rice, tempura, salmon sashimi, gyoza, and the additional (and obligatory) bowls of salad and miso soup. I guess the only minor gripes I had were that the soup was lukewarm, the salad was drenched in dressing, and the salmon was dry. But for the amount of food I got for the money, there's not much else bad to say.

ZK0gLM0VVCQquyyB94ijDw.text: This place was great for an ayce. The rolls were great and the hurricane roll was just what I was craving. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that the wait times are long to get in ( which yes I understand will be an issue at any good restaurant) and the service was ok. It took a while to get our food and then a long wait for our check. I would definitely go back just not on Fridays or Saturdays.

3jqNpJo3qg9dDAPpfuEDyg.text: One of the best sushi experiences of my life. I started to get adventurous with the menu and the sushi chef offered small tastes of things to me, instead of whole rolls or plates.
