cMfr4rlbfuBf98Kshoza7w.text: Been going here for years, staff knows us and treats us very well. I seem to go here at least once a week or once every other week. Usually order togo but it tastes as good as if I were to dine in which is hard to find with sushi.

H7ig5GKHvwpq6QxrqZAqmg.text: MY all time favorite all you can eat sushi spot since I've moved to vegas!  I mean its always busy! It's open till 2am so its usually crackalackin!  Through the years I've noticed they have gotten faster with bringing out the food.    A very famous spot amongst local hawaii peeps! People visiting from Hawaii come here.  We bring our friends here!  I have too many favorite rolls to list.    Just get there with enough time to wait for a table = 0)

qhNbFG_pUQ7WdJGr80MsRg.text: BEST AYCE sushi in Vegas. Not fancy (save that for the over priced hotel sushi  joints), but fresher and actually more fun!  Fresh fresh fresh fish. Cant wait to go back.

nxALYoeRo0kRtaFG3SIKtg.text: Pretty good sushi here. Service is friendly.  AYCE.  I'd avoid all the baked stuff because it is pretty heavy.  Well, if you want to try something, order a half portion.  Other than that, can't go wrong here.  Like everybody else is saying, it's good!  Appetizers and dessert included!  I'll be looking forward to coming back here again next time we're in Vegas.

_i3tXKDj7KZ8eRYdHHQt3g.text: Sushi Mon is a real gem! It's far enough from the Strip that I doubt most tourists will ever hear about it, but I'm really glad I asked Yelp (and my local friend) where to eat sushi on a Friday night.  Sushi Mon does ACYE sushi (all-you-can-eat) the only way you can -- by ordering off a very extensive menu, and ordering more rolls whenever something catches your eye or when you realize you're still hungry. (No stale rolls under buffet glass here!) This only works if the restaurant has great service, and luckily, the wait staff is very prompt here.  If they still have it on the specials menu, you have to try the pastel roll. Unhealthy, for sure, but oh so yummy.  The only drawback was waiting for 45+ minutes for our table on a Friday night. In their defense, we were a pretty big group. We ended up killing time by stocking up on snacks and toiletries at the Smith's across the parking lot.

BLWVwYuKOIIDOzWwrCbidQ.text: My buddy and I did the AYCE thing. We were extremely pleased with the quality and taste of every roll and nigiri sushi that we ordered. Their 9-1-1 spicy tuna roll is no joke--wonderfully SPICY!!! To finish up, we ordered the Yebisu and Ecstasy rolls. Let's call it a happy ending! We agreed that these may have been the best two rolls that we have ever eaten. The garlic in the Yebisu was definitely not subtle, and the "orgasm" sauce on the Ecstasy roll, well, we don't know what it is, but it is delightfully sinful!  We sat at the bar, and were very impressed with the great speed at which these amazing rolls were produced after we ordered each. Not only will we be back here again, we will be dragging out-of-town visitors with us!

EP2UUoh_qLn_cQxx1pImRw.text: Fantastic sushi and good service.  All you can eat for a reasonable price is hard to beat.  We've been a couple times and have always had a great time.  Sitting at the bar we can talk with the chef to quickly get whatever we want.  It is a smaller restaurant and can have a long wait so plan accordingly.

ZXop1ZcqI2H0nZ-Q3-oA0w.text: i love piggin out , me and bae went here and we got STUFFED! so delish!

aHtk-A1W12DGChC880UVFA.text: iono about you TODAI, but this place has the best AYCE sushi   the first time i came here when i was in vegas, i was too hungover so i didnt have room in my stomach for AYCE so i just ordered 2 rolls special of my choice out of their selection and it was last then $10. i dont remember what i got but i all i know is that the rolls i got were fresh and comforting  so..for the REAL review..came back to this place last weekend..yes another trip to VEGAS! i feel like its my 2nd home alreadyyy  i was ready for the $25 AYCE sushi..started off with salmon collar and tuna poki salad! amazing!! u HAVE to get the salmon collar..i also tried the mussels, gyoza, and the seaweed salad, all awesome!  then i had sunrise roll, baked 428 (chicken teryaki inside a sushi?!)  flying jason roll, baked dynamite roll, tried the quail egg shot, halibut nigiri, salmon nigiri, and the Jala Jala roll...im sure theres more but when i remember, ill update  for dessert, green tea and strawberry mochi ice cream, lychee sorbet (YUM) and then to finish it off, tempura ice creamm!!!  you can have it all, just for $25...and this place opens til 2 AM WAHH

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. quail egg
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. snowcrab
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. halibut and sea urchin

H5IwNv0K_GvT8E6zJMETvQ.text: This is one of my favorite sushi places! Some of the best in town for sure. The only downfall is the restaurant is small & a little uncomfortable.

bm41dY5CM1LwWigyj4d13A.text: You can't beat quality AYCE sushi for $27!  Come hungry. While Sushi Mon is a tiny little place, it's always busy. Their fish is good quality and they're very accomodating if you have a special order. Their service is attentive and their chefs at the bar are helpful. I'm not the kind of person that like to talk to chit-chat with the chefs much because I don't enjoy the in-your-face type of dining, but they are clearly BUSY.  I love that the appetizers are included in the AYCE price and my favorite are the baked mussels..very rich though. They have a more extensive menu (than the one at the Sahara location) with a great variety of rolls as well as nigiri so they have something for everyone.

DDF3kD6-TgqukxjhK9uyUQ.text: This is my favorite sushi place in the world. The first time I was there they had Toro on the all u can eat, and they still do every once in a while...Toros is $12 an order usually! Hell of a deal.   Now the problem with most all you can swallow sushi places is that every roll is on top of a cali roll, the lamest roll ever. Sushi Mon is not that way! I recommend you get a Sunrise, Jala Jala, JJ, Moon, and the sweet shrip upon sitting down. Also the sweet shrimp heads! DELICIOUS!!!!   Also if you like Ponzu sauce, and if don't I hope you have nightmares, you'll love the Albacore, Garlic Tuna, and Yellowtail Collar. That right there should be enough for ya.   Realize also get your Miso soup (if don't finish it you can hid rice in it...shhhh!) And some steamed gyoza. Because you have too!

I4rLQJhlVGr6lH6tQQv9jQ.text: Excellent AYCE Sushi. I love the Lemon Roll.

6Mcio_2lQu6K8Wuc3-fl2g.text: I like this place because their fish is pretty fresh compare to other AYCE. It's alway busy there and so I get to wait many times but its worth it. Will come back for hot sake and my favorite uni.

d6cjjargfREEQ2Tdc2i_4A.text: Mm. Sushi Mon! All you can eat, about $27 if I can recall correctly.   This all you can eat includes the entire menu appetizers, all rolls, and desserts. So prepare to gorge.  They are open till 2am like a lot of sushi joints in town, but AYCE ends at 1am...   They have a bunch of rolls here... "regular," specialty, baked, and tempura. Also a pretty good selection of sashimi. Yummm. And you can't ever leave Sushi Mon... no matter how much food you've stuffed yourself without Mochi and/or green tea ice cream!  What makes this place different is that the chefs remember you! It is always nice to be remembered and greeted by a restaurant that serves so many people.

ysEIGEokSBxHPd8kiW_KzA.text: Love this place.  Been going there since 2003.  Best all you can eat sushi in town. My favorite are the baked mussels. Make sure you order what you can eat.  Sometimes Toro is on the special menu. I highly recommend it.  Also plan on waiting a little bit. This spot is hot. They have a texting system. They told me 45 minutes. I left than came back when I was texted. Sweet.

TApfYGEob-wXkNkd1dkXxw.text: By far my favorite sushi place in Vegas. Great date night spot without breaking the bank. Highly recommend.

mvvhHySzAcSJ0sxH5ddy_Q.text: Honestly, the other reviewers are right when they say there is a long wait around peak hours such as dinner time, which is expected. All you can eat sushi at good places normally have a wait.   The quality of the fish: I'd have to say this place can be a hit or miss. I've been here numerous times and I've maybe had one or two times where I've felt that the quality was a little sub par, but to say that 80% of the time it tastes really fresh is a good sign for an AYCE sushi place.  The service:  90% of the time, great service! I usually sit at the bar and the chefs are very attentive and fun! They Get your rolls out at a fast pace and if they have time, they usually converse with their bar guests!   TIP: The only thing that may confuse people is that when sitting at the bar, know that all appetizers & desserts or drinks are ordered with the servers and all the rolls, nigiri, and any sushi are ordered through the sushi chef at the bar! :)

iVFfiPf1fmT7upPOKY9qfQ.text: Having a sushi roll named after me is an automatic 4 stars!!  Come on now, a Cynthia roll!?! My goodness. That NEVER happens!! =D  But besides that, I'm glad there's a sushi place located on this side of town that is opened pretty late. It's good for those late night sushi fix and you don't have to go all the way to the busy Chinatown area.  Aside for the Cynthia roll, we order a couple others and they were all delicious. Each order came with 8 pieces.   Cannot justify giving Sushi Mon the full 5 stars because 1. it's a bit pricey if you are planning to order a la carte. I'm a  very small eater...I love trying different sushi rolls but I just CANNOT, will not get AYCE because it won't be worth the price for me. So ordering a la carte, you're looking at $10-14 per order. Also, the place is pretty small which means tables are fairly close to each other. Not a big fan of that...I really don't want the table next to me to hear my mildly-inappropriate conversations to my significant other. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A sushi roll named after me?!?

Y52DcY2twp9Ebo9ak3p3Nw.text: Very rude! Kicked us out because our 4 year old doesnt eat sushi or anything on their menu so we got him a happy meal to eat while we could enjoy a meal together and be able to eat sushi. Kabuki had no problem with it and that is where our future sushi outings are going from now on. I also have a facebook mom group of over 1400 moms and plan to share this story and a kid friendly alternative to here.

Xhf5wvDwLZ8wuQFoXNEvSg.text: Visiting Nevada and stumbled upon this spot. There was a 45 minute wait for 4 on a Sunday night at 7. We barely waited 25 minutes and it was worth it! $27 all you can eat dinner. The fried calamari was the show stealer, definitely try it. The Pixie roll was delicious and the gyozas were pan fried heaven. Ate a healthy serving of sashimi and it was all fresh and tasty. Servers were attentive and food was great! Perfect spot for our last dinner in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing calamari!!

zKdX4tBIbADG0yfzbtRgBQ.text: We sat down around 12:40 when the waitress sat us down, it took about another 5 minutes to get water and order our food I receive my food in about another 5 minutes so at 12:50 I got my food but the waitress forgot my other orders for my friend and we patiently waited for a while till we asked someone when it would come out. They said they would make it as soon as possible but the cooks just started watching while we waited. Then Zach came Over and apologized and gave us our food, I'm really disappointed with our waitress and the cooks for wasting our time.

a1KRdOikAqA5jZ9Xln_Bnw.text: I brought my boys (3 teenagers) here for lunch last week and we were pleased.  Everything was pretty good and tasted fresh.  Our servers were attentive and pleasant. We ordered some sashimi, a few basic rolls, and some of thier specialty rolls.  They allowed us to modify (one of my boys doesn't do avocado) without any issue. We went on a Thursday afternoon, around 3pm and there was no wait.

p3gX33_ZjofXIlTbLCmUCQ.text: Great All You Can for my afterhours sushi craving.  Nice place to check out when all the other sushi bars are closed. Open till 2am.

They help you out if you're not familiar with the menu and are very patient. I would Definitely come back if I'm back on this side of town. Looking for amazing sushi? Come here!

If you do plan to eat here request not to have the server Jefferey. And to the manager of this place please talk to Jeffrey and teach him how to provide good customer service. If he has a problem with the customers be PROFESSIONAL and not to show some attitude especially  use of foul language to paying customers. Definitely not a place you want eat at. Had the worst service, food was NOT even good and Manager is not available when needed.

z56vYS3K1Q4dY8UzCiYh-Q.text: We ordered two dinner special and fired shumai..Quick and taste good.. Price reasonable. Service also good. Will come back.

bcu1XSXEQW70px2--OYlgQ.text: Excellent food and service. We had a delightful experience. The all you can eat sushi was full of great rolls. We will definitely be coming back here in the future.

ReDkN4X18f4hwWYJvAebRA.text: I use to visit weekly.   Average Sushi, poor service, and inconsistent quality.   Do not recommend visiting on the weekends. Wait time is not worth it.

t1sjcZuHYPeppyLypFfCXg.text: Love this sushi joint. AYCE for $26 really worth it with the fact the food is so fresh. I personally love their tako (octopus) roll. So yummy. Service was quick. Prepare to wait if it's busy but they do have seats outdoor while you wait for your table. Definitely recommend.

1zXfaHvu_i9qlLbZiF_kcg.text: My husband always buys me the miso soup here, and it's really delicious! He calls and orders, so it's ready by the time he goes pick it up. So we came for dinner the other day and the place was packed, which I thought It was a good thing, meaning it's a good place with good food.   And it really is! They have "all you can eat" option, it's not super cheap but their menu is amazing, so it's fair. If you like Japanese food you'll go crazy here! And you can have more than one dessert if you pick "all you can eat", how awesome is that? The food is amazing, seriously.  The service is good too, the lady taking care of us was really nice and knowledgeable. They bring everything considerably fast and I got everything I ordered.  The only bad thing about the restaurant is that the tables are very close to one another so you don't have privacy and can't help but to listen to others people's conversations.  I'm going back for sure, asap!

aA596UenvqnFFmmnJUAR-g.text: Normally I LOVE this place & I always recommend it. Tonight we brought fiends and the service was Horrible to say the least! In the hour we were there my friend got 2 of the 5 rolls he ordered.   Literally the WORST. So disappointed. It took 1 hour to bring 2 rolls, my husband kept trying to call the server and he would look away and not come over! DO NOT eat here!!

AJ7t6Ap89V-W1_4SmLmNQw.text: For once, I chose to sit at the sushi bar rather than a table, since it seemed like the main highlight of the restaurant was to sit at the bar (bar took up most of the space). Skeptic to sit at the bar due to my unpleasant, first experience at Hikari, I was surprised to find that there are sushi chefs out there at AYCE places that attentively listen, can figure when you're ready to order again, and make the orders at a quick pace. Thumbs up to the sushi chefs. Their cuts were clean, thick, and perhaps even overpowering compared to the rice.   Sushi Mon's menu is actually quite large in comparison to other AYCE places, specifically their specials menu. I was pleasantly surprised to find Takoyaki on the Appetizers section; that's something you don't usually see nowadays. They also had AYCE Salmon Belly which got me screaming inside with pure joy! Bless! You can also customize your sushi when you talk to the chef. I appreciated the fact that he let me go rice-less with my tamago. There aren't many places that do that for you. For some nigiri such as the scallops, I even added yum yum sauce just for the heck of it. You know, try new things.   I would love to give this place the 5 stars that they deserve, but this sushi joint has one major downfall.   The waiters.   Super inattentive. It seems that whenever I need something from them (water, appetizers, dessert, the BILL), they're just never there. I had to literally hawk my eyes around the restaurant for the first available waiter to tell him my order before he goes back hiding in the kitchen. Several male waiters just kept walking to and from the kitchen, ignoring customers like me that needed assistance, even as I raised my voice and kept saying "excuse me!"   However, it seems that for their friends that visited for the evening, their needs are met whenever they ask. There was literally a waiter right next to me that just kept ignoring my requests as his attention was on his friend who happened to be sitting right next to my group at the bar. Thanks for the service. I guess.   Despite the hiccups with the restaurant's waiters, the food here is still solid enough to get me to come back. That is, after I finish my checklist of other AYCE sushi restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I find their tamago better than most
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice fatty cuts of salmon belly

JJfYuBkmB8mh6SkyA12M2Q.text: They always serve freshest fish! I love the variety of rolls, ecstasy roll is my favorite!! They also have amazing service.

Kiatatdf4dv7MIkXhqFFbA.text: I wouldn't recommend coming here ever. The costumer service was absolutely terrible and even after complaining about uncooked rice they only gave us the option to pay extra for each piece or finish the rice. Don't waist your time. One star is generous.

UZb4OnQ23r0-Xx2EEtWCHw.text: About 9 pm on a Thursday evening, we're off work for the holidays, and craving sushi. So of course it's time for Sushi Mon!  The AYE menu is generous, the staff always friendly, the fish always fresh and my belly always happy and full when I leave. Dang. As I'm writing this review I'm craving it again...  I really like their fried calamari - it's lightly seasoned, fresh, and served with a hint of sauce over a small bed of lettuce.  Here's a tip:  Order from the specials board 1st because items sell out quickly. Be sure to pay attention to the different colored stars since they indicate if you can order 1 per person or more.  My favorite for years was hamachi (yellow tail), but Sushi Mon's super white has taken over. So delicate, fresh, and tender. The halibut is also really nice with just a tiny hint of citrus (I think?).  I also usually love the Sexy Girl (I order a half roll), but the Crispy Rice with spicy tuna will definitely be a repeat.  I always forget my punch card, so thank you for stamping my receipt. Now if I can stop losing my receipts...  No matter, it won't stop me from enjoying Sushi Mon's awesome food!

C7fN52-PQbbUOX8onM0NZg.text: Horrible!!!! The sushi was thinly sliced on a fistful of hard rice. The uni tasted like ocean trash. I've been coming here for 4 years now and never had it this bad. But this is my first time eating here at 11:30pm at night compare to lunch time or 6:30 for dinner.

59MkynLo2AXD3e2SgVcG6A.text: Favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas! Always down to come here for ayce! Sushi nigiris always fresh, melts in your mouth! Love to come here for dinner because  they have uni and amaebi nigiris! But my hands down favorite is the Hokkaido scallops! They don't have Hokkaido scallops at a lot of ayce sushi spot, highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni and amaebi nigiris
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail, super white, Saba and unagi nigiris
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maguro tekka

ugfIiGZ-fRTEXws5G46iOw.text: My daughter & I were in the area and in the mood for Japanese food. I remembered that my good friend and fellow yelper, Edith S recently ate here so we decided to give Sushi Mon a try.   Upon entering we were greeted by the friendly staff, then seated. They have AYCE, regular priced menu items and lunch specials. We decided on ordering from the lunch specials menu.   We both had the 2 Roll Lunch Combo which comes with 2 Sushi rolls of your choice (from list), salad & miso soup. All this for $8.50!   Items tried and liked (so far):  Miso Soup comes with tofu & wakame.  Salad with Ginger Sesame Dressing California Roll Spicy Tuna Roll Avocado & Asparagus Roll  Everything tasted fresh & yummy!  Service was quick & friendly.  We will definitely be back :)

oCiXRI5DdXvq8AmYLhfW-g.text: Not a bad sushi eatery. Decent sized store. You're greeted as you walk in the door. Like most places, they have a time limit.  The rolls are good, but the desserts are better. Not a bad place to eat if you're in the Silverado ranch area.

uF9cKGUuN1F9lNFMXRb8rQ.text: This place is terrible. Came in with my boyfriend and his family and were treated so rudely it was insane. First time at this location... I've only previously been to the rainbow location and that place is pretty good. Service here was trash and so was the quality of the food. Rice to fish ratio was laughable. Avoid this location and go to the other one near Summerlin.

FUyapPYQcPSqTomG96bymQ.text: Best sushi in town. The first time I went I was not really into it, maybe because it was late and didn't have what I wanted. Took me 3 years to go back and now its my favorite!!!

DfAmo33IEnhqta3cyxRuPg.text: I absolutely love this place! We drive out of our way to this location, and take out of town friends here. The food, the service, the cleanliness of the restaurant and again the service is top notch.

RHTCYbmik-0QE_BlpxJEZQ.text: Well, I reviewed the other location so why not review this one as well. One of the best AYCE sushi places in Las Vegas for sure. Don't forget to ask for the specials or read them, because they are up every day for lunch and dinner. Awesome options and actually pretty fresh fish. The chefs are good and the service is as well. You can get half rolls and there is plenty of options. Well priced and I rarely get something I don't enjoy. They have salmon belly sometimes and it's the bomb. Sweet shrimp is a must have. Don't forget dessert.

CqvwOVBbGj_at7CqBM6low.text: I love their all you can eat special. The sushi is good and the price is affordable. Great location and great customer service.

Lj3_HvEXrxhcD28-O9l-Iw.text: This place has great sushi and good service. There are tables and a sushi bar. The downside is that you always have to wait for a seat and you can't drink beer on their patio because they don't have a liquor license for outside, but they totally need one. If they had that for outside, I'd be giving them 5 stars!

eHHl89SFpw8DTkRxvM8bIg.text: Highly recommend this place for AYCE sushi. Writing this review after going several times throughout the last two years. All my experiences have been 5 star experiences   tip: order half orders on rolls  so you can try multiple.   They have rotating specials not on menu but post it on a board daily, including unique and fresh fresh.   Great service- I enjoy sitting at the bar and having the sushi recommend what I should try- if you're feeling adventurous tell them to just make a nigiri platter for you!   My fav: Ecstasy roll - their "O" sauce and seaweed salad on it delish Leash fav: small curry bowl from the kitchen, not a typical red or yellow curry I like - so this prob comes down to personal preference

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushimon lasagna
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ecstasy roll half order w lemon roll

1XLzvDhM53Ovk03hTaUwOw.text: I reside in Portland where our choices for sushi are limited to mainly dirt cheap conveyor belt style sushi or expensive pretentious style establishments.    Sushi Mon is my 2nd AYCE place I've been to in Vegas and I have to say this place blew me away.  When I discovered they were sister restaurants to Monta Ramen, I felt confident in choosing either Sushi Mon and Goyemon for dinner.    I dined with a large group of 8 and while a wait for a table was incredibly long we were able to be seated at the bar rather quickly.  Honestly I enjoyed eating at the bar and being able to interact with the staff and being able to order items on a whim and be delivered them rather quickly.    I typically stick to things I'm comfortable with when I eat sushi...however due to the AYCE pricing, and due to how damn fresh everything was, and how little rice they put into their sushi, I was able to try damn near 2/3 of the menu.  I must have had 7-8 things I normally don't order such as red snapper, uni, fresh scallop, garlic tuna, super white tuna, octopus, etc.  I was expecting to at least hate some of the things I tried, but I ultimately liked or loved everything I ate.  I was marveling at how fresh looking and tasting everything was relative to what I'm used to in Portland.  Tried a few of their specialty rolls and liked them, but I stuck mainly to nigiri throughout the meal and would suggest you do the same.    I didn't experience any service related issues that others have described, however the price point and the food alone was worthy of 5 stars regardless of service IMO.

KRf2Yp16OVd1dkamw1uRdw.text: I've been here several times, usually for lunch. My go-to is the deluxe combo lunch special that comes with Miso soup, salad, teriyaki chicken, California roll, 5 pieces sushi, shrimp and vegetable tempura.   AYCE option is available for $21.95 lunch and and $26.95 dinner. I went with the AYCE for lunch on a Monday and they were pretty crowded. They had 2 wait staff, 1 bus boy, and 3 sushi chefs. I think they could've used another person on the wait staff during this time.   I tried 7-8 rolls and several side dishes, I enjoyed each one. Don't have much to complain about except they should get 1 more person on the  wait staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green salad and deep dried roll

Solq3_lRqe2IxaEguOLw7A.text: Bit of a conflicting rating, I came here previously for a dinner service and everything was fantastic. The ambience promoted a sense of liveliness, servers enjoyed their jobs, a charismatic hostess seated me, and chefs prepped and served delicious food with energetic passion.  I went in for lunch, anticipating a similar experience. However, the difference was figuratively and literally night and day. The waitstaff appeared burnt out and overwhelmed by a full house of customers. I had an extremely difficult time flagging down servers. The chefs were impassive and merely going through the motions of preparing dishes.  I decided to try something new and ordered the chubby roll, which is as the name describes, a roll of wide girth. Moist crab, eel smothered in sweet teriyaki sauce, and crispy coated tempura shrimp all danced well together inside a pretty coral colored soy paper. However, the sheer size is where it failed. A sushi roll is meant to be eaten whole. If it wasn't like trying to shove a kids size hockey puck in my mouth, I would consider it one of the best on the menu.  Sushi Mon isn't the top of my list, for a lunch service anyway.

Y3KxGnMMOCa5LNva61xCJg.text: My favorite thing about this place is the rice to fish ratio! Some AYCE sushi places put so much rice in their sushi that you get full super fast! Here, you'll be able to try more sushi in one sitting cus you won't be as full after several orders of nigiri or a couple rolls. Also, you can do half rolls so you don't have to worry about finishing it all unless you're with a big party.  Besides the rice to fish ratio, they have a wide variety of appetizers, sushi and dessert; great service & sushi chefs; plenty parking; but limited seating. We arrived around 9pm and was able to get bar seating right away.   For all you garlic lovers... the garlic edamame is a must try!!  Overall, everything tasted great and satisfied by AYCE sushi on a Saturday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy rice
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi &amp; maguro
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy girl - half roll

PkkIo8UVhDoUmt8VtKWcUg.text: I love the Lemon roll. Sushi here are always fresh. I love it so much that I call in my order and bring it home at least once a week. As soon as I get there it is ready for pick up.   5 Stars for fresh sushi, clean restaurant and friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Roll

RPa8g_7ynK04dGF9l6u1Gg.text: Long time customer of this location but probably won't be back. Came in around 4pm with a party of 4. There were 3 small tables open but they won't push 2 small ones together, they want you to wait until there is a larger table, yet a party of 3 was sitting a a table for 6. Makes no sense  at all  Don't know if management has changed or what but they do have new employees, some that don't seem like they know what they are doing. Food is generally good but customer service is subpar and isn't worth the hassle. Especially when you can find several sushi places just as good.

Vd6fhxW9J2QnEBr7FYy6Tw.text: Food is very poor.can not eat waiter is poor.Food is not fresh.but you have to complete.

8mfF2RI6zjmAJQnv-bl3yg.text: We've been here several times. I really enjoyed eating here. Today, they didnt have uni or any sort of kama. Waiter who helped us told us they are completely out of any sort of kama.  about 15mins later, new customers sat down near us and and they ordered kama. And other server brought it out! I was so confused and asked that server if they have it. He said they randomly found just one kama. What? Okay, just tell me that you guys have biased service to customers. I really liked going there but not anymore. I'm not going to pay same money when I'm not getting same quality services.

vzBJ_ujFuSjZkoSzP5V8VQ.text: Once I get off the plane in Las Vegas, I start to crave all the food. Including sushi. Not something I seek out normally, but Vegas does sushi right.  Only about 15 min from the airport, Sushi Mon gets the AYCE job done. Even if you're ordering a la carte. Then the pressure is off, since no one is spying to see if you finished one plate before moving on to another. So many rules with all you can eat that I can't handle.  What to order: seaweed salad, takoyaki, tuna nigiri, sweet crab nigiri, crispy rice roll, and rainbow roll. I had every intention of ordering tempura ice cream but that rice filled up my belly and there wasn't any room for dessert. Then again, a deep fried roll is kind of like dessert anyway.  Beyond sticky rice roll my favorite was takoyaki and tuna nigiri. Fresh, simple, and portions not too large. Just enough. And for the same price of AYCE per person, we got to eat exactly what we wanted without the hassle. Plus a large beer to share.  Yes there's a gazillion places to eat sushi in Vegas. Sushi Mon is worth the wait. It's done right and off of The Strip, so prices reflect the quality not the ambiance.

z8Nv9rWU_2qvmYu5a6EqTA.text: This is my favorite sushi spot. I used to come here every time I was in Vegas when I lived in Cali. Now that I live in Vegas, I cant get enough of this place. I love sushi and this place offers all kinds of yummy choices. There yellow tail collar is one of my faves!    Only bummer is that space inside is kind of small so sometimes you are waiting a while for a table. Also, if you have a large party, its hard for them to accommodate.

E5X9UriDS96K8g1mQs73YA.text: It took me long enough to make it around to trying their AYCE, but I'm glad I did (thanks to my sister Stella). We came for lunch during the week and luckily, it wasn't very busy. I got my usual sushi victims like salmon, yellowtail, and (spicy) tuna hand rolls (VERY good, great spicy tuna, fresh fish all around, and I love well-stuffed hand rolls) and specialty rolls. The Spider Roll and Dragon Roll stood out to me, very delicious. I really enjoyed my dining experience because I'm more about the fish rather than all the other stuff in sushi rolls (if I could just order sashimi for AYCE, I would in a heartbeat) and their fish is fresh and just really wonderful. I'm happy with a big plate of fresh hand rolls and it is absolutely worth $21 (or $26 for dinner) here.

HzgKzAQBWgokMnOdbw6aaw.text: AYCE Sushi for $25.   There's a 45 minute time limit, but the servers say they don't really enforce it, not like you should be eating for more than an hour once you start anyways!   The rolls here are amazing. There is a large selection and everything is fresh. The sushi is not drowned with rice so you can enjoy the fish. The miso soup to start is on point. The rolls sometimes break easily when trying to grab it, but for the most part are very well made. What really pleased me was the service. It is FAST! We kept ordering away and the food kept coming out without skipping a beat.  Ended my meal with green tea ice cream which was among the best I've tasted and I left satisfied and happy.

KgTZ7_8JAX2WGsNjjwa5Dw.text: I was hoping that they would serve excellent sashimi, as it is really close to my house... but no... sashimi was just ok, definitely not fresh, and some pieces tasted weird.  I think this place is good for people who love sushi and rolls with a lot of sauces and stuff like that, not for anal purists like me - I judge a Japanese restaurant by their sashimi.

qtu_Ig7L8gCry917KsfRjA.text: Love it so much the people are grey the sushi chefs are amazing and nice they give you really good service as well just make sure you call ahead and reserve a spot or you might be waiting.

MLAuH1bf3aWaI7_Ilt0CSg.text: Can't get enough of this place!  It was fantastic again.  We got there early to beat the crowd.  We got our order in quickly.  Even with the shift change, we got supurb service as always.  They were very attentive to all of our needs.  The all-you-can-eat service is the best.  Always good and fresh!  We get enough of eveything we ordered.  The daily specials were delicious.  Part of our group ordered Teshoku meals.  These were super large portions were hard to finish.  Kamchi-kama were meals by themselves. A great place to go and get your fill of Japanese Cuisine. Gochigosamades! You bet, I will go back for more.

MudgFWoF6leUT3twWXU4sQ.text: First time coming here, It was Saturday night and it was PACKED! No kidding, you have to call in advance and then have them call you back when there is a table! Its crazy like nothing I've ever been to. Its totally okay tho its almost like making reservations, we called an hour and a half in advanced kinda crazy! The inside is rather small, like literally maybe only 10 tables and a sushi bar. The sushi was delicious, all you can eat for $25.00. Ive also gotten the beef udon soup. The broth of the soup is simply delicious, haven't had better udon soup anywhere else! Prices aren't too bad, they are like any sushi place, pretty much. Service was great our waitress was pretty funny and nice. Again, this definitely isn't a spot that you could just randomly drop into when you want because the wait is far too long! Plan ahead and call in when you are at home and see how long the wait is and you'll be okay (;

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Udon soup! Yummy!

oYcESo3yX3oFUozf5agjow.text: Who doesn't love this place?!?!? It's amazing! A vegas gem my only complaint they need more of them I don't live on this side of town anymore :( put one in the southwest PLEASE:) if you haven't been here go now and your welcome :)

nnRqtCTB9Vhw1GmEWP9XTQ.text: Let's face a fact: AYCE and excellent sushi were never meant to go hand in hand.  That is, unless you consider California roll to be sushi, in which case you'd need some sushi education.  This place serves higher than the average buffet quality of sushi, many popular side items, and rolls, all at a low price of $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. I can safely say that the quality is much better than every other AYCE sushi bar that I've eaten at by a long shot, but that's not to imply that the other places were overwhelmingly difficult to beat.  Pros: - Price. If you don't order like an idiot ("let's order rolls") you will definitely get more than what you pay for. - On their AYCE, with the exception of sea urchin nigiri, sweet shrimp nigiri, sashimi salad, and yellowtail collar (maximum one order each, per customer) everything else can be ordered as many times as you want. - Their miso soup is delicious! It comes with a sweet shrimp head in it.  Cons: - Inconveniently located away from the Las Vegas strip. - This place is always busy. Good luck on weekend nights. - Good service is something of a rarity.

5zwiDMk1bH4DZinA9qYqkQ.text: Clean location, went there about 10pm.  The sushi was a bit on the warm side.  The spicy tuna roll was good.  Overall average food.  Although service is better than most sushi places.  That is why I chose to give it a 3 instead of 2 stars.

nYxIXji9ozWcCnB92Kx06w.text: Never going back.  We did ayce & were only able to order twice, while flagging the chef down because we were sitting at the bar. They were two feet in front of us and wouldn't even look at us to order.  For like two hours.   Half the time the order is wrong (I've gone here 3x and they always bering out other things besides what we ordered, or not the sushi /roll we ordered at all.)  "Hospitality" doesn't exist here. Ok there was one kid and he was really nice. Really it's like fishing. You just sit and wait and maybe you'll get to eat. And pay the 25/person bill.   Sushi isn't bad. If you want to bash your head on the table trying to get it in front of you.

PW4_IuLMrckVcrM4Ucoy4A.text: The service, food, and prices are exceptional! Anyone that comes in town, I demand we get sushi to come here. As any great restaurant should, there is a bit of a wait if you arrive during prime dinner time. But its worth every minute. Once you've been seated the service and food come quick!  I have tried a number of rolls and have yet to find one I didn't like! Don't be naive to the vegetable rolls!! The avocado and asparagus roll is the perfect complement to a spicy, fish-filled one! A few other favorites include the shrimp tempura, edamame, and fried calamari.  They do have an all you can eat option. Although, I have left every visit stuffed and have not yet paid for the AYCE and have still spent less than it costs! Let your appetite and wallet be the judge.

EaR0no-g7aWO74KYwQNIyg.text: One of the best All You Can Eat Sushi Restaurants in town.  Been coming to this place for the past nine years.  Awesome Sushi - Cajun Albacore, Salmon, White Tuna, Garlic Tuna, Tako and Yellowtail are excellent.  911 roll is a challenge, but if you like to drink a lot of ice and water, this is the roll for you.  Orion Roll is one of the best, also, Supreme Salmon Roll is awesome.  So many rolls and different type of items on the menu to try...worth the all you can eat price.  Just be prepared to wait for over twenty-forty minutes during the busy dinner times.

9f24uXX-6tdpI0rTKBmI2w.text: Ever since I moved closer, I have been coming back more often.  I think every visit, it has gotten better and better!  I am glad I can update my review, because the staff and chefs deserve the five stars.  Keep rocking sushi mon!

a0qbrY2kwNrcAlntK4jVJg.text: Same as goyemon but the original...if im in the area and craving for sushi its one of my top three..

RGXJPtfadz9-PH88rA4VrA.text: I'm surprised at all the bad reviews. I've been here several times and the food has always been terrific. Yes, around certain hours, you'll have to wait. That just means a lot of people enjoy eating there. :-) Their take-out service is outstanding. I ordered a full meal today and it was ready in five minutes. Friendly service and I love their sushi! Good prices, too. I'll definitely be back.

9lMe5IlQBeqDteKbQsU0cg.text: Sushi Mon definitely lives up to its hype. A couple of friends recommended this place to me as a must stop in Vegas. I was reassured this is the place to be as soon as I heard Japanese coming from the chefs.  Can't get more authentic than that, right?   We came in right at opening 11:45am, even skipped breakfast to make sure we have plenty of room for the raw fish. There were only a couple of others waiting anxiously for them to open up. We had the option of sitting at the bar or table, went with the latter to accommodate our group of 4. Our server came up immediately to get our drinks started. We decided to go with the AYCE sushi. You can't go wrong paying 21.95 for good quality fish.  I decided to start off with the salmon belly, which was melt-in-your-mouth good.  I would highly recommend getting this belly if you see it on their special menu. They ran out in just 10 minutes.  Everything else was delicious and fresh!  Restaurant filled up quickly but there wasn't much of a wait until we left the restaurant around 1. I was also worried at the 45 minute time limit they have posted everywhere. How can anyone eat in 45 minutes when you have to wait for your food every time you put an order in? But luckily this rule was not enforced.  I noticed that there are plenty of people ordering from the lunch menu.  That's something I'd consider if I were a local. But since I'm not, I had to take advantage of the all you can eat menu.    Another huge plus of this restaurant is the insane 2 am closing time. I don't think I'd crave raw fish past midnight, but Vegas never sleeps, right? There is another location closer to the strip on Sahara. I accidentally came to this location because it came up on my Yelp search. But my local friend said that the other location is the original restaurant, and can get more crowded.  I'd have to check out the other one on my next trip.  I highly recommend this place! Friendly staff + reasonable price + great food = one happy returning customer!

crIYwMIN8lfIZJ8cwIRILg.text: If you like nigiri sushi, give it a try. Yashi, sushi chef, kept it coming. Honor the master and have him choose the selection. You can't go wrong. Drop the chop sticks. Eat it with your fingers and drink green tea. It's the right way.

k5qsYMbGPiFGgy0mmFlcbw.text: The fish here is fresh! Me and my sister do the sushi & sashimi dinner. It's $25. Not too bad. For AYCE is $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. We'll try it next time. I gave them three stars because of the location and set up. We got sat right by the door. There is no waiting area. So people's butts are right near your food! Request one away from the door. But, there's not many tables so you'll have to wait. The service isn't too bad. Not the friendliest but attentive to your needs.

GQZhyXc-cVwN6Fh8fPrWTg.text: Man I ate at this place around 2010 2011. They had this all you can eat deal where you could basically eat all you wanted as long as you finished it and the sushi was delicious. I was hanging out in Vegas with an ex who turned out to be a total pig and  could totally knock down tons and tons of sushi and keep going . So I guess what I'm saying is I wouldn't recommend dating any women from Vegas but I definitely would recommend all you can eat sushi at this place if you are dating or engaged to a total pig like I was.

dceIvBS7LhjXOWkwh2IcyA.text: Yummy, since it was the closet around. The baked rolls were great, I believe it was the baked 428 roll, and the lasagna roll. I was curious to what they would taste like and they did not disappoint.  The volcano roll and stace roll were just as good. I subtracted a star for the prices. If I were to drive a little more I would off ate at Sapporo Sushi.   The service was great, food was great.

6FaT6nllyWgtOGDzzqswQQ.text: in my opinion,  i think it's a good deal for all you can eat sushi for $27. but i think the location on sahara is better than this one. the fish didn't seem as fresh.  read the fine print.  it states that there are special fish/sushi of the night.  kobe beef was one them the night we went.  the kobe beef sushi (i don't think it's real. maybe it's kobe beef style or american?) was really tough. it didn't melt in your mouth or anything.  the spider roll is huge.  i liked the lychee ice cream. they're open til 2am. last call at 1:30.

BVEHH63bsi6aVZdZXaDPaQ.text: Need a sushi fix? Sushi Mon is an awesome AYCE sushi restaurant. I stop by here every time I'm in Vegas. It's quite small, however, the sushi here is really fresh and satisfies my sushi cravings! I almost always end up with a food coma whenever I'm here. However they do charge for uneaten portions.

K8YQ9SLhX3ubIfq0jmYZ-A.text: AYCE. Be patient with the service. They are so nice here. I hate when patrons are rude when it's busy. Often has a wait. Quality is not the best, but it's good none the less. Great variety. Also good for lunch take-out. Seating is tight. If your food companion eats sushi they have probably been here and likely like it.

59jZgORd4PTbfdEWXPUF1Q.text: Hands down my favorite sushi place.  I've been going here for years!  Definitely order the all you can eat and don't forget that it includes ALL food items on the menu (apps, dessert, etc).  The fact that I can order a lychee sherbet, plum sherbet, AND red bean ice cream for dessert makes it so worth it. :)  Also make sure to check out the daily specials that are posted on the walls.

VRBqlzMQRSofi9p-4AaCYQ.text: We went last night kind of late for the AYCE dinner.  Being from Reno, the capital of AYCE sushi, we were too spoiled to spend for a la carte anywhere else in Vegas, and this place was recommended by a few people.  Checking yelp and looking over the menu we got excited, the variety was great.   I like to start with nigiri but the fish looked bad, my yellowtail had a lot of different shades to it, maybe it's the way they cut it or maybe it's just kind of old but they do give good fish to rice ratiio.  Also, the salmon didn't come with lemon on it as it does at my favorite place back home, and the sushi chef was fairly inattentive when I wanted to ask for some slices so I just dealt with it. The long rolls were not anything to write home about either.  They were loosely rolled and had a lot of rice, so much that when I picked one up it fell into soy sauce which splattered ALL over me.  When this happened, the sushi chef offered soda water, which was nice, but it didn't have to happen at all.   We ordered a couple rolls with no issue but when my boyfriend ordered the Monster roll, thinking it would be piled high with fish, we got disappointed.  The chef made something that looked delicious then piled a whole bowl worth of rice onto it, rolled it up and served it.  My boyfriend decided the only way he could fit it in his mouth would be to take out the actual roll and discard the rice.  He told the waiter he wasn't going to eat it and the waiter was very nice, saying he would have warned him if he'd asked, stating it might be better for a table of 5 people (it's only 5 slices).  We just wish the chef had warned us. But we weren't charged for not eating the rice which was good, cause they charge over $12 for that roll, and that's almost half the cost of dinner.   So, to summarize, love the AYCE, love the late hours and variety of rolls.  There was so much we wanted to try that we didn't get a chance to.    Service is also excellent but the chef could've been better/more service oriented.

HhNEFMPrT6MsJgtby6FaSg.text: Have ordered take out from here several times and would recommend to anyone close by. Food is always done extremely fast and it tastes delicious. Caterpillar roll is the best!!!

-T4Z70o8wO6ITQ_fAWnt7g.text: Still love this place! There is always a wait, even at 9pm on a Monday. Such great customer service and really fresh sushi.

r96F6-hA2sOSZHS7mMkQ8g.text: Nice out of the way all you can eat sushi place.  I usually eat enough nigiri to make the trip and price worth while but as a discerning certified asian, I eat muuuuch more than I can handle.  I can eat way more fish than the $25.95 all you can eat price.  Only restriction is one uni and amaebi dish per person (and one toro when they have it).  The tempura here is very well done and somehow, in the middle of a desert, the fish is quite fresh.  Definitely a place I'd go back to when I'm in town.

poLpJVD8CcNmhiFyCdja6A.text: The best way to enjoy this experience is to go with several people and opt for the all-you-can-eat special.  Our group was able to sample dozens of different items and were well satisfied by the end of the meal.   My favorites were the hand rolls, scallops with yuzu, soft-shell crab and tuna, calamari and lychee sherbet.  It turned out to be a very good deal for the amount we ate.

XqZwx5QN5ik1lM_4xOxZBA.text: Open late and all you can eat sushi at reasonable prices!  I religiously went here in 2003 when my boyfriend lived in Vegas. We went so much the cooks new us. We loved the sashimi and special rolls!  Went back 2007, food quality wasn't the same and service went down a notch.  The wait for a table was the same, it's a small place so be prepared to wait.  Disappointed, as we were excited to eat here after so many years.   3.5 stars....not the same, but would go back.

-2v809WiovAvSwkWUNgbew.text: This is good... that is the simplest most correct way of talking about Sushi Mon... scratch that this is REALLY good.  I was suggested this place by a friend and I have been back 4 times in 2 weeks (alright I do have a sushi problem).  The fish here is fresh, the chefs have great suggestions as to new things to try and it is AYCE!!!  I even drive down from North Las Vegas for this sushi.  I am a big Uni (sea urchin) fan and have been consistently impressed with the quality.  My father (who used to go to Japan for business often) said that it was some of the best uni that he has had in the US.  The problem is they do limit you.  The other fish on the menu has consistantly been fresh and delicious.  Don't be afraid to try new things along with the gold standards (yellowtail, tuna, salmon) as they are all good.  Like most of the AYCE sushi places I have been to you can order anything on the menu including appetizers and dessert.  The menu is a good size with a nice variety of fish and rolls.  Another positive is that if you are the only diner for AYCE you can order half rolls.  This sushi place didn't try to fill me up on rice or give me a paper thin slice of fish.  I would rate this sushi place high for the AYCE AND the sitdown sushi places.  I guess that they have another location but I haven't been there.  Seating can be rough but I haven't had to wait long... for even less time sit at the sushi bar.

-lZPgjikNY5k9cJtVMaa6w.text: If you love all you can eat and you can really eat that much sushi (meaning with the rice), then this is the place for you. Not only is everything fresh, but you get a menu where you can choose from. Of course the really expensive stuff you get limited to 2/person, but its totally worth it.   The price is again, like buffets, per person so don't bother brining people that can't eat a lot or else it's not even worth it. The sweet shrimp is awesome and make sure you tell them to fry the head and eat it, caz its a delicacy. This is definitely the place I'm going to when I'm in Vegas.

yhHsusAP-M6XCyGc27E_DQ.text: Sushi and service here are great!   We always get the all-you-can-eat here and love it! The appetizers are good and they have a large variety of hand/cut rolls to choose from.  Two thumbs up! Will come back again soon!

m5tu3eQegfwgXuuzkLV_fA.text: So I recently moved to this side of town and Sushi Mon is walking distance from the new pad so its no surprise that I quickly became a fan of such a great AYCE place. I enjoy coming here because there's lots of good choices and tempura ice cream is on the AYCE menu. I had one experience here where the fish was just average but overall it has been consistently great. I will continue to come back as often as possible.

r92pWV_UtqDlw0IkKrsCEA.text: Fredo is no longer here but this place is still awesome.  I came with a couple of friends this weekend and we had such a great time.  The selection was abundant and staff was real nice.  I think the owner enjoyed watching our group love the food.   You can even get toro and sweet shrimp her.  Believe me it was so good.  I'm sad cause I live so far away from here.  I'm also kicking myself cause I forgot to use my frequent buyers card.  I'll be back though

jhOyYHOMteo5lraL__oxTA.text: Great place, very well priced and great quality for the price.  Always packed usually have to sit at the bar.  It's our every Wednesday night joint.

r3HFhqPLoLczchm2-I6Vug.text: by far the best AYCE sushi i have tasted in vegas!!! it's not the best sushi place, but best AYCE for sure!!! there has never been  a time that we experience  bad sushi or the service. its great!!! plus, the price is reasonable. also, if you decide to become a fan. be sure to get a stamp card when you ask for  the check. if you get your card stamp in full, I believe your 10th AYCE is free.   here is some of my favs you must try:  Nigiri : scallops, salmon, garlic tuna, yellowtail, super white.  sushi rolls : ALL OF THEM!!! YOU CAN EVEN ORDER HALF ROLLS!!! & yellowtail hand roll is one of my favs!!!

F4-aEwmwkPxsRoA-UVf9Qw.text: The sushi is good but they pack on too much rice.  Service is always excellent.  My favorite Chef is MOON!

K_3_PrSct1Rl8o7gzy8VAw.text: My brother in law and I stopped here for dinner after overshooting our turn for another sushi place. Walking in the door, nice ambiance. Sat at the bar and ordered the all you can eat in which the customer is timed at 45 mins to eat. Dinner started off bad because I ordered a roll and the sushi chef drowned it in a sweet sauce. And when I say drowned, the bottom of the plate showed no white. I told the sushi guy that I didn't want the roll because he drowned it in sweet sauce. He accused me putting too much soy sauce. Really!? My meal was ruined, I ate the most basic califorrnia and philly rolls, had my plum icecream and peaced the place out. Truly, truly disappointed. Not to mention, the fish was not well kept.

Hsq4GuDCCL9H0birQWcVvA.text: Whenever I see the words "sushi" and "buffet" combined together, images of horrible, unmentionable evil spring to mind and I am left a cowering mess underneath a table somewhere.  So when I found myself in Vegas in a rush for a sushi fix, Sushi Mon was brought to my attention.  A buffet, I cautiously whispered.  This can't be good.  But no - looking at the Yelp reviews, it defiantly stared back at me w/ its four star rating and dared me to say anything to the contrary.  Fine, I told myself.  *I* will be the judge of that.  The verdict:  It wins.  The place is pretty damn awesome.  It's a quick drive from the strip (and on top of that, it's easy to navigate to which helps a lot for newbs) and parking is simple b/c it's located right in a strip mall.  Strip mall sushi buffet = ZOMGWTFBBQ BAD, right?  RIGHT?!  No, damn you!  This place is GOOD!!!  The buffet is less than $30 / person for dinner and considering that each roll is about $10, you're getting a deal and a half going for the buffet option.  And unlike most sushi buffets that like to give you a high rice/fish ratio for their rolls, this place keeps that ratio relatively low and gives you a decent amount of fish per roll.  The rolls are decently sized and tasty.  I'm a big fan of spicy tuna rolls (I can hear all the purists groaning) and this place has the "911 Roll" which is THE SPICIEST TUNA ROLL EVER.  It's like eating fire wrapped around some tuna, rice and seaweed.  It is beyond brilliant.  If you're in the Las Vegas area and want to fill up on some quality sushi at a steal of a price, Sushi Mon is the place to be.  +1 for the late hours.

AKQ2MnI0jM-pVB8xSFchJw.text: Okay, so this place is small. It's always busy. The wait staff could use a little more training when it comes to acknowledging customers and replenishing drinks. But you HAVE to try this place! I have gone to a lot of sushi places and this one is the best food experience that I've had in my entire life (which is saying a lot)! The sashimi, nigiri and rolls are excellent and the variety is amazing! Everything they made was so good-and we were trying to get the full benefit from our buffet pricing-that I left so uncomfortably full that I almost despaired of life.   THIS BEING SAID, I'VE JUST READ THAT THEY CHANGED OWNERSHIP AND THAT THE QUALITY HAS VASTLY CHANGED. I still plan to check it out on my next trip through the area and truly hope that this isn't the case. Because I really LOVE this place and think that you will too!

fGRbLFVjE9UYK0XpkJquNQ.text: I'm no sushi expert so take feedback from me as a novice connoisseur .   Very excellent fresh sushi. Awesome rolls and selection   Ill go again.

jMOLbFj86fNz6o6dWSiXWA.text: Anytime you put "all you can eat" and "sushi" in the same sentence, you never know what you're going to get. But this place is superb. The quality of the fish is great, variety is awesome, and pricing for about $26.95 for adults (one hour time limit) at dinner time (a little less for lunch) is well worth it if you're hungry.   They have all the usual nigiri favorites and an extensive list of sushi rolls. What blew my mind was the Ikura and Quail Egg...oh baby...my brother-in-law introduced me to this and now it's one of my favorite bites to eat. Needless to say, we had way too many on our last visit.  You can also order regular Japanese dishes like shrimp/vegetable tempura, hamachi kama, miso soup, and the like...which we did. But it really was the sushi that I enjoyed the most.  The only slightly disappointing thing we encountered was there's really no kids menu available. Kids 2-years-old and under do eat free, but if you're kids are older than that (like my son) then expect to pay ala carte prices to get that kid fed or splurge on another all-you-can-eat.  Other than that, we had a great time and would definitely return again if we are hungry for good quality sushi off the strip.

WCERxE2TBmy3p-LRP6yvEw.text: my favorites:  - white tuna - fresh scallops - salmon belly  consistently great quality!

DrweZ5elQ4p91WDkHwXzdA.text: My favorite location for Sushi Mon.  MMmmmm.  I miss this place.  I live in the bay area now but I still crave this place from time to time. The sushi is pretty average, honestly, and I've had fresher and more generous cuts in other places, but this place has an atmosphere that I miss. That neighborhood spot-type of atmosphere. Also, I've always found this place to be most consistent with taste/quality in their All-You-Can-Eat menu for both sushi and apps. It's also nice that when you do All-you-can-eat, your nigiri rice isn't packed in so big/tight that it's basically a rice cake under a thin layer of fish.   Aaaaannnnddd you can eat here till like 1 or 2 am. OH, I miss Vegas & I miss Sushi Mon.

RmRVLYCu9CM9BVqUVqU0xw.text: dragged husband here one night as they had other items for him to eat, since he doesn't eat sushi.  I was too scared to get the AYCE because of the pressure to finish every bit of sushi including the rice, I knew I wouldn't be able to eat it all, so I ordered the super salmon roll and the pixie roll.  Loved the super salmon roll but I wished it had some avocado and cucumber in it along with the salmon for extra flavor.  Fish tasted extremely fresh.  I was not crazy about the pixie roll, as I was not a fan of that yum yum creamy shrimp.  This, plus the soy paper made the roll a bit too sweet for my tastes.  We also had the teriyaki chicken and fried oyster appetizers, the teriyaki chicken was tasty but I liked the chicken better at Yummy.  The oysters were fresh and tasted good but the thick sauce it comes with was not that great.  Giving this four stars because the fish tasted so fresh and the food came out insanely quick.  And, they are only a few minutes from the house.  I'd go here again maybe when i'm ready to try AYCE.  I also liked how they didn't restrict the menu when you order all you can eat, you just get whatever you want.  When I did it at KA on green valley parkway, they kept coming back telling me I had to pick something else.

YNscCW5j6YHIXjRDI7NVNQ.text: Sushi Mon has the best sushi ever! ALL YOU CAN EAT!!  Literally, all you do is sit there and they serve you! You get to order however much food you want and you can just sit in your chair and get fat!  The food is so good! You must order the FRIED SHRIMP HEAD and Ahi Poke!! I love this place!

qj4A_tU0flrX9R47B-ee_w.text: Living in Vegas for the past few weeks, and I've stayed far away from the buffet lines.  However, I have also been missing out on my sushi runs and finally had the opportunity for some raw fish this past weekend.  Having been to their sister restaurant on Sahara, I was familiar with Sushi Mon's all-you-can-eat menu.  For $29.95, you have an hour to chow down on nigiri, rolls, appetizers, tempura, and dessert.  For those not wanting to participate in the race, you can order from their a la carte menu as well.    For such limited items like Amaebi (don't forget to ask for the fried heads that come with them!) and Uni, it's only one order (a pair) per person.  Otherwise, diners like myself would have them running out of that stuff quick!  I also had some of their nigiri, and their specialty rolls - 9-1-1 Roll, Spider Roll, and Pixie Roll among others.  I had a better experience with their Hamachi Collar this time compared to my experience at the other Sushi Mon.  Order half orders on the rolls so you can try more out and aren't stuck with 8 pieces all to yourself!   And for dessert - I like their Plum Sherbet, Lychee Sherbet, and Green Tea Ice Cream.  I never made it around to their Mochi this time unfortunately.  Update! 09/14/07 - I made the mistake of ordering their Spider Roll which is huge and filled with crab meat filler!  Blah!  Be sure to ask what their daily fish specials are.  They had bonito and live scallops when we went, and the scallop was pretty good.  Their scallop nigiri is cooked scallop, which is something I didn't really care for.  I got a chance to try their Mochi Vanilla this time, yum!  I think I did a good job of eating my fill!  Sidenote: They offer frequent eater cards!  Eat 10 times there and get one free!  They don't take reservations!   Update! 03/11/08 - I finally tried their vanilla mochi and it was yummy.  Forgot to check what their daily fish specials were, which was probably a big mistake. Their ahi poke has nice cuts of tuna and seaweed mixed together, add a bit of soy to it though.

75g-TbmMYjR2uiwz41nsuQ.text: I had to write this review in response to the review by Joey S. of the $10 dollar special for their anniversary. We had the same issue, that is, we got there and they weren't taking anymore names since the amount of names they had would last them until closing time. That is perfectly reasonable considering they have to go home some time. They weren't taking reservations. The names in their waiting book were from people who got there before you and put their names in first. There's a difference between reservations and putting your name in way ahead of time in person at the restaurant. Sorry, we were both bested by others who got there before us.   when they say they're not doing it anymore because too many people are there, consider the language barrier and assume they mean they can't cater to all the people who showed up due to seating and time constraints. They are not trying to get cheap on you and end the deal.  They always have great quality food and friendly service. I highly recommend them.

Y4F6kY8I1PqNDYET-RI3Hg.text: Went for a late lunch during mid-week....about 2:45pm....and there was a 20 min wait...nuf said...food, presentation and service all very good

Q3in-j-S5vCS2zC0j2FlDg.text: The best all you can eat sushi? Almost sounds like and oxymoron.

WaESSObsWPdtLTKk2yX8ug.text: If you want a place with great customer service, this is not it! Usually one of my favorite places to go because a few of the chefs and servers are really friendly and it is close to my house. I have recently changed my schedule and have to go later in the evening which means longer waits to get a table. Along with this comes bad service. As it gets later the better chefs here get off and they have a bunch of new people that are not as friendly or good behind the bar. They also recently changed managers and promoted a server to that position, which is not a good change. What irritates me in particular is one waitress who usually takes over service of the sushi bar when she comes in and she would rather talk to coworkers and hide in the back then actually take care of customers. I have been a loyal customer for years and the food is always good but the service here is getting to the point where I am starting to look for another ayce sushi joint. So if you want great service this is not the place for you.

2XNu3cR1WJjPywwNlP8Scg.text: This restaurant have been so far the worst restaurant I've EVER dined. The manager is extremely rude and got furious over their own mistakes and blown his anger on us. From our previous experience we called in to make sure they had conch tonight since it was the speciality dish. Since they guaranteed that they had plenty of conch we decided to head over. After waiting for an hour they seated us and took our order. As patiently waited for my order the server came back and said we only have one piece (we had 5 people) I was stocked we drove 20 mins from the strip to the restaurant and the tell us they don't have that anymore. After that the manager came and didn't even apologize and said if you are not happy you can pay and leave. I cannot believe this restaurant got such high review for such terrifying service. This restaurant do not put customers first and all they cared about was money the seafood is no longer fresh compared to the past. This will be the last time we go.

QieZ-2YrXrzAWslJ6zWyWQ.text: We use to eat here all the time when it first opened and it being only 3 mins away from home. My wife is Japanese and according to her the quality of their sushi dropped significantly, even my teenage son says their fish was bloody. We no longer go there.

hDHx3oGSNZIyV8l4lAgG2A.text: Sushi is one of my favorite foods! $21.95 for all you can eat is an incredible price for sushi that includes all the raw fish, unlimited desserts, etc.  My favorite is the sexy girl and of course hamachi, maguro, and salmon nigiri. I was kind of annoyed by the waiter that came like a million times to bug us about collecting our plates and eventually we anticipated him coming so we did the work by stacking the plates and putting it on the side.  Aside from that, the food was so good that I will keep returning.  I like sitting at the bar because the sushi chefs are nice and come every now and then to ask if we wanted to order anything. I will definitely come back here again.

0h6K6U37RZ7wy2ie3ea-ZA.text: All-You-Can-Eat & High Quality Sushi are normally two things that I wouldn't associate together. Until now. Their full menu is available for the AYCE price, and it's a very wide menu. The rolls and cuts are made to order and the fish was very fresh. I love that you can order half-rolls so you can try lots of different ones. I had my doubts as to how good this place would be after my friends had talked it up so much, but I was not disappointed. I must've tried at least 9 different types of rolls, a couple of handrolls, tuna poki and we finished off with a refreshing lychee sorbet that cleaned the palate wonderfully.   Service was definitely on top of it and the sushi chefs behind the counter seemed very enthusiastic and were having fun being there. The place isn't very big, so even full, all of our food came out very quickly and our table waiter came back frequently to find out our next orders. It took some effort to control myself from ordering everything on the menu, but I believe my heart appreciated it.   I think a return to Sushimon will be a must for my next trip to Vegas.

bVoL9n-l8jB07msuk8uF8w.text: After hearing that the sushi chef from Sushi Mon on Sahara had moved here we had to check it out. I do enjoy their fried oysters and dynamite. However, the quality of the fish is just so-so. Maybe I'm spoiled by the high quality of fish I've been eating at my new regular spot, Naked Fish yelp.com/biz/naked-fishs... However about halfway into our meal, we were shocked when we saw them clean the inside of the glass sushi display case with a big blue bottle of windex. Yes, the case with all the fish in it. We walked out. That is wrong. Won't be going back.

t38tovpJPv6E34uCjpBeVg.text: The first time I ever came here was many years back and where there was only 1 sushi mon!  But now that they have split up, they also had split the menu!    I would say this sushi mon got the better menu!  I came here, it was about $35 with tax and tip for ayce sushi!  No sashimi but they do have nigri.  Very good selection and their hamachis are delicious!    All their rolls were great especially the 911 roll!  Very spicy and tasty!    They say it's ayce for 1 hour but we ended up staying for 2 and no one said anything!  Also, 1 hr is a long time to eat!  We stayed for two because we were talking but we weren't eating the whole time.  The selection here are pretty fresh and I wouldn't say at all that it was low quality sushi!    People here are friendly and don't make faces or anything when you order and order!    My favorite spot to go to in Las Vegas when I come visit!  Also, they have tempura ice cream!  Always a delight! =)

owGWHPWX2k4BruoxMgVNOA.text: The holy grail of AYCE IMO. This is the place I compare to all other AYCE. Fish is fresh and flavorful. Plenty of different nagiri, cut rolls, and hand rolls to pick from. Whatever sushi you are craving, I'm sure they will have it or something close to it. Lots of side dishes and deserts are also part of the AYCE menu!   Whenever someone says, "I found a good AYCE Sushi place." I respond with, "Is it as good as Sushi-Mon." The answers vary from "No" to "Close" but never "It's better than Sushi-Mon".

2-hE-0wovwNxa0Nys16bpQ.text: I love this place! The service is amazing...... The chefs already know what I like to eat. I've been coming  here for the past 4 yrs and I have no complaints. They always have a variety of fish and it's always fresh.   You guys rock!!!!

Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jn5ywFe573Yb1j1i7Rgb9g.text: I love Sushi Mon for their nigiri sushi specials such as toro and salmon belly which I don't find all the time at other AYCE sushi restaurants! The medium toro and salmon belly are just so deliciously fresh and melt in your mouth. They're not always on the menu though so be aware of that and if it is, it might be limited to one order/person. The other nigiri sushi like salmon, yellowtail, and white tuna have been my other favorites as well.   I love getting edamame and shrimp tempura here since it's pretty fresh but I've tried the takoyaki and fried gyoza and was disappointed by how soft and full of dough they were.   As for rolls, the selection is smaller than other AYCE sushi places unfortunately. The only roll that really stood out to me was the Lemon roll which had yellowtail and salmon with sliced lemon on the top to combine the flavors.   For desserts, you can pick more than one! The mochi ice cream is pretty good. I also love the specials they have for desserts - I recently got mango mochi ice cream and yuzu ice cream which were both delicious!   Sushi Mon's AYCE price at $26.95 is great for the quality of nigiri sushi and fun diversity of daily specials but I still wish there were more selection for the appetizers and rolls!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glistening salmon belly
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium toro, salmon belly, lemon roll! Love it!

on1gV8DYMkfG1_4qh-iEMw.text: this spot is just as good as their other location on the west side of town. stopped by here recently while coming back from Henderson and was 99% happy with it.  the food was served very quick, the service was on point, the prices are perfect for all you can eat. the only thing I didn't like was the rice to fish ratio. they do put more rice with the fish then the other location does, smaller fish cuts here for sure, but not really that big a deal.  I'm a fan already so I will for sure be coming back to this place if I am in the area

BDn76PIJ42FTVAy6YnZNtA.text: Very disappointed with the service and treatment at Sushi Mon.  I'm here visiting for a week and wanted to have a nice dinner and catch up with my mom and aunts.  I understand it's a small restaurant with limited tables and we would have gladly left so someone else could have our table, but we were so rudely told to leave because people were waiting... it was just unacceptable.

OIHdVhVH1-gzDXcRXY480Q.text: Came in here with friends and by far the best all you can eat sushi restaurant I've ever been too. The selection is vast and the quality of each item is top notch. This is how sushi is suppose to be done right.

4bUfXgt7Meon0Fw-G8vnHA.text: Great first time experience! The rolls are so very good, and great Sushimi too. Lunch time prices last until 4:00 making this one of the best deals on this side of town for AYCES! And their regular menu has great deals too. We'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG! After the K-9 dog trials my hubby and I came out for Sushi! Yum

ioaRJ-WA8nk9plcXvzlSPg.text: Their all you can eat sushi is a great deal, fast service, and delicious food. Will definitely bring some friends with me to try it out next time.

Z_fXvAD2ZB1kWhf2NZ2fmA.text: Quality is amazing for ayce sushi and it's open late. Service I find is usually subpar and though I tip 20% it's because I feel they have a tough job. Sit at the sushi bar in front of Honda for faster service

LvP0i70-mJKHmIsOXG9ngw.text: We haven't been to this spot in years and it is great to know they are still the best.  Friendly service and fresh delicious food. The specialty rolls are the best and there are so many of them.  We even had our little one with us and she was well looked after.

PpTVixQDvPnZ_PAHZ6Uklg.text: I've been here a couple of times now so I figured it was time for a review.  The food is pretty good here. Not amazing, but think of it as "all-you-can-eat" quality. I've done the all-you-can-eat option each time I've been in just to be able to try a bunch of things and I haven't been disappointed. There is WAY better sushi out there, but this place is better than you might expect.  The staff is outstanding, super friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating. They know/understand/accommodate gluten-free options very well. My wife, who is very sensitive to gluten did the all-you -can-eat and had no problem finding plenty of tasty options.   4 stars for two reasons. The sushi is really good, but not amazing. Also, they have a LOT of rules, and they post them everywhere. They don't seat partial parties so if you are the 1st of 6 people coming, you're not getting seated until the other 5 show up. There is a laminated card with rules for the all-you-can-eat option: No sharing, charges for leftovers, 45 min time limit for lunch and 1hr for dinner, etc.. Rules plastered on the window talking about "last call" and "last order" and all of that. I think I get it, but it doesn't make for the most welcoming of environments.  I'll totally go back again, and probably skip the all-you-can-eat and just pick a few things I know are good.

Bg5miZMVl2RowmMXvmK1Ig.text: I had been craving sushi for a few weeks now...Thursday night after work, my fella decided that after cashing checks, we would hit up Sushi Mon.  This location was closer to where we were, so rather than driving ALL the way over to the other location, we came over here.  In terms of service, it is hands down GREAT service.  I'd venture to say better than their other location, as I have NEVER had bad service here.   All of the servers were polite, and even joked around with us a few times.  There was one order of unagi that we ended up sending back, because it looked significantly less cooked/seared than the last 3 orders we had received.  The servers took it back with no problem, apologizing profusely, and asking if we wanted it prepared again.  They brought it back and it was perfect.   Now for the fish!!  The quality of fish at the location, just like the Sahara location, is always good.  I've never had anything that was downright BAD, or off.    This trip we had:  Super white:  my favourite of all time!!  It almost melts in your mouth.  Unagi:  Yum.  We order this 4 orders (each order is 2 pieces) at a time Cajun Albacore: Light spice, and very delcious Ebi: perfect! Sardines: These were on special, and I'm not a fan.  The texture was good, but there was a very fishy aromatic flavor that I'm not fond of.  Fella liked them.  Negi-toro: weird texture, but good.  (blue fin tuna belly wrapped in seaweed.) Conch: almost a lemon flavor...delicious. Garlic tuna: My second favourite of the night.  SO flavorful! Tako (octopus): My first time NOT having this in a salad.  It was surprisingly tender, and very good.  We also had fried gyoza (3 or 5 orders, or something like that), seaweed salad, and sake.  (Ok, I had a lot of sake.  It was delicious, I couldn't  help it.)   I love the AYCE option here, as it includes anything off the appetizer menu, and also dessert.    For dessert, I had the green tea creme brulee.  If you have NOT tried this yet, you must.  It is amazing.  All in all, Sushi Mon remains my favourite AYCE sushi place, and both locations are equally good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea Creme Brulee.  YUM
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tako (Octopus)...surprisingly tender!
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super white!!!!!  Yum.

ibSkRS7smSfMyUM8WvTDMw.text: This has now become my go to sushi place. EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!  Very accommodating and friendly staff.  The AYCE is worth it.

M6RCxB1ar99dr-3zPXbQ9g.text: Great sushi restaurant offering an all you can eat option! Tried it for my first time with a co-worker for lunch.... great choice! Plenty of great options to choose from!   Will definitely be back soon!
