PjzoGLzS2J3KAvATUWXPDA.text: Way way worth the price. Honestly the fish quality was middle of the road. Not bad, not great but lets be real. If you want to stuff your face for 27 bucks it dont get much better! The green mussels were excellent and the udon soup was delicious!

w97LCnB_ryDiTJcnWLM_sQ.text: Slow, inattentive service. They forgot our first sushi order and won't make any eye contact when we were trying to get their attention to order more. Had to follow up on our order twice. One server took our tray for wasabi and never replaced it although we weren't done eating yet and didn't even asked us if we wanted anything else. None of the servers asked us how we were doing or whether we wanted to order more. Oh no, wait! One person did ask when she was giving us our bill which we haven't even asked for yet. I guess that's one thing they are really attentive with. Never, ever coming back. Worst service ever!  Nothing special about the food either.

O9zvA0DFmN-wsLOv_dqzKw.text: Stopped in last week for the first time. Tried the "All you can eat". My favorites were the Tiger and the Sexy Girl. I also enjoyed the miso soup and mochi ice cream for dessert. The staff was friendly, quick and efficient. I look forward to returning soon.

BgIEKYz4qFzg2tBdGqSqWQ.text: Fred our original server, his service was just awful. I noticed he would give our order to another table and make us wait so long. However Jefferey, was the savior, he actual helped us with our orders. I'm sorry to say that Sushimon is a sushi place I don't feel comfortable going back to. If they hire more people like Jefferey, the customer service would be so much better.

m3SYcihDVQjZtiuez255ZQ.text: Worst sushi experience I've ever had! I wish I could rate lower than a single star! First we get there and we spot 2 clean tables, 20 min wait... fine we took the bar that was open the server had to wipe it off and left the whole counter wet from the dirty rag that they used. Also, never received any ginger or wasabi yet the couple next to us that came in shortly after got there's. Started off with two orders of shrimp tempura, undercooked and the taste was minimal. Garlic tuna nigiri was the cheapest tasting tuna I've ever had, hardly any sauce. The royal California roll, deep fried, was burnt and not edible. Fried eel was served raw on the dragon roll. Used to come here but it has obviously seen better days. Never coming back here, and I don't advise anyone else to.

ljGNh6X64IBNDJMF3abpHA.text: Ate here the other day with my family and the service was horrible!!! Had a very rude server named JEFFREY. He kept rolling his eyes and mouthed "oh my fucking God" after we asked if we can order. Will not eat here again. The food wasn't even that good. I ordered the AYCE and the server hardly came to our table to take my order. VERY BAD SERVICE!!! Especially the server JEFFREY.

XRI__ARcVBqJN2PMGloiaQ.text: More of a 3.5 * but I am feeling a bit generous since they have the lychee sorbet, so am rounding it up.  I have been feigning for raw fish and the last experience at Goyemon (service was lackluster, out of uni, out of lychee sorbet) and at Tomo Sushi (service was wonderful, but uni didn't taste fresh, the sauces on some pieces of nigiri wasn't great, desserts were not good), were not good.  Finally, we decided to give Sushi Mon a try.  I know it is from the same Goyemon family, so I was hoping that they have all the same items, but may be better service?  We dined at 6pm yesterday and we got a table right away.  I was excited to see salmon belly, toro, Hamachi kama on the specials board.  I was so excited that I couldn't contain myself, and spilled soy sauce on my place mat.  A lot of sauce.  But, the waiter didn't care...business as usual.  Didn't offer napkins, another place mat, nada.  As soon as our orders of nigiri came out, I didn't care as well.  The toro was not bad, conch was not sweet, but the salmon belly and super white were delicious!  We ordered a total of 6 orders of salmon belly and super white, and other (hotate was not as fresh and sweet as the ones we had at Goyemon before, saba was ok, didn't care for the meintako, the ikura with quail egg is good, Hamachi kama was yummy, ameabi was small but sweet).  I ended the meal with 3 scoops of lychee sorbet.  I was quite satisfied.

gJfUs0WGqgxKSUCwoZouQg.text: I've been here a few times for lunch. It's in the same shopping center as Smith's so there's plenty of parking nearby.  I came in here a couple days ago for a lunch meeting for work. They sat us immediately and took our drink orders. Unfortunately,  this  visit, their fountain machine was broken so our drink options were limited. I was hoping for an iced tea but had to settle for a matcha tea instead.   We each ordered a round of miso soup, a side of garlic edamame, and all you can eat sushi. The food was delivered pretty quickly and was pretty delicious.  The all you can eat lunch is a decent price. And if you aren't up to eating a ton of sushi, they also have some lunch specials that are a bit smaller and less price.

QV_PMpkD70NkLJb8M8zfDw.text: Service was the worst. They seated a party three that walked in several minutes after us, left an empty table sitting for quite a bit until they finally sat us at another table that finally opened up.  The food was just okay - the tuna nigiri tasted strongly of soap for some reason, the edamame was way over salted, the uni was not fresh and tasted off, and everything else just took a very long time to deliver even tho the joint was mostly empty.  We're probably going elsewhere from now on.

qBnDLwb0m5Svt5Stq3vPhA.text: So I think this place has gone down quite since a year ago, but I guess their longevity may speak contrary to this review.   First point, customer service is awful. Went there last Friday and was waiting for a table for 2 for a few minutes when the server sat us. Great, right? But a few minutes after being seated and waiting for our drinks already, a different server came and asked us to leave (not just move) but they were trying to set up a table for 14 and they need our table. So maybe miscommunication about the tables within the servers. We understand and waited 45 more minutes for a table. We could have left but this meant if we go somewhere else we would be at the end of the wait list again for another hour. So against our better judgment, we stayed.  At the end of the night, our last order did not taste fresh and tasted pretty metallic (which for raw fish means it's not fresh). We told our server about it and she said she will let the kitchen know and not to worry about eating it. When we asked for our check, the host told us "we have to eat all of it or we would be charged" even after our server said not to worry about it. The server and the host argued for a bit and we were just exasperated that I told them to just bring whatever bill.   Maybe it was just the two servers running the dinner shift. Food was other wise good, except for the last sushi order. But definitely not going back cause of the customer service.

KvNxErbSBOy0Qo6_95IxTA.text: Pretty solid AYCE place! I went with my mom and sister and they like the deep fried rolls and ones smothered with sauce which are clearly not the best value. The AYCE is the way to go though regardless because it's $26 and even if you don't eat a ton, order a couple rolls, nigiri orders and appetizers and you'll far exceed that amount for dinner anyways. I wish we did the AYCE because we ended up spending $70 anyways and it would have been $78 for all of us to get all you can eat. I didn't get to try the uni, sweet shrimp, or more expensive pieces so I'll definitely have to come back! Service was attentive even though the place was quite busy and there was a wait on a Wednesday at 6pm for a table so we sat at the bar

icbBuveBwoshi9bFNdeumw.text: This place was pretty delicious. Had sushi at kabuto the last time I was in LV. I feel that sushi mon was just as good, as Kabuto. Kabuto had rare pieces of fish (paid $175) but for the Fifth of the price (paid $35); sushi mon had uni, ama ebi, shishito peppers, and shrimp head miso soup. I went out of sushi mon stuffed. For the fifth of the price I'd recommend sushi mon overs Kabuto.

oI48W3neKShtvHqe00M-wg.text: This is one of my favorite sushi (AYCE) establishments that I've frequented since 2010, it offers fresh quality sushi as well as many other delectable items on their menu.  The atmosphere is casual, clean, and the staff is prompt, courteous and attentive. I found the all you can eat to be reasonably priced, you may need wait because of the popularity and quality but definitely worth the wait.

CbhuYa8iv1TSA5aVoKAPNQ.text: I've been coming to Sushi Mon for almost eight years now.  Nothing has changed.  I think the price has stayed the same the whole time.  For the most part, it's a great meal every time.  The knifework on the fish is sometimes inconsistent on some nights, but my most recent visit was great.  For $26.95, you get AYCE ordered off a menu and made to order.  The quality of the sushi is great.  And they're very good about keeping the ball of rice for each nigiri small.  The ratio of fish to rice is always very good and you don't feel like they're just trying to fill you up on rice by giving you a large ball of rice under each piece of fish.  The selection is expansive.  They do custom orders as well, so I always ask for a few orders of salmon nigiri with yuzu sauce, lemon, and jalapeno.  It's an item that used to be on the menu years ago, but lots of people still order it so they'll know what you're talking about.  If salmon belly is offered on the specials board, get lots of that.  They also have a large variety of rolls and you are allowed to order half rolls.  Aside from sushi, there's a large selection of side dishes as well.  From fried gyoza to udon soup to baked mussels, everything you want is there.  I usually end up eating three bowls of seaweed salad on my own.  And don't forget to get the garlic edamame!  Dessert is amazing as well.  You can get unlimited mochi ice cream.  The menu lists strawberry and mango, but the specials board will usually have green tea.  It's always served at an appropriate temperature so the mochi skin is soft while the ice cream is still solid.  They also have options for scoops of ice cream and the lychee sorbet is delicious.  The best thing they serve here is the grilled hamachi collar.  Don't miss out on it!  And get the salmon collar as well, even though it's not as good.  We missed out on the salmon collar as they ran out around 5:30pm.  Few tips: -Their best nigiri is not on the menu.  It's salmon belly nigiri with yuzu, a slice of lemon, and a slice of jalapeno.  Ask for it and they'll make it.  -You can order hand rolls too.  Get a salmon skin hand roll.  -The best apps are the calamari and the grilled mussels.  Order lots of these.  -Don't get the chicken skewer.  It's always dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon nigiri with yuzu sauce and jalapeno is the best (I forgot to say I wanted sliced lemon on it too)

taMvXQGqjZf5Ot93u2zMeQ.text: Had some late night sushi here with my bestie, as it's right around the corner from her house.  I'm happy to see they keep the late night sushi spot thing going even in the burbs so she doesn't always have to come to my neck off the woods.   They were nice and busy,  but had a few spots for us at the bar.  We started with some sake, and edamame.  My friend ordered the all you can eat and I just did a la cart because I wanted less fluff and more fish (I have learned that when you order the all you can eat sushi,  too...i usually don't get the good cuts,  understandably so). I ordered the salmon belly special and an order of gyoza. Both were super tasty! All of the rolls my friend had looked fabulous,  and the service was wonderful. I'm sure it will become a regular spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adorable how to for all you can eat lol

CZ11dp3nz_-BusEGQ95HZg.text: Lychee sorbet- you must have this between your rounds of sushi and then again at the end of your meal! Sooo refreshing and delicious, I want some more right now! The AYCE sushi is great and such a wide variety to choose from. It's healthy eating for the most part, some deep fried options, but definitely feel good yummy fresh sushi. I totally agree with one of the reviews that noted they hv a good rice-to-fish ratio, not too much rice so u hv room to eat more :-) highly recommend!

LX_TYNwf_NN2pGWwKtmkww.text: My favorite place for all you can eat sushi--and here's the weird thing, I don't eat seafood. I get the veggie rolls, teriyaki chicken, garlic edamame (to die for!!) and more! Although I don't eat seafood, I trust the seafood is good because everyone I've ever taken here, loves it!   Check it out. Be prepared for a decent wait during dinner time, or be like me, and go late night. They are open late into the night!!

oBCu2P2gKkCry4_4Z70IaQ.text: For a small sushi place, the staff can't handle a really busy day. My friend and I are sitting there for quite sometime now and we haven't gotten our orders yet. Service here isn't that great in my opinion. They need more training or a better management.

unbTfuzg0suMUguG9xKb7g.text: I always do the all you can eat special here and have taken over a dozen people here the past months.  Everyone was happy with their apps, sushi and rolls.  Service is always friendly and quick.   This is not Sushi Endo or some super high end place.  For what it is, it is better than 9 out of 10 sushi spots.

GLh1zWRkGXetwdNiAttZ-A.text: This used to be my favorite until they got this cranky, grumpy mean chef who turned me off completely from their Eat-All-You-Can fare.  He looks Asian but don't expect the politeness we've come to expect from Japanese gentlemen.

drtuvpCiVq6Sorsj5JuXug.text: Place was busy, service was good. They did take awhile To get our food to us and I'm pretty sure the table next to us got food before us, even tho we were there first. But it was tasty and reasonably priced. We tried over 5 dishes. All really good. Favorite is the 911.

UCAR4G4azJoGjDxpyksKwQ.text: I just love this place. Since my wife & moved here from South Florida we go to this place every other week. People are friendly, it's ALL YOU CAN EAT (A.Y.C.E), price is good, and more importantly the food is fantastic.   Of course it's not 5 star just because of the overall quality of the food. It is however a very close second to some of these 5star restaurants. The ambiance is not deserving of a True 4 star restaurant however the food is that good couple with experience they it makes the OVERALL experience 4star.   Don't forget to ask for a frequent flyer card. After 10 stamps, you get a free one. We are almost there...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bm_hg7BBxr6KNEuG0cqbVQ.text: Sushi Mon is my absolute favorite sushi restaurant in all of Vegas. Yes, I know that's a bold statement, since there are many excellent sushi options in Las Vegas.  I've eaten at Sushi Mon in more occasions than I'd like to count.  The food is always absolutely amazing, the rolls they've created are very cool and perfectly balanced, and the service is always top notch.  However, be warned that they are a smaller place and very popular!  Be sure to get there early, make a reservation, or expect a wait. It's hard to get a table quickly sometimes. But trust me, it's worth it!

CqP9uY7svZEu-5HMkmc3JQ.text: Our fellow Las Vegas native friend took us here while we were in town. So good that we went twice within a week.  Love the all you can eat option.  My go to has been the pastel roll! And the Uni nigiri with quail egg.   There's nothing like this back in the Bay Area and for the quality AND price? Cmon!! Everyone is sweet here.   IF you do the AYCE, ask for a stamp card.   You will not regret this spot. Plenty of parking, not too many seats so this place fills up quickly.

Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastel at the bottom

aZhAkPx9qBSnGpmYqzbz6Q.text: This is by far my go to sushi spot here in the valley. I've always loved it for the AYCE, and the price point is great. I know all the rolls I like, so I probably have a bit of a bias too. I figured it was just average, or a little below average quality of fish since we're in Vegas and the price was so nice, but not that case. My wife and I went to Hawaii recently, and expected to be blown away by the high price sushi from the recommended sushi spots, but not the case. The clean taste of Sushi Mon held up in the comparison.   Little kids can share for just $3 in the all you can eat. Our 3 year old loves gyoza, and we definitely get our money's worth from that and the nigiri he eats. The staff is super friendly, and there is included dessert with AYCE.   No reservations, but they do have a text system once you arrive if there is a wait.

BqmSiehvIFXZmaahjgB9-w.text: This is a quality neighborhood sushi joint. The service was very friendly and prompt, the fish fresh, and the $26.99 AYCE for dinner was a great deal. We had several rolls: sexy girl, athena, tiger, and 911 (which was disappointingly un-spicy). For nigiri we opted for uni (limit one per person for ayce), salmon, scallop and tuna.  We also had two orders of their calamari which was great. All in all the food was fresh, service friendly and on point. I am marking one star off because Athena roll was bland and 911 roll was not as spicy as advertised.

YKKdL1jNn4UK-Y0eqPgKww.text: OK, my 1st review...here it goes...  Arrived at 8 on a thurs night, they said it would be a 30min wait but it was only like 10-15...so not bad at all.    If you haven't been before it's like $27 i think it was...for all you can eat sushi, rule is no leftovers, and you have to finish the rice.  If your getting rolls I would also recommend ordering half rolls unless u knw of a specific one you really like and know you'll finish with no problems...  We sat at the bar and service was great.  The sushi guy was always checking to see how we were doing with a smile...  Ok, onto the food!  I think I had to be rolled outta the place, everything was so goowd!    Starters: Green shell mussels are a MUST!!!  I'm usually not a fan but they were really good! Dynamite was just ok and a lil oily... Miso soup, tasty and had good amount of tofu.  You can order it with shrimp heads if you want a seafood miso...I think it's alright but my friend loves it... Shrimp tempura...gotta love it!  Serves hot and perfectly fried  For the nigiri everything was so fresh!  We had garlic salmon, yellowtail, and mackerel (my favorite...fishy I knw but yum!). Order was done quick and don't be afraid to ask for any sauce or extras like jalapenos like we did...(not that it didn't taste great, I just always add extra!   =)  Onto the rolls!  We had the 911 roll...like a spicy tuna roll on crack!  Doesn't seem hot when you put it in your mouth, but like 3.2 seconds later it hits ya and your looking for high quality H2O!   =p  JJ roll...tempura, avocado, asparagus, cream cheese...tasty!!!  And the Sexy Girl Roll...hard time remembering what's in this one...shrimp, scallions, crab meat, avocado maybe?  Very good!...BUT!  This is why I recommend ordering half rolls till u knw what u really like...it was towards the end and was SO hard finishing,   I did (somehow!) save enough room for desert which is included...choice between green tea, red bean and tempura ice cream.  And vanilla and strawberry mochi balls.  We had strawberry mochi balls, great way to end meal!  And red bean ice cream!  Yummo!    Great way to get GOOD sushi!  Much better then strip places in my opinion!    Ok, that was my 1st review!!!  Hope it wasn't too long n hope it helps!!!    =)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left to right...Mackerel, Yellowtail, Garlic Salmon...with some of the Sexy Lady Rolls in background!  Mmmmmm!  =)
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green shell Mussels...SO Gooowd!

ApdARPDGMpMdbvv_whSV7w.text: On a recent trip from Oahu, we ran into this restaurant while searching for an all you can eat sushi joint... The 4 of us got there at about 7:30pm on a Wednesday night and had about an hour and a half wait. Besides the reservationist/cashier being a little on the rude side, and the all you can eat sushi menu only allowing each person only 1 order of uni, ama ebi, and the hamachi kama each, the fish was very fresh, and they had nice size cuts of fish on their nigiri sushi. All in all I'd give it a thumbs, and will be returning there on my next visit to Las Vegas! I just hope the reservationist/cashier doesn't read this or the next time my wait will be even longer, buahahaha.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tough To Beat - all you can eat sushi...Generous and very fresh cuts of fish.
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi / Sake
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My 1 allowed order of Hamachi Kama

03HZo-QIaqG5Vd7XiqzBOA.text: I never eat in the restaurant but pick up sushi frequently. Every time I have ordered to go, it has been awesome. Good quality sushi and made fresh. Only reason giving 4 stars is because the workers could be a little more friendly.

0rsnITpN8hW85TtOdJ8n9Q.text: Fish is not fresh,  sushi is salty and fried tempura ice cream-is generic and old.  Shrimp tempura is fast and cold,   Sauce is. Cold and light. Calamari loos like a fried tofu chalk, poke is tasteless.  Don't know why this place is full. Won't go back here anymore.

vrzYg23DJvNQIg96ijv7aw.text: This place was packed. So much so in fact that I had to wait almost an hour just for a seat! I was excited and thought it was going to be fantastic! Boy was I wrong. The only reason I'm even giving them two stars is because the chef was really cool and checked on us very often. But there was literally nothing on the menu worth the money, at least from what I tried. The food was just overly bland. I got the spicy tuna roll, regular tuna roll, albacore sashimi, shrimp tempura, and spider roll. I could never recommend this place to someone, unless you don't mind extremely low quality AYCE. Disappointing, because I was really hyped up because of how busy it was.

vJ1jx78Zw94XbM5Z0RA28g.text: Great AYCE place that my sister took me to. She insisted on going to this place when we were in vegas for a couple days and I have to say it was well worth it. The restaurant isn't that big, but it just shows that great things come in small packages! :)  They have a great selection of sushi and specialty rolls for you to choose from.  The staff is friendly and seated us right away. I normally don't opt to sit at the bar but the decision turned out to be great. We were able to order directly from the chef. The fish was fresh and rolls had a little bit more rice than I'd like but the flavors of the rolls made up for it. I ordered the Pixie roll. It's a play on the spider roll and was so delicious. If I still had room after all the different rolls I tried, I probably would have ordered myself another Pixie roll.   They offered a wide range of appetizers as well as desserts (not many places includes dessert in the AYCE menu). For you seaweed lovers, they have seaweed salad on the menu, we each ordered a bowl. They also offered baked mussels, miso  soup, calamri, and much much more! I ended my meal with a generous scoop of green tea ice cream, and my sister had a strawberry mochi ice cream. I will definitely be going back when I'm in town.

hC5mCBl-GfXO4-IbmWM-lA.text: All you can eat is a great deal!!! So yummy, fast...clean environment... just gets busy and idk why they don't allow all you can eat to sit outside.

cL58QjfHk0YiSIpH12Zgsw.text: love this place! addicted to the lemon roll and rainbow roll!

ZSjT-6_1xWW01pmRkvEXdg.text: I live in the Bay Area so I love fresh fish and sushi rolls. After hearing my cousin, who lives in Vegas, tell me this is the best AYCE spot, I had to stop by. I got seated at the bar right away. I give one star to the staff for being nice and attentive. One star for the quick service and getting my food out quickly. One star for some pretty fresh Salmon nigiri. But their rolls were just not good enough. None of the rolls wowed me enough. I liked a couple rolls but it just wasn't that great. I really liked how big their menu was and how many options they had but I don't think I'll be back again.

jtK0Jb-5cqU5Kc1NT-eIEw.text: Sushi is awesome and delicious, however, seating is extremely limited. I would recommend ordering for pick up because it is always busy!!

oxBc-aZ-IP41jHdQMdJanw.text: Came here with my cousins who are Vegas locals.  They have an all you can eat time frame which was cool.  Waiters were attentive and food came out quick.  no complaints

OMpQAbtNhSD3KzsNKaTFwg.text: Definitely off the beaten path, but so worth the drive and the over an hour wait! My girls and I made this our last stop before heading back home to Cali.   We ordered salmon belly, yellowtail belly, baked mussels, and various rolls that I can't even remember all their names. We even ordered a baked chicken roll, which was not typical, but was unexpectedly tasty! The salmon, yellowtail and baked mussels were my favorites though. The fish was very fresh. Sometimes it's best to keep it simple, especially when you're eating so much!  We thought we would not have much room for dessert, so we decided to share a scoop of strawberry mochi ice cream, lychee sorbet and green tea ice cream. The lychee sorbet was really good, with real chunks of lychee on the inside, but the real winner was the strawberry mochi ice cream. We loved it so much we ordered two more scoops.   Service was good, though there was a little misunderstanding with quantity (make sure you know how much is in an order) and you can't beat the lunch price of $22 per person.   My only wish is that they would serve uni for lunch, but will definitely be back!

RyQiZ77UhgF8uT4C2TT_PQ.text: This place has much choices to choose from.  The price is a bit pricey for one hour of sushi and desserts, because by my 3rd dish I was already stuffed not even 15 minutes.  The choices were awesome though, warm sake was great, and never can go wrong with kirin beer.  The food was delicious except when I tried their spicy ahi, DANG, that was spicy.

cU7ySBPW3kA38jeC2TLQ6w.text: When you just need some quick and affordable good sushi:  I love this place and its prices. And did I say it's fast?  Great place for all you can eat. Packed with tables and chairs and other diners, the atmosphere is busy and electric. Great place to bring a group of friends and just have a good time.  Cheers!

CbdmEulwX7cCac_kVrKb-A.text: The fish was fresh and the service was excellent. This was not my first time here but my first checkin with Yelp.

OCVtt3TBvOPXOQ6PvonxZg.text: I eat here once a month. Love it !!! I personally think they should allow children to bring in their own food because not all kids eat sushi. But that's there rules!

i2ybfCJJEj0GxgTsHBmXcg.text: The great sushi (and the great deal of $21 for all you can eat!) have made this place a lunch habit of mine. I really like that they offer half rolls as an option for the all you can eat, that way you try/enjoy a variety of rolls - they do have a lot to choose from.   It's pretty small and does tend to fill up; that being said, I've never waited for a table. One more thing about the atmosphere, the music in the main restaurant is always top 40 blah. In the restrooms they play some throw backs. The last time I was there I heard The Humpty Dance, I think they need to switch up the stations and get that playing where the tables are.

tVmsx9c38EWQy6mrcHxcNQ.text: Oh I love this place! This is a cool little spot that has awesome sushi. The all you can eat is awesome bc it is worth it. Been here many times and will be back!!

dvznBqb3s5rfZHBrU6VF5Q.text: Ate here today with my two friends. It's a pretty small place and it's popular so there was a 45 minute wait for a table at 8ish, which is to be expected. We just wandered around while we waited.   Once we got seated they got us drinks pretty fast and we sat at the bar so we were able to tell them right away that we were doing ayce and start ordering.   I wasn't a fan of their cucumber salad. I think they should have it chopped differently. I also wasn't a fan of the naked mussels or tempura.   The red snapper was delicious as was the garlic tuna.   The wait staff was terribly unattentive. It made their 60 minute rule for ayce seem unfair. They checked on us maybe twice.  All in all it's ok but I prefer going elsewhere

Q3pf44d0Nz9cA_G0eoRzkw.text: Very disappointed in the new staff and changes in the restaurant. Before we moved this place was awesome! Now they have decided to use a new seating system that is no longer first come first serve. We were a group of two and kept getting passed over for groups of 4-6 that came way later than us. Sushi Mon you let us down and that's sad cause we always made a trip to eat here every time we visit and always recommend you to any friends who was visiting. We waited over an hour and 1/2, when your text said 40mins. Double sad that we left when you 3 empty seats open at the bar. At the two hour mark you sent a text and called but we had long gone since your hostess was rude and just didn't care.

97LgrPq9Fqa3YXM1bZej5Q.text: I miss this place! After living in Vegas for 6 years, it's truly one of the things I miss most.  I used to go to Sushi on Rainbow when I lived on West Trop back in '99 and it was good. After I bought  a place in Silverado Ranch in '01, Sushi Mon opened up 6 months later and it was great. I believe it's Japanes owned and often the staff are foreign exchange students going to UNLV.   The service has always been good, and the sushi a great value. Love the late night all-you-can-eat. Kind of funny how they have to over emphasize the "rules" of all you can eat, but I guess it comes with the territory.  I get back to Vegas 3-4 times a year and always make sure I have a car to visit Sush-Mon and the buffet and M Casino.  I have lived in Hawaii and now Seattle and I still think and crave Sushi-Mon in the desert of Vegas more often than the sushi establishments in these oceanside States.

loOXzI7TDwhK95P3vdwVpA.text: My favorite AYCE sushi in L.V.  Kind service, fish is always good, really above other all you can eat sushi bars. I love their rolls too. This is a place I never miss when I come to this city.

64COmuolTsx7vxH55MfV9A.text: I came in here on a Thursday night with my brother. It was extremely busy & took about 30 minutes before we were seated. we ordered AYCE and it was delish! It's a bit on the smaller side. the fish was so fresh and tasty that I would definitely come back. price for the dinner AYCE was expensive @ $26. overall, very good!

2lIXxIOB1yjbP8VMsN2aoQ.text: I've come here twice already and the first time I came here it was extremely busy yet i got all my food fast and the service was EXCELLENT. But today i don't know why things are different? Like seriously it was not busy at all and the guy kept messing up our order and the food was coming out extremely slow and it was irritating me because I had somewhere to go. I expected to be out of there around 5 but now it's 6 and I have work at 7 and I was supposed to go to is sweet ugh irritates me when I can't get my daily sweets  like seriously I ordered baked green mussles first and that was the last thing that I got before paying the check. I think our server was Anthony? Well he kept messing up our orders and I asked for the mussles like 3-4 times before I got them. And I ordered one green salad and a poki tuna but I ended up getting two green salads and no poki tuna I had to remind them twice. Like cmon guys it wasn't even busy. Definitely not coming back here when I have somewhere to be because that just totally took all my time and I'm always on a time crunch

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano roll (:
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous salmon nigiri
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Supreme salmon

uyknHQ5qbMN_MOePsz2V1g.text: Consistently amazing sushi and decent service. All you can eat is the only way to go, make sure the whole group gets it so everyone can share. Great miso soup, baked green mussels and an interesting dynamite, which is served piping hot and in a mini cast iron.   Friday and Saturday nights are always slammed so prepare to get there early and maybe have a coffee next-door while you wait for your table. More patrons than seats is always a good sign!

hlyS41-ByBo7e4QiSXeZ5A.text: Best sushi you can get for an all-you-can-eat! food is always fresh and cant complain about the prices. Only downside, the restaurant is a little small.

2NVMZzWjpigvMxV4EDtaOQ.text: I love u guys to death! But these continued 30-45 min waits are getting old! When are u going to expand this location!? And if u aren't u need to create some kind of VIP program!! U should have some kind of VIP card for ur customers that are at ur establishment all the time! The ones u know by name! Or maybe start taking reservations! I have to take my business else where tonight! PLEASE, as a loyal customer, please start takin care of us!!

IW_vF8t2KUWcXHx_SL0_Og.text: ok - a little bit too overrated.  They change their daily specials so the specials we had today were Salmon Belly and Yellowtail belly: Salmon belly - WOW amazing. Very buttery Yellowtail belly - nothing to write home about.  So bad I only got 1 order.  Con:  their rice with their sushi was horrible.  I think I had the bad end of the rice because most of my sushi had cold and 40% hardening rice!  Uni was NOT fresh.  Sweet Shrimp was NOT fresh either!  it was a chore to eat.   Pro: Sashimi salad, unbelievable dessert (Get the ice cream)  If you are a big eater, its a good bargain.  you get a HUGE order of yellowtail cheeks as well! Don't come here for quality.

AJ9cvC4y5o-1LJGsJhNlmA.text: All you can eat lunch is $21.95 and dinner is 24.95, I think. Time limit for lunch is 45 mins and dinner is 60 mins. Service is okay. Food is good, but I can't say I was blown away. For some reason, I like the AYCE in S Rainbow Blvd better. The ones that stood out to me are baked mussels, and volcano roll.

8c2c9V44TrFdvsLiIOztJA.text: I vote the next location opens in the San Gabriel Valley, California! It's painful to have to wait until a Vegas trip to fill my belly with this delicious fish (and mochi ice cream)!  The cuts of fish were above what is typical for an AYCE sushi gig. The scallop nigiri was fresh and tasty. The cut of fish simply named "white fish" was really good, too. I could eat unagi anything all day long.   They have many rolls to experience as well. My personal favorite was the spider roll which was huge, and had the best combo of ingredients and sauces. I like that you can order half orders of rolls, so that you can try a greater variety.   The desserts were wonderful, too! The vanilla and strawberry mochi ice cream balls were the best. The tempura ice cream ball was next best, and the green tea (wasabi-looking) ice cream came in at a close third place.  The best part about this place is all of the choices! You get to try such a variety of great-tasting different things, and even experiment with things you've never had the opportunity to try before.   An entertainment aspect of Sushi Mon is they have some pretty awesome names for their rolls... We had many "that's what she said" comments with their creative names, especially the famed "Monster Roll". I also can't wait to try multiples of the Orgasm Roll next time! Should be a real treat! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monster Roll

RJ9U4GHKwhO6xUn9QtAT7A.text: Finally, an AYCE sushi spot that has variety, fresh sushi, great service, and the whole menu is included. It's a bit of a drive from the strip but worth the trip, especially for their sweet shrimp, Toro, and salmon belly sushi.  The best part is it's only $26. For what they serve its totally worth it. You'll spend that inside a hotel/casino cafe easily.

DuBLaXzAn1Jz77Gu0Fa4RQ.text: What a deal!  The place was pretty packed at 2 PM on a Sunday; our local friend said that lotsa people like Sushi Mon and it seems so from the reviews.   We went for lunch and saw the lunch special: 2-roll combination comes with a side salad and miso soup. Our waitress was courteous and came back several times to take our order (I need pictures to decide!).   I ended up ordering the spicy shrimp and Unagi roll.   The food didn't come out all at the same time, but when you're busy, you're busy, and she brought the food out as soon as it was ready.  I thought they'd serve half (4 and 4) roll portions to make one roll but they actually served a 16-piece lunch.  Oh. Emm. Jee.  That was too much, but the rolls were good; soup was good (Miso generally tastes the same to me where ever), salad was fine (too much dressing for me). But it was a steal @ $8.50  :)  I would definitely return with an appetite and with or without a limited budget.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dl_GdxCUHM7QNvEt5IVKwg.text: After a long night of work at a restaurant you're usually starving from looking at food all night! Sushimon took care of all of mine and my coworkers grumbling bellies. There were 12 of us and we went crazy ordering SO many rolls and appetizers and desserts. Being able to order everything AYCE was awesome!  Their menu is huge and the soft crab roll had to be a favorite of tge table. The cajun tuna was my personal favorite. The service was surprisingly good, the food came at a steady rate. Its nice that they were open late enough to accomodate us. I will be returning and will pay more attention to what I eat lol.

DCn9Ssym-BT5NljtBJbsSQ.text: They have really good sushi rice, but the construction of their rolls leaves something to be desired. They also do a good job slicing the fish.   Their rolls are a mess, and not really flavorful. Service was good, with the exception of the waitress saying, "Hot plate!" and then promptly setting that hot plate down right in front of my 10 month old daughter who enjoys grabbing everything. The waitress may not have had kids, so that may explain why she would do that. Would I come here again? Probably not.

wWJ5eLS6z3dK-xaO6vXI6w.text: Place is not what it use to be. Wait time is very long for mediocre sushi. I would only go for the tempura ice cream. Quality in sushi has declined.

6zhqoTA-N3NdPbQg6XFfNA.text: The best all you can eat I've had in Las Vegas.  Quality of the food is excellent. Wait staff is excellent.  And the value is excellent.   the only reason I'm rating this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the long waits during dinner hours. Especially on weekends. Often times the wait is more than 30 minutes.   I hope this place gets to expand and gets more seating!

XOcif2aCRRMZVtagPImv8w.text: Ill be honest they have delicious food BUT THEIR SERVICE IS TERRIBLE! We waited 15 minutes until a server notice us that were still waiting. Yes 15 minutes bfore he ask what we wanted for drink! There are 3-4 servers walking around lookin at every table but ddnt even bother asking us. I understand its busy but even the two people in their front desk didnt call a server to get us started with our orders!

H5qaBu77rs3PDZ-t9TiLUQ.text: Food was delicious and everyone working there were so sweet and attentive!  I got the hurricane, ecstasy, Domingo, miso and a seaweed salad all yum!!!!

NeenqygNKG5EL9tOjNby6w.text: had sushi mon last night with a friend.. amazing selection for all you can eat sushi including appetizers (I had seaweed salad) and includes desserts like lychee ice cream and Moshee! sushi was fresh and came fairly quickly even though they were packed wall to wall.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy girl roll in the front, hurricane roll in the back left and I forget the other name! But sooo good

FJTU8V1x7f-7xe5L_S-VNg.text: The host was the manager I'm sure and was the most unaccommodating person ever. Do u want business or not? We had a party of 10 people and we were willing to squish and he was NOT willing to accommodate?! Wtf...  Nigiri comes with a big piece of rice thats hella hard, and we were supposed to eat all of them?! I would have if they cooked it better. and employee kept pushing us to finish the damn rice. Ugh  They gave us 45 min limit for all u can eat but it took them half hour to bring out each order...what?  Mediocre in every aspects.

YMzQvWzuek4j1IPfWLRpZg.text: I'm from LA and my family was staying down the street over at South Point. My dad found this before we left for the vacation and decided we wanted to try it.  Originally, he was going to do a la carte instead of AYCE. He definitely does not regret his choice.   Sitting at the bar is a better experience in my opinion because you don't need to order thru any of the servers. The chefs were all Japanese except one and even though Yoshi, the chef who helped us, didn't look Japanese, he's from the same city my dad is from. Yoshi made our experience better because he made sure to check up on us every once in a while, while still attending to other people at the bar.   As for the other servers, some were good and some weren't. The younger ones were friendlier and had better attitudes and I learned to ask from them.   Food wise, everything comes out quick, even when you order items like takoyaki or baked mussels that are prepared in the back. This may be because we sat in front of the chef who would hand it to us but even the fried items came out quick.   The rolls are mediocre. What I like though, is that you can order a half order instead of the whole thing to avoid getting full and allowing you to try more food. Where I go in LA, they don't have that option so it;s best to go with a big group or you'll get full off 2 orders of rolls.   My absolute favorite thing about this place,though, is that dessert is included as AYCE. I don't know if it;s a Nevada thing but dessert is always a la carte at other AYCE sushi places. And the dessert is good. They have tempura ice cream, mochi, creme brulee, and sorbets. The lychee sorbet was definitely my favorite but we also tried the yuzu sorbet and the green tea creme brulee.   Overall, it was a really good experience and I wish LA had this place. Thank you Yoshi, and the three servers who were kind.

DtiLDDSYs5IeuxiX0sKcAA.text: Found this place on multiple friend's recommendation list and it does not disappoint.  AYCE sushi made to order is delicious!  The variety is awesome and you can eat anything you want from sushi to appetizers to dessert.    For dinner at least, there are two dishes that are limited I believe to two servings per person.  The uni (which I think is sea urchin) and the sweet shrimp, neither of which I've tried, but I've heard they are good.    They do not offer plain sashimi, and they require you to eat all the rice on your sushi else they will charge a le carte.  Not unreasonable as their sushi does taste fresh and good quality for an AYCE.  No real recommendation on which sushi to eat.  Try them all for yourself!

mRzGiFK8yv48MqTkfe8abw.text: Great sushi.  Hamachi handroll was delicious.  Fish was fresh service was good.  Enjoyed the white tuna.  They had Toro on their special and it was fresh.  Service was good.

5RXtgPRGIjnzhhcoskESZQ.text: We've been here a few times and Arturo is great with recommendations. I would give them 5 stars, but in the evenings the wait time can be pretty long and that can be a pain but they're good at calling when tables are ready and the staff are friendly. Tip - I love the Cajun albacore best! It has a lemon hint to it and it's delicious!

mlbx7xTtaBTzGzuDKXy-2Q.text: Friend: OMG THIS PLACE HAS THE BEST AYCE SUSHI EVARRRRRRRR. Me: It is off strip, hells no, I'm not driving out there.  Friend: What if I got my gf to drive us out there?  Me: Sighhhhhhhhhhh, if you insist...can't believe I'm leaving off strip to get buffet.   Okay, okay, Friend, you are correct...this place is pretty delish. Worth the off strip excursion. Loved that they have half rolls (plus a good variety of rolls that doesn't just consist of Cali roll + (insert topping)) and a really interesting selection of appetizer-like food (yellowtail collar & ahi poke!). Their cuts of fish are super fresh (which is super impt for ayce sushi). Didn't pay too much attention to the ordering because my friend is a regular here (...and he doesn't even live in Vegas -____-) so I just gobbled up everything he ordered. Their dessert selection is pretty amazing (tempura ice cream, lychee sorbet, red bean + green tea ice cream, mochi!) and they don't skimp on the portion size.   Nifty that they have a stamp card (10 = 1 free buffet)! Service was great. About $30 (with tax & tip) for lunch. Easy parking.

zktzOUiMyaFcSo6T3p4J3g.text: Beware!!!!!  It pains me to write this review, but if I can get one person to avoid the mistake we made tonight, it makes this yelp review worthwhile.  This place used to be a staple for my wife and me every Vegas visit, but we will never come here again.  We are disappointed that we have to find a new sushi place to come to, but this place is definitely not it anymore.  Sushi Mon changed ownership recently, and it really shows.  The cute Japanese lady is no longer at the cash register.  The new ownership charges the same price, but everything good about this place has gone.  The nigiri now comes with huge pieces of rice.  If you are a rice connoisseur, this place is for you.  It's a shame what the new management is trying to pull.  On top of that, the fish is not fresh.  My wife ordered a spicy scallop handroll, and it was overflowing with imitation crab.  I argued with the sushi chef, and he opened the handroll up and showed us the 2 pieces of scallop hidden in the bed of imitation crab.  Really??  The presentation of the salmon skin handroll looked like a kindergarten art project.    The sushi chefs are inexperienced and can't get the sauce right.  The rolls are either too salty or falling apart.

ZPfebEoWHtfoR0-nCY_6DA.text: Came through for AYCE lunch on a Friday. We arrived at 12pm, only 15 minutes after opening, and the place was already buzzing. By 12:15 it was packed, although the lunch crowd had cleared out by 1pm.  The food was great! My favorite was the Exstacy roll. I also like that they put extra sauces right on the menu, and of course they are included in AYCE. The only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5, is that they did not have any sashimi on the menu. Some other AYCE places will limit you to one order of sashimi per person, but I appreciate having the option. But, their fish was very fresh so we did get a couple orders of plain sushi.

VfKsiUo5C-hJmLAn56aU8g.text: I like the night shift chefs and servers. They served me sushi with very little rice throughout my meal. Very good cuts as well. The chef accomodated my food allergy very well. Sometimes I have to wait but the chef would always apologize and explain though I can see that they are preparing for someone else's order (which I understand). But when they are not busy, the chef always goes to my side whenever I'm almost done, to see if I want to order more. One time I ordered sake nigiri and the chef asked if I want belly (not on menu) instead. Yes pls! Very satisfied. 5 stars. Left $10 tip.   I went back for late lunch with a friend. Only got one tray of wasabi and ginger (good my friend doesn't like them so I took that 1 tray for myself). Rice was very little on my first order then they put more rice after that  (even my friend commented on the significant increase of rice on my nigiris). The cuts (small and not properly cut) are also worse on my next orders--I can tell they are skimping fish on me. The chef did not want to accomodate my food allergy so I wasn't able to get one of the sushi that I want. 1st server ignored us even when he see me looking at him(he's doing his best not to make eye contact) and the other server heard us talking about it while looking at the 1st server, 2nd server went straight to the table beside us (which was already asked by the 1st server) then she proceeded to serve other tables before we were able to make her feel pity on us. Our water wasn't filled right right away and had to flag the 3rd server to get water. 0 stars. Left $1.24 tip.  Very disappointed, I keep bragging to my friend how good I was taken care of from my prior visit. Tip: go late at night or maybe give lunch servers their tip in advance MAYBE they will take care of you. Or NOT to request anything if you're going on lunch or early dinner time if you can't go late at night. And yes, I was friendly to them until they keep ignoring us.

kdjI031FGXr-ivsI7Oml9g.text: I love this place so much.  I get so frustrated reading other reviews that say "mediocre sushi and service." Come to New York City and you'll see mediocre sushi and service at Trump prices.   This is a STEAL. $21.95 (lunch) $26.95 (dinner) for all you can eat menu that's so extensive? Yes please!  Now this place has a little more seating available compared to the other location but also gets twice as busy.  Their service here is amazing. The waiters and busboys were all very nice and attentive. Our waiter (Archer, who's adorably cute) was very friendly, attentive, and fast.   All the sushi tasted fresh. Salmon and salmon belly were deeeeeeelicious.  Ikura with quail egg -- yummm!  I am ADDICTED to their baked green mussels. I could really have about 10 orders to myself and miss the taste about 5 minutes after I leave.   I will be here any time I visit Vegas.

BSIU9QdFewrVCPWzECUpgw.text: Not the best sushi I have ever eaten, but it was pretty darn good.  We went on a Saturday night and had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated.  We were going to get the all you can eat special but you only get an hour to eat and after looking at their menu, we thought it would be cheaper to go the a la carte route.  I got the screaming orgasm and calamari appetizers.  Both were tasty and I loved the screaming orgasm sauce.  My husband got the salmon teriyaki, which was not the best, but not bad either.  I got the chicken teriyaki and was pretty good, not the best.  But, for food value, this place rocks.  Our entrees came with miso soup, small salad, tempura, and a small california roll!! Our bill ended up being just at $40, not too shabby if you ask me.  I will definitely return.

vX0OtvuKtq1OffvE602qQg.text: I've had Sushi Mon on my radar for a long time, but since it is not anywhere near my house, nor is it around anywhere I tend to go all the time it has been collecting dust on my "Bookmark" shelf. Luckily lunch with a friend who works in the area happened to arise, so my reason to waste some gas to come here was justified at last!  First off we arrived right when they opened at 11:45 AM and we were not the only ones waiting. About four other parties walked in the door at the same time as us. We were seated immediately at a two-person table and we let them know we would be doing the AYCE lunch special.   I've heard really great things about Sushi Mon so I was hoping it would not disappoint. The restaurant itself is on the smallish side and decor is pretty much minimal and non-existent. Oh well, as long as the fish is good right?   I skipped appetizers and went straight into the sushi. I figured I wouldn't fill myself up on anything but fish. Our server quickly took our order.   Nigiri: Garlic Tuna Yum Yum Scallop Salmon   All were good, but my favorite was the Yum Yum Scallop. If I were to go back, this would be on the menu for a return trip.  Rolls: 1/2 J.J. Roll - Lovely roll, really enjoyed the addition of asparagus and avocado. Lemon Roll - My friend ordered this one and I had a piece, it was very fragrant and refreshing Chubby (5 pieces) - Good roll, nothing spectacular, but well put together, the soybean paper around it is a nice change.  Hand-Rolls: Per usual I ordered a spicy tuna hand roll. I always do a sushi places. This one was tasty, so I actually had two. =o^-^o=  Other: I did order the Poke bowl. It was okay, nothing special, but at least it was not overly-salted. I ended my meal with strawberry mochi ice cream - yummy! But so cold it hurt my teeth. But. That's just because I have sensitive teeth. Tee hee.  Overall:   I believe the "hype" is True. This place serves up GOOD, QUALITY sushi. And that is what matters when you are eating raw fish. Nothing tasted strange or wrong to me. The fish was the perfect temperature. The presentations were simple, but the rolls were made well. I would reccomened Sushi Mon and I would love to go back sometime if I am in the area.

zZUB8-Bl6HGG1GTW5saIUA.text: We are fans, closest to our house and last one to try. The service is awesome, lots of staff and friendly faces. My hubby is a fan of AYCE and tried many items, enjoying them all. I tried rolls, and am happy that they office 1/2 rolls, BUT they are 5 huge pieces. I ordered 2 and couldn't even finish. The miso soup was so-so, I didn't have mine...it was scalding when it arrive and later I did not want to use up valuable space. We tried the shu-mai (terrible, should not have ordered) and chicken yakitori (it was fine) apps, but apps are a mistake if you are there for sushi and rolls. I truly wish that the AYCE places offered True half rolls or made their rolls smaller. Bigger isn't better in this case because you cant enjoy variety if you have a small stomach. I had 4 pieces left and the server explained if I left more than 2 she would have to charge me ala carte. Didn't matter, my meal (2 half rolls and yakitori) didn't even come to the 26.95 price, actually I would have saved money. But for those like me who's eyes are bigger than their stomach, beware. I understand their position, just good to know. Awesome red bean and green tea ice cream. Everything we saw coming from behind the sushi counter looked amazing, everything fresh and the temp expected. We went at 5pm, good time, not too crowded and we know this place does get crowded regularly. Nice selection and many items that don't have cream cheese (wish that had not become a thing). Anyway, recommend this place highly.

FZ_g9onXfVhLAnjdEKUlSA.text: Everyone can argue which AYCE sushi is best in Sin City but in my sushi-venturing tenure, Mon is the best. (Note: OPINION)  This is the sister franchise of the renowned Goyemon, in which I was disappointed with in terms of service. There is practically no difference other than the infrastructure  because they serve practically the same rolls with maybe some minor differences.  Every visit I've had here, they have been on top of their service. The servers tend to lack personalities but who needs personality when you have great service? I routinely begin my rolls with the Volcano, which can take a bit longer but Mon takes a reasonable 5 minutes max as to Goyemon which took approximately 20 minutes. Why such a discrepancy? No excuse other than terrible service.  My favorites: Volcano, sexy girl, ecstasy, philadelphia, hurricane, 911(warning: very spicy hence, the name), cynthia, & stacy. All cooked to near perfection and delight. Fresh avocado, fish, rice, etc.  Some tips: - Order by half rolls unless you have a large party. I'm sure you're here to stuff yourselves but you should take advantage of the diversity of the rolls you can get with an AYCE menu. Diversity over quantity. - Make your order subsequently to receiving. Start with one roll then once it arrives, order your next so that you don't have to wait long periods of time cause sushi does take some meticulous care to make. - Chew slowly! Since sushi has rice, it has a lot of carbs. No need to be rapid since you get all you can eat cause the faster you eat, the more carbs you consume which fills up your stomach. - Get a stamp card! Whether or not you're an out of town visitor, you're destined to come back since it's so good and every 10 stamps is one free AYCE meal. They really do accumulate, especially when you come with big parties.   Don't forget to leave some room(I doubt it) for dessert! They serve green tea ice cream, mochi ice cream (strawberry & vanilla, lychee, etc.   Overall, I truly enjoy being a local here. You can never go wrong with an endless selection of sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picture menu for noobs like me

pwBqIqnQ2C8rcNmZlMm13g.text: AYCE sushi! U said the magic words! I'm such a sucker for good sushi! We came here on the last day of our trip.  It was 20mins away from the strip, located in an Asian strip mall.  Wait time was abt an hour.  Place is small, seats abt 50 at most? Service was great! we had Hamachi and salmon belly (which both r soooo good) baked muscles, and tons of rolls.  We started to order everything and anything, since we all were pretty hungry.    it was $22/person.  Which is an awesome price!!!  Thanks for being a hidden gem!

t_suaPj0Bi4qs_4x7aYyuw.text: Favorite sushi place in town! I always go for all you can eat, but also enjoy their bento lunches. Price is average compared to other sushi joints. Fish is fresh and tasty. The only bummer is that they don't offer as many good baked scallop roll options as Osaka, but that has never stopped me from coming here for either an excellent lunch or late-night food option. Also right next to the Japanese/Tokyo store; a great location!

wDdsyqJQ9ZUiMxZZvwuAsA.text: Nice atmosphere ! Felt very welcome when we walked in ! Staff was very nice & friendly , sushi was on point . I loved it , definitely recommend this place , I love sushi , they even serve half sushi just in case your almost to the knock out point of falling asleep . But sushi tastes exactly like my job's sushi SUPER awesome !!!

IlIsnqd3klxbMnE8rmXRFQ.text: Having eaten my way through most of the AYCE sushi places in Vegas, I can say that some definitely shine bright (more creative rolls, better fish selection, etc), but Sushi-mon wins every time in overall value, consistency and freshness.  Admittedly, I have history here, so this review may be somewhat biased. I've been coming here since the advent of AYCE sushi in this town. Though I've ventured off to try other places, I somehow always find myself back here. It sort of has a "Cheersish" vibe for me.  The main reason I love it here is that I know I will get fresh, consistent product. I have never received anything less than that. At a lot of places in town, you may receive old or frozen fish which is very disconcerting. Sushi-mon somehow always has beautifully fresh fish.   In addition, they are FAST! I order something (in most cases, LOTS of things) and it's on the table in 5 minutes. Sushi-mon chefs seem to get a kick out of the people who order ridiculous amounts of food, so they send it out as quick as they can.   Speaking of the staff, they are as friendly as can be. Fransisco is my "go-to" server and he always takes care of us. Paul, the busser/runner, knows us well too and always keeps our drinks filled and our table clean.   But on to the food...  As I said, we usually order our fair share of nigiri: hamachi, garlic tuna, aji, hirame, hotate with yuzu...but our favorites are the hokkigai (surf clam) and sake (salmon). I've never had surf clam as fresh and delicious as theirs. If you've tried surf clam somewhere else and hated it, try it here. Trust me.  The rolls are no joke as well. Some favorites are the Yebisu, Stacey and Hurricane roll, but I've yet to try one I didn't like. Another tip: you can get most rolls in "hand roll" form. I like to get yumyum scallops, california and spider rolls that way. Also, try some baked green mussels. They're creamy and briny, yet sweet and unctuous. If you're still hungry after all that, get the Frying Jason roll. It's delicious, but it'll put you over the edge. Their side dishes (miso soup, tempura shrimp, sesame chicken, calamari) are terrific as well.   Ok. That's enough. This review is making me hungry. I'll see y'all there! :::insert Cheers theme song here:::

QE21gXBTmN9cF_TzW0gHbg.text: Everyone says this place is better than Sushi Kaya but I have to disagree. The rolls here are nothing special and I'm a roll girl... The salmon nigiri is pretty fresh and good but that itself won't keep me from coming here. They don't have too may options with rolls or side dishes either. I would only come here if I really wanted AYCE and was in the area. Though the service is very attentive and sweet.

8q1r8-3ULGk8kvZ0TQheFg.text: Every time I came to Vegas, this is the first restaurant I will go to immediately. Generally I order the all you can eat, most of them I like are appetizers. My favorite Japanese restaurant. The only thing I really dislike is that we have to wait for at least 40 minutes for dinner. No reservation.

JGO5DNX8CwPeTxgW2a-MeQ.text: Love the food!  Love the crew!!! Hate the wait :-)

1TNns3gNkO02Ivs8cc9GYg.text: I'm sorry. I have to give this place a 1 star. Server sucks.. waiting on our food and they already gave us our check. Never coming here again! I am only going to sushi Mon on Sahara where they have better customer service there.

HdoM1MZRO-0cqyrc3l1HtQ.text: I have finally returned since writing my first Yelp review.  I really love this place and really wanted the opportunity to review them.  Tonight, I finally have that opportunity.  I suggested this place to a friend of mine for some drinks and Japanese food.  I arrived at the location and to my surprise, it was empty!  No line, no waiting, no headache.  SCORE!  I chose to sit at a table of two rather than the sushi bar.  the tables are a little close from the others, however, I've learned to deal with that from my frequent past visits.  The servers are clean, wear all black and really pays attention to the need of their customers.  I appreciate them coming around often to fill up my water, or clearing any plates and debris from the table.  Makes me feel special :)  Tonight my friend got a $10 Teriyaki chicken dinner plate.  Added was my meal:  A bowl of salted edamame, an appetizer of the Yellowtail collar, a bowl of the California salad, a larger Sapporo beer and a large hot sake.   Everything mentioned above came to $52.00 with tax and ample tip.  The edamame was lightly salted and not overpowering.  It came out so warm, I was in heaven!  My favorite thing, hands down, about Sushimon is the Yellowtail or Hamachi collar.  Literally, a grilled piece of the fish collar area, close to the head.  The collar is packed with fish meat, marbleized and full of smokey flavor goodness!  This dish is served with a lemon wedge, a little fish roe and a soy-vinegar dipping sauce.  I literally take my time on this dish.  It's so good!  Every bite offers such a euphoric experience for me, I became super sad on the last bite LOL. It was the first time I've tried the California salad.  This was AH-MAZE-ING!  Start off with a spring mix accompanied with a mustard/ginger dressing.  On the top of the salad is sliced avocado, yum, shrimp and crab meat-lots of it!  It was soo filling and so fresh.  This is a must try in my book.  The crab meat was everywhere, fanned out shrimp and long slivers of avocado.  Every bite was better than the rest!    I had a great night here as I always tend to do.  Lots of great food, great service and an intimate space that allows you to really enjoy the company around you.  Definitely need to check this place out.  It's in the middle of a busy part of town and super accessible.  You will not be disappointed!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi collar
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat dinner price.

bC-InVsdpTl6OQusU2mD1g.text: Came here for my FIRST TIME with family while I visited.  Just say "SUSHI" and my big booty is THERE.  Lol!  At $22 (for lunch) and $25 (for dinner) I think I ate waaaay more than what was paid.  People have said the nigiri portions (fish to rice) aren't great but I thought they were fine.  I mean, I'm no sushi expert but I thought it was GREAT!    Ordered (12 people) 1. Super white tuna -my FAVORITE thing there, nice and clean flavored with the ponzu sauce that it had.  Oh so MELT in your mouth delicious.  Get it! 2. Salmon -it's always my go-to when I eat sushi.  Very soft and melt in your mouth awesome. 3. Masago w/quail egg -crunch of the masago mixed with the creaminess of the quail egg...MMMMM! 4. Uni w/quail egg (only served at dinner) -ORGASM IN YO MOUTH 5. Ikura w/quail egg -ocean flavor with that creaminess?  Yes. 6. Shrimp tempura -Filler.  It was ok but, not doing again.   7. Seared tuna -Also came with the same ponzu sauce.  It was ok, probably woody order it again. 8. Soft shell crab roll -I'm a sucker for soft shell crab.  Another must order. 9. Green tea ice cream -My palette cleanser.  Nice green tea flavor.  A must after I eat sushi. 10. Tempura ice cream -JUST.  GET.  IT.  A deep fried japanese bread holding vanilla ice, whip cream, and a cherry.  Yum!  If they drizzled chocolate syrup over it...PERFS.  There were other things ordered but these were what I mostly ate.  Service was not that bad.  Orders came out once they were ready (not like other places that come out at ONE time).  That's a plus for me.  Well...the fact that it was ALL YOU CAN EAT...made it a SUPER plus for me.  Definitely coming back.

ki_Dxo0arJOTFSc5gVxFIg.text: This place has to be the best "AYCE" spot in vegas...  I am a sushi fiend and nothing satisfies or competes with the selection you get here. Service has never been a let down, but if you do decide to show up with a big party, do expect to wait a little bit.   Sushi is fresh as it gets, and i cant resist their side dishes either! Grilled yellowtail collars, the best baked green mussels, fried shumai, fried shrimp heads, and dont forget the fried (tempura) ice cream! The list goes on and on!  Hands down the #1 sushi spot!  One Love!

C1HFM-ZrQXXSGaEAxQ1dhQ.text: I have been going to this sushi mon location for years and there is no comparison in town. Always the best quality rolls and always a pleasant experience. Two thumbs up.

A_yRTQqhUIyyMACdHFMqew.text: Amazing ! I go here all the time. The servers are great. The decor isn't the best, but who cares because the sushi is amazing. The workers are awesome. They are very accommodating to my meal modifications since I eat a little on the healthy side. The sushi is also so so inexpensive. My friends flew in from Michigan to visit me. Instead of taking them anywhere on the strip I took them here ! Its honestly such a great place.

3RLUvOqePa-xWkSZPuSLnQ.text: Granted, I was extremely hungry when I ate here for a delayed lunch on a day full of celebrations, but this place made quite the favorable impression on yours truly.  The four of us gallant fellows all opted for the AYCE deal for maximum value. This also allowed us to pool our various orders and get the most variety while we also got the most bang for our buck. Sitting at the bar is advisable if you want to get straight to business. Obviously, lunch will deliver a better value.  The miso was a boon to us dehydrated souls. The Nigiri is all very solid. Their garlic tuna is a delicious standout, and you can't go wrong with the yellow tail. The mackerel offers that ever so distinctive fresh water taste-- may not be for everyone.  You could just as easily fill up exclusively on their specialty rolls and definitely not go wrong there. The Hurricane impressed me most of all-- so many flavors dancing on the tongue that I couldn't even describe them to you. Ecstasy roll = solid. The Flying Jason, while delicious, should be ordered with caution. It's one of the cooked rolls and contains melted cheese with a distinct, mustard like aftertaste. Great stuff but it is very filling and should probably be ordered right before dessert if at all (if you care about maximizing your value). The same goes for the Baked 428-- yummy but oh so filling.   The tempura ice cream-- I don't know how many sushi places do this but this place definitely does it RIGHT. Perhaps the most guilt ridden dessert per gram-- it is a serving of mochi covered in a doughnut like tempura crust that creates an absolutely heavenly experience (and one that can be enjoyed with chop sticks, nonetheless!) You must order this, at least once in your life.  If you are in the mood for gorging on quality sushi and don't want to shell out the cash for a place on the strip, I can promise you that Sushi Mon will lull you into a peaceful food coma.

ouhkIO3xHRRjI0T-cbl2Og.text: Terrible customer service!!! If you get all you can eat then you better order all you can eat first round otherwise you'll be waiting quite a while for the waiter to come back! Even when they are slow they always take forever to get to you. Best advice is to sit at the bar!

LfyXtGMfhqPZej3CDVtG_A.text: First of all I would like to recommend this place start taking reservations. Our group lost 2 members due to some confusion about wait time. We were told 1 hour and really only waited 20 minutes.   AYCE sushi should warrant a wait (as in 4 laps around the parking lot before you are allowed to sit down) and sushi is prepared fresh--- no rolls sitting under fluorescent lights here!  Started with seaweed salad, which was followed by; Mingus roll Domingo roll Yebisu roll Jala Jala roll Hurricane roll Ecstasy roll Red dragon roll Pastel roll Mussels a few nigiri rolls (yellow tail, halibut) along with smelt/quail egg roll  My stomach hurt so good that I somehow managed to have a bite of strawberry mochi!!  Dinner was about $26 a person (beverage not included), well worth the wait.

hA1MeN91e_15qOVYXkygRQ.text: Coworkers called to check up on me and my jacked up back (I am okay now, just sored from packing and moving and not exercising enough of late) plus to go eat at Sushi Mon (not the one on Sahara and also the closer one) and I went to meet up with them. I didn't know it was that far until I called another coworker for directions, and realized it was "Holy Cow! I am practically starting to drive back to California" far.  Last time I came here to eat, I just blindly followed Maryland Parkway all the way down until I reached the destination.  We arrived at 11:45am, when they opened and they already have 1/3 of the restaurant filled on a Wednesday.  Coworkers have raved about this place for a good 9 months we been working together and the food they served I have enjoyed.  And this time it was pretty good, except for the first order of sushi roll we were served (the rice tasted like it was old from last night).  But after that the rice seemed fresh like the fresh super white tuna they served us.  Tip:  Always check the specials of the day or ask the sushi chefs.  Today's Special: Super White Tuna - so good we ordered a second round, and highly recommended.  Cajun Salmon - it was alright Japanese Snapper- alright Fresh Scallop - pretty good (I don't care for the yum yum scallops the Japanese sushi places serve here in general) Yellowtail Belly - don't have it :( We also ordered the limit 1 per customer items: Uni - good Amaebi - good (but no deep fried heads) Hamachi Kama(Yellowtail collar) - good. Makes an excellent meal with just rice.  Tried the poki roll (didn't look like what we ordered last time) and the rice was not fresh. It tasted like it was from the previous night.  Spider Roll - huge and tasted great, but served with rice paper.  Rice paper usually costs $1 more, but I still like it made with the traditional nori. Pixie Roll - Another huge roll, and tasted good. Volcano Roll - Pretty good, but can be messy to eat.  But sometimes messy is a good thing when it comes to food :)  Also order: Masago with Quail Eggs - it was beautiful and I enjoyed it Tamago - The eggs are most likely ordered premade, and they just to cut it and assemble it with the rice and nori strip, but I liked it nonetheless. Fresh Water Eel - not bad  Desserts - we each picked different ones. I had the green tea ice cream, coworkers ordered the Lychee Sorbet (looks good), and Tempura Ice Cream (good).  BUT after we asked for and signed for our credit cards and the waitress came and picked stuff off of our table, I suddenly see a confused cockroach stumbling from where the soy sauce bottles and AYCE menu is.  I was in shocked and not sure where it came from, except maybe when the waitress came she might have set something down on the table, and grabbed our dessert bowls and left the unwanted hitchhiker.  Or it drop from the sky via the ventilation vent, which does NOT have a filter in place.    We waved the waitress over and she was shocked and afraid of the roach as well, but hesitantly picked up a used napkin in from the table and dropped it on top of the cockroach and picked it up off the table.  It was not the happy ending to our otherwise enjoyable meal, so -1 for that.  So 3 stars.  Good place to get sushi for those living in the South South East of Las Vegas. And they have Caked next door, which have good cupcakes, and they are on TV! (But I digressed)

f2onETuD9ucQDi_RK3Mzkw.text: We order for the kids the waitress never ask what we wanted . They bring soup and salad for the kids walked away after 10 minutes later we finally get to ask for forks  then 15/20 minutes later the kids rolls come then and We finally ask the waitress if she would take our order

gPN4GStN90ThyvWneXiKNA.text: The guys that deliver water are very nice and the sushi chefs are totally awesome!  The waitresses never have a personality and won't speak to you at all if you don't ask them a specific question.  One of the sushi chefs recently went way out of his way to help me out when my bill was like $30 more than it should have been.  Without his help I don't think they would have ever gotten it right!  The sushi is great. The chicken is not.  The lunch specials are a great deal!

H4-5eu56ghpGHwvBkK893Q.text: I'm so happy that Sushi Mon is as good as I remember it from two years ago. You know how something is always better in your memory. It's $25 for all you can eat, made to order sushi. We had that for lunch and although she told us that she would probably have to hold us to the 45 minute rule (they have you cut you off after 45 minutes), we didn't feel pressured at all the entire time we were there and we were definitely still eating after 45 minutes. We probably got by with an hour and then just hung out and talked after that.   Everything was good, and what I like about this place is that you can order almost everything off the menu, they don't limit you to a certain section or items because of AYCE. You can get rolls at half the size, so you can try things you normally wouldn't order. They have a variety of different rolls, with surprisingly good combination of ingredients. The quality of fish is good, not great, but definitely slightly above average for the price.   We had all the different nigiri sushi, including the cajun albacore which I really liked. Had a little bit of kick with the ponzu flavor. The No Name rolls was pretty good, and I think we had the Athena as well. I say, just go for it, and if you don't want a roll, sometimes they can just do a handroll for you with the same ingredients. We also had a couple of yellowtail collars, edamame, a cucumber salad, and to top it off, we had lychee sorbet (super yummy with lychee jelly mixed in), and tempura ice cream which was made with vanilla ice cream. It was coated in what looked to be pound cake and then deep fried. Or attempted to be deep fried. Either way, I would not get it again.   Service was great, and they carefully explained everything and happily took our order. They never made us feel like we could only order the cheaper items because of the AYCE, and service was great throughout. I hope to come back on a future trip to Vegas.

Z-tdDW4apnyv4V27e7frEg.text: I am kicking myself for coming here! I live close and thought I would try it. The worst sushi I've had in a long time. The rice was super dry and the fish is prob grade D. They hide the worst fish in the rolls.

J9Vgq4vWg1jm-mA6mr-gFw.text: Worste manager ever!! Went on a double date here and we walked in about 7pm on a Sunday, we asked how long the wait was and he looked at us up & down and said 2 hours! The place wasnt even packed.   We were averaging about 3 times a week coming here so we asked to order food to go. In the order all we wanted  changed was instead of regular Salads we wanted cucomber salads. The waitrsses ALWAYS do it for Us with a small upcharge of $3. When the manager rang us up, He tried charging us a extra $30!! We are not cheap what so ever, but the size of the salads can fit into the palm of 1 hand. We kindly explain to him that we never Get charged that much. His answer "no your lieing, we never do that!" I told our friends "f*ck this the food isn't worth this rude prick! & DEFINitly let's take our $$ elsewhere"  No where is food good Enough for anyone to put up with DISRESPECTFUL people. My bf is a huge guy, this mother f**ker is so lucky he didn't pick up one of the bar stools and hit him over The head with it. WE WILL NEVER RETURN AGAIN.   If your looking for a AMAZING sushi spot where the cooks drink with you & are tons of fun go to SUMO SUSHI off warm springs & durango. They play all the top 40 hits & great hip hop :) they are never rude & the 25 min drive from our house is completely worth it :)

_vPhn3wgq72vpAxLL1gN9w.text: They don't take reservation. Always first come first serve and there is always a wait. If you have something planned after , be there early !! For a party of 3 and more the wait time is normally 30min.   The food is yummy and fast. Personally I don't really like special rolls, I think Nigiri is the real sushi but the spider rolls here are really good!   When it comes to service, some servers are really good at what they doing, friendly and welcoming, however some servers are not. Some of my bestfriends mentioned that they were treated very rude last time they were there. Some of the fish didn't taste fresh but the server basically said eat it or else he would charge them extra.

tfu5SxgzduETkebcn1qN0Q.text: This place is amazing! I recently located from New York City so in naturally I'm a Sushi snob. The price for the all you can eat option is unreal. The fish is fresh and the staff are on point!

iAr4NT7wj7J17vw_oFvlVA.text: Great place for sushi but also offers other great options. My bf and I go here frequently, the downside is there is usually a wait but they are good at seating as soon as possible. The food here is good and they have some pretty good deals. We often get the dinner special and the beef dinner special they are good with a lot of food and a great price.

w1vYJQQrxnKeQUsFJRumZA.text: This place was so bomb-tastic...lol...  I'm a huge sushi fan and I LOOOVVEED this place.  Too bad we came during lunch, otherwise I could have had uni.  I love uni.  :)    The quality of the food is really good and the service was great.  Honestly, I enjoyed the food here more than any of the Las Vegas Strip Buffets I've been to.  But, I'm super bias.  I love sushi!  :D
