Sometimes it makes more sense, especially if you want to try lots of different rolls.  But you gotta be ready for AYCE, i.e., have some drawstring sweatpants on.  As we debated, the chef advised us that he would tally the amount once we were done, and charge us whatever was less, whether that be itemizing the rolls or the AYCE price. Awesome!!!  --one of the best things I loved is that they let you order half orders of most rolls. This is really great when there's only two people eating. My husband and I have different tastes, so it can be challenging to eat multiple rolls by myself. But we love trying lots of different rolls. Ordering half rolls was a great option for us.  --that being said, I didn't l-o-v-e the rolls. Don't get me wrong -- it was good but I just didn't think it was *great.* Some of the rolls we had were kinda bland. Maybe it was just an off-night we went. I think I'm willing to give it a try again ;-)

Cj1g66vnq-E9QhXDb-jXYg.text: All you can you sushi made to order in Vegas. Very fresh sushi in the middle of the desert believe it or not. For around $25/person you get a wide variety of fresh sushi and side dishes. The restaurant was not too big but we came for lunch on Sunday so we didn't have to wait, I heard it gets crowded at peak times. My favorite are definitely all the nigiri and they don't give you a huge piece of rice as filler. There are a couple of high end more expensive items on the menu that you can only have one order per person. I say take full advantage and order it all because they were all very delicious; Uni, sweet shrimp, cajun salmon, amberjack, and yellowtail collar.   We stuffed our face and proud of it. All you can ask for in Sushi are freshness and variety and SushiMon satisfy both. Only downside, it is located about 20min drive from the main strip and if you do not have a car, it's not worth it to taxi out there.

pEPXbrqLEUVKZQ9lEBU6Xw.text: Always an excellent experience! Great food and wonderful staff! Their prices are very decent and their rolls are large. My favorite is the Vegas roll. Can't beat the buy 2 get 1 free special! Delicious!!!

HDcIGGLq3TWJRDEKVPUF5w.text: Food is decent but service is ridiculously bad. Our order was given away to the table next to us and we know for a fact that we ordered first. We've been here for over 50 minutes and our first order still isn't complete WTF!

tMZ0pnZXsVEv9XBJKVX4Fw.text: What's unique about Sushi-Mon? 1. 1/2 orders are ok with them -sharing IS caring, good to share with friends and try different rolls 2. their AYCE menu includes appetizers and dessert (hard to find elsewhere) 3. Lychee Sherbet is a must try ( finally! I found it at Nijiya yelp.com/biz/nijiya-mark...) 4. Open late until 2 a.m. They have a good variety of rolls and everything is pretty fresh. The place is always full with a line out the door and a waiting list so you know it's good! The specialty rolls are great, and I recommend the Pixie, Mingus, and the Spider. Just wish their poki salad was a tad less salty. I can't eat as much as I used to but want to get my money's worth.

wkQN4KpRJJGijjPYM7c0cA.text: I had never been for all you can eat sushi so my friend took me and we sat at the bar. We ordered something fresh to start so we had a half of a cucumber roll, the sushi chef  kind of laughed and rolled his eyes. I brushed it off. Then we ordered a few more and we never got the ones we ordered and he gave us things that we didn't order. He rolled his eyes was rude and made me feel like I was inconveniencing him to make my food. That's what you are there for to make my food! Even the party next to us noticed that he was not nice to us. He is an older Asian man with glasses. His tip jar was empty when we came in and it stayed that way the hour we were there. I at one point even asked a waiter if we could order rolls with him because of the total negative attitude that we got from our chef. The food was decent but I would not return because of how I was treated.

c7AvpaLsfpK6k4apPM7ZPw.text: AMAZING! If you like to eat a lot of sushi, this is the best place in town! Between the all-you-can-eat price, the abundance of nigiri / roll options, and the quality of food, Sushi Mon is the place to eat in Las Vegas! It is a little bit of a drive from the strip, but it is completely worth the drive!

BUmVH8YU5VqZ_Ur1sZ8jrQ.text: There are *way* cheaper all you can eat sushi deals in Vegas than here if you're looking to be on the conservative side with your hard earned money. I don't know about anyone else, but unless the sushi quality is top notch and the dining experience comes with the 360 degree service and quality, I absolutely refuse to pay $25-$28 for all you can eat when I know I can get it for at/under $23 elsewhere where I don't have to wait 20/30 minutes to be sat.   While their sushi and plates are interesting, I honestly don't see anything overly special about this place. Small, always seems to be mobbed, and while the service is good, it is nothing overly outstanding like some of my friends raved to me about.  The reason why I gave it three stars is because 1.) The prices are a little over the top for something you can get cheaper (and in a better setting) somewhere else, and 2.) This place is always busy, and the wait times are very much over-quoted and long.

M9uy50qctu5tozLXpM-oNA.text: A few people had recommended this place for all you can eat sushi, so I was looking forward to it. This was the fourth all you can eat sushi place I have tried in Vegas. Honestly, I was really disappointed. The tables are almost stacked on top of each other when you are seated. I could have rubbed elbows with the table next to me. The fish was not fresh when I was there, which was a big bummer. I'm not sure why everyone is raving about the menu selection, because this place had the smallest selection of the 4 I have been to. They are quick to get the rolls out to you, but quick isn't always good. The quality definitely wasn't there. I think most people like this place because it's convenient, but outside of that you should go elsewhere.

Nxb_GrnRGyMq9v1tNPDUcA.text: Since it can get packed up in there--ya gotta wonder.  Is it hype?  Is it good?  Is it both?  YES.  Apparently they have managed to use quality fresh fish at low prices to their advantage and hence the place is packed.  As good as I have had for "All Ye Can Scarf" Sushi.  This is definitely all about the All You Can Eat vice the a la carte items.  Just be prepared that if you go during typical dinner-evening rush hour times you might wait a bit.  If you are on a tight time-line you should think twice about coming.  For the price of what you get, it is top value in the sushi world.  I was almost expecting mediocore food due to the amount of people and the constant, intense, back-and-forth sushi retrieval operations going on.  However, for the volume and low price, they maintained a decent presentation and didn't do a hatchet job on the sushi/sashimi.  If you wanna binge on sushi of good quality without getting schwacked in the wallet, you can't beat this place.

bfYrtpai6FPJmmJ7dcaF7A.text: Love this place very quite place to eat with the famiily employees are great!! Keep up the good work

zJcpTMcLVJkRboYZEAUgyg.text: Is it weird that an AYCE sushi place off the Vegas strip is better than any I've had in SoCal? Come on, we're losing to a land-locked state!  I wish my friends hadn't overhyped this place though, it made the experience less enjoyable since I was expecting my wallet to beg me to make it come back.   My favorites: desserts, yellowtail collar, super white tuna, salmon nigiri  Their uni tasted rather funky though, but perhaps it was just our sitting.

UWM6g91Z_bimotbDcjHLGA.text: We had all you can eat here last night.  It's a small place with not much seating so unless you call ahead you will likely have to sit at the bar.  The dynamite is delicious along with the tempura ice cream.  I would say the quality is average as well as the price.  The location is convenient but for all you can eat w/ a good quality I would probably go somewhere else.

nj-FEoyM8V-zJdetOC7IAQ.text: Service is good but instantly got stomach aches and bad bathroom issues... not sure if the fish sits out to long but man o man last time I'm going there. If you want sushi go anywhere else and spend a few dollars more

dHps8qnk8LCLLLgSl08_5w.text: I can't believe I haven't been to this place considering how much I love sushi, how much I've heard about it, and how close it is to my house.  To be perfectly honest, I have very mixed feelings about it.  It's a small space and seemingly always busy, but we were lucky and got two spots right away at the sushi bar.  Our sushi chef was quick and friendly, and the fish he served us  was beautifully cut and arranged.  We started off with a bunch of orders of nigiri: tuna, salmon, super white tuna, albacore, yellow tail, snapper, all of which were fresh and delicious.  I really wanted a roll with soft shell crab but they only had 2. I ordered the Spider Roll and I was sorely disappointed.  It was huge, but full of the imitation crab meat and a lot of rice and barely any soft shell crab inside.  Of course, I had to eat it all anyway since AYCE.    Our sushi chef left to go on break so another chef took over. We went back to ordering nigiri and the pieces he served were comical. One small, one big, one cut in half in the middle...really, as a sushi chef, he should have been embarrassed to be putting out pieces like this.  The rest of our meal proceeded in this fashion, with very tiny ugly looking pieces of fish.  I know I know, it all tastes the same, but sorry, I expect my sushi to look pretty, too. Our last dish was the dynamite, which took forever and it was overcooked so the scallops were a little tough.    We ended our meal with delicious mochi in mango, strawberry and vanilla flavors.  I would say that overall the service was great and the food was good.  Not my favorite sushi joint, but I'd go back because I like the atmosphere and it's close to my house.

RPP5QglXTeJKEnJ1Th62gg.text: $21.95 for AYCE lunch means that my friends and I get our money's worth whenever we eat here.  I usually dine with my pals after we do a long ride or run in the area, so we come ready to eat.  This was the case again this past Saturday when we arrived a few minutes before the doors opened at 11:45am.  There were a few other people waiting, too, but our party of six had no problem snagging a table, so come early and you won't have to wait, either. I can only eat shellfish, so my sushi choices are very limited, but I like the appetizers, too.  This equates to a not very healthy meal, but you gotta live a little. My usuals:  miso soup, shrimp and vegetable tempura, shumai, cucumber salad, shrimp tempura roll, 007 roll, Dynamite roll, Moment roll, with red bean ice cream or strawberry mochi for dessert. The service is always attentive and the food just keeps coming.  For the amount of food that we can put away when we're hungry, Sushi Mon is a bargain.    *Review #200 for 2013--yay.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE lunch, $21.95: miso soup, shrimp and vegetable tempura, red bean ice cream, 007 roll,  Dynamite, among other things.

AvNONEvcCqPKHI3S9Jn4QA.text: I love this place! They have fast service, quality sushi and sashimi and a great atmosphere. My favorite roll, lemon roll! It is sooooo refreshing!   They also have an amazing sashimi salad! You have to try it next time you visit!   Oh! and they serve half rolls! I have visited numerous sushi restaurants and if they don't serve half rolls, I will definitely not go back! I like enjoying a great variety of flavors and textures which is hard to attain if you're eating 8 rolls of the same thing... And hopefully those 8 rolls are good. That's what keeps me coming back to them!

F8O9syCHkCJl0NcLc9SAQA.text: parking: parking in front. lots of parking.   environment: came at 12:05 pm, a little bit after they opened, and the place was half filled. customer service is a - ok. i think they have more people coming here earlier so service slows down. they are really good with serving food. we had the ayce for 21.99, each order is 2 pieces. what has changed since the previous time i was here is that, before we got uni for lunch too. this time you have to add 5 dollars, then every person can get 2 orders. which isnt a great deal.  food: sushi is fresh, and sushi is cut nicely. sadly the food doesnt come fast enough, and leave us starving :/

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salmon belly, with masago and quail egg

kwtuDe1JiejP0XNhc06vXA.text: One word: SUSHIGASM.  Okay okay....so it's not a real word.  Before I go on with my review, I have to say I was a bit weary dining here.  My last experience of AYCE sushi was HORRIBLE.  I never felt so sick in my life and had to hang out in the bathroom for the rest of the night. Yeah, you can say I was scarred from AYCE joints from that experience.    With that said, my brother told me he loves this place and takes all his visitors here for dinner.  My brother has a waaaaay more sensitive stomach than I do. If he loves this place and doesn't get sick from it, then I'm sure I can tolerate it.    $28 is not a bad deal for AYCE sushi.  Originally I thought this place was going to be buffet-style but get this: they make it fresh for you once you put in your order! Ummm how great is that??  So I felt a lot better once I found that out.  I tried to sample a variety of dishes served at Sushi Mon.  Between my brother, his fiancee and I, this is what I remember ordering:  Seared salmon nigiri Every time I dine at a kaiten restaurant, I always order a few plates of this.  I thought it was interesting how they presented this dish because they sear the underside of the salmon.  And yes, I thought the the texture and taste was good.  Garlic tuna nigiri The only other place I can compare this to is Genki Sushi and Sushi Mon does it a lot better.  I like how there's enough garlic to compliment the taste of the tuna, rather than overwhelm it.    Ecstasy Roll This roll contains chopped albacore, avocado and tempura crumb wrapped with tuna, smelt eggs & seaweed salad drizzled with orgasm sauce. Yeah, you heard that right, orgasm sauce.  I dunno what orgasm sauce is (or if I wanna know) but that with the entire roll was delicious.  I liked the texture the tempura crumbs added to the roll as well.  Supreme Salmon roll Salmon wrapped with rice, nori and...more salmon!? This was an instant hit with me but I had to deduct a half star because I found a fish bone in one of the rolls.  Baked mussels These were pretty good, although I thought there was a little too much mayo and cheese topping it.  Sushi Mon Lasagna To clarify, this contains scallop yum and cucumber spread with yum yum sauce & cream cheese.  All I can say is there was way too much yum yum.  This roll was a bit rich for my liking.  I'll pass on this the next time I visit.  Saba I thought it was ok and it seemed like it didn't taste as "oily" as I remember it to be.  I hope that makes sense to you all...  Uni During dinner, they only allow one order of uni per person. I can totally see why...this tasted so fresh!  I was tempted to have someone order me another round but we still had a lot of food to finish.  For those of you who wonder what this tastes like, it reminds me of the fat of dungeness crabs (aka the best part of the crab).  If you still think it sounds gross, you are so missing out.  Grilled yellow tail collar Cooked to perfection! The meat easily fell off the bones and I enjoyed the tenderness of the fish and the crispiness of the outside.  Lychee sorbet Best lychee sorbet I've tasted.  This also contained chunks of lychee fruit in it. Mmmm...  Strawberry mochi Most of the time when I had this at other restaurants, this is frozen rock hard.  Sushi Mon's mochi was nice and soft while the ice cream in the inside was slightly firm.  Another good choice for dessert.  I apologize if this review was ridiculously long.  Anyways, I personally think it's worth the trip to dine here at Sushi Mon.

AVdYcZGx0PQq4x6HnzPU4A.text: Came here pass midnight to get the special price of 21.95 instead of dinner price of 26.95 upon arrival we were greeted and sat right away. We order our rolls and was offer sashimi special so we agree to it but when the bill came we were charge not knowing of the up charge from the item the lady suggested. Wish they mention the upcharge to dinner price from ordering the sashimi she recommended. We usually tip 22% since we work hospitality but we ended uo still tipping 18% .. over all we did enjoyed the food. Debating if will come back for a late night grub.

zX_vxMFjS7FE7M9_3-ZeyA.text: Not the best Sushi I have had by far, but it is good enough to keep going back to, since it is in walking distance. It is also open all night so I like to walk over and gets rolls in the A.M.  I will say this...the pricing for the all you can eat Sushi is high. I am a 190 pound male with a decent appitetite and I would have to pack it down to try to eat 4-5 rolls in order to get my money's worth. I order two rolls and I am good, so it is silly to think that I could bring a 120 pound date here and They would charge her the same as a 350 pound man. Silly.   Further more, they give you a time limit to eat. 45 min for lunch and 60 min for dinner. Normal people who want to try different rolls won't kill your business by eating you out of house and home, if you charge them a price where you aren't treating them like a sumo wrestler.   Normal people will eat 1-3 rolls and be full. Your pricing structure is old school within the industry and should be changed.  I'd like to see a date package where a couple can come in and share an all you can eat dish for 30 bucks. That's fair. That's a good price where it is a win win. A couple will probably only eat 4-5 rolls on average. Why charge them over 60 bucks to sit down for an hour to break bread?   This must be changed.   There is a burger joint in Vegas that let's you eat for free every time if you go on the scale and weight over 300 or 400 pounds. I forget what it is. The waitresses dress up like nurses and they encourage you to have a heart attack in there joint, which had happened before.  I know it is a far stretch in diversity and culture to compare the two industries, but this is Vegas! Most sushi in American already has fusion build into the menu. Change it up! Tell these big fatsos to come out their pocket! Don't take the little guys money for the same service of all you can eat! Those big bastards need to pay more! Not normal people!   That's all I have to say.

-emy7D25sEE6A6hfAX-w3g.text: The food was either greasy or salty...  restaurant was empty. First time and last time

ObwhPOgKep6BwQifIA2FrQ.text: This is our fave spot for AYCE. The food is always so good. Fresh and tasty. Sometimes the wait time can be up to an hour but it's well worth it! And they have punch cards lol after the 10 stamp you get one free.

Spoiled my dinner. Not going here again!   The food: tamago was gray, Salmon was dry, the tempura tasted like nothing the tempura dip, didn't taste like anything! The lasagna was undercooked. All sushi and rolls are nothing special.  Service was poor. All staff gathered together talk and ignored the guests. When they server, felt like they don't really want to do it. Won't be back.

_pX28s51Hj_iWTIVhn_WbA.text: Who is server? I spent $72 and gave to $6 tips. Sever never take care us.She didn't do anything. Never ask food and drink. No refill ... She just care only bills and standing front!! But, sushi man and basser were good.

qJf71IWxPLBM4GtoFIcPsw.text: I have to give Sushi Mon * * * * * five stars.   It's one of the best deals in Vegas.  High quality food, great service, and nice fair prices.  It's an AYCE all you can eat, Sushi restaurant that also has non-sushi items on the menu that counts towards AYCE, so you can have a variety of foods and flavors.  It's much better than buying sushi a la carte, by the order, if you can eat more than 10 pairs of sushi, then you're going to really get your money's worth here.  I'd come here again.  If you're from the Los Angeles area, and know the place "Midori" in the Valley, this is similar to that in format and quality.  And inversely, if you like Sushi Mon in Vegas and are ever in the LA area, check out Midori.  Parking was easy, in the hot, outdoor lot shared with other retailers.

5mfNH_5wcYal91DeurRTsw.text: Great sushi, incredible staff!  All of the sushi chef's are fantastic but the one older lady makes the place have a great vibe.  It was my first time here but I will be back when I am in town.

_XIwmDecx_Q6fd1oD1O55g.text: Still the best sushi around town! I've been going here since they opened and it's always fresh and delicious! Love that they are open late hours ands always friendly,  happy to see us!

XGa22MA-S75HMm5Iyz7dpw.text: My favorite all you can eat sushi restaurant in Las Vegas hands down.  Environment: The interior of the restaurant is not very big, but there are enough seating options that I rarely must wait a substantial amount of time to sit down even during peak hours. The sushi bar has more than enough spots but there are tables as well if you prefer that type of seating or if you are with a bigger group of people. Additionally, this restaurant has the same menu as Goyemon for those who want the same food but without the wait.  Food: This is where Sushi Mon can set itself aside from all the other all you can eat sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. They have THE best specials in town. The always have at least five different verities of special nigiri to try and each time I can try a type of fish I have never had before. Additionally, they have salmon belly and Bluefin tuna which are unlimited in orders which is great compared to most places which put a limit on such premium verities of fish. Additionally, the fish itself is always very fresh and the chefs are good about not skimping out on the cuts for the orders. Their selection of appetizers, rolls, and desserts also offer a fair amount of variety and I always leave full and happy  Service: Service is good as well as the chefs at the sushi bar make sure opt take our orders when necessary and the waiters are consistently checking up on guests to ensure that they have everything they need.  Overall I will be coming back here time and time again to satisfy my sushi craving!

qYHXxdS8ALwaid5cqssAIw.text: One of the best sushi spots in Vegas! This place is clean friendly and yummy. Fresh sushi and fresh wasabi. Some of the best wasabi I've had! Great prices as well. Be sure to come early bc they stay busy!

7bYLRhxlhlYOljkwPPBo_g.text: Great place. Staff and service was excellent. We were given soup and salad while we waited for our rolls. Rolls came out very fast and tasted very fresh.

3fKt12Ip0QgUBTZidee7wg.text: I returned often and the quality is a little lower than before. A little less fish on the sushi for example. Still rally good and has interesting specials nigiris and side dishes included in the ayce.

ov9oQzIplAxGeq84A5U0UQ.text: I usually love coming to this sushi spot for lunch because it's near my house, lunch price is great, and it's not too busy. Service is usually great but I came a couple of nights ago and sat at the sushi bar and got a bad customer experience.   It was obviously a full house so me and my boyfriend were in no rush to order. But a guy named Alejandro came to us from behind the bar and asked us what would we like to order. Wonderful! We always get the same things on first order: salmon nigiri, yellowtail nigiri, and tuna nigiri. And we threw in a roll. So he makes our order except for tuna nigiri. No biggie. We know it's coming soon. 10 mins go by.. 15 mins.. (mind you there are 4 other sushi chefs and two in the back helping and they are fast with making orders)  He then hands a roll we did not order and I say we didn't order this. And he just looks at me dumbfounded like I was stupid and I didn't know what I ordered. And he asked what we order. I accidentally said salmon instead of tuna but I corrected myself right away and he just bluntly says "well is it tuna or salmon??" And my boyfriend corrected. Alejandro walks away and he NEVER SPOKE TO US AGAIN. He didn't even give us our order. Another 15 mins later. Nothing. I was getting super annoyed and was about to talk to a manager for how he was so helpful at first and now he was did not make any eye contact or make our food. The sushi chef next to him Jun, asked what we order and he was gonna make it for him but Alejandro saw him making it and just did it himself, but it was shitty.   Still debating if I'll return.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is Alejandro

JkTW_grtTHJ6Myq_b0zICw.text: This is by fair mine and hubby's favorite sushi spot. There is a huge selection of specialty rolls which makes it fun to try different things. I love the rolls with cream cheese! But the nigiri is soooo light and yummy. I don't know what the sauce they put on it but it is delicious. I would never go here and not do AYCI. It is $26.95 for dinner and I eat triple the amount of that so it is worth it! Even if you are super full at the end, you HAVE to try the mochi balls. Strawberry flavor is the best. I will always come back no matter what because the food is bomb. Sometimes it gets a little too busy and the servers are distracted and all over the place BUT they are always very friendly so it's understanding. Can't wait to come stuff myself again.

MmI2rnmST_b1-RvpwF2Icw.text: I would highly recommend this place to anyone! The best sushi I've had in terms of both quality and price. I got a salmon roll and salmon nigiri and my girlfriend got an avacado cucumber roll and an avacado asparagus roll. Each roll comes with eight pieces, the nigiri comes with two pieces, and they were all delicious.

P4sI9cxB2bpsjgmaNZVvyg.text: Excellent customer service from both our server and the sushi chef. We came in on a Wednesday night and all the tables were full but the host got us a nice little seating area at the sushi bar. I honestly think sitting at the bar was the best way to do AYCE. You order your side dishes, rolls and desserts from the super attentive waiter and order your nigiri dishes directly from the sushi chef.  The seating time is limited to 60 minutes but the food comes out so quickly that 60 minutes is plenty of time to get your grub on.   I loved the huge selection on the menu and really enjoyed the ikura, salmon belly and super white tuna. The regular tuna wasn't the best though so skip it here. Loved the selection of desserts and side dishes. Baked mussel was delicious as was the seaweed salad. I wanted to try so much more but I was stuffed. I'll have to go back to try some more dishes.

sfgvdIzo3bWV7zMHKGAzig.text: We've eaten here years ago. Never thought about coming back because We have our favorite Sushi joints and there are just tons to choose from in the city. My in laws invited us to eat here with them one night so we happily obliged.  We got the AYCE dinner. Kids don't have reduced AYCE price, one star off for that. My kids don't eat much but I like that if they want more, they can just order. But since they didn't have kids AYCE price, we ordered a la carte for them.   We started with half Roll orders. I ordered a tiger roll and another one (I forget the exact name). All were bland and bla. Poke and nigiri were good. I was turned off by some of the food my kids ordered and by the rolls we all ordered. No umph in looks or taste at all!!   Even though my palate and stomach were satiated by the nigiri (because after a taste of the other food, they were my only options), I felt a bit robbed. After I ordered my dessert, I turn around to the sushi bar (because my dessert took a good loooong 10 min or so (ice cream scoop), and I notice a chalkboard in the back with "specials".  I was so annoyed because our waiter didn't tell us that our AYCE dinner included all that is listed on the chalkboard. Why was I so irked??? Because one of my favorite things to order at Japanese restaurants were up there and not on my menu at the table -- hamachi kama and sake Kama. I told the waiter I was upset because he didn't mention the specials to us. He did apologize but that did not remove the bad taste the whole place left in my mouth. Pun intended!

4hQcPwPWv9w2kp_ZnR7VaQ.text: this place is so lit. i've come here a few times the past couple of weeks with a friend for lunch and it's good. we've always been seated quickly and taken care of properly, especially at the bar. my fav roll is the ecstasy roll and the garlic edamame is to die 4. the only thing is that sometimes they take forever to check up on you, or if you want to order more side dishes you have to waaaaaaaaiiiiiiitttt. but only sometimes. u should still stop by tho

r-P3kDbwtZMpN6055UZp4A.text: I loved it. Ayce at its best but i still think its a bit expensive. The food was amazing and the chefs were so kind and always smiling.

A1W0_m8PpPrzYgjO3PuSug.text: My friend and I weren't allowed to sit and eat because our 4 year olds walked in with happy meals! They're little and don't care for sushi. Pissed!

P8H5R26EpdbUibGqm5oGVA.text: Second time here, there won't be a third.  The service was ok, the staff was kind of rude, if you are missing one person in your party they won't seat you.  Once seated they bring you drinks pretty fast but getting refills can be a challenge.  If you have empty plates on the table don't expect them to say excuse me before putting their arm in front of your face over the food you are eating and grabbing the plates.  You basically have to stop eating and move your head back so you don't get hit in the face.  My son in law said the menu was not the same as it used to be and as I experienced, if you want to order a meal plate, if you don't like teriyaki, then you have to order single items and pay more because they will not substitute the teriyaki for chicken or beef prepared another way which means you have to do side orders of soup, salad, chicken or beef, tempura, rice, California Roll, so what is a $9.95 dish with teriyaki comes out to over $20 if you can't eat teriyaki. They don't care...  The sushi rolls were good tasting but not wrapped very tight so you ended up with a mess in your dish when trying to pick up the pieces.  This place seems to have become a mill basically getting you in and out as quickly as possible, so once they decide to drop the bill on your table, don't expect anymore refills without asking even if you are not done eating yet.  They decide when it's time for you to leave without the offer of desert.  We were a party of four that will not be back to this place.

lim5nwAsfFKz7K5FbDjgMg.text: The all you can eat deal is better than most sushi places that I have been to in Las Vegas. Not only is the sushi included, but appetizers and dessert is too. At times they can be a little slow or forget parts of the order, but the wait staff is very friendly and kind. Plus, there are lots of options for people who are allergic to shrimp. Pretty delicious.

_N05uBZpgCv9mklOEuJ4JA.text: I always love Sushi Mon.  They have wonderful selections and I love the service.  Remember to have everyone in your party present before being seated.    I usually order To Go, and I've never had an issue.  They have quick service and are always really happy.  It's conveniently located by my house and I usually frequent here about 5x/mth.

YEXaDdpRF_pil-VxeVD60A.text: What was once my least favorite sushi spot, is now my go-to for late night AYCE! I have always loved the friendly service from George, but there was always something missing for me when it came to the food. Thankfully that has changed. The freshness and quality of the food has improved drastically. So much that I'm here at least once a week. Good for them, bad for my diet. Hah!   Like I said, I'm here for the AYCE most of the time. The Lemon Roll is my all time favorite, along with steamed shumai, and fried chicken. However, when I'm not feeling sushi I opt for a bowl of shrimp tempura udon, which always hits the spot.   The only downside to Sushi Mon is there are no to go container for soups, which means I can't order my favorite udon as take out. It's okay though, I'll continue to come back as long as the fish remains fresh and the smiles & good service are plentiful.

MX-7J9c193w9il_WwskXlQ.text: This review is wayyyy overdue. Sushi Mon is the best AYCE sushi restaurant ever!! My husband and I live in California and we make frequent trips to Vegas.  There is not one time we do not go to Sushi Mon. Sometimes, we make a trip out to Vegas just so that we can eat at Sushi Mon. We always sit at the same two seats at the corner of the sushi bar and they treat us like regulars. Their service is amazing and the staff/sushi chefs are so kind. We typically go during lunch but pay the dinner price (so that we can have uni and sweet shrimp). One time, they brought the check to us and they charged us the lunch price instead of the dinner price. I let the server know that they should've charged us more. The server took the check, came back, and let us know that they would honor the lunch price because we were honest with them. That is just the best customer service! This restaurant is doing everything right!! Thank you Sushi Mon for great food and great service! We are your forever customers!!

Fe1AeHsNtcU4FgQFBhzJMw.text: Very bad service the food was awful, no one checked on me, I paid $13 to leave hungry

AIGBoMbushCrtOqDx-YlbA.text: Sushi Mon is my sushi home away from home.  Since I travel to Las Vegas often, I have tried all the high end sushi eateries you can imagine.  Although all were amazing, the hit to your wallet is worse than some of the gambling tables in Vegas.    $26.95 gets you all you can eat sushi which includes a plethora of choices. Keep and eye on their chalk board for special cuts. For instance I was fortunate enough to have had Blue Fin tuna which normally is an fin and a leg - yes that was cheesy, sue me - but it was included in the deal. 1 order per person on the special items.  The house rules are simple and if you can't read, they provide simple illustrations to follow. Despite the handy instruction card they have at the bar, you will inevitably have someone try to cheat the system.  I don't know about you but the last person I try to antagonize is man who is very skilled with a super sharp knife.   If eating as much sushi as humanly possible is your objective, then void the rolls or ordering too many sides dishes.  Stick with the nigiri and venture out of your comfort zone. Don't be afraid to ask for suggestions and letting them know of any allergies you may have. I have a shell fish allergy so they prepared my sushi on a different cutting board to avoid cross contamination.  That is really going the extra mile because other sushi establishments I frequent can care less.  The attention to detail and their customer service sets them apart.   If you want great sushi at a reasonable price, Sushi Mon will definitely hit the spot. Oh and don't forget to try the lychee sorbet... Simply the best!!!

zo09n2X3U6Y6wdDHlD8SPA.text: My husband and I frequent this location about twice every 2 weeks. We have been coming here since my daughter was born ( 4 years ago ) . The waitresses and staff are always so sweet to us and my daughter. We love this place because of the service and the food!  Yesterday we came to eat here and they were closed, no sign on the door nothing. We waited outside thinking maybe they were opening a little late? No big deal. A short blonde girl walks out from the back and tells us that they are closed for the day. I asked her why and she said because her staff is protesting and did not show up for work? I asked what they were protesting and she said the " national immigrant protest " . I then asked her well are they all legal immigrants? And she said yes so then I asked what are they protesting for then ? Her response was " to support one another "  Fair enough, so I then told her , you might want to put a sign on your door so other people know! ( me and 3 other people had been waiting outside 15+ minutes . ) her response was : yes we are working on that so how about you give me some time and I'll put a sign on the door for you. ( something in that context)  I told her listen, I come here ALOT , you don't have to be rude I was just suggesting to put a sign up.. , I then looked at my cousin and said let's go to island sushi. and she proceeded to then get into a pitty argument with me about how I was being rude, and how I can try to go anywhere else but all of the other sushi places are closed as well ? I called 3 within a 5 mile radius, all open. We ended up at island sushi.  Your staff doesn't show up for work, I get it you might be stressed. But treating a loyal customer that way is just unacceptable. I know that the waitresses and sushi chefs are awesome and always treat us so good, but because she went off on me for suggesting to put a sign on the door so other people don't stand around waiting, I will never ever return. No professionalism from that girl what so ever. I drive all the way from mountains edge to eat here not only because the food is good , but because they make us feel like regulars. I will never ever eat here again, my family will never eat here again and I will make sure all my friends on social media know the way my family was treated because you chose to close for the day, and take your frustration out on me. Your customers are the foundation of your business, and when they are spending hundreds a month at your location, and you treat them like that, you will go out of business fast.

vlzIHQP-zPakuj05C9p5Fw.text: I've been to Sushi Mon in Sahara Ave location and I liked it. I was hoping it's the same but I didn't like it in this location. I was going to give it 1 star but I'm feeling generous today. if I want to be satisfied eating sushi, I will go to Sushi Neko in spring mountain. Compared to this place, its double the fish & half of the rice..

ufH3iHimNhBuU5OqXEiaAA.text: This ain't no "Todai - leave - all - the - seafood - out - all - dai - everydai - since yesTodai" Seafood Buffet.   How or why I took so long to remember to Yelp this place is beyond me. This is our "Go-To" restaurant everytime we're in Vegas visiting my parents. If you've eaten here, you know why, if you haven't...well let me tell you...   THIS HAS GOT TO BE ONE OF THE BEST SUSHI RESTAURANTS YOU'LL EVER GO TO IN YOUR LIFE.   - First of all, the fish is flown in FRESH, from the west coast, the Gulf and sometimes Hawaii, daily.  - They don't 'skimp' on their portions. (If it's too much, you can place 1/2 an order upon request)  - For $26.00 / person, you'll definitely get your money's worth! (If you know how to order) - You can also order from the kitchen menu (hot items) You're not limited to ONLY sushi.  - It also helps if you haven't eaten much (or at all) all day. But try not to "over order" since you must finish what you order.  - You can share within your party, as long as whoever you share with ordered the buffet as well.   Some of my "Sushi Mon favorites" are the Garlic Tuna (nigiri), the Sushi Monster (huge) & the Toro (1 order / person). Other than those, I'll order the usual: Hamachi roll, Tekka maki, 9-1-1 roll, Rainbow roll...etc...   Can't forget dessert either, oh yeah it's included...I usually go for the Tempura Ice cream...make that 2 orders...   Like I said, if you know what / how to order, you'll definitely get your money's worth... But hold on...there are some drawbacks.  - Wait time can be horrendous!!! Show up as soon as they open, preferably with a party smaller than 6. - You have to finish what you order. They're really anal about you eating the rice that goes along with the fish. - I think they're only open for dinner now (5pm - 2am) They still might serve lunch at the Sahara location.  Either way, I'll stick to my guns and name this place the best sushi spot I know of...and being born and raised on an island, I know my fresh fish.

And...save room for ice cream!  Head there early for din (or you may need to wait up to 90 min for a table) and bring your appetite! :)

oY-NfuR2yvBaNilxXTdoeg.text: I live close by so I always drop in late night since their open till 2am. For the all you can eat sushi of $27...you can't go wrong.  I'm not a fan of their yellowtail sushi...one time it didn't taste fresh so now I stick to the rolls.  My fav by far is the Jay Jay roll...shrimp tempura, avocado, philly creamcheese, asparagus, wrapped in seaweed and rice...topped with eel sauce...melts in your mouth!!!!!  This roll is priced at $8.  You can't go wrong with all the other rolls either...and their reasonably priced, but if you can put down some sushi..go with the all you can eat! :) Location is decent...not like super nice but it's decent..at least they have a flat screen where they have sports on all the time!  If you have a craving for sushi and you need to feed it really quick with good sushi then this is the place, but if you want to really impress a date or significant other..hit up Yellowtail on the strip!  ps.  Jay Jay roll! my fav!

v2D50565Gxo46pYetrPXLw.text: Sushi Mon's menu for the price, selection, and quality (especially quality of seafood brought into the desert) are the best I have ever had. I have been frequenting this place over the years and have had the same good service every time. The sushi chefs and some of the employees that I have seen and talked to here at this location are from Japan, good to have some authenticity. All of the friends that I have brought here have loved the food and usually have bought the All You Can Eat special and happy with the value. Check the Special Rolls Out! sushi-mon.com/menu/speci... I recommend the All You Can Eat special; lunch time costs less than dinner, you have to eat everything you order, and you have like 45 min to an hour to eat so come hungry! If your not sharing with others consider getting half rolls so you get to try more and not fill up so quick. The special includes some non-sushi items that I like including Baked Mussels, Tempura Shrimp, Fried Calamari, and Cucumber Salad. Sushi Rolls are awesome here, flavor, the rice, the ingredients, can't go wrong. You want quality similar to local Nobu and Hamada at under $30.00 per person without feeling pretentious and don't mind simple decor then this is the place you should go in Vegas to eat sushi. Don't forget dessert, I recommend the Green Tea or Red Bean Ice Cream. Sushi Mon use to be open until 4am way back in the day when it first started business, now it is still open pretty late, but not 24 hours. The line can get pretty long if you go during busy hours but definitely worth the wait. Here are some pics from my last visit: flic.kr/p/9sf84P flic.kr/p/9si9QE flic.kr/p/9sf9Kn Don't forget to grab a punch card when you pay! This saved me lots of money over the years. Domo Arigato Sushi Mon!

O1aCk3IIQXRh5fWz4HwHGQ.text: Ordered carryout sushi, some nigiri and some rice. Uni was not that fresh, but everything else was good. Only complaints are that they gave me tuna instead of salmon even after I repeated my order twice, and that they don't do udon soup as a carryout menu item.

I have no idea why I'm capitalizing AYCE?! Guess I'm just really excited about the thought that I'm going there this month (was there just last month) and I have a filled rewards card with them....mmmm...free AYCE! Ok bye.

I will most likely try out I Love Sushi and Kaizen Sushi as another friend suggests but I thought Sushi Mon was still worth a good review.

LGEHSGXOR3BvpvWwhCy1IQ.text: I have been around the sushi block and I will say that this is still my favorite. I wish the wait was not so long at times and the service could be better, but I do think that the quality and consistency of their fish is incredible.

pJB_47Ud7eUX8LN9ikBVwg.text: Sushi Mon is pretty mediocre in my opinion. I had a lot of their nigiri during my visit. Not bad, but not the greatest.  The one and ONLY memorable thing here, SNOW CRAB NIGIRI. A must try if you're going to visit Sushi Mon.  I have found a better sushi spot and will not be returning.

Vb_oaU1gFZvDqqBGUy1FAw.text: Love this place! A Vegas trip would not be complete without stopping by and getting me some AYCE sushi. The food is authentic and the waiters are friendly. The cost is about $25ish. Definitely would not suggest bringing a big group, unless you don't mind the wait. There's a 90minute time limit to their AYCE, but of all the times I have been there, they have yet to enforce it. Try the Dynamite. It's delici-o-so! Be sure to pick up a stamp card before you leave because you'll be coming back here again and again!

0vZK3PajrHZ2MoRg2cZnpA.text: My buddy Will introduced me to this little place in South East of Vegas. I swear he defends this place as if he owns it! Luckily we were able to get in fairly quick since word on the street is that this place usually has long lines.  Stays open 'til 2 am so perfect for those who are craving sushi this late without having to go all the way to Chinatown where other restaurants stay open late as well.  All you can eat is a bit pricey for such a small joint.  I believe it was close to being $30 unlike the $20 I'm used too in other all you can eat sushi places.  You can never go wrong with baked mussels. They serve pretty big nigiris, but it's just ok on the taste factor. I highly recommend the volcano roll and jala jala roll. But if you ordered all you can eat, just order half the original quantity of the rolls so you can try all their other rolls as well which are pretty good too. And for deserts, tempura ice cream is a must for me!    I like this place but won't be going here too often since I know other great sushi places that offer less of their ridiculous all you can eat price.

3GlcDa7xtVgNKtxe8FyUmQ.text: All you can eat fresh, delicious sushi for $27 in the hot desert in Las Vegas?  Is this a mirage?  Am I hallucinating?  Nope...it's real.  Sushimon is a must go for me everytime I am in Vegas, EVERYTIME.    Each time that I eat here, I can't believe that i'm actually eating fresh raw fish that doesn't make me hit the can later.  The sushi rice here is perfect...comes out a little warm with the right amount of vinegar taste that sushi rice should have.  I like that the fish to rice ratio is proportioned right.  Some AYCE's have too much rice, in hopes to fill you up.  Not here.  I love that the AYCE menu is double sided with nigiri, appetizers, dessert and for all you sushi lovers who think you like "sushi" (cooked, battered, fried, saucey rolls) they have a whole side dedicated to you.  They also have specials of the day. Toro, fresh scallop, super white tuna, even mirugai have appeared before so remember to ask your server before you miss out.  The servers are hot and cold...sometimes they are super nice and sometimes they seem like they really hate their job.  It depends on how busy they are i think.    There are a few items that are limited to one order per person...the uni, amaebi and hamachi kama.  This is understandable considering it's more on the expensive side.  If you love these items, go with someone who doesn't that way you can have their share too!     Save room for dessert because they have tempura ice cream and it is delicious!  Just a hint of tempura batter so it doesn't over power the ice cream...i wonder how do you fry ice cream?    If you are a sushi lover and want a great all you can eat experience, you have to come here.  I wish and wish that they would open one up in SF and HI so I don't have to fly to Vegas just to enjoy good quality AYCE sushi.    TIP:  No reservations and the line can get long so come early or just place your name on the list...they call your phone when your table is ready!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super White Tuna
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Medley
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hotate, Mirugai

PydNhn6TuQSRgJMsof0nqg.text: OMG. i think i Have a new favorite buffet sushi place! too bad it's in Vegas!!!   So this is not your typical buffet. it's all you can eat, but they take your order and serve it to you. :) Awesome for us lazy bums.   decently priced too! under 30 bucks for lunch or dinner.   Uni- this is the first time i've enjoyed Uni. yummy buttery goodness   fresh Scallop sushi. omg this was sweet and amazing!   Miso soup was also like it was home made and the perfect balance of salt and miso.   will definitely try to talk my friends into coming her our next trip out to vegas! :)

es1ksXtZUqgqPIpSv9I7ZA.text: Sushimon is one of my favorite go to spots when I don't feel like risking a new spot. It's not the best spot I've been to but is consistent and reliable. Same with their sister property goymon.

CkUrto2_mS7Ezg9UVsBDkQ.text: I like to go here after the gym, since it is so close.  Love the lunch time specials and usually get the 2 roll combo.  Very inexpensive and yummy too!  When you order the all u can eat, the fish is made to order and is super fresh.  I just wish the place was bigger because it gets crowded sometimes and you have to wait.

nfQK73_9yrkqffNJoJRZlg.text: sushi mon really is one of the best sushi restaurants in town.  the lunch/dinner specials are really tasty...but the best bang for your buck is the all you can eat menu.  it's the best way to experiment with different rolls and it's such a great deal for sushi.  $25 per person for dinner sounds pricey...but when you consider the fact that it's all you can eat sushi/fish, it's actually really inexpensive.    try out the baked green mussels.  they're delicious.  also, drink some green tea while you're there.  it's so good for you!  try the seaweed salad too...but if you're not into it, make sure you share it with someone, because you have to eat everything or else you get charged.    the best place to sit is at the sushi bar.  the sushi chefs will get you your order right away and you get to watch them prepare everything too.

ULHIDc3WbUcY9KNYsekWgQ.text: For an all you can eat sushi place in the middle of America, this was very good.  I loved all the rolls with unagi in them.  You have exactly one hour to eat all you can, but can order as many rolls as you want to begin with.  I was with a group of six people and we ordered 25 plates of sushi to start.  Within 10 minutes, the plates started to roll in.  Each of them was very good.  The waiter was really good.    The only reason that it wasn't a five, is a good thing.  The place is pretty small, so we had to wait an hour to get in, even on a Tuesday night.

V9Utzz7QftoGFpdGUEdx5Q.text: The is my favorite AYCE sushi bar in town. The daily special board offers anyone some items not on their regular menu. One new special yesterday was Wasabi Crawfish and it was simply delicious. Mixed with tobiko, mayo and wasabi, it was a creamy mixture similar to their scallops or bay shrimp mix. Definitely should be a regular in their menu.

Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wEAgEgvDHieK7MXLQkbgrA.text: For the first time going there it was really good. The menu was kinda confusing at first but you'll get the hang of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sovOROfgfsOm_JKzLD5B3Q.text: Late post (First time here was January 2015) but: Good service, great food, pretty fresh fish. And LADIES, they have purse hooks under the bar!!! Lol  Sushi chefs and waiters/waitresses are very attentive and consistently check in with you to refill drinks and take your side dish orders.  My boyfriend & I were on a huge sushi kick after trying this place we came to eat AYCE here for 3 days in a row... Now we're sick of sushi for like a year but next time we want some we are definitely coming here!

ARKk_FkMqSL_zM-AadRVSA.text: Amazing sushi and I love that they'll do half rolls for AYCE. Excited to find a great sushi place near my house and will definitely be returning.

1RbzgAlB4DG1yc8YAjEwyA.text: Close to home... First time trying Sushi and it was excellent!!! Small place but worth it.. To go is just as good as well!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider Rolls!!!! Yum

ml67-BEgHmz0y0eMvjbAUw.text: What a meal! Not only was it all you can eat, the food was delicious, and the staff were extremely friendly! From start to finish our time was fantastic. All three of us highly recommend this place! If you like sushi and want a variety at a reasonable price, this place is it! As for the desserts...everything was tasty, but the lychee sorbet was out of this world!!! Overall, we couldn't have asked for a better time or better service.

4LBRAmU8xzKaeMw4qiCqkg.text: This is my number one AYCE sushi choice. I've been going to Sushimon ever since they opened up. I cant speak for their regular item since I always eat the AYCE. Love the freshness and variety of rolls.

ix141ZNlEcvYFX3IBlkMGQ.text: The service here, from the manager to servers, make you feel like you are not really wanted here.  Their friends on the other hand get treated quite well, it's understandable but ....  Order second round and the rice is packed like hell and the fish noticeably thinner, eel was so pathetic on the second round we had to laugh.  Enough is enough, wonder how long there guys will last on their past laurels.

TWp_L442cg9OEul7xCZg9A.text: We love this place. Great service. Great food. Love the fresh sushi rolls made in right of you. Cold saki. And so close to home. Cute little place and great service too.

0KU5ESLRmgTYvV-yKu1YaA.text: Never been to a sushi place like this and I enjoyed it. Good service and they were packed. I'll try them again, hopefully when not so busy so I'm not afraid to get feedback on dishes.  Part 2: came here for supper and ate off the menu instead of the All You Can Eat Sushi. Wow good food great price and decent service. Added a star to my original review.

1jI_oOi-RBoVBOVLgrLCGA.text: We spent 22 dollars a person for AYCE lunch and an additional $1.75 for soft drinks. Our waiter was very understanding of my husband's shellfish allergies and even jotted down a list of safe rolls for us to enjoy. We got about 8 different half rolls, including our new favorite ecstacy. We will be back for lunch again, or maybe just to try stuff ala cart.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ecstacy roll.. definitely the best
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stacy roll!

hTa9sxLg7avyHriLljGSBw.text: This place definitely has a huge AYCE menu. Loved the variety! =)  We came promptly when they opened at 11am on a Monday and the restaurant was already have full!  I came at the recommendation of a coworker and he had suggested that I try the yellowtail collar. Unfortunately they don't serve that at lunch. Three of us  ordered off the AYCE menu and the fourth person ordered ala carte. I'm so glad that Sushi Mon doesn't have that rule that everyone has to order AYCE at the table. It is also really cool too that we can order half rolls so we can try a lot more things on the menu.    We tried so many different rolls, appetizers, nigiri sushi, I can't even remember them all. What I do remember is that almost everything tasted pretty fresh, some of the rolls were really unique and they have AYCE mochi and ice cream for dessert too. Score!   We were rushing to make sure that we could eat under the 1 hour time limit at lunch, but after awhile we realized that the waiters were pretty relaxed about it. Food came out relatively fast after we ordered and the servers were pretty prompted about filling water and taking more orders.   Paid about $27 (including tax and tip) for AYCE lunch.   Sushi Mon is definitely better then some of the AYCE sushi places in Cali!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UB475gfR6zs7tKWO0KachQ.text: AYCE amazingness.  I'm always looking for great sushi. This place is an institution in this town. It's a go-to sushi place when you want it done right and don't want to take any chances.  It's not particularly close to my where I live, so I don't go as often as I used to, but my friend was in town recently and she requested this place and I could not for the life of me remember why I don't go more often. Yum.  I do hate waiting for a table, but this place is worth it.  I usually stick with the nigiri here. To get more bang for my buck. The fish is always fresh. Unagi, super white tuna, spicy tuna, snapper, salmon skin handroll, yellowtail collar and salmon. There are some good specialty rolls that I get as well. The JJ, 911, and a really refreshing one I love, but the name escapes me at the moment. Probably a good idea to order half rolls to save space.  This place is a safe bet. You never know what you're getting with AYCE, but this place always makes me happy. A little more expensive than some, but definitely worth it.  Make sure to get your card stamped to earn a free AYCE!

FkMaxaPxOHpompkInJZOmQ.text: Great food, fresh and that's the problem  Called ahead and checked wait time and was informed there was no wait. Showed up 20 min later and the wait was over an hour  There is always a long wait one hour plus last three times we went both week nights and week ends  Service was slow but that was due to how busy they were

AKiJWYmSRyQGGB0okMTxaw.text: TO NIGIRI: this has to be one of my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant. I love the atmosphere here, it's a great place to hang with my fellow nigiri lovers.  All the sushi chefs here are rockstars. Some are funny some are not. But they have a great sense of humor anyway.  Just bring your small group friends and give this place a try. The wait can be long during dinner and weekends. The bigger the party the longer the wait. But trust. They get chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes baked muscles
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amaebi
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon belly

Z7FPChI4PTblAB_jI1xfUA.text: Where do I even begin?! Came in with my two siblings and three kids - all under the age of 7.  Was told that there was an hour wait for a party of six when there were two empty tables right in front of us.  After suggesting he combine the two, the greeter (Taku?) said the best he can do is to separate us - three ayce at the bar and the three kids at a table.  Are you kidding me?  How much does a little common sense cost us now a days huh?  They're kids for crying out loud!  Why I decided to stay is beyond me.  The service here is painfully slow.  Ordered two chicken katsu combos and a chicken teriyaki bowl for the kids and seriously, it took them 15 minutes to come out with the miso soup alone!  You can just imagine how long it took them to come out with their food.   Also, the wait time for our sushi was just the same if not longer.  Seriously, waiting more than 30 minutes for food is just too much.  Chop, chop!  So ayce... You can't share food, I get it.  But when my 5-year-old nephew wants a bite of my ice cream, gosh dang it, he can have a bite of my ice cream.  The need for our server, Jean, to act like it's the end of the world is just crazy.  Relax girl, just charge me an extra $3, not a big deal.    The service here could be much better.  Shame.  One star for the food and another for the all you can eat ice cream that comes with it.

jJ4hUeZFPmict9G3mXRxNA.text: I LOVE this place. The atmosphere is nice. You can carry out at a reasonable time. They're open later than most. Their portion sizes are worth the money. AND. The all-you-can-eat is definitely worth it.

tUmSC1Chpoc1c4nLn0Vqfw.text: Terrible customer service. Staff here is rude and disrespectful - including the manager as well.   Go to Goyemon instead.

6R2dXXOEYsG62yVSqN-xXA.text: My first time here and I am beyond impressed. They have a stand out menu, especially when most of the all-you-can-eat sushi restaurants in Vegas are Korean owned and have basically the same stuff. The chefs were so quick with our orders and their selection of fish was incredibly fresh. They have a board of daily specials near the back of the restaurant that we definitely ordered from and they were all delicious. From their regular menu, I would recommend their uni - it was one of the freshest I've had in Vegas. Or if you're into rolls, the Sexy Girl roll (HUGE but they do half rolls if that's more your style). The best part of my visit was the service - our waiter, Joseph, was SOOO friendly and approachable with our questions (also very trustworthy when it comes to recommendations). My mom and I also had the pleasure of chatting with Ziggy, another waiter I think, and he was very sweet and funny. This restaurant is a bit of a drive from my house but it is worth the distance and I look forward to the next time :)

Q8tHIbeO4MeoPTcnEIWuhQ.text: Horrible rolling skills on not 1 but 2 rolls! Go for the first piece fell apart then the second same thing! and not so great on the other roll either. Very disappointing can't do anything when it's take out and you don't see it until you are home. Should've known when the rolls weren't even put in the bag tight just falling on its side. New person taking orders on the phone work on your bagging skills so not to disappoint any future customers!

yGbybFfHOIkEDDXzdNwUDQ.text: After moving to Henderson/Vegas 2 months ago, I've finally found my new favorite sushi restaurant. Everyone was incredibly nice (especially our chef!) and most importantly, the sushi was wonderful. Definitely plan on coming back!

F9B5ey_1Y23CJOsznx2txA.text: Great little sushi place with respectable owners, chefs and waiters. The prices are really reasonable with over 50 different sushi options. The hours here are also perfect for people like me who are random. Overall great sushi shop!

oESjfDtLfwCErW9C2ar5Gw.text: Sushi mon is a great deal for an ayce. They have a great variety of rolls and sides that you can eat along with your sushi. I love sitting at the bar and being able to order as I go along. However, Depending on the time that you go, service can be a bit slow. They only down side to sushi mon is that uni is limited to 1 per person for the ayce.

RUNzze8VYtPbfs8dN4w_Fw.text: Fast service (from sushi chefs), and great food. I was so happy with everything I ordered. Took them only 10 mins to get about 15 orders of nigiri and rolls to me! Super speedy!

aXRqUkg7JdyRBNs10fL9Xw.text: I'm not a big fan of sushi, or seafood in general, but my husband and friends love it, so I tag along. However, the rolls here are just really good, and usually fresh. I really like their Veggie roll. Of course, some chefs make it better than others, but it's still good. I also like the spicy tuna rolls quite a bit. The service is usually good. But, sometimes with different people coming to check on you & getting you refills, it can be lacking. Still, better service than most AYCE sushi places.  The only bad thing is the crowds. There are often very long waits, and sometimes the company isn't too great either. Last time we got stuck to a group of people older than me (I'm 26) talking about how drunk they were and yelling "penis." Not the restaurants fault of course.

Q2rby3qctBtXtI4s822N4w.text: The food was good but it takes forever for them to bring the food out. I ordered spider roll, it was pretty big so it was hard to eat in one piece. The dynamite was good but it took a while for them to bring it out. I actually had to ask them again for it. And since it was sweet, I needed to off-set the taste so I also ordered shumai. It took half an hour and still no shumai. I finally asked one of the servers for it and within a couple minutes, they brought it out. Were they just sitting on it?

h7piWSj7mQHxwfLITQsAYQ.text: I...don't know why I haven't written a review for this place yet. How weird.   This is definitely what I consider to be my gold standard when it comes to AYCE sushi. For $35 (dinner) this is definitely a bargain...especially since the quality is up there.  I hate to admit...but their rolls are pretty amazing. I'm usually not a fan of rolls but their sexy girl and ecstasy rolls were my favorites.   Their selection of nigiri sushi is pretty good. Don't forget to look at their specials...those are usually too good to pass up!   Did I mention I'm a fan of their tempura ice cream? Soooo good!   And I'll be honest, service here sucks (go figure). They're slow as heck but you definitely get your money's worth (and then some) so whatevers. I'll overlook the poor service this time.

WYzXqoImZ6Gnkqcr1ClxUA.text: I must say the food is usually good. However, the service is terrible. The servers are not attentive at all. The bussers obviously are not aware of the fact they should be picking up plates etc. throughout a persons entire meal instead of letting them pile up.   Service at the sushi bar is okay. Servers don't seem to pay much mind to those eating at the sushi bar.  The few times I've ate here I've received the same horrible service. So sad.. Management should have a meeting with staff in regards to service and what it should be.  Think I tried for my last time as it's always disappointing....

iQgfCOWEDlhZpa6od8lEeA.text: Nothing wrong with this place. Good food. It is a little loud, but it makes up for that by being open late. It is hard to get a table most of the time because it is so popular.

t_0uxW8jleHvGuQB9iGuag.text: Not very good service, but pretty good sushi. They didn't even greet us when we walked in/ up to the counter and our server was just okay. But it was very good, and the food came out quickly. I would still go back, but I have others closer, cheaper, with just as good sushi.

598Jph_eXkIXiYZ-qIQUOA.text: Sushi Mon is a solid place for AYCE sushi, but not as creative as their new venture. Although some of the rolls are the same as Goyemon, Sushi Mon does not have the awesome appetizers and desserts that the other restaurant does.   The quality of fish is the same, the service is better, but the variety is lacking. If you ignore these minor complaints, the difficulty in picking up the nigiri was the major problem of the night. The ones that had a sauce splashed on top fell apart too easily. Instead of drizzling it lightly on the fish, they put it directly on the rice which caused it to loosen up on contact.   The rolls are nothing particularly special, so nigiri is definitely the way to go. The nice large pieces of fish placed on a proportionate piece of rice was perfection.   I didn't know that they use the same stamp card as Goyemon, so if your waitress ask if you have a card give them that card. I looked at the one she gave me and asked if I could just get my Goyemon stamped, but they will not combine. Be prepared and just add on to your preexisting one.

dhb7KOFYqQ_8SKkbFGzrYQ.text: I heard a lot good thing about this place so we wanted to try out.  We've been some sushi restaurant but I think this will be our spot.  Nigiri sushi were a lot smaller than another restaurants but it was pretty good!  Just order more.  Lol. Rolls are awesome too.  But I didn't  see any noodle menu like everybody posted thogh.  Overview,I'll recommended to my friends.

HtxipXlSqjOZc0ee18jLnQ.text: It's by far my favorite go-to spot for a great sushi lunch special! They are always so friendly and their food is fantastic!

tx22G6TNjqwbhxO9ygv9gA.text: Go to Island Sushi & Grill, on Eastern & Serene streets. It's way better food, for non sushi eaters & sushi eaters. They have ALL YOU CAN EAT, lunch for $21.95 & dinner for $26.95. Kids under 10 are half off, for lunch & Kids under 10 are half off, for dinner, as well.  NOT worth the wait! I've tasted better food at other Japanese restaurants & I've had excellent customer service at other restaurants, in general. The GOOD, the servers seem friendly & seem to move fast waiting on their customers. The BAD, crowded restaurant & it's loud, the extended wait time to get a table or a seat at the bar. Customers see employees gathered around the host / hostess area chit chatting with each other & not paying attention to their customers. The manager doesn't smile, moves slow, not professional, not friendly, lacks skills to be a manager & does not resolve matters for customers. They should get rid of him & get a experienced manager. Do they have an assistant manager? Doesn't seem like it. It's not a kid friendly restaurant & they don't have a kid's menu. Seriously time to BOYCOTT Sushi Mon...

_IoxcW61nPFly7Zx-K8dlQ.text: Hands down the best sushi in town. Even if you don't do raw, you will love it. tempura ice cream is a must!

uDaclQbQEE3RJssuneaNmw.text: When I used to go to Vegas 2-3 times a month, this was my go-to place to get my sushi fix. There were times when I used to come here twice in one weekend...shesh! The one thing I love about Sushi Mon is they include appetizers in the all-you-can-eat menu. The sushi is delicious. I mean, it is an all-you-can-eat place, but the seafood is pretty darn good quality. I usually get this knotty feeling in my stomach when I eat mediocre fish, and the only reason why my tummy aches from this place is cause by over eating. I will admit, I usually have to loosen my belt a few notches at the conclusion of my meal. I've listed my favorites below. The garlic tuna and cajun albacore are must tries! I used to order 5 orders of this. My significant other at the time hated raw fish. After tasting the garlic tuna and cajun albacore, they were sold! Darn, so wishing I was in Henderson right about now!   Appetizers Calamari Poke Baked Mussels Green Salad Cucumber Salad Seaweed Salad Grilled Salmon & Yellowtail Collar  Rolls Volcano Roll Frying Jason Goyemon Style Lasagna Sexy Girl Sunrise Ecstasy Orion  Nigiri ***Garlic Tuna (SOOOOO GOOD) Cajun Albacore Seared Tuna

3lVW03Kdg0NgWj0Obdb7Sg.text: Another good AYCE sushi fix. The Sex Girl roll is the bomb.Always fresh fish and creative rolls.Lots of variety and they are open until the wee hours if you get a sushi munchy after a night out on the town.You will leave with a smile on your face and wanting to go back again soon.

WZ6Gk7e7f5ZQ93Hl4f9WbQ.text: So, I really wanted to love this place, one because it's right by my house and two because of the reviews on it, but honestly I don't know what kind of sushi the people who wrote good reviews on this place are eating because that's definitely not what I got. I'm not sure if it's the fact that I ate there at midnight or what but everything I ordered was not good. The sushi had a bad aftertaste as well as the seaweed salad, which I normally love...(my mouth is offended the whole time..this was said by my boyfriend whilst eating)..my reaction was just as bad, I kind of wanted to throw up when I got home to make up for what I put in my stomach. I paid way, way too much for what we both consumed. I will say one thing good about the meal...the wine and green tea was great :)

SL9ikbahYWWZ5R_cFT2TJw.text: So we gave Sushi Mon another try and I must say  that it was better. The sushi is still not as cold as we would like it to be but it was better then our previous visits a few months back. So I am giving them 4 stars. The sushi tasted fresh and the mochi was frozen n not soggy we will definitely go back.
